targetString: Os pacientes com COVID-19 transmitem o vírus quando não apresentam sintomas, enquanto os pacientes com SARS geralmente a transmitem quando estão gravemente doentes, o que gera uma maior dificuldade em conter a propagação da COVID-19 do que da SARS.
en-mt: COVID-19 patients transmit the virus when they do not have symptoms, while SARS patients usually transmit it when they are seriously ill, which makes it more difficult to contain the spread of COVID-19 than SARS.

sourceString: This partially explains why SARS-CoV-2 spread much faster and broader than SARS-CoV.
targetString: Isso explica, em partes, porque o SARS-CoV-2 se propaga muito mais rapidamente e afeta mais regiões do que o SARS-CoV.
en-mt: This partly explains why SARS-CoV-2 spreads much faster and affects more regions than SARS-CoV.

sourceString: The regular RNA assay for SARS-CoV-2 can be negative in some COVID-19 patients.
targetString: O ensaio regular de RNA para o SARS-CoV-2 pode ser negativo em alguns pacientes com COVID-19.
en-mt: Regular RNA assay for SARS-CoV-2 may be negative in some patients with COVID-19.

sourceString: On the other hand, cured patients can be positive for the virus again.
targetString: Por outro lado, os pacientes curados podem receber um teste positivo para o vírus novamente.
en-mt: On the other hand, cured patients may receive a positive test for the virus again.

sourceString: These findings dramatically increase the risk of virus spreading.
targetString: Esses resultados aumentam drasticamente o risco de propagação do vírus.
en-mt: These results dramatically increase the risk of spreading the virus.

sourceString: Given such rapid progress in research on COVID-19, several critical issues remain to be solved, as follows:
targetString: Dado o rápido progresso na pesquisa sobre a COVID-19, várias questões cruciais ainda precisam ser resolvidas, conforme se segue:
en-mt: Given the rapid progress in COVID-19 research, several critical questions remain to be resolved, as follows:

sourceString: Where did SARS-CoV-2 come from?
targetString: De onde surgiu o SARS-CoV-2?
en-mt: Where did SARS-CoV-2 come from?

sourceString: Although 96% genetic homolog was found between SARS-CoV-2 and two bat SARS-like CoVs, we still cannot conclude that SARS-CoV-2 is from bats.
targetString: Embora um homólogo genético de 96% tenha sido encontrado entre o SARS-CoV-2 e dois CoVs de morcegos semelhantes ao SARS, ainda não podemos concluir que o SARS-CoV-2 tenha origem nos morcegos.
en-mt: Although a 96% genetic homologue was found between SARS-CoV-2 and two bat-like SARS-like CoVs, we still cannot conclude that SARS-CoV-2 originated in bats.

sourceString: What animal was the intermediate species to transmit the virus from the original host, say bats, to humans?
targetString: Qual animal foi a espécie intermediária que transmitiu o vírus do hospedeiro original, do morcego, digamos, para os humanos?
en-mt: Which animal was the intermediate species that transmitted the virus from the original host, the bat, say, to humans?

sourceString: Without knowing answers to #1 and 2, we cannot efficiently cut the transmission, and the outbreak can relapse at any time.
targetString: Sem saber as respostas para as perguntas n.° 1 e 2, não poderemos cortar a transmissão com eficiência, e a epidemia poderá ter uma reincidência a qualquer momento.
en-mt: Without knowing the answers to questions #1 and #2, we will not be able to efficiently cut transmission, and the epidemic could relapse at any time.

sourceString: Although molecular modeling and biochemical assays have demonstrated that SARS-CoV-2 binds to ACE2, how exactly does the virus enter the airway cells and cause subsequent pathological changes?
targetString: Embora a modelagem molecular e ensaios bioquímicos tenham demonstrado que o SARS-CoV-2 se une ao ECA2, como exatamente o vírus entra nas células da via respiratória e causa mudanças patológicas subsequentes?
en-mt: Although molecular modeling and biochemical assays have demonstrated that SARS-CoV-2 binds to ACE2, how exactly does the virus enter airway cells and cause subsequent pathological changes?

sourceString: Does the virus also bind ACE2-expressing cells in other organs?
targetString: O vírus também liga-se às células com expressão de ECA2 nos outros órgãos?
en-mt: Does the virus also bind to ACE2-expressing cells in other organs?

sourceString: Without clear answers to these questions, we cannot achieve fast and accurate diagnosis and effective treatment.
targetString: Sem respostas claras para essas perguntas, não podemos obter um diagnóstico rápido e preciso e um tratamento eficaz.
en-mt: Without clear answers to these questions, we cannot get a quick and accurate diagnosis and effective treatment.

sourceString: How long will the epidemic last?
targetString: Por quanto tempo durará a epidemia?
en-mt: How long will the epidemic last?

sourceString: How is the virus genetically evolving during transmission among humans?
targetString: Como o vírus está evoluindo geneticamente durante a transmissão entre os seres humanos?
en-mt: How is the virus evolving genetically during human-to-human transmission?

sourceString: Will it become a pandemic worldwide, die down like SARS or relapse periodically like the flu?
targetString: Ela se tornará uma pandemia mundial, desaparecerá como a SARS ou terá reincidência sazonal, como a gripe?
en-mt: Will it become a worldwide pandemic, disappear like SARS, or have a seasonal recurrence like the flu?

sourceString: It is essential but may take some time to search for answers to the above and many other questions.
targetString: É essencial, mas poderá levar algum tempo a procura por respostas para as questões acima e para tantas outras.
en-mt: It is essential, but it may take some time to search for answers to the above questions and many others.

sourceString: However, with whatever expense it may demand, we have no other choice but to stop the epidemic as soon as possible and bring our life back to normal.
targetString: Entretanto, independentemente dos esforços necessários, não temos outra escolha a não ser deter a epidemia o mais breve possível e voltar às nossas vidas normais.
en-mt: However, regardless of the efforts required, we have no choice but to stop the epidemic as soon as possible and return to our normal lives.

sourceString: Zoonotic origins of human coronaviruses
targetString: Origens zoonóticas dos coronavírus humanos
en-mt: Zoonotic origins of human coronaviruses

sourceString: Mutation and adaptation have driven the co-evolution of coronaviruses (CoVs) and their hosts, including human beings, for thousands of years.
targetString: A mutação e a adaptação impulsionaram a coevolução dos coronavírus (CoVs) e seus hospedeiros, incluindo os seres humanos, por milhares de anos.
en-mt: Mutation and adaptation have driven the coevolution of coronaviruses (CoVs) and their hosts, including humans, for thousands of years.

sourceString: Before 2003, two human CoVs (HCoVs) were known to cause mild illness, such as common cold.
targetString: Antes de 2003, sabia-se que dois CoVs humanos (HCoVs) causavam uma doença branda, como um resfriado comum.
en-mt: Prior to 2003, two human CoVs (HCoVs) were known to cause a mild illness, like the common cold.

sourceString: The outbreaks of severe acute respiratory syndrome (SARS) and the Middle East respiratory syndrome (MERS) have flipped the coin to reveal how devastating and life-threatening an HCoV infection could be.
targetString: As epidemias da síndrome respiratória aguda grave (SARS) e da síndrome respiratória do Oriente Médio (MERS) mudaram o que se pensava sobre os CoVs e revelaram o quanto uma infecção por HCoV pode ser letal e devastadora.
en-mt: The severe acute respiratory syndrome (SARS) and Middle East respiratory syndrome (MERS) epidemics changed thinking about CoVs and revealed just how deadly and devastating an HCoV infection can be.

sourceString: The emergence of SARS-CoV-2 in central China at the end of 2019 has thrusted CoVs into the spotlight again and surprised us with its high transmissibility but reduced pathogenicity compared to its sister SARS-CoV.
targetString: O surgimento do SARS-CoV-2 na China central no final de 2019 colocou os CoVS em destaque novamente e surpreendeu a todos com sua alta transmissibilidade e sua patogenicidade reduzida em comparação ao seu irmão SARS-CoV.
en-mt: The emergence of SARS-CoV-2 in central China at the end of 2019 put CoVS in the spotlight again and surprised everyone with its high transmissibility and reduced pathogenicity compared to its sibling SARS-CoV.

sourceString: HCoV infection is a zoonosis and understanding the zoonotic origins of HCoVs would serve us well.
targetString: A infecção por HCoV é zoonótica, e compreender as origens zoonóticas dos HCoVs é de enorme utilidade.
en-mt: HCoV infection is zoonotic, and understanding the zoonotic origins of HCoVs is enormously helpful.

sourceString: Most HCoVs originated from bats where they are non-pathogenic.
targetString: A maioria dos HCoVs originou dos morcegos, nos quais eles são não patogênicos.
en-mt: Most HCoVs originated from bats, in which they are non-pathogenic.

sourceString: The intermediate reservoir hosts of some HCoVs are also known.
targetString: Os hospedeiros reservatórios intermediários de alguns HCoVs também são conhecidos.
en-mt: Intermediate reservoir hosts of some HCoVs are also known.

sourceString: Identifying the animal hosts has direct implications in the prevention of human diseases.
targetString: A identificação dos hospedeiros animais tem implicações diretas na prevenção das doenças nos seres humanos.
en-mt: Identification of animal hosts has direct implications for disease prevention in humans.

sourceString: Investigating CoV-host interactions in animals might also derive important insight on CoV pathogenesis in humans.
targetString: A investigação das interações do hospedeiro do CoV em animais também pode proporcionar informações importantes sobre a patogênesis do CoV em seres humanos.
en-mt: Investigation of CoV host interactions in animals can also provide important information about CoV pathogenesis in humans.

sourceString: In this review, we present an overview of the existing knowledge about the seven HCoVs, with a focus on the history of their discovery as well as their zoonotic origins and interspecies transmission.
targetString: Neste estudo, apresentamos uma visão geral das informações existentes sobre os sete HCoVs, com um foco no histórico de sua descoberta, bem como suas origens zoonóticas e transmissão interespécie.
en-mt: In this study, we present an overview of existing information on the seven HCoVs, with a focus on the history of their discovery, as well as their zoonotic origins and interspecies transmission.

sourceString: Importantly, we compare and contrast the different HCoVs from a perspective of virus evolution and genome recombination.
targetString: Uma análise importante é a que fazemos de comparação e contraste entre diferentes HCoVs de uma perspectiva da evolução do vírus e da recombinação do genoma.
en-mt: One important analysis is that we compare and contrast different HCoVs from a virus evolution and genome recombination perspective.

sourceString: The current CoV disease 2019 (COVID-19) epidemic is discussed in this context.
targetString: A atual epidemia da doença por CoV 2019 (COVID-19) é discutida neste contexto.
en-mt: The current epidemic of CoV disease 2019 (COVID-19) is discussed in this context.

sourceString: In addition, the requirements for successful host switches and the implications of virus evolution on disease severity are also highlighted.
targetString: Além do mais, os requisitos para transição eficaz entre hospedeiros e as implicações da evolução do vírus na gravidade da doença também são destacados.
en-mt: Furthermore, the requirements for effective transition between hosts and the implications of virus evolution on disease severity are also highlighted.

sourceString: Coronaviruses (CoVs) belong to the family Coronaviridae, which comprises a group of enveloped, positive-sensed, single-stranded RNA viruses.
targetString: Os coronavírus (CoVs) pertencem à família Coronaviridae, que compreende um grupo de vírus encapsulados, de polaridade positiva e de RNA de fita simples.
en-mt: Coronaviruses (CoVs) belong to the Coronaviridae family, which comprises a group of enveloped, positive polarity, single-stranded RNA viruses.

sourceString: These viruses harbouring the largest genome of 26 to 32 kilobases amongst RNA viruses were termed “CoVs” because of their crown-like morphology under electron microscope.
targetString: Esses vírus que apresentam o maior genoma, entre 26 e 32 quilobases, entre vírus RNA foram denominados "CoVs" devido à sua morfologia de coroa ao serem observados em microscópio eletrônico.
en-mt: Those viruses that have the largest genome, between 26 and 32 kilobases, among RNA viruses were called "CoVs" due to their crown morphology when observed under an electron microscope.

sourceString: Structurally, CoVs have non-segmented genomes that share a similar organization.
targetString: Quanto à estrutura, os CoVs têm genomas não segmentados que compartilham uma organização semelhante.
en-mt: As for structure, CoVs have unsegmented genomes that share a similar organization.

sourceString: Approximately two thirds of the genome contain two large overlapping open reading frames (ORF1a and ORF1b), which are translated into the pp1a and pp1ab replicase polyproteins.
targetString: Aproximadamente dois terços do genoma contêm duas estruturas de leitura aberta sobrepostas (ORF1a e ORF1b), que são traduzidas nas poliproteínas de replicase pp1a e pp1ab.
en-mt: Approximately two-thirds of the genome contains two overlapping open reading frames (ORF1a and ORF1b), which are translated into the replicase polyproteins pp1a and pp1ab.

sourceString: The polyproteins are further processed to generate 16 non-structural proteins, designated nsp1~16.
targetString: As poliproteínas são transformadas novamente e geram 16 proteínas não estruturais, designadas nsp1 a nsp16.
en-mt: The polyproteins are transformed again and generate 16 non-structural proteins, designated nsp1 to nsp16.

sourceString: The remaining portion of the genome contains ORFs for the structural proteins, including spike (S), envelope (E), membrane (M) and nucleoprotein (N).
targetString: A porção restante do genoma contém ORFs para as proteínas estruturais, incluindo spike (S), envelope (E), membrana (M) e nucleoproteína (N).
en-mt: The remaining portion of the genome contains ORFs for structural proteins, including spike (S), envelope (E), membrane (M) and nucleoprotein (N).

sourceString: A number of lineage-specific accessory proteins are also encoded by different lineages of CoVs.
targetString: Algumas proteínas acessórias de linhagem especifica também são codificadas por diferentes linhagens de CoVs.
en-mt: Some lineage-specific accessory proteins are also encoded by different lineages of CoVs.

sourceString: Based on the difference in protein sequences, CoVs are classified into four genera (alpha-CoV, beta-CoV, gamma-CoV and delta-CoV), among which the beta-CoV genera contains most HCoVs and is subdivided into four lineages (A, B, C and D).
targetString: Com base na diferença nas sequências proteicas, os CoVs são classificados em quatro gêneros (alfaCoV, betaCoV, gamaCoV e deltaCoV), entre os quais o gênero betaCoV contém a maioria dos HCoVs e é subdividido em quatro linhagens (A, B, C e D).
en-mt: Based on the difference in protein sequences, CoVs are classified into four genera (alphaCoV, betaCoV, gammaCoV, and deltaCoV), among which the genus betaCoV contains the majority of HCoVs and is subdivided into four lineages (A, B, C, and D ).

sourceString: Phylogenetic evidence has shown that bats and rodents serve as the gene source of most alpha-CoVs and beta-CoVs, while birds are the main reservoir of gamma-CoVs and delta-CoVs.
targetString: Evidências filogenéticas mostraram que morcegos e roedores servem de fonte genética para a maioria dos alfaCoVs e betaCoVs, enquanto as aves são o principal reservatório de gamaCoVs e deltaCoVs.
en-mt: Phylogenetic evidence has shown that bats and rodents serve as the genetic source for most alphaCoVs and betaCoVs, while birds are the main reservoir of gammaCoVs and deltaCoVs.

sourceString: For thousands of years, CoVs have constantly crossed species barriers and some have emerged as important human pathogens.
targetString: Por milhares de anos, os CoVs cruzaram constantemente as barreiras das espécies, e alguns tornaram-se patógenos humanos relevantes.
en-mt: For thousands of years, CoVs have steadily crossed species barriers, and some have become relevant human pathogens.

sourceString: To date, seven human CoVs (HCoVs) are known.
targetString: Até o momento, sete CoVs humanos (HCoVs) são conhecidos.
en-mt: To date, seven human CoVs (HCoVs) are known.

sourceString: Among them HCoV-229E and HCoV-NL63 are alpha-CoVs.
targetString: Entre eles, o HCoV-229E e o HCoV-NL63 são alfaCoVs.
en-mt: Among them, HCoV-229E and HCoV-NL63 are alphaCoVs.

sourceString: The other five beta-CoVs include HCoV-OC43, HCoV-HKU1, severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus (SARS-CoV), Middle East respiratory syndrome coronavirus (MERS-CoV) and SARS-CoV-2.
targetString: Os outros cinco betaCoVs incluem HCoV-OC43, HCoV-HKU1, o coronavírus da síndrome respiratória aguda grave (SARS-CoV), o coronavírus da síndrome respiratória do Oriente Médio (MERS-CoV) e o SARS-CoV-2.
en-mt: The other five betaCoVs include HCoV-OC43, HCoV-HKU1, severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus (SARS-CoV), Middle East respiratory syndrome coronavirus (MERS-CoV), and SARS-CoV-2.

sourceString: HCoV-229E, HCoV-OC43, HCoV-HKU1 and HCoV-NL63 usually cause mild symptoms, like common cold and/or diarrhea.
targetString: Os vírus HCoV-229E, HCoV-OC43, HCoV-HKU1 e HCoV-NL63 geralmente causam sintomas leves, como um resfriado comum e/ou diarreia.
en-mt: The HCoV-229E, HCoV-OC43, HCoV-HKU1 and HCoV-NL63 viruses usually cause mild symptoms such as a common cold and/or diarrhea.

sourceString: In contrast, SARS-CoV, MERS-CoV and the newly-identified SARS-CoV-2 are highly pathogenic, causing severe lower respiratory tract infection in relatively more patients with a higher chance to develop acute respiratory distress syndrome (ARDS) and extrapulmonary manifestations.
targetString: Em contrapartida, o SARS-CoV, o MERS-CoV e o recém-identificado SARS-CoV-2 são altamente patogênicos e causam infecção grave do trato respiratório inferior em uma quantidade relativamente maior de pacientes, com uma alta chance de desenvolvimento da síndrome de desconforto respiratório agudo (SDRA) e de manifestações extrapulmonares.
en-mt: In contrast, SARS-CoV, MERS-CoV, and the newly identified SARS-CoV-2 are highly pathogenic and cause severe lower respiratory tract infection in a relatively larger number of patients, with a high chance of developing Down syndrome. acute respiratory distress (ARDS) and extrapulmonary manifestations.

sourceString: The first HCoV-229E strain, B814, was isolated from the nasal discharge of patients with common cold in mid-1960s.
targetString: A primeira cepa de HCoV-229E, B814, foi isolada da coriza de pacientes com resfriado comum na metade da década de 1960.
en-mt: The first strain of HCoV-229E, B814, was isolated from the coryza of patients with the common cold in the mid-1960s.

sourceString: Since then, more knowledge was accumulated through extensive studies on HCoV-229E and HCoV-OC43, both of which cause self-limiting symptoms.
targetString: Desde então, mais conhecimento foi acumulado por meio de estudos abrangentes sobre o HCoV-229E e o HCoV-OC43, sendo que os dois causam sintomas autolimitadores.
en-mt: Since then, more knowledge has accumulated through extensive studies on HCoV-229E and HCoV-OC43, both of which cause self-limiting symptoms.

sourceString: Indeed, the concept had been widely accepted that infection with HCoVs is generally harmless until the outbreak of SARS.
targetString: De fato, o conceito de que a infecção pelos HCoVs é geralmente inofensiva era amplamente aceito até a epidemia de SARS.
en-mt: In fact, the concept that infection with HCoVs is generally harmless was widely accepted until the SARS epidemic.

sourceString: The SARS outbreak occurred in 2003 is one of the most devastating in current history, infecting over 8,000 people with a crude case fatality of approximately 10%.
targetString: A epidemia de SARS que ocorreu em 2003 é uma das mais devastadoras da atualidade e infectou mais de 8 mil pessoas, com uma taxa bruta de mortalidade relacionada aos casos confirmados de aproximadamente 10%.
en-mt: The SARS epidemic that occurred in 2003 is one of the most devastating today and infected more than 8,000 people, with a crude mortality rate related to confirmed cases of approximately 10%.

sourceString: Ten years later, the Middle East respiratory syndrome (MERS) outbreak resulted in a persistent epidemic in the Arabian Peninsula with sporadic spreading to the rest of the world.
targetString: Dez anos depois, a epidemia da síndrome respiratória do Oriente Médio (MERS) resultou em uma epidemia persistente na Península Arábica, com propagação esporádica para o resto do mundo.
en-mt: Ten years later, the Middle East respiratory syndrome (MERS) epidemic resulted in a persistent epidemic in the Arabian Peninsula, with sporadic spread to the rest of the world.

sourceString: The 2019 novel HCoV (2019-nCoV), which has subsequently been renamed SARS-CoV-2, is the causative agent of the ongoing epidemic of coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19), which has claimed more than 3,120 lives and infected more than 91,000 people as of March 3, 2020.
targetString: O novo HCoV de 2019 (2019-nCoV), que foi renomeado posteriormente SARS-CoV-2, é o agente causador da epidemia atual da doença do coronavírus de 2019 (COVID-19), que tirou mais de 3.120 vidas e infectou mais de 91 mil pessoas até 3 de março de 2020.
en-mt: The 2019 novel HCoV (2019-nCoV), which was later renamed SARS-CoV-2, is the causative agent of the current 2019 coronavirus disease (COVID-19) epidemic, which has claimed more than 3,120 lives and infected more than 91,000 people by March 3, 2020.

sourceString: The alarm has been ringing and the world has to prepare for the coming pandemic of SARS-CoV-2.
targetString: O alarme está soando, e o mundo precisa se preparar para a pandemia do SARS-CoV-2 que está chegando.
en-mt: Alarm bells are ringing, and the world needs to prepare for the SARS-CoV-2 pandemic that is just around the corner.

sourceString: All seven HCoVs have a zoonotic origin from bats, mice or domestic animals.
targetString: Todos os sete HCoVs têm origem zoonótica nos morcegos, camundongos ou animais domésticos.
en-mt: All seven HCoVs have a zoonotic origin in bats, mice or domestic animals.

sourceString: Multiple lines of evidence support an evolutionary origin of all HCoVs from bats, where viruses are well adapted and non-pathogenic but show great genetic diversity.
targetString: Múltiplas linhas de evidência corroboram com a origem evolutiva de todos os HCoVs a partir dos morcegos, onde os vírus são bem adaptados e não patogênicos, mas demonstram grande diversidade genética.
en-mt: Multiple lines of evidence support the evolutionary origin of all HCoVs from bats, where the viruses are well-adapted and non-pathogenic but demonstrate great genetic diversity.

sourceString: The COVID-19 epidemic has presented enormous medical, scientific, social and moral challenges to China and the world.
targetString: A epidemia de COVID-19 apresenta enormes desafios médicos, científicos, sociais e morais para a China e para o restante do mundo.
en-mt: The COVID-19 epidemic presents enormous medical, scientific, social and moral challenges for China and the rest of the world.

sourceString: Tracing the zoonotic origins of HCoVs provides a framework to understand the natural history, driving force and restriction factors of species jumping.
targetString: O rastreamento das origens zoonóticas dos HCoVs fornece uma estrutura para entender a história natural, a força impulsionadora e os fatores restritivos da migração do vírus para outras espécies.
en-mt: Tracing the zoonotic origins of HCoVs provides a framework for understanding the natural history, driving force, and constraining factors of virus migration to other species.

sourceString: This might also guide or facilitate the search for the reservoir, intermediate and amplifying animal host(s) of SARS-CoV-2, with important implications in the prevention of future spillovers.
targetString: Isso também pode orientar e facilitar a busca pelos hospedeiros reservatório, intermediário e amplificador do SARS-CoV-2, com implicações importantes na prevenção futura da migração viral entre espécies.
en-mt: This could also guide and facilitate the search for SARS-CoV-2 reservoir, intermediate and amplifier hosts, with important implications for the future prevention of cross-species viral migration.

sourceString: In this review we present an overview of the zoonotic origins, interspecies transmission and pathogenesis of HCoVs.
targetString: Neste artigo, apresentamos uma visão geral das origens zoonóticas, da transmissão interespécie e da patogênese dos HCoVs.
en-mt: In this article, we present an overview of the zoonotic origins, interspecies transmission, and pathogenesis of HCoVs.

sourceString: Particularly, we highlight and discuss the common theme that parental viruses of HCoVs are typically non-pathogenic in their natural reservoir hosts but become pathogenic after interspecies transmission to a new host.
targetString: Em particular, destacamos e discutimos o tema comum de que os vírus parentais dos HCoVs são geralmente não patogênicos em seus hospedeiros reservatórios naturais, mas tornam-se patogênicos após a transmissão interespécie para um novo hospedeiro.
en-mt: In particular, we highlight and discuss the common theme that the parental viruses of HCoVs are generally non-pathogenic in their natural reservoir hosts, but become pathogenic after interspecies transmission to a new host.

sourceString: We also review the trend of HCoV evolution in which the increase in transmissibility often comes with the decrease in pathogenicity.
targetString: Também revimos a tendência de evolução do HCoV, na qual o aumento da transmissibilidade geralmente vem acompanhado da diminuição da patogenicidade.
en-mt: We also reviewed the evolutionary trend of HCoV, in which increased transmissibility often goes hand in hand with decreased pathogenicity.

sourceString: The outcome of the ongoing SARS-CoV-2 outbreak is also discussed in this context.
targetString: O desfecho da atual epidemia de SARS-CoV-2 também é discutido nesse contexto.
en-mt: The outcome of the current SARS-CoV-2 epidemic is also discussed in this context.

sourceString: Animal CoVs have been known since late 1930s.
targetString: Os CoVs de animais são conhecidos desde o final da década de 1930.
en-mt: CoVs from animals have been known since the late 1930s.

sourceString: Before the first isolation of HCoV-229E strain B814 from the nasal discharge of patients who had contracted common cold, different CoVs had been isolated in various infected animals, including turkey, mouse, cow, pig, cat and dog.
targetString: Antes do primeiro isolamento da cepa B814 do HCoV-229E da coriza de pacientes que contraíram resfriado comum, CoVs diferentes tinham sido isolados em vários animais infectados, incluindo peru, camundongo, vaca, porco, gato e cachorro.
en-mt: Prior to the first isolation of the B814 strain of HCoV-229E from the coryza of patients who contracted the common cold, different CoVs had been isolated from a number of infected animals, including turkey, mouse, cow, pig, cat, and dog.

sourceString: In the past decades, seven HCoVs have been identified.
targetString: Nas últimas décadas, sete HCoVs foram identificados.
en-mt: In recent decades, seven HCoVs have been identified.

sourceString: A brief summary of the history of HCoV discovery in chronological order (Table ​1) would be informative and instructive.
targetString: Um breve resumo do histórico da descoberta do HCoV em ordem cronológica (Tabela 1) seria informativo e instrutivo.
en-mt: A brief summary of the history of HCoV discovery in chronological order (Table 1) would be informative and instructive.

sourceString: The first HCoV-229E strain was isolated from the respiratory tract of patients with upper respiratory tract infection in the year of 1966, and was subsequently adapted to grow in WI-38 lung cell lines.
targetString: A primeira cepa de HCoV-229E foi isolada do trato respiratório de pacientes com infecção do trato respiratório superior no ano de 1966, e foi adaptada posteriormente para crescimento em linhagens de células pulmonares WI-38.
en-mt: The first HCoV-229E strain was isolated from the respiratory tract of patients with upper respiratory tract infection in the year 1966, and was later adapted for growth in WI-38 lung cell lines.

sourceString: Patients infected with HCoV-229E presented with common cold symptoms, including headache, sneezing, malaise and sore-throat, with fever and cough seen in 10~20% cases.
targetString: Os pacientes infectados com HCoV-229E apresentaram sintomas de resfriado comum, incluindo dor de cabeça, espirro, mal-estar e dor de garganta, com febre e tosse presentes em 10% a 20% dos casos.
en-mt: Patients infected with HCoV-229E showed symptoms of the common cold, including headache, sneezing, malaise, and sore throat, with fever and cough present in 10% to 20% of cases.

sourceString: Later in 1967, HCoV-OC43 was isolated from organ culture and subsequent serial passage in brains of suckling mice.
targetString: Posteriormente, em 1967, o HCoV-OC43 foi isolado da cultura de órgãos e da passagem serial subsequente em cérebros de camundongos em período de lactação.
en-mt: Subsequently, in 1967, HCoV-OC43 was isolated from organ culture and subsequent serial passage in the brains of lactating mice.

sourceString: The clinical features of HCoV-OC43 infection appear to be similar to those caused by HCoV-229E, which are symptomatically indistinguishable from infection with other respiratory tract pathogens such as influenza A viruses and rhinoviruses.
targetString: As características clínicas da infecção por HCoV-OC43 parecem semelhantes às causadas pelo HCoV-229E, que são sintomaticamente indistinguíveis da infecção por outros patógenos do trato respiratório, como os vírus influenza A e os rinovírus.
en-mt: The clinical features of HCoV-OC43 infection appear similar to those caused by HCoV-229E, which are symptomatically indistinguishable from infection with other respiratory tract pathogens such as influenza A viruses and rhinoviruses.

sourceString: Both HCoV-229E and HCoV-OC43 are distributed globally, and they tend to be predominantly transmitted during the season of winter in temperate climate.
targetString: O HCoV-229E e o HCoV-OC43 estão distribuídos globalmente, e tendem a ser transmitidos predominantemente durante a estação do inverno em climas temperados.
en-mt: HCoV-229E and HCoV-OC43 are globally distributed, and tend to be transmitted predominantly during the winter season in temperate climates.

sourceString: Generally, the incubation time of these two viruses is less than one week, followed by an approximately 2-week illness.
targetString: No geral, o período de incubação desses dois vírus é menor que uma semana, acompanhado da doença por aproximadamente 2 semanas.
en-mt: In general, the incubation period for these two viruses is less than a week, accompanied by illness for approximately 2 weeks.

sourceString: According to a human volunteer study, healthy individuals infected with HCoV-229E developed mild common cold.
targetString: De acordo com um estudo com voluntários humanos, indivíduos saudáveis infectados pelo HCoV-229E desenvolveram um resfriado brando comum.
en-mt: According to a study of human volunteers, healthy individuals infected with HCoV-229E developed a common mild cold.

sourceString: Only a few immunocompromised patients exhibited severe lower respiratory tract infection.
targetString: Apenas alguns pacientes imunocomprometidos exibiram infecção grave do trato respiratório inferior.
en-mt: Only a few immunocompromised patients exhibited severe lower respiratory tract infection.

sourceString: SARS, also known as “atypical pneumonia”, was the first well documented HCoV-caused pandemic in human history and the etiological agent is SARS-CoV, the third HCoV discovered.
targetString: A SARS, também conhecida como "pneumonia atípica", foi a primeira pandemia documentada causada por HCoV na história do ser humano, e o agente etiológico é o SARS-CoV, o terceiro HCoV descoberto.
en-mt: SARS, also known as "atypical pneumonia", was the first documented pandemic caused by HCoV in human history, and the etiologic agent is SARS-CoV, the third HCoV discovered.

sourceString: The first case of SARS can be traced back to late 2002 in Guangdong Province of China.
targetString: O primeiro caso de SARS remonta a 2002 na Província de Guangdong, na China.
en-mt: The first case of SARS dates back to 2002 in Guangdong Province, China.

sourceString: The SARS epidemic resulted in 8,096 reported cases with 774 deaths, spreading across many countries and continents.
targetString: A epidemia de SARS resultou em 8.096 casos notificados com 774 mortes, espalhando-se por vários países e continentes.
en-mt: The SARS epidemic resulted in 8,096 reported cases with 774 deaths, spanning multiple countries and continents.

sourceString: Apart from the super-spreaders, it was estimated that each case could give rise to approximately two secondary cases, with an incubation period of 4 to 7 days and the peak of viral load appearing on the 10th day of illness.
targetString: Com exceção dos "superespalhadores", foi estimado que cada pessoa contaminada pode contaminar aproximadamente outras duas, com um período de incubação de 4 a 7 dias, e com o aparecimento do pico da carga viral no décimo dia da doença.
en-mt: With the exception of "superspreaders", it has been estimated that each infected person can infect approximately two others, with an incubation period of 4 to 7 days, and with the peak of viral load appearing on the tenth day of illness.

sourceString: Patients infected with SARS-CoV initially present with myalgia, headache, fever, malaise and chills, followed by dyspnea, cough and respiratory distress as late symptoms.
targetString: Os pacientes infectados com SARS-CoV apresentam inicialmente mialgia, dor de cabeça, febre, mal-estar e calafrios, seguidos dos sintomas posteriores de dispneia, tosse e desconforto respiratório.
en-mt: Patients infected with SARS-CoV initially present with myalgia, headache, fever, malaise, and chills, followed by later symptoms of dyspnea, cough, and respiratory distress.

sourceString: Lymphopenia, deranged liver function tests, and elevated creatine kinase are common laboratory abnormalities of SARS.
targetString: Linfopenia, disfunção hepática e creatina quinase elevada são as anormalidades comuns da SARS em testes laboratoriais.
en-mt: Lymphopenia, liver dysfunction and elevated creatine kinase are the common abnormalities of SARS in laboratory tests.

sourceString: Diffuse alveolar damage, epithelial cell proliferation and an increase of macrophages are also observed in SARS patients.
targetString: Dano alveolar difuso, proliferação das células epiteliais e aumento do número de macrófagos também são observados nos pacientes com SARS.
en-mt: Diffuse alveolar damage, epithelial cell proliferation, and increased numbers of macrophages are also seen in patients with SARS.

sourceString: Approximately 20-30% of patients subsequently require intensive care and mechanical ventilation.
targetString: Aproximadamente 20% a 30% dos pacientes necessitam, em algum momento, de tratamento intensivo e de ventilação mecânica.
en-mt: Approximately 20% to 30% of patients require, at some point, intensive care and mechanical ventilation.

sourceString: In addition to lower respiratory tract, multiple organs including gastrointestinal tract, liver and kidney can also be infected in these severe cases, usually accompanied with a cytokine storm, which might be lethal particularly in immunocompromised patients.
targetString: Além do trato respiratório inferior, vários órgãos, incluindo o trato gastrointestinal, o fígado e os rins, também podem ser afetados nesses casos graves, geralmente com ocorrência de uma cascata de citocina, que pode ser letal, principalmente em pacientes imunocomprometidos.
en-mt: In addition to the lower respiratory tract, several organs, including the gastrointestinal tract, liver and kidneys, can also be affected in these severe cases, usually with the occurrence of a cytokine cascade, which can be lethal, especially in immunocompromised patients.

sourceString: The virus was first isolated from the open lung biopsy of a relative of the index patient who travelled to Hong Kong from Guangzhou.
targetString: O vírus foi isolado pela primeira vez em uma biópsia de pulmão de um parente do paciente zero que viajava de Guangzhou para Hong Kong.
en-mt: The virus was first isolated from a lung biopsy of a relative of patient zero who was traveling from Guangzhou to Hong Kong.

sourceString: Since then, tremendous efforts have been dedicated to HCoV research.
targetString: Desde então, esforços enormes são dedicados à pesquisa sobre o HCoV.
en-mt: Since then, enormous efforts have been devoted to HCoV research.

sourceString: HCoV-NL63 was isolated from a 7-month-old child from the Netherlands during late 2004.
targetString: O HCoV-NL63 foi isolado de um bebê de 7 meses na Holanda no final de 2004.
en-mt: HCoV-NL63 was isolated from a 7-month-old baby in the Netherlands in late 2004.

sourceString: It was initially found to be prevalent in young children, the elderly and immunocompromised patients with respiratory illnesses.
targetString: Descobriu-se inicialmente que o vírus era prevalente em crianças pequenas, idosos e pacientes imunocomprometidos com doenças respiratórias.
en-mt: The virus was initially found to be prevalent in young children, the elderly, and immunocompromised patients with respiratory illnesses.

sourceString: Presentation of coryza, conjunctivitis, fever, and bronchiolitis is common in the disease caused by HCoV-NL63.
targetString: Os sintomas de coriza, conjuntivite, febre e bronquiolite são comuns na doença causada pelo HCoV-NL63.
en-mt: Symptoms of coryza, conjunctivitis, fever and bronchiolitis are common in the disease caused by HCoV-NL63.

sourceString: Another independent study described the isolation of the same virus from a nasal specimen from an 8-month-old boy suffering from pneumonia in the Netherlands.
targetString: Outro estudo independente descreveu o isolamento do mesmo vírus de um espécime nasal de um bebê de 8 meses que sofria de pneumonia na Holanda.
en-mt: Another independent study described the isolation of the same virus from a nasal specimen of an 8-month-old baby suffering from pneumonia in the Netherlands.

sourceString: Although it was identified in Netherlands, it is actually distributed globally.
targetString: Embora tenha sido identificado na Holanda, ele está disperso em todo o mundo.
en-mt: Although it has been identified in the Netherlands, it is dispersed throughout the world.

sourceString: It has been estimated that HCoV-NL63 accounts for approximately 4.7% of common respiratory diseases, and its peak incidence occurs during early summer, spring and winter.
targetString: Foi estimado que o HCoV-NL63 corresponde aproximadamente a 4,7% das doenças respiratórias comuns, e sua incidência de pico ocorre no inverno, na primavera e no início do verão.
en-mt: It has been estimated that HCoV-NL63 accounts for approximately 4.7% of common respiratory illnesses, and its peak incidence occurs in winter, spring and early summer.

sourceString: HCoV-NL63 is associated with obstructive laryngitis, also known as croup.
targetString: O HCoV-NL63 está associado à laringite obstrutiva, também conhecida como crupe.
en-mt: HCoV-NL63 is associated with obstructive laryngitis, also known as croup.

sourceString: In the same year, HCoV-HKU1 was isolated from a 71-year-old man who had been hospitalized with pneumonia and bronchiolitis in Hong Kong.
targetString: No mesmo ano, o HCoV-HKU1 foi isolado de um homem de 71 anos hospitalizado com pneumonia e bronquiolite em Hong Kong.
en-mt: In the same year, HCoV-HKU1 was isolated from a 71-year-old man hospitalized with pneumonia and bronchiolitis in Hong Kong.

sourceString: Besides community-acquired pneumonia and bronchiolitis, HCoV-HKU1 was reported to be associated with acute asthmatic exacerbation.
targetString: Além da pneumonia e da bronquiolite adquiridas de modo comunitário, relatou-se que o HCoV-HKU1 estava associado à exacerbação da asma aguda.
en-mt: In addition to community-acquired pneumonia and bronchiolitis, HCoV-HKU1 has been reported to be associated with exacerbation of acute asthma.

sourceString: Similar to HCoV-NL63, HCoV-229E and HCoV-OC43, HCoV-HKU1 was found worldwide, causing mild respiratory diseases.
targetString: Do mesmo modo que o HCoV-NL63, o HCoV-229E e o HCoV-OC43, o HCoV-HKU1 foi encontrado no mundo todo, causando doenças respiratórias brandas.
en-mt: Like HCoV-NL63, HCoV-229E, and HCoV-OC43, HCoV-HKU1 has been found worldwide to cause mild respiratory illness.

sourceString: All these four community-acquired HCoVs have been well adapted to humans and are generally less likely to mutate to cause highly pathogenic diseases, though accidents did occur for unknown reasons as in the rare case of a more virulent subtype of HCoV-NL63, which has recently been reported to cause severe lower respiratory tract infection in China.
targetString: Todos esses quatro HCoVs adquiridos de modo comunitário se adaptaram bem aos seres humanos e têm geralmente menor chance de sofrerem mutação e causarem doenças altamente patogênicas, embora acidentes tenham ocorrido por razões desconhecidas no raro caso de um subtipo mais virulento do HCoV-NL63, que foi relatado recentemente como causador de infecção grave do trato respiratório inferior na China.
en-mt: All four of these community-acquired HCoVs have adapted well to humans and are generally less likely to mutate and cause highly pathogenic disease, although accidents have occurred for unknown reasons in the rare case of a more virulent subtype of HCoV-NL63, which was recently reported to cause severe lower respiratory tract infection in China.

sourceString: Generally, when these HCoVs acquire the abilities to transmit efficiently and to maintain themselves continuously within humans, they also become less virulent or pathogenic.
targetString: No geral, quando esses HCoVs adquirem a capacidade de serem transmitidos de modo eficiente e de se manterem continuamente nos seres humanos, eles também se tornam menos virulentos e menos patogênicos.
en-mt: Overall, when these HCoVs gain the ability to be transmitted efficiently and to maintain themselves continuously in humans, they also become less virulent and less pathogenic.

sourceString: MERS-CoV was first isolated in 2012 from the lung of a 60-year-old patient who developed acute pneumonia and renal failure in Saudi Arabia.
targetString: O MERS-CoV foi isolado pela primeira vez em 2012 do pulmão de um paciente de 60 anos que desenvolveu pneumonia aguda e falha renal na Arábia Saudita.
en-mt: MERS-CoV was first isolated in 2012 from the lung of a 60-year-old patient who developed acute pneumonia and kidney failure in Saudi Arabia.

sourceString: Whereas most of the laboratory-confirmed cases originate from the Middle East, imported cases with occasional secondary spreads to close contacts have been reported in various European countries and Tunisia.
targetString: Enquanto a maioria dos casos confirmados por laboratório tem origem no Oriente Médio, casos importados com propagação secundária ocasional para contatos próximos foram relatados em vários países europeus e na Tunísia.
en-mt: While most laboratory-confirmed cases originate in the Middle East, imported cases with occasional secondary spread to close contacts have been reported in several European countries and Tunisia.

sourceString: Another secondary outbreak occurred in South Korea in 2015 with 186 confirmed cases.
targetString: Outra epidemia secundária ocorreu na Coreia do Sul em 2015 com 186 casos confirmados.
en-mt: Another secondary epidemic occurred in South Korea in 2015 with 186 confirmed cases.

sourceString: Clinical manifestations of MERS resemble those of SARS, characterized by progressive acute pneumonia.
targetString: As manifestações clínicas da MERS assemelham-se às da SARS, caracterizadas por pneumonia aguda progressiva.
en-mt: The clinical manifestations of MERS resemble those of SARS, characterized by progressive acute pneumonia.

sourceString: Unlike SARS, many patients with MERS also developed acute renal failure, which is thus far unique for MERS among HCoV-caused diseases.
targetString: Ao contrário da SARS, muitos pacientes com MERS também desenvolvem insuficiência renal aguda, o que é, portanto, bem peculiar para a MERS, entre as doenças causadas por HCoV.
en-mt: Unlike SARS, many MERS patients also develop acute renal failure, which is therefore quite peculiar for MERS among the diseases caused by HCoV.

sourceString: More than 30% of patients present with gastrointestinal symptoms, such as diarrhea and vomiting.
targetString: Mais de 30% dos pacientes apresentam sintomas gastrointestinais, como diarreia e vômito.
en-mt: More than 30% of patients have gastrointestinal symptoms such as diarrhea and vomiting.

sourceString: As of February 14, 2020, over 2500 laboratory confirmed cases were reported with a high case fatality of 34.4%, making MERS-CoV one of the most devastating viruses known to humans.
targetString: Até 14 de fevereiro de 2020, mais de 2.500 casos confirmados por laboratório foram relatados com uma alta taxa de mortalidade relacionada aos casos confirmados, de 34,4%, o que tornou o MERS-CoV um dos vírus mais devastadores de conhecimento do homem.
en-mt: As of February 14, 2020, over 2,500 laboratory-confirmed cases have been reported with a high case-related fatality rate of 34.4%, which has made MERS-CoV one of the most devastating viruses known to man.

sourceString: During middle to late December 2019, clusters of pneumonia patients retrospectively known to be associated with SARS-CoV-2 infection were detected in Wuhan, Hubei Province, China.
targetString: Da metade para o final de dezembro de 2019, grupos de pacientes com pneumonia, a qual sabia-se retrospectivamente estar associada à infecção por SARS-CoV-2, foram detectados em Wuhan, Província de Hubei, na China.
en-mt: In mid-to-late December 2019, clusters of patients with pneumonia, which was retrospectively known to be associated with SARS-CoV-2 infection, were detected in Wuhan, Hubei Province, China.

sourceString: World Health Organization declared the ongoing outbreak of lower respiratory tract infection caused by SARS-CoV-2 a Public Health Emergency of International Concern and also named the disease COVID-19.
targetString: A Organização Mundial da Saúde declarou a epidemia contínua de infecção do trato respiratório inferior causada pelo SARS-CoV-2 uma Emergência de Saúde Pública de Importância Internacional e também nomeou a doença COVID-19.
en-mt: The World Health Organization has declared the ongoing epidemic of lower respiratory tract infection caused by SARS-CoV-2 a Public Health Emergency of International Concern and has also named the disease COVID-19.

sourceString: As of March 3, 2020, 90,053 cases have been confirmed worldwide, with a crude case fatality of 3.4%.
targetString: Até 3 de março de 2020, 90.053 casos foram confirmados no mundo, com uma taxa bruta de mortalidade relacionada aos casos confirmados de 3,4%.
en-mt: As of March 3, 2020, 90,053 cases have been confirmed worldwide, with a crude death rate related to confirmed cases of 3.4%.

sourceString: Notably, the case fatality in Hubei, China is 4.2%, whereas the one outside of it is 1.2%.
targetString: Nota-se que a letalidade relacionado aos casos confirmados em Hubei, na China, é de 4,2%, enquanto a letalidade fora dessa cidade é de 1,2%.
en-mt: Note that the lethality related to confirmed cases in Hubei, China, is 4.2%, while the lethality outside that city is 1.2%.

sourceString: SARS-CoV-2 causes severe respiratory infection like SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV, presented as fever, cough and dyspnea.
targetString: O SARS-CoV-2 causa infecção respiratória grave, do mesmo modo que o SARS-CoV e o MERS-CoV, com presença de febre, tosse e dispneia.
en-mt: SARS-CoV-2 causes severe respiratory infection, similarly to SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV, with the presence of fever, cough and dyspnoea.

sourceString: Diarrhea is also seen in some patients.
targetString: Alguns pacientes também apresentam diarreia.
en-mt: Some patients also have diarrhea.

sourceString: Pneumonia is one of the most severe symptoms and can progress rapidly to acute respiratory distress syndrome.
targetString: A pneumonia é um dos sintomas mais graves e pode evoluir rapidamente para a síndrome do desconforto respiratório agudo.
en-mt: Pneumonia is one of the most serious symptoms and can quickly progress to acute respiratory distress syndrome.

sourceString: Although SARS-CoV and SARS-CoV-2 are very similar due to high nucleotide sequence homology of 82%, they cluster into different branches in the phylogenetic tree.
targetString: Embora o SARS-CoV e o SARS-CoV-2 sejam muito similares devido à alta homologia de 82% na sequência nucleotídica, eles se agrupam em ramos diferentes na árvore filogenética.
en-mt: Although SARS-CoV and SARS-CoV-2 are very similar due to a high homology of 82% in nucleotide sequence, they cluster on different branches in the phylogenetic tree.

sourceString: SARS-CoV-2 is apparently less pathogenic but more transmissible compared to SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV.
targetString: O SARS-CoV-2 aparentemente é menos patogênico, mas é mais transmissível comparado ao SARS-CoV e ao MERS-CoV.
en-mt: SARS-CoV-2 appears to be less pathogenic but more transmissible compared to SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV.

sourceString: Asymptomatic subjects infected with SARS-CoV-2 have been reported and might contribute to its rapid spreading around the world.
targetString: Foram relatados indivíduos assintomáticos infectados pelo SARS-CoV-2, e eles podem contribuir para a rápida propagação do vírus no mundo.
en-mt: Asymptomatic individuals infected with SARS-CoV-2 have been reported, and they may contribute to the rapid spread of the virus worldwide.

sourceString: Comparing and contrasting SARS-CoV-2 with the other six HCoVs reveal similarities and differences of great interest.
targetString: A comparação e o contraste do SARS-CoV-2 com os outros seis HCoVs revelam semelhanças e diferenças de grande relevância.
en-mt: Comparing and contrasting SARS-CoV-2 with the other six HCoVs reveals striking similarities and differences.

sourceString: First, the incubation period and the duration of the course of HCoV disease are very similar.
targetString: Em primeiro lugar, o período de incubação e a duração da evolução da doença do HCoV são muito semelhantes.
en-mt: First, the incubation period and duration of disease progression of HCoV are very similar.

sourceString: In this regard, SARS-CoV-2 follows the general trend of the other six HCoVs.
targetString: Nesse sentido, o SARS-CoV-2 segue a tendência geral dos outros seis HCoVs.
en-mt: In that sense, SARS-CoV-2 follows the general trend of the other six HCoVs.

sourceString: Second, the severity of symptoms of COVID-19 lies between SARS-CoV and the four community-acquired HCoVs (i.e. HCoV-229E, HCoV-OC43, HCoV-HKU1 and HCoV-NL63).
targetString: Em segundo lugar, a gravidade dos sintomas da COVID-19 encontra-se entre a gravidade do SARS-CoV e a gravidade dos quatro HCoVs adquiridos de modo comunitário (HCoV-229E, HCoV-OC43, HCoV-HKU1 e HCoV-NL63).
en-mt: Second, the severity of COVID-19 symptoms lies between the severity of SARS-CoV and the severity of the four community-acquired HCoVs (HCoV-229E, HCoV-OC43, HCoV-HKU1, and HCoV-NL63).

sourceString: On one hand, SARS-CoV-2 infection exhibits features that are more commonly seen during infection with community-acquired HCoVs, including the presentation of non-specific, mild or even no symptoms.
targetString: Por um lado, a infecção por SARS-CoV-2 apresenta características que são mais observadas durante a infecção com HCoVs adquiridos de modo comunitário, incluindo a presença de sintomas não específicos, brandos ou até a ausência de sintomas.
en-mt: On the one hand, SARS-CoV-2 infection exhibits features that are more commonly seen during infection with community-acquired HCoVs, including the presence of non-specific, mild, or even no symptoms at all.

sourceString: On the other hand, a small subset of severe cases of COVID-19 can also be seen as in the case of SARS-CoV infection, although the ratio is a bit lower.
targetString: Por outro lado, um pequeno subgrupo de casos graves de COVID-19 também pode ser observado, como no caso da infecção por SARS-CoV, embora a proporção seja um pouco menor.
en-mt: On the other hand, a small subgroup of severe cases of COVID-19 can also be observed, as in the case of SARS-CoV infection, although the proportion is somewhat smaller.

sourceString: Third, the transmission of SARS-CoV-2 also shows interesting patterns characteristic of both community-acquired HCoVs and SARS-CoV.
targetString: Em terceiro lugar, a transmissão do SARS-CoV-2 também mostra padrões interessantes, tanto nos HCoVs adquiridos de modo comunitário quanto nos SARS-CoV.
en-mt: Third, the transmission of SARS-CoV-2 also shows interesting patterns, both in community-acquired HCoVs and in SARS-CoV.

sourceString: On one hand, the transmissibility of SARS-CoV-2 is at least as high as that of community-acquired HCoVs.
targetString: Por um lado, a transmissibilidade do SARS-CoV-2 é, pelo menos, tão alta quanto a dos HCoVs adquiridos na comunidade.
en-mt: On the one hand, the transmissibility of SARS-CoV-2 is at least as high as that of community-acquired HCoVs.

sourceString: On the other hand, it remains to be verified whether the transmissibility of SARS-CoV-2 decreases after passages in humans as in the cases of SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV.
targetString: Por outro lado, deve-se confirmar se a transmissibilidade do SARS-CoV-2 diminui após passar para os seres humanos, como no caso do SARS-CoV e do MERS-CoV.
en-mt: On the other hand, it must be confirmed whether the transmissibility of SARS-CoV-2 decreases after passing to humans, as in the case of SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV.

sourceString: Finally, same as the other HCoVs, SARS-CoV-2 can be detected in fecal samples.
targetString: Por fim, do mesmo modo que os outros HCoVs, o SARS-CoV-2 pode ser detectado em amostras fecais.
en-mt: Finally, like other HCoVs, SARS-CoV-2 can be detected in fecal samples.

sourceString: Whether fecal-oral transmission of SARS-CoV-2 plays an important role as in the case of SARS-CoV at least under some circumstance remains to be clarified by future studies.
targetString: Ainda precisa ser esclarecido em estudos futuros se a transmissão oro-fecal do SARS-CoV-2 desempenha um papel importante, como no caso do SARS-CoV, pelo menos em algumas circunstâncias.
en-mt: It remains to be clarified in future studies whether oro-fecal transmission of SARS-CoV-2 plays an important role, as in the case of SARS-CoV, at least in some circumstances.

sourceString: It is also of particularly great interest to see whether SARS-CoV-2 might exhibit seasonality as in the cases of community-acquired HCoVs.
targetString: É também de grande interesse descobrir se o SARS-CoV-2 pode exibir sazonalidade, como nos casos de HCoVs adquiridos de modo comunitário.
en-mt: It is also of great interest to find out whether SARS-CoV-2 can exhibit seasonality, as in cases of community-acquired HCoVs.

sourceString: Nevertheless, the features of SARS-CoV-2 including its transmissibility, pathogenicity and sustainable spreading after passages in humans will be influential on the ultimate fate of the ongoing outbreak of COVID-19.
targetString: De qualquer forma, as características do SARS-CoV-2, incluindo sua transmissibilidade, patogenicidade e propagação sustentável depois de sua passagem para os seres humanos, influenciarão o desfecho da epidemia atual de COVID-19.
en-mt: In any case, the characteristics of SARS-CoV-2, including its transmissibility, pathogenicity and sustainable spread after its passage to humans, will influence the outcome of the current COVID-19 epidemic.

sourceString: All four community-acquired HCoVs causing mild symptoms have been well adapted to humans.
targetString: Todos os HCoVs adquiridos por modo comunitário que causam sintomas brandos se adaptaram bem aos seres humanos.
en-mt: All community-acquired HCoVs that cause mild symptoms have adapted well to humans.

sourceString: From another perspective, it might also be true that humans have been well adapted to these four HCoVs.
targetString: Sob outra perspectiva, também pode ser verdade que os seres humanos se adaptaram bem a esses quatro HCoVs.
en-mt: From another perspective, it may also be true that humans have adapted well to these four HCoVs.

sourceString: In other words, both could be the survivors of ancient HCoV pandemics.
targetString: Em outras palavras, os dois poderiam ser os sobreviventes de pandemias antigas de HCoV.
en-mt: In other words, the two could be survivors of ancient HCoV pandemics.

sourceString: HCoVs that cause severe diseases in humans and humans who developed severe HCoV diseases have been eliminated.
targetString: Os HCoVs que causam doenças graves em seres humanos e a pessoas que desenvolvem doenças graves de HCoVs foram eliminados.
en-mt: HCoVs that cause severe disease in humans and people who develop severe disease from HCoVs have been eliminated.

sourceString: For this to happen, HCoVs have to replicate in humans to sufficient extent to allow the accumulation of adaptive mutations that counteract host restriction factors.
targetString: Para que isso aconteça, os HCoVs precisam se replicar nos seres humanos a uma extensão suficiente de modo a permitir a acumulação de mutações adaptativas que neutralizem os fatores de restrição.
en-mt: For this to happen, HCoVs need to replicate in humans to a sufficient extent to allow the accumulation of adaptive mutations that counteract the restricting factors.

sourceString: In this sense, the longer the SARS-CoV-2 outbreak persists and the more people that it infects, the greater chance that it will fully adapt to humans.
targetString: Nesse sentido, quanto maior for o tempo de permanência da epidemia de SARS-CoV-2, mais pessoas serão infectadas, e maior a chance de que o vírus de adapte aos seres humanos.
en-mt: In this sense, the longer the SARS-CoV-2 epidemic lasts, the more people will be infected, and the greater the chance that the virus will adapt to humans.

sourceString: If it adapts well, its transmission in humans would be difficult to stop by quarantine or other infection control measures.
targetString: Se a adaptação for adequada, sua transmissão aos seres humanos seria difícil de controlar com a quarentena ou outras medidas de controle de infecção.
en-mt: If adaptation is adequate, its transmission to humans would be difficult to control with quarantine or other infection control measures.

sourceString: For many years, the four community-acquired CoVs circulate in human populations, triggering common cold in immunocompetent subjects.
targetString: Há vários anos, os quatro CoVs adquiridos de modo comunitário circulam nas populações humanas, causando resfriado comum em indivíduos imunocompetentes.
en-mt: For several years now, the four community-acquired CoVs have been circulating in human populations, causing the common cold in immunocompetent individuals.

sourceString: These viruses do not need an animal reservoir.
targetString: Esses vírus não precisam de um reservatório animal.
en-mt: These viruses do not need an animal reservoir.

sourceString: In contrast, highly pathogenic SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV have not adapted to humans well and their transmission within humans cannot be sustained.
targetString: Em contrapartida, o SARS-CoV e o MERS-CoV, altamente patogênicos, não se adaptaram bem aos serem humanos, e sua transmissão entre os seres humanos não pode ser sustentada.
en-mt: In contrast, the highly pathogenic SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV have not adapted well to humans, and their human-to-human transmission cannot be sustained.

sourceString: They need to maintain and propagate in their zoonotic reservoirs and seek the chance to spillover to susceptible human targets, possibly via one or more intermediate and amplifying hosts.
targetString: Eles necessitam manter-se e propagar-se em seus reservatórios zoonóticos e aproveitar a chance de migrar para alvos humanos suscetíveis, possivelmente por meio de um ou mais hospedeiros intermediários e amplificadores.
en-mt: They need to maintain and propagate in their zoonotic reservoirs and take the chance to migrate to susceptible human targets, possibly via one or more intermediate and enhancer hosts.

sourceString: SARS-CoV-2 has features that are similar to both SARS-CoV/MERS-CoV and the four community-acquired HCoVs.
targetString: O SARS-CoV-2 tem características similares ao SARS-CoV, ao MERS-CoV e aos quatro HCoVs adquiridos de modo comunitário.
en-mt: SARS-CoV-2 has similar characteristics to SARS-CoV, MERS-CoV, and the four community-acquired HCoVs.

sourceString: It is highly transmissible like community-acquired HCoVs, at least for the time being.
targetString: Ele é altamente transmissível, da mesma forma que os HCoVs adquiridos de modo comunitário, pelo menos até o momento.
en-mt: It is highly transmissible, as are community-acquired HCoVs, at least so far.

sourceString: However, it is more pathogenic than community-acquired HCoVs and less pathogenic than SARS-CoV or MERS-CoV.
targetString: Entretanto, ele é mais patogênico que os HCoVs adquiridos de modo comunitário e menos patogênico do que o SARS-CoV e o MERS-CoV.
en-mt: However, it is more pathogenic than community-acquired HCoVs and less pathogenic than SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV.

sourceString: It remains to be seen whether it will adapt fully to humans and circulate within humans without a reservoir or intermediate animal host.
targetString: Ainda precisa ser descoberto se ele se adaptará completamente aos seres humanos e circulará entre nós sem um hospedeiro animal reservatório ou intermediário.
en-mt: It remains to be seen whether it will fully adapt to humans and circulate among us without a reservoir or intermediate animal host.

sourceString: Before discussing the animal origins of HCoVs, it will serve us well to discuss the definitions and characteristics of evolutionary, natural, reservoir, intermediate and amplifying hosts of HCoVs.
targetString: Antes de discutir as origens animais dos HCoVs, seria útil discutir as definições e características dos hospedeiros evolutivos, naturais, reservatórios, intermediários e amplificadores dos HCoVs.
en-mt: Before discussing the animal origins of HCoVs, it would be helpful to discuss the definitions and characteristics of evolutionary, natural hosts, reservoirs, intermediates, and amplifiers of HCoVs.

sourceString: An animal serves as the evolutionary host of an HCoV if it harbours a closely related ancestor sharing high homology at the level of nucleotide sequence.
targetString: Um animal serve como o hospedeiro evolutivo de um HCoV se ele abriga um ancestral de relação direta, compartilhando alta homologia a nível da sequência nucleotídica.
en-mt: An animal serves as the evolutionary host of an HCoV if it harbors a closely related ancestor sharing high homology at the nucleotide sequence level.

sourceString: The ancestral virus is usually well adapted and non-pathogenic in this host.
targetString: O vírus ancestral geralmente é bem adaptado e não patogênico nesse hospedeiro.
en-mt: The ancestral virus is usually well adapted and non-pathogenic in that host.

sourceString: Likewise, a reservoir host harbours HCoV continuously and for long term.
targetString: Da mesma forma, um hospedeiro reservatório abriga o HCoV de modo contínuo e duradouro.
en-mt: Likewise, a reservoir host harbors HCoV continuously and enduringly.

sourceString: In both cases, the hosts are naturally infected and are the natural hosts of HCoV or its parental virus.
targetString: Nos dois casos, os hospedeiros são infectados naturalmente e são os hospedeiros naturais do HCoV ou de seu vírus parental.
en-mt: In both cases, the hosts are naturally infected and are the natural hosts of the HCoV or its parent virus.

sourceString: In contrast, if the HCoV is newly introduced to an intermediate host right before or around its introduction to humans, it is not well adapted to the new host and is often pathogenic.
targetString: Em contrapartida, se o HCoV é recém-introduzido a um hospedeiro intermediário logo antes ou perto de sua introdução aos seres humanos, ele não se adapta adequadamente ao novo hospedeiro, e é geralmente patogênico.
en-mt: In contrast, if HCoV is newly introduced to an intermediate host shortly before or close to its introduction to humans, it does not adapt properly to the new host, and is generally pathogenic.

sourceString: This intermediate host can serve as the zoonotic source of human infection and play the role of an amplifying host by allowing the virus to replicate transiently and then transmitting it to humans to amplify the scale of human infection.
targetString: Esse hospedeiro intermediário pode servir como a fonte zoonótica da infecção humana e desempenhar a função de um hospedeiro amplificador, permitindo que o vírus replique de forma transiente e, então, transmitindo-o para humanos e aumentando a escala da infecção humana.
en-mt: This intermediate host can serve as the zoonotic source of human infection and play the role of an amplifying host, allowing the virus to replicate transiently and then transmitting it to humans and increasing the scale of human infection.

sourceString: An HCoV can undergo a dead-end infection if it cannot sustain its transmission within the intermediate host.
targetString: Um HCoV pode ter a infecção interrompida se ele não conseguir sustentar sua transmissão no hospedeiro intermediário.
en-mt: An HCoV can stop infection if it fails to sustain its transmission in the intermediate host.

sourceString: On the contrary, HCoVs can also adapt to the intermediate host and even establish long-term endemicity.
targetString: Em contrapartida, os HCoVs também pode se adaptar ao hospedeiro intermediário e estabelecer endemicidade de longo prazo.
en-mt: In contrast, HCoVs can also adapt to the intermediate host and establish long-term endemicity.

sourceString: In this case, the intermediate host becomes a natural reservoir host.
targetString: Nesse caso, o hospedeiro intermediário torna-se o hospedeiro reservatório natural.
en-mt: In this case, the intermediate host becomes the natural reservoir host.

sourceString: Epidemiological data revealed retrospectively that the index case of SARS had a contact history with game animals.
targetString: Dados epidemiológicos revelaram que o paciente zero da SARS teve um histórico de contato com animais de caça.
en-mt: Epidemiological data revealed that SARS patient zero had a history of contact with game animals.

sourceString: Subsequent seroprevalence investigations indicated that animal traders had a higher prevalence of anti-SARS-CoV IgG compared with that of the general population.
targetString: Investigações posteriores da soroprevalência indicaram que comerciantes de animais tinham uma maior prevalência de IgG antiSARS-CoV, em comparação com a da população geral.
en-mt: Further seroprevalence investigations indicated that animal traders had a higher prevalence of antiSARS-CoV IgG compared to the general population.

sourceString: Masked palm civets (Paguma larvata) and a racoon dog in live animal markets were first identified to carry SARS-CoV-like viruses that are almost identical to SARS-CoV.
targetString: Civetas de palma mascarada (Paguma larvata) e um cão-guaxinim nos mercados de animais vivos foram identificados inicialmente como portadores de vírus similares ao SARS-CoV.
en-mt: Masked palm civets (Paguma larvata) and a raccoon dog in live animal markets were initially identified as carrying viruses similar to SARS-CoV.

sourceString: This was indirectly supported by the fact that no further SARS was reported after killing all civets in the markets.
targetString: A identificação foi corroborada indiretamente pelo fato de que nenhuma outra SARS foi notificada após o abate de todas as civetas nos mercados.
en-mt: The identification was indirectly supported by the fact that no further SARS was reported after the culling of all civets in the markets.

sourceString: However, it has been reported that masked palm civets from the wild or farms without exposure to the live animal markets were largely negative for SARS-CoV, suggesting that masked palm civets might only serve as the intermediate amplifying host but not the natural reservoir of SARS-CoV.
targetString: Entretanto, foi relatado que as civetas de palma mascarada selvagens ou de fazendas sem exposição aos mercados de animais vivos eram altamente negativas para o SARS-CoV, sugerindo que as civetas de palma mascarada poderiam ser apenas o hospedeiro intermediário amplificador, mas não o reservatório natural do SARS-CoV.
en-mt: However, wild or farmed masked palm civets with no exposure to live animal markets were reported to be highly negative for SARS-CoV, suggesting that masked palm civets could only be the intermediate amplifier host, but not the natural reservoir. of SARS-CoV.

sourceString: Notably, since 80% of the different animals in the markets in Guangzhou have anti-SARS-CoV antibodies, the possibilities that multiple species of small mammals might also serve as intermediate amplifying hosts of SARS-CoV cannot be excluded.
targetString: Nota-se que 80% dos diferentes animais nos mercados em Guangzhou têm anticorpos antiSARS-CoV; a possibilidade de que várias espécies de pequenos mamíferos possam servir de hospedeiros intermediários amplificadores do SARS-CoV não pode ser excluída.
en-mt: It is noted that 80% of the different animals in the markets in Guangzhou have anti-SARS-CoV antibodies; the possibility that several species of small mammals could serve as intermediate, amplifying hosts for SARS-CoV cannot be excluded.

sourceString: All of these appear to be dead-end hosts of SARS-CoV.
targetString: Todos esses animais parecem ser hospedeiros terminais do SARS-CoV.
en-mt: All of these animals appear to be terminal hosts of SARS-CoV.

sourceString: Subsequent search for the natural animal host of SARS-CoV unveiled a closely related bat CoV, termed SARS-related Rhinolophus bat CoV HKU3 (SARSr-Rh-BatCoV HKU3), which exists in Chinese horseshoe bats.
targetString: A procura subsequente pelo hospedeiro animal natural do SARS-CoV revelou um CoV de morcego de relação estreita, nomeado CoV HKU3 de morcego Rhinolophus relacionado ao SARS (SARSr-Rh-BatCoV HKU3), que existe no morcego-ferradura chinês.
en-mt: Subsequent search for the natural animal host of SARS-CoV revealed a closely related bat CoV, named SARS-related Rhinolophus bat CoV HKU3 (SARSr-Rh-BatCoV HKU3), which exists in the Chinese horseshoe bat.

sourceString: These bats are positive for anti-SARS-CoV antibodies and genome sequence of SARSr-Rh-BatCoV HKU3.
targetString: Esses morcegos são positivos para anticorpos antiSARS-CoV e para a sequência genômica do SARSr-Rh-BatCoV HKU3.
en-mt: These bats are positive for antiSARS-CoV antibodies and for the genomic sequence of SARSr-Rh-BatCoV HKU3.

sourceString: This and other bat CoVs share 88-92% nucleotide sequence homology with SARS-CoV.
targetString: Este e outros CoVs de morcegos compartilham de 88% a 92% de homologia com o SARS-CoV na sequência nucleotídica.
en-mt: This and other bat CoVs share 88% to 92% homology with SARS-CoV in nucleotide sequence.

sourceString: These studies have laid the foundation for the new concept that bats host emerging human pathogens.
targetString: Esses estudos formaram a base para o novo conceito de que os morcegos são o hospedeiro de patógenos humanos emergentes.
en-mt: These studies formed the basis for the new concept that bats are the host of emerging human pathogens.

sourceString: Several SARS-like CoVs (SL-CoVs) have also been identified from bats, but none except for one designated WIV1 can be isolated as live virus.
targetString: Vários CoVs semelhantes ao SARS (SL-CoVs) também foram identificados em morcegos, mas nenhum CoV, com exceção do designado WIV1, pode ser isolado como vírus vivo.
en-mt: Several SARS-like CoVs (SL-CoVs) have also been identified in bats, but no CoVs, with the exception of the designated WIV1, can be isolated as live viruses.

sourceString: Human angiotensin converting enzyme 2 (ACE2) is known to be the receptor of SARS-CoV.
targetString: Sabe-se que a enzima conversora de angiotensina 2 (ECA2) dos seres humanos é o receptor do SARS-CoV.
en-mt: Human angiotensin-converting enzyme 2 (ACE2) is known to be the receptor for SARS-CoV.

sourceString: WIV1 derived from fecal sample of bats was demonstrated to use bat, civet and human ACE2 as receptor for cell entry.
targetString: Demonstrou-se que o WIV1 derivado de amostras fecais de morcegos usa a ECA2 de morcegos, civetas e seres humanos como receptor para entrada nas células.
en-mt: WIV1 derived from bat fecal samples has been shown to use ACE2 from bats, civets and humans as a receptor for entry into cells.

sourceString: Intriguingly, sera of convalescent SARS patients were capable of neutralizing WIV1.
targetString: É intrigante o fato de que o soro de pacientes convalescentes da SARS foi capaz de neutralizar o WIV1.
en-mt: It is intriguing that serum from convalescent SARS patients was able to neutralize WIV1.

sourceString: Thus far, WIV1 represents the most closely related ancestor of SARS-CoV in bats, sharing 95% nucleotide sequence homology.
targetString: Até agora, o WIV1 representa o ancestral com relação mais próxima ao SARS-CoV em morcegos, compartilhando 95% de homologia na sequência nucleotídica.
en-mt: So far, WIV1 represents the closest related ancestor to SARS-CoV in bats, sharing 95% homology in nucleotide sequence.

sourceString: Albeit the high homology between these two viruses, it is generally believed that WIV1 is not the immediate parental virus of SARS-CoV and bats are not the immediate reservoir host of SARS-CoV.
targetString: Apesar da alta homologia entre esses dois vírus, acredita-se, no geral, que o WIV1 não seja o vírus parental imediato do SARS-CoV, e que os morcegos não sejam os hospedeiros reservatórios imediatos do SARS-CoV.
en-mt: Despite the high homology between these two viruses, it is generally believed that WIV1 is not the immediate parental virus of SARS-CoV, and that bats are not the immediate reservoir hosts of SARS-CoV.

sourceString: Phylogenetic analysis clusters MERS-CoV to the same group as bat CoV-HKU4 and bat CoV-HKU5.
targetString: A análise filogenética agrupa o MERS-CoV no mesmo grupo que o CoV-HKU4 de morcegos e que o CoV-HKU5 de morcegos.
en-mt: Phylogenetic analysis groups MERS-CoV into the same group as bat-CoV-HKU4 and bat-CoV-HKU5.

sourceString: Bat CoV-HKU4 and MERS-CoV utilize the same host receptor, dipeptidyl peptidase 4 (DPP4), for virus entry.
targetString: O CoV-HKU4 de morcegos e o MERS-CoV usam o mesmo receptor do hospedeiro, a dipeptidil-peptidase 4 (DPP4), para a entrada do vírus.
en-mt: Bat CoV-HKU4 and MERS-CoV use the same host receptor, dipeptidyl peptidase 4 (DPP4), for virus entry.

sourceString: RNA-dependent RNA polymerase sequences of MERS-CoV are phylogenetically closer to counterparts in bat beta-CoVs identified from Europe and Africa.
targetString: Sequências de polimerase de RNA dependentes de RNA do MERS-CoV são filogeneticamente mais próximas aos homólogos em betaCoVs de morcegos identificados na Europa e na África.
en-mt: MERS-CoV RNA-dependent RNA polymerase sequences are phylogenetically closer to homologues in betaCoVs from bats identified in Europe and Africa.

sourceString: Up to now, no live MERS-CoV can be found in wild bats.
targetString: Até agora, nenhum MERS-CoV vivo foi encontrado em morcegos selvagens.
en-mt: So far, no live MERS-CoV has been found in wild bats.

sourceString: MERS-CoV and its closest relative bat CoV-HKU25 share only 87% nucleotide sequence homology.
targetString: O MERS-CoV e seu parente mais próximo, o CoV-HKU25 dos morcegos, compartilham apenas 87% de homologia na sequência nucleotídica.
en-mt: MERS-CoV and its closest relative, bat CoV-HKU25, share only 87% homology in nucleotide sequence.

sourceString: Thus, bats might not be the immediate reservoir host of MERS-CoV.
targetString: Portanto, os morcegos podem não ser o hospedeiro reservatório imediato do MERS-CoV.
en-mt: Therefore, bats may not be the immediate reservoir host for MERS-CoV.

sourceString: On the other hand, studies in Middle East have shown that dromedary camels are seropositive for MERS-CoV-specific neutralizing antibodies, same as camels of Middle East origin in multiple African countries.
targetString: Por outro lado, estudos no Oriente Médio mostraram que os dromedários são soropositivos para anticorpos de neutralização específica do MERS-CoV, da mesma forma que camelos do Oriente Médio em vários países da África.
en-mt: On the other hand, studies in the Middle East have shown that camels are seropositive for MERS-CoV-specific neutralizing antibodies, as are Middle Eastern camels in several African countries.

sourceString: Live MERS-CoV identical to the virus found in humans was isolated from the nasal swabs of dromedary camels, further indicating that camels serve as the bona fide reservoir host of MERS-CoV.
targetString: O MERS-CoV vivo, idêntico ao vírus encontrado nos seres humanos, foi isolado de esfregaços nasais de dromedários, aumentado a evidência de que os camelos sirvam como o hospedeiro reservatório legítimo do MERS-CoV.
en-mt: Live MERS-CoV, identical to the virus found in humans, was isolated from camel nasal swabs, adding to the evidence that camels serve as the legitimate reservoir host for MERS-CoV.

sourceString: It is also noteworthy that generally mild symptoms but massive virus shedding were observed in camels experimentally infected with MERS-CoV.
targetString: Também vale notar que os sintomas geralmente brandos, porém com transmissão massiva do vírus, foram observados em camelos infectados experimentalmente com o MERS-CoV.
en-mt: It is also worth noting that generally mild symptoms, but with massive transmission of the virus, have been observed in camels experimentally infected with MERS-CoV.

sourceString: Notably, infected camels shed viruses not only through respiratory route but also through fecal-oral route, which is also the main route for virus shedding from bats.
