targetString: É notável que os camelos infectados transmitem os vírus não apenas pela rota respiratória, mas também pela rota fecal-oral, que também é a principal rota de transmissão de vírus em morcegos.
en-mt: It is notable that infected camels transmit the viruses not only through the respiratory route but also through the fecal-oral route, which is also the main route of virus transmission in bats.

sourceString: However, questions still remain since many confirmed cases of MERS have no contact history with camels prior to symptom onset, plausibly ascribed to human-to-human transmission or unknown transmission routes involving unrecognized animal species that harbour MERS-CoV.
targetString: Entretanto, ainda faltam respostas, já que muitos casos confirmados da MERS não têm histórico de contato com camelos antes do aparecimento dos sintomas, que podem ser atribuídos, de forma plausível, à transmissão entre pessoas ou a rotas de transmissão que envolvem espécies animais não identificadas que abrigam o MERS-CoV.
en-mt: However, answers are still lacking, as many confirmed cases of MERS have no history of contact with camels before the onset of symptoms, which could plausibly be attributed to person-to-person transmission or transmission routes involving unidentified animal species. that harbor MERS-CoV.

sourceString: SARS-CoV-2 shares 96.2% nucleotide homology with a bat CoV RaTG13 isolated from Rhinolophus affinis bats.
targetString: O SARS-CoV-2 compartilha 96,2% de homologia de nucleotídeos com um CoV RaTG13 de morcego, isolado de morcegos Rhinolophus affinis.
en-mt: SARS-CoV-2 shares 96.2% nucleotide homology with a bat CoV RaTG13, isolated from Rhinolophus affinis bats.

sourceString: As in the cases of SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV, the sequence divergence between SARS-CoV-2 and RaTG13 is too great to assign parental relationship.
targetString: Como nos casos de SARS-CoV e de MERS-CoV, a divergência na sequência entre SARS-CoV-2 e RaTG13 é muito grande para se atribuir uma relação parental.
en-mt: As in the cases of SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV, the sequence divergence between SARS-CoV-2 and RaTG13 is too large to attribute a parental relationship.

sourceString: That is to say, bats might not be the immediate reservoir host(s) of SARS-CoV-2 unless almost identical bat CoVs are found in future.
targetString: Ou seja, os morcegos podem não ser os hospedeiros reservatórios imediatos do SARS-CoV-2, a menos que CoVs quase idênticos de morcegos sejam descobertos futuramente.
en-mt: That is, bats may not be the immediate reservoir hosts for SARS-CoV-2, unless nearly identical CoVs from bats are discovered in the future.

sourceString: Presumably, the intermediate animal hosts of SARS-CoV-2 should be among the wildlife species sold and killed at the Huanan Seafood Wholesale Market, with which many of the initial cases of COVID-19 were associated, indicative of a probable animal-to-human transmission event.
targetString: Presume-se que os hospedeiros animais intermediários do SARS-CoV-2 devam configurar-se entre espécies selvagens vendidas e abatidas no Mercado de Atacado de Frutos do Mar de Huanan, ao qual muitos dos casos iniciais da COVID-19 foram associados, indicando um provável evento de transmissão de animais a seres humanos.
en-mt: It is presumed that the intermediate animal hosts of SARS-CoV-2 must be among wild species sold and slaughtered at the Huanan Seafood Wholesale Market, with which many of the initial cases of COVID-19 were associated, indicating a likely transmission event from animals to humans.

sourceString: Several recent studies based on metagenomic sequencing have suggested that a group of endangered small mammals known as pangolins (Manis javanica) could also harbour ancestral beta-CoVs related to SARS-CoV-2.
targetString: Vários estudos recentes baseados em sequenciamento metagenômico sugeriram que um grupo de pequenos mamíferos ameaçados de extinção conhecidos como pangolins (Manis javanica) também poderiam abrigar betaCoVs ancestrais relacionados ao SARS-CoV-2.
en-mt: Several recent studies based on metagenomic sequencing have suggested that a group of endangered small mammals known as pangolins (Manis javanica) could also harbor ancestral betaCoVs related to SARS-CoV-2.

sourceString: These novel pangolin CoV genomes share 85-92% nucleotide sequence homology with SARS-CoV-2.
targetString: Esses novos genomas de CoV de pangolim compartilham de 85% a 92% de homologia na sequência nucleotídica com o SARS-CoV-2.
en-mt: These new pangolin CoV genomes share 85% to 92% nucleotide sequence homology with SARS-CoV-2.

sourceString: However, they are equally closely related to RaTG13 with about 90% identity at the level of nucleotide sequence.
targetString: Entretanto, eles também são, da mesma forma, diretamente relacionados ao RaTG13, com cerca de 90% de identidade a nível de sequência nucleotídica.
en-mt: However, they are also similarly directly related to RaTG13, with about 90% identity at the nucleotide sequence level.

sourceString: They cluster into two sub-lineages of SARS-CoV-2-like viruses in the phylogenetic tree, one of which share a more similar receptor binding domain (RBD) with SARS-CoV-2, with 97.4% amino acid sequence identity.
targetString: Eles se agrupam em sublinhagens de vírus semelhantes ao SARS-CoV-2 na árvore filogenética, um dos quais compartilha um domínio de ligação ao receptor (DLR) com o SARS-CoV-2, com 97,4% de identidade na sequência de aminoácidos.
en-mt: They cluster in SARS-CoV-2-like virus sublines in the phylogenetic tree, one of which shares a receptor binding domain (DLR) with SARS-CoV-2, with 97.4% amino acid sequence identity .

sourceString: In stark contrast, the RBDs of SARS-CoV-2 and RaTG13 are more divergent, albeit a higher degree of sequence homology genome-wide.
targetString: Em um enorme contraste, os DLRs do SARS-CoV-2 e do RaTG13 são mais divergentes, embora apresentem um alto grau de homologia sequencial em todo o genoma.
en-mt: In stark contrast, the DLRs of SARS-CoV-2 and RaTG13 are more divergent, yet show a high degree of sequence homology across the genome.

sourceString: An earlier study on diseased pangolins also reported the detection of viral contigs from lung samples, which turn out to be similarly related to SARS-CoV-2.
targetString: Um estudo recente sobre pangolins doentes também relatou a detecção de sequências consenso virais de amostras do pulmão, que são estreitamente relacionadas ao SARS-CoV-2.
en-mt: A recent study of diseased pangolins also reported the detection of viral consensus sequences from lung samples, which are closely related to SARS-CoV-2.

sourceString: This study adopted different assembly methods and manual curation to generate a partial genome sequence comprising about 86.3% of the full-length viral genome.
targetString: Esse estudo adotou diferentes métodos de configuração e curadoria manual para gerar uma sequência genômica parcial, correspondendo a cerca de 86,3% do genoma viral no tamanho total.
en-mt: This study adopted different configuration and manual curation methods to generate a partial genomic sequence, corresponding to about 86.3% of the viral genome in full size.

sourceString: We cannot exclude the possibility that pangolin is one of the intermediate animal hosts of SARS-CoV-2.
targetString: Não podemos excluir a possibilidade de que o pangolim seja um dos hospedeiros animais intermediários do SARS-CoV-2.
en-mt: We cannot exclude the possibility that the pangolin is one of the intermediate animal hosts of SARS-CoV-2.

sourceString: However, currently there is no evidence in support of a direct pangolin origin of SARS-CoV-2 due to the sequence divergence between SARS-CoV-2 and pangolin SARS-CoV-2-related beta-CoVs.
targetString: Entretanto, atualmente, não há evidência que confirme a origem direta do SARS-CoV-2 do pangolim devido à divergência na sequência entre o SARS-CoV-2 e os betaCoVs relacionados ao SARS-CoV-2 dos pangolins.
en-mt: However, at present, there is no evidence to confirm the direct origin of pangolin SARS-CoV-2 due to divergence in sequence between SARS-CoV-2 and betaCoVs related to pangolin SARS-CoV-2.

sourceString: In addition, the distance between SARS-CoV-2 and RaTG13 is even shorter than that between SARS-CoV-2 and pangolin SARS-CoV-2-related beta-CoVs.
targetString: Além disso, a distância entre o SARS-CoV-2 e o RaTG13 é ainda menor do que a distância entre o SARS-CoV-2 e os betaCoVs relacionados ao SARS-CoV-2 dos pangolins.
en-mt: Furthermore, the distance between SARS-CoV-2 and RaTG13 is even smaller than the distance between SARS-CoV-2 and betaCoVs related to pangolin SARS-CoV-2.

sourceString: The evolutionary pathway of SARS-CoV-2 in bats, pangolins and other mammals remains to be established.
targetString: A rota evolutiva do SARS-CoV-2 nos morcegos, pangolins e outros mamíferos ainda precisa ser esclarecida.
en-mt: The evolutionary path of SARS-CoV-2 in bats, pangolins and other mammals remains to be clarified.

sourceString: Whereas the highest sequence homology has been found in the RBDs between SARS-CoV-2 and pangolin, SARS-CoV-2-related beta-CoVs, SARS-CoV-2 and RaTG13 share the highest genome-wide sequence homology.
targetString: Enquanto a homologia sequencial mais alta foi encontrada nos DLRs entre o SARS-CoV-2 e o pangolim, os betaCoVs relacionados ao SARS-CoV-2, o SARS-CoV-2 e o RaTG13 compartilham a homologia sequencial genômica ampla mais alta.
en-mt: While the highest sequence homology was found in the DLRs between SARS-CoV-2 and the pangolin, the betaCoVs related to SARS-CoV-2, SARS-CoV-2, and RaTG13 share the highest genomic-wide sequence homology.

sourceString: It is highly speculative that the high degree of similarity between the RBDs of pangolin SARS-CoV-2-related beta-CoVs and SARS-CoV-2 is driven by selectivity-mediated convergent evolution.
targetString: É altamente especulativo que o alto grau de semelhança entre os DLRs dos betaCoVs de pangolins relacionados ao SARS-CoV-2 e o SARS-CoV-2 decorra da evolução convergente mediada pela seletividade.
en-mt: It is highly speculative that the high degree of similarity between the DLRs of pangolin betaCoVs related to SARS-CoV-2 and SARS-CoV-2 stems from selectivity-mediated convergent evolution.

sourceString: A counter-proposal is in favour of a recombination between a pangolin SARS-CoV-2-related beta-CoV and RaTG13 in the third wild animal species.
targetString: Um argumento contrário conta a favor da recombinação entre o betaCoV de pangolins relacionados ao SARS-CoV-2 e o RaTG13 na terceira espécie animal selvagem.
en-mt: A counterargument counts in favor of recombination between betaCoV from pangolins related to SARS-CoV-2 and RaTG13 in the third wild animal species.

sourceString: As a driving force in evolution, recombination is widespread among beta-CoVs.
targetString: Como uma força impulsionadora na evolução, a recombinação está bastante presente nos betaCoVs.
en-mt: As a driving force in evolution, recombination is very much present in betaCoVs.

sourceString: The jury is still out on the immediate zoonotic origin of SARS-CoV-2.
targetString: A origem imediata zoonótica do SARS-CoV-2 permanece em investigação.
en-mt: The immediate zoonotic origin of SARS-CoV-2 remains under investigation.

sourceString: Besides the highly pathogenic HCoVs, the zoonotic origin of HCoV-229E, HCoV-OC43, HCoV-NL63 and HCoV-HKU1 have also been studied.
targetString: Além dos HCoVs altamente patogênicos, a origem zoonótica dos vírus HCoV-229E, HCoV-OC43, HCoV-NL63 e HCoV-HKU1 também foi estudada.
en-mt: In addition to the highly pathogenic HCoVs, the zoonotic origin of the HCoV-229E, HCoV-OC43, HCoV-NL63 and HCoV-HKU1 viruses has also been studied.

sourceString: Phylogenetic evidence indicated that both HCoV-NL63 and HCoV-229E might have originated from bat CoVs, while the parental viruses of HCoV-OC43 and HCoV-HKU1 have been found in rodents.
targetString: Evidências filogenéticas indicaram que tanto o HCoV-NL63 quanto o HCoV-229E poderiam ter se originado de CoVs de morcegos, enquanto os vírus parentais do HCoV-OC43 e do HCoV-HKU1 foram descobertos em roedores.
en-mt: Phylogenetic evidence indicated that both HCoV-NL63 and HCoV-229E could have originated from bat CoVs, while the parental viruses of HCoV-OC43 and HCoV-HKU1 were discovered in rodents.

sourceString: It has been reported that a bat CoV termed ARCoV.2 (Appalachian Ridge CoV) detected in North American tricolored bat displayed close relationship with HCoV-NL63.
targetString: Foi relatado que um CoV de morcegos denominado ARCoV.2 (CoV de Appalachian Ridge) detectado no morcego tricolor norte-americano apresentava uma relação direta com o HCoV-NL63.
en-mt: A bat CoV called ARCoV.2 (Appalachian Ridge CoV) detected in the North American tricolor bat was reported to be directly related to HCoV-NL63.

sourceString: On the other hand, HCoV-229E was genetically related to another bat CoV, termed Hipposideros/GhanaKwam/19/2008, which was detected in Ghana, while camelids have also been suspected as its intermediate host.
targetString: Por outro lado, o HCoV-229E era geneticamente relacionado a outro CoV de morcego, denominado Hipposideros/GhanaKwam/19/2008, que foi detectado em Gana, sendo que também há suspeita de que os camelídeos sejam seus hospedeiros intermediários.
en-mt: On the other hand, HCoV-229E was genetically related to another bat CoV, called Hipposideros/GhanaKwam/19/2008, which was detected in Ghana, and camelids are also suspected to be its intermediate hosts.

sourceString: For clarity, the current knowledge on animal origins of known HCoVs is summarized in Figure ​1 and Table 2.
targetString: Para maior clareza, o conhecimento atual sobre as origens animais de HCoVs conhecidos é resumido na Figura 1 e na Tabela 2.
en-mt: For clarity, current knowledge about the animal origins of known HCoVs is summarized in Figure 1 and Table 2.

sourceString: Phylogenetic analysis has provided evidence for interspecies transmission events of HCoVs in the history.
targetString: A análise filogenética forneceu evidências para eventos de transmissão interespécie dos HCoVs ao longo da história.
en-mt: Phylogenetic analysis provided evidence for interspecies transmission events of HCoVs throughout history.

sourceString: When HCoV-OC43 crossed species to infect humans from domestic livestock around 1890, a pandemic of respiratory infection was recorded.
targetString: Quando o HCoV-OC43 cruzou as espécies e infectou seres humanos a partir de animais domésticos por volta de 1890, uma pandemia de infecção respiratória foi registrada.
en-mt: When HCoV-OC43 crossed species and infected humans from domestic animals around 1890, a respiratory infection pandemic was recorded.

sourceString: The interspecies transmission history of HCoV-229E is less clear.
targetString: O histórico de transmissão interespécie do HCoV-229E é menos claro.
en-mt: The interspecies transmission history of HCoV-229E is less clear.

sourceString: Bat alpha-CoVs closely related to HCoV-229E have been found.
targetString: AlfaCoVs de morcegos estreitamente relacionados ao HCoV-229E foram descobertos.
en-mt: AlphaCoVs from bats closely related to HCoV-229E have been discovered.

sourceString: Between them there is an alpaca alpha-CoV.
targetString: Entre eles, há um alfaCoV de alpacas.
en-mt: Among them is an alphaCoV from alpacas.

sourceString: Several lines of evidence support the transmission of virus from bats to humans directly.
targetString: Várias linhas de evidência corroboram a transmissão direta do vírus dos morcegos para os seres humanos.
en-mt: Several lines of evidence support direct transmission of the virus from bats to humans.

sourceString: First, humans but not alpacas might have contact with bats in a shared ecological niche.
targetString: Primeiro, os seres humanos, mas não as alpacas, podem ter contato com os morcegos em um nicho ecológico compartilhado.
en-mt: First, humans, but not alpacas, may have contact with bats in a shared ecological niche.

sourceString: Instead, humans have close contact with alpacas.
targetString: Em contrapartida, os seres humanos têm contato direto com as alpacas.
en-mt: In contrast, humans have direct contact with alpacas.

sourceString: Second, HCoV-229E-related bat alpha-CoVs are diverse and non-pathogenic in bats, whereas alpaca alpha-CoV caused an outbreak of respiratory disease in infected animals.
targetString: Segundo, os alfaCoVs de morcegos relacionados ao HCoV-229E são diversos e não patogênicos em morcegos, enquanto o alfaCoV de alpacas causaram uma epidemia de doença respiratória em animais infectados.
en-mt: Second, alphaCoVs from bats related to HCoV-229E are diverse and non-pathogenic in bats, whereas alphaCoVs from alpacas have caused an epidemic of respiratory disease in infected animals.

sourceString: Finally, alpaca alpha-CoV has not been found in feral animals.
targetString: Por fim, o alfaCoV de alpacas não foi encontrado em animais selvagens.
en-mt: Finally, alphaCoV from alpacas has not been found in wild animals.

sourceString: Thus, the possibility cannot be excluded that alpacas obtain the HCoV-229E-related alpha-CoV from humans.
targetString: Portanto, a possibilidade não pode ser excluída de que as alpacas obtêm dos seres humanos o alfaCoV relacionado ao HCoV-229E.
en-mt: Therefore, the possibility cannot be excluded that alpacas obtain HCoV-229E-related alphaCoV from humans.

sourceString: In fact, bats are the direct source of human pathogenic viruses including rabies virus, Ebola virus, Nipah virus and Hendra virus.
targetString: Na verdade, os morcegos são a fonte direta de vírus patogênicos para os seres humanos, incluindo o vírus da raiva, o vírus Ebola, o vírus Nipah e o vírus Hendra.
en-mt: In fact, bats are the direct source of viruses that are pathogenic to humans, including rabies virus, Ebola virus, Nipah virus and Hendra virus.

sourceString: It is therefore not too surprising that bats might transmit HCoV-229E to humans directly.
targetString: Portanto, não é surpreendente o fato de que morcegos transmitam HCoV-229E diretamente aos seres humanos.
en-mt: It is therefore not surprising that bats transmit HCoV-229E directly to humans.

sourceString: Alternatively, whereas bat alpha-CoVs serve as the gene pool of HCoV-229E, alpacas and dromedary camels might serve as intermediate hosts that transmit viruses to humans, exactly as in the case of MERS-CoV.
targetString: Como alternativa, enquanto os alfaCoVs servem de pool genético do HCoV-229E, as alpacas e dromedários podem servir de hospedeiros intermediários que transmitem os vírus para os seres humanos, exatamente como no caso do MERS-CoV.
en-mt: Alternatively, while alphaCoVs serve as the gene pool for HCoV-229E, alpacas and dromedaries can serve as intermediate hosts that transmit the viruses to humans, just as in the case of MERS-CoV.

sourceString: MERS-CoV serves as an excellent example of interspecies transmission from bats to dromedary camels and from dromedary camels to humans.
targetString: O MERS-CoV serve como um exemplo excelente de transmissão interespécie dos morcegos para os dromedários e dos dromedários para os seres humanos.
en-mt: MERS-CoV serves as an excellent example of interspecies transmission from bats to camels and from camels to humans.

sourceString: The evolutionary origin of MERS-CoV from bats is known at its initial identification and has also been strengthened by subsequent findings.
targetString: A origem evolutiva do MERS-CoV a partir dos morcegos é conhecida em sua identificação inicial e foi corroborada por resultados posteriores.
en-mt: The evolutionary origin of MERS-CoV from bats is known at its initial identification and has been supported by later results.

sourceString: It is obvious that bats provide a rich pool of virus species for interspecies exchange of genetic fragments and interspecies transmission.
targetString: É óbvio que os morcegos fornecem um rico pool de espécies virais para troca interespécie de fragmentos genéticos e transmissão interespécie.
en-mt: It is obvious that bats provide a rich pool of viral species for interspecies exchange of genetic fragments and interspecies transmission.

sourceString: Longevity, densely packed colonies, close social interaction and strong ability to fly are all favourable conditions for bats to be an ideal 'virus spreader'.
targetString: Longevidade, colônias com alta densidade, interação social estreita e alta capacidade de voo são todas condições favoráveis para que os morcegos sejam o "propagador viral" ideal.
en-mt: Longevity, high colony density, close social interaction and high flight capability are all favorable conditions for bats to be the ideal "viral propagator".

sourceString: On the other hand, MERS-CoV has been introduced to dromedary camels for decades.
targetString: Por outro lado, a introdução do MERS-CoV nos dromedários remonta a décadas.
en-mt: On the other hand, the introduction of MERS-CoV in camels goes back decades.

sourceString: It is well adapted to these camels that have turned from an intermediate host to a stable and natural reservoir host.
targetString: Ele é bem adaptado a esses camelos, e migrou de um hospedeiro intermediário para um hospedeiro reservatório natural e estável.
en-mt: It is well adapted to these camels, and has migrated from an intermediate host to a natural and stable reservoir host.

sourceString: MERS-CoV causes very mild disease and maintains a relatively low mutation rate in these animals.
targetString: O MERS-CoV é causador de uma doença bem branda e sustenta uma taxa relativamente baixa de mutação nesses animais.
en-mt: MERS-CoV causes very mild disease and sustains a relatively low mutation rate in these animals.

sourceString: Its sporadic transmission to humans is an accident and humans remain a dead-end host of MERS-CoV as its transmission cannot be sustained.
targetString: Sua transmissão esporádica aos seres humanos é um acidente, e os seres humanos permanecem hospedeiros terminais do MERS-CoV, já que sua transmissão não pode ser sustentada.
en-mt: Its sporadic transmission to humans is an accident, and humans remain terminal hosts of MERS-CoV, as its transmission cannot be sustained.

sourceString: In contrast to the role of camels in the transmission of MERS-CoV, the role of pangolins, if there is any, in the transmission of SARS-CoV-2 is different.
targetString: Em contraste com o papel dos camelos na transmissão do MERS-CoV, o papel dos pangolins, se houver algum, na transmissão do SARS-CoV-2, é diferente.
en-mt: In contrast to the role of camels in the transmission of MERS-CoV, the role of pangolins, if any, in the transmission of SARS-CoV-2 is different.

sourceString: Particularly, pangolin beta-CoVs are highly pathogenic in pangolins.
targetString: Especificamente, os betaCoVs de pangolins são altamente patogênicos em pangolins.
en-mt: Specifically, pangolin betaCoVs are highly pathogenic in pangolins.

sourceString: They might be a dead-end host for SARS-CoV-2-related beta-CoVs, similar to civets in the case of SARS-CoV.
targetString: Eles podem ser um hospedeiro terminal para betaCoVs relacionados ao SARS-CoV-2, de modo parecido às civetas, no caso do SARS-CoV.
en-mt: They may be a terminal host for betaCoVs related to SARS-CoV-2, similar to civets in the case of SARS-CoV.

sourceString: Several possibilities for interspecies transmission of SARS-CoV-2 from animals to humans have to be ruled in or ruled out in future studies.
targetString: Várias possibilidades para a transmissão interespécie do SARS-CoV-2 de animais para seres humanos precisam ser confirmadas ou descartadas em estudos futuros.
en-mt: Several possibilities for the interspecies transmission of SARS-CoV-2 from animals to humans need to be confirmed or ruled out in future studies.

sourceString: First, bats could be the reservoir host of a SARS-CoV-2-related virus almost identical to SARS-CoV-2.
targetString: Primeiro, os morcegos poderiam ser o hospedeiro reservatório de um vírus relacionado ao SARS-CoV-2, quase idêntico ao SARS-CoV-2.
en-mt: First, bats could be the reservoir host for a SARS-CoV-2-related virus that is nearly identical to SARS-CoV-2.

sourceString: Humans might share the ecological niche with bats through butchering or coal mining.
targetString: Seres humanos poderiam compartilhar o nicho ecológico com os morcegos por meio do abate ou das minas de carvão.
en-mt: Humans could share the ecological niche with bats through slaughter or coal mining.

sourceString: Second, pangolins could be one of intermediate amplifying host to which a SARS-CoV-2-related virus had been newly introduced.
targetString: Em segundo lugar, os pangolins poderiam ser um dos hospedeiros intermediários amplificadores, no qual um vírus relacionado ao SARS-CoV-2 tivesse sido recém-introduzido.
en-mt: Second, pangolins could be one of the amplifier intermediate hosts into which a virus related to SARS-CoV-2 has just been introduced.

sourceString: Humans contract the virus through butchering and consumption of game meat.
targetString: Os seres humanos contraem o vírus através do abate e do consumo da carne de caça.
en-mt: Humans contract the virus through the slaughter and consumption of bushmeat.

sourceString: It is possible that many mammals including domestic animals are susceptible to SARS-CoV-2.
targetString: É possível que muitos mamíferos, incluindo animais domésticos, sejam suscetíveis ao SARS-CoV-2.
en-mt: It is possible that many mammals, including domestic animals, are susceptible to SARS-CoV-2.

sourceString: A survey of domestic and wild animals for antibodies is warranted.
targetString: Uma pesquisa sobre anticorpos produzidos de animais domésticos e selvagens é necessária.
en-mt: Research on antibodies produced from domestic and wild animals is needed.

sourceString: Third, as mentioned above, recombination and adaptation of SARS-CoV-2 might have occurred in a third species that has contact with both bats and pangolins.
targetString: Em terceiro lugar, conforme mencionado acima, a recombinação e a adaptação do SARS-CoV-2 poderia ter ocorrido em uma terceira espécie que tem contato tanto com os morcegos quanto com os pangolins.
en-mt: Third, as mentioned above, SARS-CoV-2 recombination and adaptation could have occurred in a third species that has contact with both bats and pangolins.

sourceString: The search for the animal origins of SARS-CoV-2 is still on.
targetString: A busca pelas origens animais do SARS-CoV-2 ainda está ativa.
en-mt: The search for the animal origins of SARS-CoV-2 is still active.

sourceString: Apart from different types of the animal hosts, three major factors on the viral side are also important in facilitating CoVs to cross species barriers.
targetString: Além dos diferentes tipos de hospedeiros animais, três fatores principais no vírus são importantes na facilitação para que os CoVs cruzem as barreiras das espécies.
en-mt: In addition to different types of animal hosts, three main factors in the virus are important in facilitating CoVs to cross species barriers.

sourceString: First of all, their relatively high mutation rates in RNA replication.
targetString: Primeiro, sua taxa de mutação relativamente alta na replicação do RNA.
en-mt: First, its relatively high mutation rate in RNA replication.

sourceString: In comparison to other single-stranded RNA viruses, the estimated mutation rates of CoVs could be regarded as “moderate” to “high” with an average substitution rate being ~10-4 substitution per year per site 2, depending on the phase of CoV adaptation to novel hosts.
targetString: Em comparação a outros vírus de RNA de fita simples, as taxas de mutação estimadas dos CoVs podem ser consideradas de "moderadas" a "altas" com uma taxa média de substituição de aproximadamente 10-4 substituições por ano, por local, dependendo da fase de adaptação do CoV aos novos hospedeiros.
en-mt: Compared to other single-stranded RNA viruses, the estimated mutation rates of CoVs can be considered "moderate" to "high" with an average replacement rate of approximately 10-4 replacements per year, per location, depending on stage adaptation of CoV to new hosts.

sourceString: CoVs have a proof-reading exoribonuclease, deletion of which results in exceedingly high mutability and attenuation or even inviability.
targetString: Os CoVs têm a exorribonuclease com mecanismo de revisão, cuja exclusão resulta em mutabilidade excessivamente alta e atenuação, ou até mesmo inviabilidade.
en-mt: CoVs have exoribonuclease with proofreading mechanism, the deletion of which results in excessively high mutability and attenuation, or even inviability.

sourceString: Interestingly, the nucleotide analogue Remdesivir is known to suppress CoV replication through inhibition of this exoribonuclease and the RNA-dependent RNA polymerase.
targetString: É interessante o fato de que o análogo nucleotídeo remdesivir suprime a replicação do CoV através da inibição dessa exorribonuclease e da polimerase de RNA dependente de RNA.
en-mt: Interestingly, the nucleotide analogue remdesivir suppresses CoV replication through inhibition of this exoribonuclease and RNA-dependent RNA polymerase.

sourceString: Remdesivir is one of most promising anti-SARS-CoV-2 agents to be tested in clinical trials.
targetString: O remdesivir é um dos agentes antiSARS-CoV-2 mais promissores testados em ensaios clínicos.
en-mt: Remdesivir is one of the most promising antiSARS-CoV-2 agents tested in clinical trials.

sourceString: Nevertheless, mutation rates of CoVs are about a million times higher than those of their hosts.
targetString: Entretanto, as taxas de mutação dos CoVs são quase um milhão de vezes maiores do que as de seus hospedeiros.
en-mt: However, the mutation rates of CoVs are nearly a million times higher than those of their hosts.

sourceString: In addition, mutation rate is often high when CoVs are not well adapted to the host.
targetString: Além do mais, a taxa de mutação geralmente é alta quando os CoVs não estão bem adaptados ao hospedeiro.
en-mt: Furthermore, the mutation rate is generally high when CoVs are not well adapted to the host.

sourceString: Compared to SARS-CoV with a high mutation rate, the mutation rate of SARS-CoV-2 is apparently lower, suggestive of a higher level of adaptation to humans.
targetString: Comparada ao SARS-CoV, que tem uma alta taxa de mutação, a taxa de mutação do SARS-CoV-2 é baixa, aparentemente, o que sugere seu nível mais alto de adaptação aos seres humanos.
en-mt: Compared to SARS-CoV, which has a high mutation rate, the mutation rate of SARS-CoV-2 is apparently low, which suggests its higher level of adaptation to humans.

sourceString: Presumably, it has already been adapted to another host close to humans.
targetString: Presumivelmente, ele já se adaptou a outro hospedeiro que mantém contato com os seres humanos.
en-mt: Presumably, it has already adapted to another host that maintains contact with humans.

sourceString: In addition to SARS-CoV-2, this also applies to MERS-CoV, which is well adapted to dromedary camels.
targetString: Além do SARS-CoV-2, isso também se aplica ao MERS-CoV, que é bem adaptado aos dromedários.
en-mt: In addition to SARS-CoV-2, this also applies to MERS-CoV, which is well adapted to camels.

sourceString: Theoretically, it is unlikely that genetic drift would render vaccines and antivirals against SARS-CoV-2 ineffective quickly.
targetString: Teoricamente, é improvável que uma mudança genética tornaria rapidamente ineficazes as vacinas e os antivirais contra o SARS-CoV-2.
en-mt: Theoretically, it is unlikely that a genetic change would quickly render vaccines and antivirals against SARS-CoV-2 ineffective.

sourceString: Second, the large RNA genome in CoVs exerts extra plasticity in genome modification for mutations and recombination, thereby increasing the probability for interspecies co-evolution, which is advantageous for the emergence of novel CoVs when the conditions become appropriate.
targetString: Em segundo lugar, o grande genoma do RNA em CoVs exerce uma plasticidade extra na modificação do genoma para mutações e recombinações, aumentando, portanto, a probabilidade de coevolução interespécie, que é vantajosa para o surgimento de novos CoVs quando as condições se tornam apropriadas.
en-mt: Second, the large RNA genome in CoVs exerts extra plasticity in genome modification for mutations and recombinations, therefore increasing the likelihood of interspecies coevolution, which is advantageous for the emergence of new CoVs when conditions become appropriate.

sourceString: This is supported by the copious unique open reading frames and protein functions encoded towards the 3′ end of the genome.
targetString: Isso é corroborado pela abundância de quadros únicos de leitura e funções proteicas codificadas em relação às últimas três polegadas da extremidade do genoma.
en-mt: This is borne out by the abundance of single reading frames and encoded protein functions relative to the last three inches from the edge of the genome.

sourceString: Third, CoVs randomly and frequently switch templates during RNA replication through a unique “copy-choice” mechanism.
targetString: Em terceiro lugar, os CoVs trocam os modelos de modo aleatório e frequente durante a replicação de RNA por meio de um mecanismo único de "escolha de cópia".
en-mt: Third, CoVs randomly and frequently switch templates during RNA replication through a unique "copy-choice" mechanism.

sourceString: In a host that serves as the mixing vessel, strand switching occurs frequently during CoV RNA transcription.
targetString: Em um hospedeiro que serve como recipiente de mistura, a troca de fitas ocorre com frequência durante a transcrição do RNA do CoV.
en-mt: In a host that serves as a mixing vessel, strand swapping occurs frequently during transcription of CoV RNA.

sourceString: Highly homologous full-length and subgenomic RNAs could recombine to generate new CoVs.
targetString: RNAs longos altamente homólogos e subgenômicos podem recombinar-se para gerar novos CoVs.
en-mt: Highly homologous and subgenomic long RNAs can recombine to generate new CoVs.

sourceString: Phylogenetic evidence of natural recombination has been found in both HCoV-HKU1 and HCoV-OC43, as well as animal CoVs such as bat SL-CoV and batCoV-HKU9.
targetString: Evidências filogenéticas da recombinação natural foram encontradas tanto no HCoV-HKU1 quanto no HCoV-OC43, bem como em CoVs de animais, como o SL-CoV dos morcegos e o batCoV-HKU9.
en-mt: Phylogenetic evidence of natural recombination has been found in both HCoV-HKU1 and HCoV-OC43, as well as animal CoVs such as bat SL-CoV and batCoV-HKU9.

sourceString: Virus-host interaction in relation to transmission
targetString: Interação vírus-hospedeiro em relação à transmissão
en-mt: Virus-host interaction in relation to transmission

sourceString: Besides three viral factors stated above, viral interaction with host receptor is another key factor influential on interspecies transmission.
targetString: Além dos três fatores virais mencionados acima, a interação viral com o receptor do hospedeiro é outro fator chave que influencia a transmissão interespécie.
en-mt: In addition to the three viral factors mentioned above, viral interaction with the host receptor is another key factor influencing interspecies transmission.

sourceString: Herein, recombination of SARS-CoV is taken as a typical example, which also showed evidence of positive selection during interspecies transmission events.
targetString: Aqui, a recombinação do SARS-CoV é tomada como um típico exemplo, que também mostrou evidências da seleção positiva durante eventos de transmissão interespécie.
en-mt: Here, SARS-CoV recombination is taken as a typical example, which also showed evidence of positive selection during interspecies transmission events.

sourceString: Based on the comparative analysis between isolates of human and civet SARS-CoVs, SARS-CoV is thought to undergo rapid adaptation in different hosts, particularly with mutations at the RBD of the S protein.
targetString: Com base na análise comparativa entre isolados de SARS-CoVs de seres humanos e civetas, acredita-se que o SARS-CoV passe por uma rápida adaptação em diferentes hospedeiros, principalmente com mutações no DLR da proteína S.
en-mt: Based on the comparative analysis between SARS-CoV isolates from humans and civets, it is believed that SARS-CoV undergoes rapid adaptation in different hosts, mainly with mutations in the S protein DLR.

sourceString: Generally, the RBD in the S protein of a CoV interacts with the cellular receptor and is intensely selected by the host antibody response.
targetString: No geral, o DLR na proteína S de um CoV interage com o receptor celular e é selecionado intensamente pela resposta de anticorpo do hospedeiro.
en-mt: In general, the DLR on the S protein of a CoV interacts with the cellular receptor and is selected intensely by the host's antibody response.

sourceString: In SARS-CoV, the RBD is in the 318th to 510th amino acids on the S1 fragment, which binds to the human ACE2 as well as its coreceptors for viral entry.
targetString: No SARS-CoV, o DLR está nos aminoácidos 318º a 510º no fragmento S1, que se liga à ECA2 humana, bem como a seus correceptores para a entrada viral.
en-mt: In SARS-CoV, the DLR is at amino acids 318 to 510 in the S1 fragment, which binds human ACE2 as well as its co-receptors for viral entry.

sourceString: The RBD of SARS-CoV is capable of recognizing the ACE2 receptors of various animals, including bat, civet, mouse and raccoon dog, allowing interspecies transmission of the virus.
targetString: O DLR do SARS-CoV é capaz de reconhecer os receptores da ECA2 de vários animais, incluindo morcegos, civetas, camundongos e cães-guaxinins, possibilitando a transmissão interespécie do vírus.
en-mt: The SARS-CoV DLR is able to recognize the ACE2 receptors of several animals, including bats, civets, mice and raccoon dogs, enabling interspecies transmission of the virus.

sourceString: In fact, only 6 amino acid residues were observed to be different from human and civet viral isolates in the RBD and 4 of them locate in the receptor-binding motif for interaction with the ACE2 receptor.
targetString: Na verdade, observou-se que apenas seis resíduos de aminoácidos eram diferentes dos isolados virais humanos e de civetas no DLR, e quatro deles se localizam no motivo de ligação ao receptor para interação com o receptor de ECA2.
en-mt: In fact, only six amino acid residues were found to be different from human and civet virus isolates in the DLR, and four of these are located in the receptor-binding motif for interaction with the ACE2 receptor.

sourceString: Civet SARS-CoV has K479N and S487T mutations in its RBD, which might increase the affinity of the interaction of spike protein with human ACE2 receptor.
targetString: O SARS-CoV das civetas tem mutações K479N e S487T em seu DLR, o que poderia aumentar a afinidade da interação da proteína spike com o receptor da ECA2 humana.
en-mt: Civet SARS-CoV has K479N and S487T mutations in its DLR, which could increase the affinity of the spike protein's interaction with the human ACE2 receptor.

sourceString: In other words, these two amino acid substitutions might be critical to viral adaption to humans.
targetString: Em outras palavras, essas duas substituições de aminoácidos poderiam ser críticas para a adaptação viral nos seres humanos.
en-mt: In other words, these two amino acid substitutions could be critical for viral adaptation in humans.

sourceString: It is noteworthy that SARS-CoV-2 shares the same cellular receptor with SARS-CoV.
targetString: Vale notar que o SARS-CoV-2 compartilha o mesmo receptor celular com o SARS-CoV.
en-mt: It is worth noting that SARS-CoV-2 shares the same cellular receptor with SARS-CoV.

sourceString: A 30% difference between SARS-CoV-2 and SARS-CoV in the S1 unit of the S protein implicates that the binding affinity of its S protein with human ACE2 might have altered.
targetString: Um diferença de 30% entre o SARS-CoV-2 e o SARS-CoV na unidade S1 da proteína S implica que a afinidade de ligação da sua proteína S com a ECA2 humana poderia ter sido alterada.
en-mt: A 30% difference between SARS-CoV-2 and SARS-CoV in the S1 unit of the S protein implies that the binding affinity of their S protein for human ACE2 could have been altered.

sourceString: Indeed, a cryo-EM study indicates a 10- to 20-fold higher affinity of this binding than that between human ACE2 and SARS-CoV S protein.
targetString: De fato, um estudo com criomicroscopia eletrônica indica uma afinidade de 10 a 20 vezes maior dessa ligação do que entre a ECA2 humana e a proteína S do SARS-CoV.
en-mt: In fact, a study using cryo-electron microscopy indicates a 10 to 20 times greater affinity for this binding than between human ACE2 and the SARS-CoV S protein.

sourceString: It will also be of interest to determine whether any other coreceptor might be required for SARS-CoV-2 transmission.
targetString: Também será útil determinar se algum outro correceptor pode ser necessário para a transmissão do SARS-CoV-2.
en-mt: It will also be helpful to determine whether any other coreceptors may be required for SARS-CoV-2 transmission.

sourceString: Intriguingly, HCoV-NL63 also binds to ACE2 but with a different part of S.
targetString: É intrigante o fato de que o HCoV-NL63 também se liga à ECA2, mas com uma parte diferente da proteína S.
en-mt: Intriguingly, HCoV-NL63 also binds to ACE2, but with a different part of the S protein.

sourceString: There exist many other HCoV receptors, such as aminopeptidase N for HCoV-229E, and 9-O-acetylated sialic acid for HCoV-OC43.
targetString: Existem vários outros receptores de HCoV, como a aminopeptidase N para o HCoV-229E e o ácido siálico 9-O-acetilado para o HCoV-OC43.
en-mt: There are several other HCoV receptors such as aminopeptidase N for HCoV-229E and 9-O-acetylated sialic acid for HCoV-OC43.

sourceString: They might also account for successful adaptation of these CoVs in humans after interspecies transmission from their animal hosts.
targetString: Eles também poderiam responder pela adaptação eficaz desses CoVs em seres humanos depois da transmissão interespécie de seus hospedeiros animais.
en-mt: They could also account for the effective adaptation of these CoVs in humans after interspecies transmission from their animal hosts.

sourceString: In addition to cellular receptors, the outcome of interspecies transmission of HCoVs is also governed by other host dependency and restriction factors.
targetString: Além dos receptores celulares, o resultado da transmissão interespécie dos HCoVs também é governada por outros fatores de restrição e dependência com o hospedeiro.
en-mt: In addition to cellular receptors, the outcome of interspecies transmission of HCoVs is also governed by other restrictive and host-dependent factors.

sourceString: The divergence of these host proteins between humans and natural reservoir hosts of HCoVs such as bats, dromedary camels and rodents might constitute a barrier to interspecies transmission.
targetString: A divergência dessas proteínas do hospedeiro entre os seres humanos e os hospedeiros reservatórios naturais dos HCoVs como os morcegos, dromedários e roedores poderia constituir uma barreira à transmissão interespécie.
en-mt: The divergence of these host proteins between humans and natural reservoir hosts of HCoVs such as bats, camels and rodents could constitute a barrier to interspecies transmission.

sourceString: HCoVs have to usurp host dependency factors and subvert host restriction factors for a successful interspecies transmission.
targetString: Os HCoVs precisam usurpar os fatores de dependência com o hospedeiro e subverter os fatores de restrição do hospedeiro para uma transmissão interespécie eficaz.
en-mt: HCoVs need to usurp host-dependent factors and subvert host-restricting factors for effective interspecies transmission.

sourceString: In this regard, molecular determinants in this important area of virus-host interaction remain to be identified and characterized.
targetString: Nesse sentido, os determinantes moleculares nessa importante área da interação vírus-hospedeiro ainda precisam ser identificados e caracterizados.
en-mt: In this sense, the molecular determinants in this important area of virus-host interaction still need to be identified and characterized.

sourceString: An unbiased genome-wide screening of host dependency and restriction factors for SARS-CoV-2 using the state-of-the-art technology of CRISPR might be fruitful.
targetString: Uma triagem não tendenciosa com alcance a nível de genoma da dependência do hospedeiro e de fatores de restrição para o SARS-CoV-2 usando tecnologia moderna de CRISPR pode render bons resultados.
en-mt: A genome-wide unbiased screening of host dependence and restriction factors for SARS-CoV-2 using modern CRISPR technology may yield good results.

sourceString: Emergence of novel HCoVs: back to ground zero
targetString: Surgimento de novos HCoVs: de volta à estaca zero
en-mt: Emergence of new HCoVs: back to square one

sourceString: The diversity of bat CoVs provides ample opportunities for the emergence of novel HCoVs.
targetString: A diversidade dos CoVs de morcegos fornece amplas possibilidades para o surgimento de novos HCoVs.
en-mt: The diversity of bat CoVs provides ample possibilities for the emergence of new HCoVs.

sourceString: In this sense, bat CoVs serve as the gene pool of HCoVs.
targetString: Nesse sentido, os CoVs de morcegos servem como um pool genético dos HCoVs.
en-mt: In this sense, bat CoVs serve as a gene pool for HCoVs.

sourceString: In addition, rapid mutation and genetic recombination also drive HCoV evolution and serve as two important steps in this process.
targetString: Além disso, a rápida mutação e recombinação genética também impulsionam a evolução do HCoV e servem como dois passos importantes neste processo.
en-mt: Furthermore, rapid mutation and genetic recombination also drive HCoV evolution and serve as two important steps in this process.

sourceString: For example, the acquisition or loss of novel protein-coding genes has the potential to drastically modify viral phenotypes.
targetString: Por exemplo, a aquisição ou perda de genes novos de codificação de proteína tem o potencial de modificar drasticamente os fenótipos virais.
en-mt: For example, the acquisition or loss of new protein-coding genes has the potential to dramatically modify viral phenotypes.

sourceString: Among SARS-CoV accessory proteins, ORF8 has been thought to be important in adaptation to humans, as SARS-CoV-related bat viruses were isolated but found to encode divergent ORF8 proteins.
targetString: Entre as proteínas acessórias do SARS-CoV, acredita-se que a ORF8 seja importante em sua adaptação aos seres humanos, uma vez que os vírus de morcegos relacionados ao SARS-CoV foram isolados, mas descobriu-se que eles codificam proteínas ORF8 divergentes.
en-mt: Among the accessory proteins of SARS-CoV, ORF8 is believed to be important in its adaptation to humans, since bat viruses related to SARS-CoV have been isolated, but they have been found to encode divergent ORF8 proteins.

sourceString: A 29-nucleotide deletion characteristic of SARS-CoVs has been found in strains isolated at the beginning of the human epidemic.
targetString: Uma característica de exclusão do nucleotídeo 29 dos SARS-CoVs foi descoberta em cepas isoladas no começo da epidemia humana.
en-mt: A nucleotide 29 deletion feature of SARS-CoVs was discovered in strains isolated early in the human epidemic.

sourceString: This deletion splits ORF8 into ORF8a and ORF8b and is thought to be an adaptive mutation that promotes the switch of hosts.
targetString: A exclusão divide a ORF8 em ORF8a e ORF8b, e acredita-se que seja uma mutação adaptativa que promove a alternância de hospedeiros.
en-mt: The deletion splits ORF8 into ORF8a and ORF8b, and is believed to be an adaptive mutation that promotes host switching.

sourceString: Besides, SARS-CoV has a possible recombination history with lineages of alpha- and gamma-CoVs, where a large number of smaller recombinant regions were identified in the RNA-dependent RNA polymerase.
targetString: Além disso, o SARS-CoV tem um possível histórico de recombinação com linhagens de alfaCoVs e gamaCoVs, onde um grande número de regiões recombinantes menores foram identificadas na polimerase de RNA dependente de RNA.
en-mt: Furthermore, SARS-CoV has a possible history of recombination with alphaCoVs and gammaCoVs lineages, where a large number of minor recombinant regions have been identified in the RNA-dependent RNA polymerase.

sourceString: Recombination locations were also identified in the nsp9, most of nsp10, and parts of nsp14.
targetString: Os locais de recombinação também foram identificados na nsp9, na maior parte da nsp10 e partes da nsp14.
en-mt: Recombination sites have also been identified in nsp9, most of nsp10 and parts of nsp14.

sourceString: Likewise, it has been shown that the epidemic MERS-CoV experienced recombination events between different lineages, which occurred in dromedary camels in Saudi Arabia.
targetString: Da mesma forma, foi demonstrado que o MERS-CoV epidêmico passou por eventos de recombinação entre diferentes linhagens, que ocorreram em dromedários na Arábia Saudita.
en-mt: Likewise, epidemic MERS-CoV has been shown to undergo recombination events between different lineages, which occurred in camels in Saudi Arabia.

sourceString: Besides SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV, recombination events have also been observed in other HCoVs, in which the HCoVs recombine with other animal CoVs in their non-structural genes.
targetString: Além do SARS-CoV e do MERS-CoV, os eventos de recombinação também foram observados em outros HCoVs, nos quais os HCoVs recombinam-se com outros CoVs de animais em seus genes não estruturais.
en-mt: In addition to SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV, recombination events have also been observed in other HCoVs, in which HCoVs recombine with other CoVs from animals in their non-structural genes.

sourceString: It should also be cautioned that artificial selection can contribute to unintended changes in viral genomes, most likely resulting from relieving viruses from selection pressures exerted, such as by the host immune system.
targetString: Também deve ser advertido que a seleção artificial pode contribuir para mudanças indesejadas nos genomas virais, resultantes provavelmente do alívio da pressão de seleção exercida sobre os vírus, como a pressão do sistema imune do hospedeiro.
en-mt: It should also be warned that artificial selection can contribute to unwanted changes in viral genomes, likely resulting from the relief of selection pressure exerted on viruses, such as pressure from the host's immune system.

sourceString: An example of these effects is the loss of a full-length ORF4 in the HCoV-229E prototype strain, owing to a two-nucleotide deletion.
targetString: Um exemplo desses efeitos é a perda de uma ORF4 longa na cepa protótipo do HCoV-229E, devido à exclusão de dois nucleotídeos.
en-mt: An example of these effects is the loss of a long ORF4 in the HCoV-229E prototype strain, due to the deletion of two nucleotides.

sourceString: While intact ORF4 could be observed in bat and camel viruses related to HCoV-229E, the alpaca alpha-CoV displays a single nucleotide insertion, resulting in a frameshift.
targetString: Enquanto a ORF4 intacta pode ser observada em vírus de morcegos e camelos relacionados ao HCoV-229E, o alfaCoV de alpacas apresenta uma inserção simples de nucleotídeos, resultando em uma mudança nos quadros.
en-mt: While intact ORF4 can be seen in bat and camel viruses related to HCoV-229E, alphaCoV from alpacas has a single nucleotide insertion, resulting in a change in frames.

sourceString: Last but not least, the evolution of novel HCoVs is also driven by the selection pressure in their reservoir hosts.
targetString: Por fim, mas não menos importante, a evolução de novos HCoVs também é impulsionada pela pressão de seleção em seus hospedeiros reservatórios.
en-mt: Last but not least, the evolution of new HCoVs is also driven by selection pressure on their reservoir hosts.

sourceString: Asymptomatic or only mild symptoms were detected when bats were infected with CoVs, indicating the mutual adaptation between CoVs and bats.
targetString: Ausência de sintomas ou apenas sintomas leves foram detectados em morcegos ao serem infectados com CoVs, indicando a adaptação mútua entre CoVs e morcegos.
en-mt: No symptoms or only mild symptoms were detected in bats when infected with CoVs, indicating mutual adaptation between CoVs and bats.

sourceString: It appeared that bats are well adapted to CoVs anatomically and physiologically.
targetString: É provável que os morcegos sejam bem adaptados aos CoVs anatomica e fisiologicamente.
en-mt: It is likely that bats are well adapted to CoVs anatomically and physiologically.

sourceString: For example, defects in the activation of pro-inflammatory response in bats efficiently reduce the pathology triggered by CoVs.
targetString: Por exemplo, defeitos na ativação da resposta pró-inflamatória nos morcegos reduzem com eficiência a patologia desencadeada pelos CoVs.
en-mt: For example, defects in the activation of the pro-inflammatory response in bats efficiently reduce the pathology triggered by CoVs.

sourceString: Besides, the natural killer cell activity in bats is suppressed due to upregulation of inhibitory natural killer cell receptor NKG2/CD94 and low expression level of major histocompatibility complex class I molecules.
targetString: Além disso, a atividade das células exterminadoras naturais nos morcegos é suprimida devido à adaptação do receptor inibidor de células exterminadoras naturais NKG2/CD94, e ao baixo grau de expressão de moléculas classe I do complexo principal de histocompatibilidade.
en-mt: Furthermore, natural killer cell activity in bats is suppressed due to adaptation of the natural killer cell inhibitor NKG2/CD94 receptor, and low expression of class I molecules of the major histocompatibility complex.

sourceString: Moreover, the high level of reactive oxygen species (ROS) generated from high metabolic activity of bats could both suppress CoV replication and affects proofreading by exoribonuclease, thus providing the selection pressure for the generation of virus strains highly pathogenic when introduced into a new host.
targetString: Além do mais, o alto nível de espécies reativas de oxigênio (ERO) geradas da alta atividade metabólica dos morcegos pode tanto suprimir a replicação do CoV quanto afetar a revisão por exorribonuclease, fornecendo, portanto, a pressão seletiva para a geração de cepas de vírus altamente patogênicas ao serem introduzidas em um novo hospedeiro.
en-mt: Furthermore, the high level of reactive oxygen species (ROS) generated from the high metabolic activity of bats can both suppress CoV replication and affect exoribonuclease proofreading, therefore providing the selective pressure for the generation of virus strains. highly pathogenic when introduced into a new host.

sourceString: More pathogenic CoV strains might also evolve by recombination, leading to the acquisition of novel proteins or protein features for host adaptation.
targetString: Cepas mais patogênicas de CoV também poderiam evoluir por recombinação, levando à aquisição de proteínas ou características proteicas novas para a adaptação do hospedeiro.
en-mt: More pathogenic CoV strains could also evolve by recombination, leading to the acquisition of new proteins or protein traits for host adaptation.

sourceString: Thus, it is not by chance that three novel HCoVs have emerged in the past two decades.
targetString: Portanto, não é ao acaso que três novos HCoVs surgiram nas últimas duas décadas.
en-mt: Therefore, it is no coincidence that three new HCoVs have emerged in the last two decades.

sourceString: CoVs are non-pathogenic or cause mild symptoms in their reservoir hosts such as bats and camels.
targetString: Os CoVs são não patogênicos, ou causam, no máximo, sintomas brandos em seus hospedeiros reservatórios, como os morcegos e os camelos.
en-mt: CoVs are nonpathogenic, or at best cause mild symptoms in their reservoir hosts, such as bats and camels.

sourceString: They replicate robustly without eliciting a strong host immune response.
targetString: Eles se replicam imensamente sem provocar uma elevada resposta imune do hospedeiro.
en-mt: They replicate immensely without eliciting a heightened host immune response.

sourceString: Herein lie the secrets of why asymptomatic carriers are seen and what causes the severe cases in human infection.
targetString: Neste documento encontra-se as explicações sobre a descoberta dos portadores assintomáticos e a causa dos casos graves na infecção humana.
en-mt: This document explains the discovery of asymptomatic carriers and the cause of severe cases in human infection.

sourceString: The severe symptoms are mainly due to the hyperactivation of immune response and the cytokine storm wherein the stronger the immune response, the more severe the lung damage.
targetString: Os sintomas graves se devem principalmente à hiperativação da resposta imune e da cascata de citocina, em que quanto maior é a resposta imune, mais grave é o dano aos pulmões.
en-mt: Severe symptoms are mainly due to hyperactivation of the immune response and the cytokine cascade, where the greater the immune response, the more severe the damage to the lungs.

sourceString: In contrast, in asymptomatic carriers, the immune response has been de-coupled from CoV replication.
targetString: Em contrapartida, em portadores assintomáticos, a resposta imune foi desligada da replicação do CoV.
en-mt: In contrast, in asymptomatic carriers, the immune response was turned off from CoV replication.

sourceString: The same strategy of delinking the immune response might have beneficial effects in anti-SARS-CoV-2 therapy.
targetString: A mesma estratégia de desligamento da resposta imune poderia ter efeitos benéficos na terapia anti-SARS-CoV-2.
en-mt: The same immune response shutdown strategy could have beneficial effects in anti-SARS-CoV-2 therapy.

sourceString: The interferon response is particularly strong in bats.
targetString: A resposta do interferon é especificamente forte em morcegos.
en-mt: The interferon response is particularly strong in bats.

sourceString: Thus, administration of type I interferon at least in the early phase of SARS-CoV-2 infection in humans should be beneficial.
targetString: Portanto, a administração do interferon tipo I na etapa inicial da infecção por SARS-CoV-2 em seres humanos deve ser benéfica.
en-mt: Therefore, administration of type I interferon in the early stage of SARS-CoV-2 infection in humans should be beneficial.

sourceString: In addition, NLRP3 inflammasome activation in bats is defective.
targetString: Além disso. a ativação do inflamassomo NLRP3 nos morcegos é deficiente.
en-mt: Furthermore. activation of the NLRP3 inflammasome in bats is deficient.

sourceString: By this reasoning, inhibition of NLRP3 inflammasome with MCC950 might be useful in the treatment of COVID-19.
targetString: Seguindo esse raciocínio, a inibição do inflamassomo NLRP3 com MCC950 poderia ser útil no tratamento da COVID-19.
en-mt: Following this reasoning, inhibition of the NLRP3 inflammasome with MCC950 could be useful in the treatment of COVID-19.

sourceString: The emergence of SARS-CoV-2 follows the general theme by which SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV arose.
targetString: O surgimento do SARS-CoV-2 segue os mesmos princípios pelos quais surgiram o SARS-CoV e o MERS-CoV.
en-mt: The emergence of SARS-CoV-2 follows the same principles by which SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV emerged.

sourceString: Whereas a bat beta-CoV sharing 95% nucleotide homology with SARS-CoV has been found, there also exists a bat-CoV sharing 96% nucleotide homology with SARS-CoV-2.
targetString: Ao passo que foi descoberto que o betaCoV dos morcegos compartilha 95% de homologia nucleotídica com o SARS-CoV, existe um CoV de morcegos que compartilha 96% de homologia nucleotídica com o SARS-CoV-2.
en-mt: Whereas bat betaCoV was found to share 95% nucleotide homology with SARS-CoV, there is a bat CoV that shares 96% nucleotide homology with SARS-CoV-2.

sourceString: Whereas civets and other animals in the markets have been found to harbour viruses identical to SARS-CoV, immediate intermediate hosts for SARS-CoV-2 have not been identified.
targetString: Embora tenha-se descoberto que as civetas e outros animais nos mercados abrigam vírus idênticos ao SARS-CoV, os hospedeiros intermediários para o SARS-CoV-2 não foram identificados.
en-mt: Although civets and other animals in markets have been found to harbor viruses identical to SARS-CoV, intermediate hosts for SARS-CoV-2 have not been identified.

sourceString: Pangolin beta-CoVs strikingly homologous to SARS-CoV-2 have been found, indicating that pangolins might serve as one of intermediate hosts or pangolin beta-CoVs could contribute gene fragments to the final version of SARS-CoV-2.
targetString: BetaCoVs de pangolins, com alta homologia com o SARS-CoV-2, foram descobertos, indicando que os pangolins podem servir como um dos hospedeiros intermediários, ou os betaCoVs dos pangolins podem contribuir com fragmentos genéticos para a versão final do SARS-CoV-2.
en-mt: BetaCoVs from pangolins, with high homology to SARS-CoV-2, were discovered, indicating that pangolins may serve as one of the intermediate hosts, or betaCoVs from pangolins may contribute genetic fragments to the final version of SARS-CoV-2 .

sourceString: Although questions remain, there is no evidence that SARS-CoV-2 is man-made either deliberately or accidentally.
targetString: Embora as perguntas permaneçam, não há evidência de que o SARS-CoV-2 seja produzido pelo homem acidental ou intencionalmente.
en-mt: Although questions remain, there is no evidence that SARS-CoV-2 is accidentally or intentionally produced by humans.

sourceString: CoVs have returned to the limelight due to the recent outbreak of SARS-CoV-2.
targetString: Os CoVs voltaram à atenção mundial devido à epidemia recente de SARS-CoV-2.
en-mt: CoVs have returned to worldwide attention due to the recent SARS-CoV-2 epidemic.

sourceString: The study of CoVs in bats and other animals has drastically changed our perception of the importance of zoonotic origins and animal reservoirs of HCoVs in human transmission.
targetString: O estudo dos CoVs nos morcegos e em outros animais mudou drasticamente nossa percepção sobre a importância das origens zoonóticas e reservatórios animais dos HCoVs na transmissão entre seres humanos.
en-mt: The study of CoVs in bats and other animals has dramatically changed our perception of the importance of zoonotic origins and animal reservoirs of HCoVs in human-to-human transmission.

sourceString: Pervasive evidence has shown that SARS-CoV, MERS-CoV and SARS-CoV-2 have a bat origin and are transmitted to humans via intermediate hosts.
targetString: Evidências de ampla difusão mostram que o SARS-CoV, o MERS-CoV e o SARS-CoV-2 têm origem no morcego e são transmitidos para as pessoas por meio de hospedeiros intermediários.
en-mt: Widespread evidence shows that SARS-CoV, MERS-CoV and SARS-CoV-2 originate in the bat and are transmitted to people through intermediate hosts.

sourceString: Given that SARS-CoV infection originates from the contact between humans and civets in the markets, closing wet markets and killing civets therein could have effectively ended the SARS epidemic.
targetString: Dado que a infecção por SARS-CoV se originou do contato entre os seres humanos e as civetas nos mercados, o fechamento dos mercados úmidos e o abate das civetas nesses mercados poderiam ter colocado um fim à epidemia de SARS.
en-mt: Given that SARS-CoV infection originated from contact between humans and civets in markets, closing the wet markets and culling the civets in those markets could have put an end to the SARS epidemic.

sourceString: By the same reasoning, pangolins should be removed from wet markets to prevent zoonotic transmission, in view of the discovery of multiple lineages of pangolin beta-CoVs closely related to SARS-CoV-2.
targetString: Seguindo o mesmo raciocínio, os pangolins deveriam ser removidos dos mercados úmidos para prevenir a transmissão zoonótica, em face à descoberta de múltiplas linhagens de betaCoVs de pangolins estreitamente relacionados ao SARS-CoV-2.
en-mt: By the same token, pangolins should be removed from wet markets to prevent zoonotic transmission, in light of the discovery of multiple pangolin betaCoV lineages closely related to SARS-CoV-2.

sourceString: However, whether and how SARS-CoV-2 is transmitted to humans through pangolins and other mammals remain to be clarified in future investigations.
targetString: Entretanto, ainda deverá ser esclarecido em estudos futuros se o SARS-CoV-2 é transmitido para os seres humanos através dos pangolins e de outros mamíferos, e o modo dessa transmissão.
en-mt: However, it remains to be clarified in future studies whether SARS-CoV-2 is transmitted to humans through pangolins and other mammals, and the mode of this transmission.

sourceString: On the other hand, MERS-CoV has existed in dromedary camels for a long time.
targetString: Por outro lado, o MERS-CoV existe em dromedários há muito tempo.
en-mt: On the other hand, MERS-CoV has existed in camels for a long time.

sourceString: These camels serve as an important tool for transportation as well as a main source of meat, milk, leather and wool products for the local people.
targetString: Esses camelos servem como meio importante de transporte, e são uma fonte essencial de carne, leite, couro e lã para a comunidade local.
en-mt: These camels serve as an important means of transportation, and are an essential source of meat, milk, leather and wool for the local community.

sourceString: They are widely distributed across the Middle East and Africa.
targetString: Eles estão amplamente distribuídos no Oriente Médio e na África.
en-mt: They are widely distributed in the Middle East and Africa.

sourceString: It is therefore impossible to sacrifice all camels for the control of MERS, as what was done in wild animal markets in China to prevent the spreading of SARS-CoV and SARS-CoV-2.
targetString: Portanto, é impossível sacrificar todos os camelos para o controle da MERS, como foi feito nos mercados de animais selvagens na China para impedir a propagação do SARS-CoV e do SARS-CoV-2.
en-mt: Therefore, it is impossible to euthanize all camels for MERS control, as was done in wild animal markets in China to stop the spread of SARS-CoV and SARS-CoV-2.

sourceString: To stop the recurrent outbreaks of MERS, a comprehensive approach should be taken to develop effective vaccines against MERS-CoV for camels, in combination with other infection control measures.
targetString: Para deter as epidemias recorrentes de MERS, uma abordagem abrangente deve ser adotada para desenvolver vacinas eficazes contra o MERS-CoV para os camelos, em combinação com outras medidas de controle de infecção.
en-mt: To halt recurrent MERS epidemics, a comprehensive approach must be taken to develop effective MERS-CoV vaccines for camels, in combination with other infection control measures.

sourceString: As we are not able to eliminate these viruses, new genotypes might emerge to cause outbreaks.
targetString: Já que não conseguimos eliminar esses vírus, novos genótipos poderão surgir e causar epidemias.
en-mt: Since we cannot eliminate these viruses, new genotypes may emerge and cause epidemics.

sourceString: A variety of zoonotic CoVs are circulating in the wild.
targetString: Uma variedade de CoVs zoonóticos circulam na natureza.
en-mt: A variety of zoonotic CoVs circulate in the wild.

sourceString: Particularly, bat CoVs with zoonotic potential are so diverse.
targetString: Especificamente, os CoVs de morcegos com potencial zoonótico são muito diversos.
en-mt: Specifically, bat CoVs with zoonotic potential are very diverse.

sourceString: There are plenty of opportunities that these zoonotic CoVs evolve and recombine, resulting in the emergence of new CoVs that are more transmissible and/or deadly in humans in future.
targetString: Há várias possibilidades de que esses CoVs zoonóticos evoluam e recombinem, resultando no surgimento de novos CoVs que são mais transmissíveis e/ou letais para os seres humanos no futuro.
en-mt: There are several possibilities that these zoonotic CoVs will evolve and recombine, resulting in the emergence of new CoVs that are more transmissible and/or lethal to humans in the future.

sourceString: The culture of eating wild animals in some places of China should be abandoned to reduce unnecessary contact between humans and animals.
targetString: A cultura de comer animais selvagens em alguns lugares da China deve ser abandonada para reduzir o contato desnecessário entre seres humanos e animais.
en-mt: The culture of eating wild animals in some parts of China must be abandoned to reduce unnecessary contact between humans and animals.

sourceString: With the ordeals of SARS, MERS and COVID-19, a better preparedness and response plan should be in place.
targetString: Com a crise da SARS, da MERS e da COVID-19, um melhor plano de resposta e preparo deverá ser adotado.
en-mt: With the SARS, MERS and COVID-19 crisis, a better response and preparedness plan must be adopted.

sourceString: In fact, many viruses have existed in the planet for a very long time.
targetString: Na verdade, muitos vírus existem no planeta há muito tempo.
en-mt: In fact, many viruses have existed on the planet for a long time.

sourceString: They stay in their own natural reservoirs until there is a chance for spillover.
targetString: Eles ficam em seus reservatórios naturais até que há uma chance de migração para outra espécie.
en-mt: They stay in their natural reservoirs until there is a chance for them to migrate to another species.

sourceString: Although bats have many features that favours the spreading of viruses, the chance for humans to be in contact with bats and other wildlife species can be minimized if people are educated to stay away from them.
targetString: Embora os morcegos apresentem muitas características que favorecem a propagação do vírus, a chance de que as pessoas estejam em contato com morcegos e outras espécies selvagens pode ser minimizada se as pessoas forem ensinadas a ficarem longe deles.
en-mt: Although bats have many characteristics that favor the spread of the virus, the chance that people will be in contact with bats and other wild species can be minimized if people are taught to stay away from them.

sourceString: Continuous surveillance in mammals is necessary for better understanding of the ecology of CoVs and their natural hosts, which will prove useful in preventing animal-to-human transmission and future outbreaks.
targetString: A vigilância contínua nos mamíferos é necessária para um melhor entendimento da ecologia dos CoVs e de seus hospedeiros naturais, que se mostrará útil na prevenção da transmissão de animais para seres humanos e de epidemias futuras.
en-mt: Ongoing surveillance in mammals is needed for a better understanding of the ecology of CoVs and their natural hosts, which will prove useful in preventing animal-to-human transmission and future epidemics.

sourceString: To conclude, the most effective way to prevent viral zoonosis is for humans to stay away from the ecological niches of the natural reservoirs of the zoonotic viruses.
targetString: Para concluir, a forma mais eficaz de prevenir a zoonose viral é que as pessoas fiquem longe dos nichos ecológicos dos reservatórios naturais dos vírus zoonóticos.
en-mt: In conclusion, the most effective way to prevent viral zoonosis is for people to stay away from the ecological niches of natural reservoirs of zoonotic viruses.

sourceString: Several pieces in the puzzle of the zoonotic origin of SARS-CoV-2 are still missing.
targetString: Várias peças do quebra-cabeças da origem zoonótica do SARS-CoV-2 ainda estão faltando.
en-mt: Several pieces of the puzzle of the zoonotic origin of SARS-CoV-2 are still missing.

sourceString: First, if bats transmit an ancestral virus of SARS-CoV-2 to pangolins, it will be of interest to see under what circumstances bats and pangolins could share the same ecological niche.
targetString: Primeiro, se os morcegos transmitem um vírus ancestral do SARS-CoV-2 para os pangolins, é importante descobrir sob que circunstâncias os morcegos e pangolins poderiam compartilhar o mesmo nicho ecológico.
en-mt: First, if bats transmit an ancestral SARS-CoV-2 virus to pangolins, it is important to find out under what circumstances bats and pangolins could share the same ecological niche.

sourceString: Second, if bats play a more direct role in human transmission, how humans get into contact with bats should be determined.
targetString: Em segundo lugar, se os morcegos desempenham um papel mais direto na transmissão para seres humanos, deverá ser determinado como as pessoas entram em contato com os morcegos.
en-mt: Second, if bats play a more direct role in transmission to humans, it will have to be determined how people come into contact with bats.

sourceString: Third, if a third mammal acts as the true intermediate host, how it interacts with the different species including humans, bats and pangolins has to be clarified.
targetString: Em terceiro lugar, se um terceiro mamífero tem o papel do hospedeiro intermediário verdadeiro, precisa ser esclarecida a forma em que ele interage com as diferentes espécies, incluindo seres humanos, morcegos e pangolins.
en-mt: Third, if a third mammal is to play the role of the true intermediate host, the way in which it interacts with different species, including humans, bats and pangolins, needs to be clarified.

sourceString: Finally, since many mammals including domestic animals might be susceptible to SARS-CoV-2, both surveillance and experimental infection should be conducted.
targetString: Por fim, já que vários mamíferos, incluindo animais domésticos, podem ser suscetíveis ao SARS-CoV-2, tanto a vigilância quanto a infecção experimental devem ser realizadas.
en-mt: Finally, since many mammals, including domestic animals, may be susceptible to SARS-CoV-2, both surveillance and experimental infection must be performed.

sourceString: Should it be a bat, a pangolin or another mammal, it is expected that SARS-CoV-2 or its parental viruses that are almost identical will be identified in its natural hosts in future.
targetString: Caso seja um morcego, um pangolim ou outro mamífero, é esperado que o SARS-CoV-2 ou seus vírus parentais que são quase idênticos sejam identificados em seus hospedeiros naturais futuramente.
en-mt: Whether it's a bat, a pangolin or another mammal, it's expected that SARS-CoV-2 or its parent viruses that are nearly identical will be identified in their natural hosts in the future.

sourceString: Continued investigations in this area will elucidate the evolutionary pathway of SARS-CoV-2 in animals, with important implications in the prevention and control of COVID-19 in humans.
targetString: Investigações continuadas nessa área elucidarão a rota evolutiva do SARS-CoV-2 em animais, com implicações importantes na prevenção e controle da COVID-19 em seres humanos.
en-mt: Continued investigations in this area will elucidate the evolutionary pathway of SARS-CoV-2 in animals, with important implications for the prevention and control of COVID-19 in humans.

sourceString: Updating the diagnostic criteria of COVID-19 “suspected case” and “confirmed case” is necessary
targetString: É necessário atualizar os critérios de diagnóstico de "caso suspeito" e "caso confirmado" de COVID-19
en-mt: It is necessary to update the diagnostic criteria for "suspected case" and "confirmed case" of COVID-19

sourceString: On 6 February 2020, our team had published a rapid advice guideline for diagnosis and treatment of 2019 novel coronavirus (2019-nCoV) infection, and this guideline provided our experience and make well reference for fighting against this pandemic worldwide.
targetString: Em 6 de fevereiro de 2020, nossa equipe publicou um guia rápido de orientação para diagnóstico e tratamento da infecção do novo coronavírus de 2019 (2019-nCoV). Esse guia transmite nossa experiência e constitui uma boa referência para combate dessa pandemia mundial.
en-mt: On February 6, 2020, our team published a quick guideline for diagnosing and treating 2019 novel coronavirus (2019-nCoV) infection. This guide transmits our experience and constitutes a good reference for combating this global pandemic.

sourceString: However, the coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) is a new disease, our awareness and knowledge are gradually increasing based on the ongoing research findings and clinical practice experience; hence, the strategies of diagnosis and treatment are also continually updated.
targetString: No entanto, a doença do coronavírus de 2019 (COVID-19) é nova. Nossa compreensão e conhecimento aumentam gradativamente com base nas constantes descobertas de pesquisas e experiências na prática clínica; em razão disso, as estratégias de diagnóstico e tratamento também são atualizadas continuamente.
en-mt: However, coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) is new. Our understanding and knowledge gradually increases based on constant research findings and experiences in clinical practice; as a result, diagnostic and treatment strategies are also continuously updated.

sourceString: In this letter, we answered one comment on our guideline and provided the newest diagnostic criteria of “suspected case” and “confirmed case” according to the latest Diagnosis and Treatment Guidelines for COVID-19 (seventh version) that issued by the National Health Committee of the People’s Republic of China.
targetString: Nesta carta, respondemos um comentário sobre nosso guia e fornecemos os critérios de diagnóstico mais recentes de "caso suspeito" e "caso confirmado" de acordo com os últimos Guias de Diagnóstico e Tratamento da COVID-19 (sétima versão) publicados pelo Comitê Nacional de Saúde da República Popular da China.
en-mt: In this letter, we responded to a comment about our guide and provided the most recent diagnostic criteria of "suspected case" and "confirmed case" according to the latest COVID-19 Diagnostic and Treatment Guides (seventh version) published by the National Committee on Health of the People's Republic of China.

sourceString: In December 2019, the 2019 novel coronavirus (2019-nCoV) has caused an outbreak, which is now officially named as the coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) and the virus has been named severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2).
targetString: Em dezembro de 2019, o novo coronavírus de 2019 (2019-nCoV) causou um surto, que é oficialmente denominado agora como a doença do coronavírus de 2019 (COVID-19), e o vírus é denominado coronavírus 2 da síndrome respiratória aguda grave (SARS-CoV-2).
en-mt: In December 2019, the 2019 novel coronavirus (2019-nCoV) caused an outbreak, which is now officially named as the 2019 coronavirus disease (COVID-19), and the virus is named severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 ( SARS-CoV-2).

sourceString: On 11 March 2020, WHO characterized COVID-19 as a pandemic.
targetString: Em 11 de março de 2020, a OMS classificou a COVID-19 como uma pandemia.
en-mt: On March 11, 2020, WHO classified COVID-19 as a pandemic.
