sourceString: In order to fight against the SARS-CoV-2 infection, our team has developed a rapid advice guideline and that has been published online in Military Medical Research on 06 February 2020.
targetString: A fim de combater a infecção por SARS-CoV-2, nossa equipe desenvolveu um guia rápido de orientação publicado on-line no Military Medical Research em 6 de fevereiro de 2020.
en-mt: In order to combat SARS-CoV-2 infection, our team developed a quick guideline published online in Military Medical Research on February 6, 2020.

sourceString: It has attracted a great attention since published.
targetString: Ele tem atraído uma atenção excelente desde a publicação.
en-mt: It has attracted excellent attention since publication.

sourceString: Note however that COVID-19 is a new disease, our awareness and knowledge is gradually increasing based on the ongoing research findings and clinical practice experience; hence, the strategies of diagnosis and treatment are also continually updated.
targetString: No entanto, observe que a COVID-19 é uma doença nova. Nossa compreensão e conhecimento aumentam gradativamente com base nas constantes descobertas de pesquisas e experiências na prática clínica; em razão disso, as estratégias de diagnóstico e tratamento também são atualizadas continuamente.
en-mt: However, please note that COVID-19 is a new disease. Our understanding and knowledge gradually increases based on constant research findings and experiences in clinical practice; as a result, diagnostic and treatment strategies are also continuously updated.

sourceString: For instance the Diagnosis and Treatment Guidelines for COVID-19 issued by the National Health Committee of the People’s Republic of China (http://www.nhc.gov.cn/), among 16 January 2020 to 3 March 2020, has issued a total of seven editions with some contexts being substantively changed.
targetString: Por exemplo, os Guias de Diagnóstico e Tratamento da COVID-19 publicados pelo Comitê Nacional de Saúde da República Popular da China (http://www.nhc.gov.cn/) entre 16 de janeiro de 2020 e 3 de março de 2020 contam com um total de sete edições com mudanças substanciais no contexto em algumas.
en-mt: For example, the COVID-19 Diagnosis and Treatment Guides published by the National Health Committee of the People's Republic of China (http://www.nhc.gov.cn/) between January 16, 2020 and March 3, 2020 they have a total of seven editions with substantial changes in context in some.

sourceString: Now our guideline received a comment by Zhou et al., they introduced a simple scoring proposal based on their clinical experience.
targetString: Nosso guia recebeu agora um comentário de Zhou et al., que apresentou uma proposta de pontuação simples baseada em sua experiência clínica.
en-mt: Our guide has now received a comment from Zhou et al., who have come up with a simple scoring proposal based on their clinical experience.

sourceString: Their work added new evidence for our guideline and also make valuable reference for this pandemic worldwide.
targetString: Esse trabalho adicionou evidências novas ao nosso guia e também faz referências valiosas a essa pandemia mundial.
en-mt: This work has added new evidence to our guide and also makes valuable references to this worldwide pandemic.

sourceString: We endorse their significant work and express our thanks.
targetString: Endossamos seu trabalho significativo e expressamos nossa gratidão.
en-mt: We endorse their significant work and express our gratitude.

sourceString: However, their work also needs update according to the latest Diagnosis and Treatment Guidelines for COVID-19 (Trial seventh version) and recently studies.
targetString: Entretanto, seu trabalho também precisa de atualização de acordo com os últimos Guias de Diagnóstico e Tratamento da COVID-19 (sétima versão de ensaio) e estudos recentes.
en-mt: However, their work also needs updating in line with the latest COVID-19 Diagnostic and Treatment Guides (seventh trial version) and recent studies.

sourceString: According to the seventh edition (3 March 2020), to confirm the suspected case needs to combine any one item of epidemiological history features with two items of clinical manifestations to make a comprehensive analysis, or needs to meet three items of clinical manifestations if without clear epidemiological history:
targetString: De acordo com a sétima edição (3 de março de 2020), para confirmar o caso suspeito, é necessário combinar um item dos elementos de histórico epidemiológico com dois itens de manifestações clínicas para fazer uma análise abrangente, ou é necessário cumprir três itens de manifestações clínicas, caso não haja histórico epidemiológico claro:
en-mt: According to the seventh edition (March 3, 2020), to confirm the suspected case, it is necessary to combine one item of the epidemiological history elements with two items of clinical manifestations to make a comprehensive analysis, or it is necessary to fulfill three items of manifestations clinics, if there is no clear epidemiological history:

sourceString: Epidemiological history: (1) a history of travel or residence in Wuhan city and surrounding areas, or other communities where COVID-19 cases had been reported in the last 14 days before symptom onset; (2) a history of contact with SARS-CoV-2 infectious cases (with positive nucleic acid test); (3) a history of contacting with patients with fever or respiratory symptoms from Wuhan city and surrounding areas, or other communities where COVID-19 had been reported in the last 14 days before symptom onset; (4) a history of contacting with cluster of confirmed cases (≥ 2 cases with fever and/or respiratory symptoms occurred within 2 weeks in small areas, such as home, office, class of school, etc).
targetString: Histórico epidemiológico: (1) um histórico de viagem ou residência na cidade de Wuhan e em áreas próximas ou em outras comunidades onde casos de COVID-19 foram reportados nos últimos 14 dias antes do aparecimento de sintomas; (2) um histórico de contato com casos infecciosos de SARS-CoV-2 (com teste de ácido nucleico positivo); (3) um histórico de contato com pacientes com febre ou sintomas respiratórios oriundos da cidade de Wuhan e de áreas próximas ou de outras comunidades onde casos de COVID-19 foram reportados nos últimos 14 dias antes do aparecimento de sintomas; (4) um histórico de contato com grupo de casos confirmados (maior ou igual a dois casos com febre e/ou sintomas respiratórios ocorridos dentro de 2 semanas em espaços pequenos, como casa, escritório, sala de aula etc.).
en-mt: Epidemiological history: (1) a history of travel or residence in the city of Wuhan and in nearby areas or in other communities where cases of COVID-19 were reported in the last 14 days before the appearance of symptoms; (2) a history of contact with infectious cases of SARS-CoV-2 (with a positive nucleic acid test); (3) a history of contact with patients with fever or respiratory symptoms from the city of Wuhan and nearby areas or from other communities where cases of COVID-19 were reported in the last 14 days before the appearance of symptoms; (4) a contact history with confirmed case cluster (greater than or equal to two cases with fever and/or respiratory symptoms occurring within 2 weeks in small spaces such as home, office, classroom, etc.).

sourceString: Clinical manifestations: (1) fever and/ or respiratory symptoms; (2) with imaging features of COVID-19 infection; (3) total white blood cell counts showing normal, decreased, or reduced lymphocyte count in the early onset stage.
targetString: Manifestações clínicas: (1) febre e/ou sintomas respiratórios; (2) com recursos de diagnóstico por imagem da infecção por COVID-19; (3) contagem de glóbulos brancos totais do sangue exibindo contagem normal, diminuída ou reduzida de linfócitos no estágio inicial de aparecimento de sintomas.
en-mt: Clinical manifestations: (1) fever and/or respiratory symptoms; (2) with diagnostic imaging capabilities for COVID-19 infection; (3) total white blood cell count showing normal, decreased, or reduced lymphocyte counts in the early stage of symptom onset.

sourceString: Diagnosing the confirmed case should base on suspected case with any one item of pathogenic or serological evidence as following: (1) real-time PCR test positive for SARS-CoV-2; (2) viral whole genome sequencing showing high homogeneity to the known novel coronaviruses; (3) positive for the specific IgM antibody and IgG antibody to SARS-CoV-2 in serum test; or a change of the SARS-CoV-2-specific IgG antibody from negative to positive, or titer rising ≥4 times in the recovery phase above that in the acute phase.
targetString: O diagnóstico do caso confirmado deve ser baseado em caso suspeito com qualquer um dos itens sorológicos ou patogênicos a seguir: (1) exame PCR positivo para SARS-CoV-2; (2) sequenciamento do genoma viral completo exibindo homogeneidade alta em relação aos novos coronavírus conhecidos; (3) positivo para os anticorpos IgM e IgG específicos para SARS-CoV-2 em exame de soro; ou alguma alteração do anticorpo IgG específico para SARS-CoV-2 de negativo para positivo ou aumento de título maior ou igual a quatro vezes na fase de recuperação acima daquele na fase aguda.
en-mt: The diagnosis of the confirmed case must be based on a suspected case with any of the following serological or pathogenic items: (1) positive PCR test for SARS-CoV-2; (2) whole viral genome sequencing exhibiting high homogeneity with known novel coronaviruses; (3) positive for SARS-CoV-2 specific IgM and IgG antibodies in serum; or any change in the specific IgG antibody for SARS-CoV-2 from negative to positive or a titer increase greater than or equal to four times in the recovery phase above that in the acute phase.

sourceString: We can see that the real-time PCR test for nucleic acid in respiratory tract or blood samples was added to the second (18 January 2020) and third (22 January 2020) editions.
targetString: Podemos notar que o exame PCR em tempo real para ácido nucleico em amostras de sangue ou do trato respiratório foi adicionado à segunda e terceira edição (de 18 e 22 de janeiro de 2020, respectivamente).
en-mt: We may note that real-time PCR testing for nucleic acid in blood or respiratory tract samples has been added to the second and third editions (January 18 and 22, 2020, respectively).

sourceString: The pathogenic detection of blood sample was added to the fourth (27 January 2020) and fifth (8 February 2020) editions; and then the serological evidence was added to the seventh edition.
targetString: A detecção patogênica de amostra de sangue foi adicionada à quarta e quinta edição (de 27 janeiro de 2020 e 8 de fevereiro de 2020, respectivamente), e a evidência sorológica foi adicionada à sétima edição.
en-mt: Blood sample pathogenic detection was added to the fourth and fifth edition (dated January 27, 2020 and February 8, 2020, respectively), and serologic evidence was added to the seventh edition.

sourceString: These modifications based on the researchers continued work that to search for an optimal nucleic acid detection kit for rapid diagnosis, as well as the samples from respiratory tract including blood sampling, which increased the availability of different specimens, and supported bringing the specific antibody positive result into the confirmed criteria.
targetString: Essas modificações são baseadas no trabalho contínuo de pesquisadores na busca de um kit de detecção ideal de ácido nucleico para diagnóstico rápido e das amostras do trato respiratório, inclusive amostragem sanguínea, o que aumentou a disponibilidade de espécimes diferentes e ajudou a trazer o resultado positivo de anticorpos específicos para os critérios confirmados.
en-mt: These modifications are based on the continued work of researchers in the search for an ideal detection kit for rapid diagnosis of nucleic acid and respiratory tract specimens, including blood sampling, which increased the availability of different specimens and helped bring about the positive result of specific antibodies for the confirmed criteria.

sourceString: Besides, there are more and more evidence that remind us to caution with the atypical symptomatic and asymptomatic patients.
targetString: Além disso, há cada vez mais evidências que nos lembram de atentar para os pacientes sintomáticos e assintomáticos atípicos.
en-mt: In addition, there is increasing evidence reminding us to watch out for atypical symptomatic and asymptomatic patients.

sourceString: Hence, the flow chart of Zhou et al. should be updated, as they classified the person without clinical symptoms as “low risk”.
targetString: Por isso, o fluxograma de Zhou et al. deve ser atualizado, pois classifica a pessoa sem sintomas clínicos como "baixo risco".
en-mt: Therefore, the flowchart by Zhou et al. should be updated, as it classifies the person without clinical symptoms as "low risk".

sourceString: The score system also needs to be verified in further clinical practice and studies.
targetString: O sistema de pontuação também precisa ser verificado em mais estudos e práticas clínicas.
en-mt: The scoring system also needs to be verified in further studies and clinical practices.

sourceString: To conclude, we hope more direct evidence coming up and call for readers to provide their comments.
targetString: Para concluir, esperamos o surgimento de mais evidências diretas e pedimos que os leitores forneçam seus comentários.
en-mt: In conclusion, we look forward to more direct evidence emerging and ask readers to provide their comments.

sourceString: For the diagnosis of “suspected case” and “confirmed case”, we suggest to trace and obey the newest guidelines of their home countries.
targetString: Para o diagnóstico de "caso suspeito" e "caso confirmado", sugerimos que verifiquem e obedeçam às diretrizes mais recentes dos seus países de origem.
en-mt: For the diagnosis of "suspected case" and "confirmed case", we suggest that you check and comply with the latest guidelines in your home countries.

sourceString: Our team will also timely update our guideline to offer help.
targetString: Nossa equipe também atualizará oportunamente nosso guia para oferecer ajuda.
en-mt: Our team will also timely update our guide to offer help.

sourceString: Bangladesh reports five new deaths due to COVID-19, a daily highest
targetString: Bangladesh reporta cinco novas mortes devido à COVID-19, maior número diário
en-mt: Bangladesh reports five new deaths from COVID-19, highest daily toll

sourceString: Yesterday, Bangladesh has confirmed five new deaths due to COVID-19 on the day.
targetString: Ontem, Bangladesh confirmou cinco novas mortes devido à COVID-19 no dia.
en-mt: Yesterday, Bangladesh confirmed five new deaths due to COVID-19 on the day.

sourceString: This is the highest number of fatalities in a day due to the virus.
targetString: Esse é o maior número de mortes em um dia devido ao vírus.
en-mt: This is the highest number of deaths in one day due to the virus.

sourceString: As of yesterday, Bangladesh's Institute of Epidemiology, Disease Control and Research (IEDCR) reported the number of recorded infected cases included 114 active cases and 33 recovered cases who were staying home.
targetString: Na data de ontem, o Instituto de Epidemiologia, Controle de Doenças e Pesquisa de Bangladesh (IEDCR) reportou que o número de casos confirmados registrados incluía 114 casos ativos e 33 casos recuperados que permaneciam em casa.
en-mt: As of yesterday, the Bangladesh Institute of Epidemiology, Disease Control and Research (IEDCR) reported that the number of confirmed cases registered included 114 active cases and 33 recovered cases that remained at home.

sourceString: A total of 17 deaths have been recorded.
targetString: Um total de 17 mortes foram registradas.
en-mt: A total of 17 deaths were recorded.

sourceString: In an online news briefing, the director of IEDCR, Dr Meerjady Sabrina Flora, said the fatalities included four males and one female.
targetString: Em um noticiário on-line, a diretora do IEDCR, Dra. Meerjady Sabrina Flora, disse que as mortes incluíam quatro homens e uma mulher.
en-mt: In an online newscast, IEDCR Director Dr. Meerjady Sabrina Flora, said the deaths included four men and one woman.

sourceString: According to Dr Meerjady, two cases were aged above 60, two between 51 and 60, and one 41-50 years old.
targetString: De acordo com a Dra. Meerjady, dois casos tinham mais de 60 anos, dois tinham entre 51 e 60 anos e um tinha entre 41 e 50 anos.
en-mt: According to the doctor. Meerjady, two cases were over 60 years old, two were between 51 and 60 years old, and one was between 41 and 50 years old.

sourceString: She also said two of the victims were from Dhaka.
targetString: Ela disse também que duas das vítimas eram de Daca.
en-mt: She also said that two of the victims were from Dhaka.

sourceString: The World Health Organization (WHO) declared COVID-19 a pandemic on March 11.
targetString: A Organização Mundial da Saúde (OMS) declarou pandemia de COVID-19 em 11 de março.
en-mt: The World Health Organization (WHO) declared COVID-19 a pandemic on March 11.

sourceString: A hospital official told Anadolu Agency, a local news outlet, that one of the deceased was Jalal Saifur Rahman, a director of Bengali Anti-Corruption Commission, who was cared for at the Kuwait Maitree Hospital.
targetString: Um agente hospitalar disse à Anadolu Agency, uma de agência de notícias local, que um dos mortos era Jalal Saifur Rahman, diretor da Comissão Bengali Anticorrupção, que foi tratado no Hospital Kuwait Maitree.
en-mt: A hospital official told Anadolu Agency, a local news agency, that one of the dead was Jalal Saifur Rahman, director of the Bengali Anti-Corruption Commission, who was treated at the Kuwait Maitree Hospital.

sourceString: On Saturday, in an online video announcement, Bangladeshi Road Transport and Bridges Minister Obaidul Quader said public transport would be shut down for longer than initially planned, until this coming Saturday.
targetString: No sábado, em um comunicado on-line em vídeo, o ministro bengali de transporte rodoviário e pontes Obaidul Quader disse que o transporte público ficaria paralisado por mais tempo do que o planejado inicialmente, até o próximo sábado.
en-mt: On Saturday, in an online video statement, Bengali Minister of Road Transport and Bridges Obaidul Quader said public transport would be paralyzed longer than initially planned, until next Saturday.

sourceString: This public transport shutdown had initially started on March 26 and was planned to end on Saturday, April 4.
targetString: Essa paralisação do transporte público teve início em 26 de março e estava planejada para terminar no sábado, 4 de abril.
en-mt: This public transport shutdown started on March 26 and was planned to end on Saturday, April 4.

sourceString: Transport of essential goods -- medical, fuel and food -- was still allowed.
targetString: O transporte de produtos essenciais (produtos médicos, combustível e alimentos) ainda era permitido.
en-mt: The transport of essential products (medical products, fuel and food) was still allowed.

sourceString: The first recorded incidents of COVID-19 infection in Bangladesh were on March 8, in two people who returned from Italy and also the wife of one of them.
targetString: Os primeiros incidentes de infecção por COVID-19 em Bangladesh foram registrados em 8 de março, em duas pessoas que voltaram da Itália e também na esposa de uma delas.
en-mt: The first incidents of COVID-19 infection in Bangladesh were recorded on March 8, in two people returning from Italy and also in the wife of one of them.

sourceString: As of March 19, these three had already recovered.
targetString: Em 19 de março, os três já tinham se recuperado.
en-mt: By March 19, all three had recovered.

sourceString: SARS-CoV-2 surpasses one million infections worldwide
targetString: SARS-CoV-2 ultrapassa um milhão de infecções no mundo
en-mt: SARS-CoV-2 exceeds one million infections worldwide

sourceString: On Thursday, the total number of cases of the SARS-CoV-2 coronavirus infections surpassed one million worldwide, Johns Hopkins University data indicated.
targetString: Na quinta-feira, o número total de casos de infecções pelo coronavírus SARS-CoV-2 no mundo passaram de um milhão, indicaram os dados da Universidade Johns Hopkins.
en-mt: As of Thursday, the total number of cases of SARS-CoV-2 coronavirus infections in the world surpassed one million, according to data from Johns Hopkins University.

sourceString: At least 52 thousand deaths were linked to COVID-19, the disease caused by the coronavirus.
targetString: Pelo menos 52 mil mortes estavam ligadas à COVID-19, a doença causada pelo coronavírus.
en-mt: At least 52,000 deaths were linked to COVID-19, the disease caused by the coronavirus.

sourceString: The milestone came the same day Malawi confirmed its first coronavirus infections and Zambia had its first coronavirus-related death.
targetString: Esse marco veio no mesmo dia em que o Malaui confirmou suas primeiras infecções por coronavírus e a Zâmbia teve sua primeira morte relacionada ao vírus.
en-mt: This milestone came on the same day that Malawi confirmed its first coronavirus infections and Zambia had its first virus-related death.

sourceString: North Korea claimed, as of Thursday, it was one of the few countries remaining free of coronavirus infections.
targetString: A Coreia do Norte afirmou que, até quinta-feira, era um dos poucos países restantes livres de infecções por coronavírus.
en-mt: North Korea said that, as of Thursday, it was one of the few remaining countries free of coronavirus infections.

sourceString: By yesterday, the World Health Organization reported 1,051,635 confirmed cases, including 79,332 cases in the twenty four hours preceding 10 a.m. Central European Time (0800 UTC) on April 4.
targetString: Até ontem, a Organização Mundial de Saúde relatou 1.051.635 casos confirmados, incluindo 79.332 casos nas 24 horas antes das 10h no Horário da Europa Central (0800 UTC) em 4 de abril.
en-mt: As of yesterday, the World Health Organization has reported 1,051,635 confirmed cases, including 79,332 cases in the 24 hours before 10:00 Central European Time (0800 UTC) on April 4.

sourceString: In the United States, over 244 thousand coronavirus cases were recorded, linking to at least 5,900 deaths.
targetString: Nos Estados Unidos, foram registrados mais de 244 mil casos de coronavírus, ligados a pelos menos 5.900 mortes.
en-mt: In the United States, there have been more than 244,000 cases of the coronavirus, linked to at least 5,900 deaths.

sourceString: CBS News reported, citing Johns Hopkins University data, there were over 1,000 US deaths on Wednesday caused by coronavirus infections.
targetString: A CBS News informou, citando os dados da Universidade Johns Hopkins, que houve mais de 1.000 mortes nos EUA causadas por infecções por coronavírus na quarta-feira.
en-mt: CBS News reported, citing data from Johns Hopkins University, that there were more than 1,000 deaths in the US caused by coronavirus infections as of Wednesday.

sourceString: Around the world, countries announced stricter measures to inhibit the disease from spreading.
targetString: Pelo mundo, países anunciaram medidas mais rígidas para inibir a disseminação da doença.
en-mt: Around the world, countries announced stricter measures to inhibit the spread of the disease.

sourceString: On Thursday, Sergei Sobyanin, the mayor of Moscow, extended the city lockdown to May 1.
targetString: Na quinta-feira, o prefeito de Moscou Sergei Sobyanin prorrogou o bloqueio total da cidade até 1 de maio.
en-mt: On Thursday, Moscow Mayor Sergei Sobyanin extended the full city lockdown until May 1.

sourceString: Nationally, President Vladimir Putin declared Russians would continue to be paid without going to work until April 30.
targetString: Em esfera nacional, o presidente Vladimir Putin declarou que os russos continuariam a ser remunerados sem comparecer ao trabalho até 30 de abril.
en-mt: At the national level, President Vladimir Putin declared that Russians would continue to be paid no-shows until April 30.

sourceString: The parliament of Portugal voted to extend the national state of emergency by 15 days; the vote passed with 215 votes in favor, ten abstentions, and one vote against.
targetString: O parlamento de Portugal votou por prorrogar o estado nacional de emergência em 15 dias. A votação foi aprovada por 215 votos a favor, dez abstenções e um voto contra.
en-mt: Portugal's parliament voted to extend the national state of emergency by 15 days. The vote was approved by 215 votes in favour, ten abstentions and one vote against.

sourceString: Saudi Arabia extended curfews in the holy cities of Mecca and Medina to last the entire day; previously, the curfew was only in effect between 3 p.m. and 6 a.m.
targetString: A Arábia Saudita estendeu para o dia inteiro a duração do toque de recolher nas cidades sagradas de Meca e Medina. Anteriormente, essa duração era somente das 15h às 6h.
en-mt: Saudi Arabia has extended curfews in the holy cities of Mecca and Medina to all day. Previously, this duration was only from 3:00 pm to 6:00 am.

sourceString: Thailand planned to implement a curfew between 10 p.m. and 4 a.m.
targetString: Tailândia planeja implementar toque de recolher das 22h às 4h
en-mt: Thailand plans to implement curfew from 10 pm to 4 am

sourceString: The governor of Ohio, Mike DeWine, announced the state had extended its stay-at-home order until May 1.
targetString: O governador de Ohio, Mike DeWine, anunciou que o estado havia prorrogado a ordem de ficar em casa até 1 de maio.
en-mt: Ohio Governor Mike DeWine announced that the state had extended the stay-at-home order until May 1.

sourceString: Stores in Australia lower toilet paper limits per transaction
targetString: Lojas na Austrália reduzem limites de papel higiênico por transação
en-mt: Stores in Australia reduce toilet paper limits per transaction

sourceString: On Sunday and Saturday evening, Australian store chains Woolworths and Coles lowered their purchase restrictions on toilet paper to two and one package per transaction in all stores on national level, respectively.
targetString: Na noite de sábado e domingo, as redes de lojas australianas Woolworths e Coles reduziram as restrições de compra de papel higiênico, respectivamente, para dois pacotes e um pacote por transação em todas as lojas do país.
en-mt: On Saturday and Sunday night, Australian chain stores Woolworths and Coles eased toilet paper purchase restrictions to two packs and one pack per transaction respectively across all stores across the country.

sourceString: ALDI also introduced a one-pack limit, on Monday.
targetString: Na segunda-feira, a ALDI também implementou um limite de um pacote.
en-mt: On Monday, ALDI also implemented a one-pack limit.

sourceString: These limitations were posted as messages on the checkouts, and on the chains' Facebook pages.
targetString: Essas limitações foram comunicadas por mensagens nos caixas e nas páginas do Facebook das redes.
en-mt: These limitations were communicated through messages at the cashiers and on the networks' Facebook pages.

sourceString: Buyers were reportedly stocking up due to fears of COVID-19 in case people need to self-isolate.
targetString: Por medo da COVID-19, compradores estavam supostamente estocando para caso houvesse a necessidade de se isolar.
en-mt: Out of fear of COVID-19, shoppers were reportedly stocking up in case there was a need to self-isolate.

sourceString: On Wednesday, Woolworths also limited toilet paper purchases for home delivery to one pack per order.
targetString: Na quarta-feira, a Woolworths também limitou as compras de papel higiênico com entrega em domicílio para um pacote por pedido.
en-mt: On Wednesday, Woolworths also limited home delivery toilet paper purchases to one pack per order.

sourceString: These changes followed the previous four-pack per transaction restriction introduced by Woolworths and Coles on March 4 and 5 respectively.
targetString: Essas mudanças vieram após a restrição anterior de quatro pacotes por transação implementada pela Woolworths e Coles em 4 e 5 de março, respectivamente.
en-mt: These changes follow the previous restriction of four packs per transaction implemented by Woolworths and Coles on March 4th and 5th respectively.

sourceString: Coles, in its March 8 media release, reported that with the four-pack restriction in place, "many stores are still selling out within an hour of delivery", and called the demand "unprecedented", while ALDI, in a Facebook post on Tuesday, called it "unexpected".
targetString: A Coles, em sua nota de imprensa de 8 de março, informou que, mesmo com a restrição de quatro pacotes, "muitas lojas ainda estão esgotando os estoques em menos de uma hora após a entrega" e chamou a demanda de "sem precedentes", enquanto a ALDI a chamou de "inesperada" em uma postagem no Facebook na terça-feira.
en-mt: Coles, in its March 8 press release, reported that even with the four-pack restriction, "many stores are still running out of stock within an hour of delivery" and called the demand "unprecedented". , while ALDI called it "unexpected" in a Facebook post on Tuesday.

sourceString: Sales went up in a "sharp increase" last week, according to a Woolworths spokesperson.
targetString: As vendas tiveram um "aumento acentuado" na semana passada, de acordo com um porta-voz da Woolworths.
en-mt: Sales saw a "sharp increase" last week, according to a Woolworths spokesman.

sourceString: Costco's store in Canberra also limited the allowed amount to two packs last week.
targetString: A loja da Costco em Camberra também limitou a quantidade permitida para dois pacotes na semana passada.
en-mt: The Costco store in Canberra also limited the quantity allowed to two packs last week.

sourceString: To further alleviate the shortage, Coles ordered bigger packages from suppliers and increased delivery frequency, Woolworths ordered extra stock, while ALDI made stocks for a planned Wednesday special available early.
targetString: Para aliviar ainda mais a escassez, a Coles encomendou pacotes maiores dos fornecedores e aumentou a frequência de entrega, a Woolworths encomendou estoque extra, enquanto a ALDI disponibilizou antecipadamente estoques de uma promoção planejada para a quarta-feira.
en-mt: To further alleviate the shortage, Coles ordered larger packs from suppliers and increased delivery frequency, Woolworths ordered extra stock, while ALDI made advance stock available from a promotion planned for Wednesday.

sourceString: Russell Zimmerman, executive director of the Australian Retailers Association, said that retailers try to raise stock, but local council restrictions on the timing of truck-deliveries make it hard.
targetString: Russel Zimmerman, diretor executivo da Associação Australiana de Varejistas, disse que varejistas tentam aumentar estoques, mas que restrições da junta local em relação à frequência de entregas por caminhão dificulta isso.
en-mt: Russell Zimmerman, executive director of the Australian Retailers Association, said retailers were trying to build up inventories, but that local board restrictions on the frequency of deliveries by truck made it difficult.

sourceString: He expects rising production costs, as suppliers try to meet demand, and fewer specials.
targetString: Ele espera custos elevados de produção, já que os fornecedores tentam atender à demanda, e menos promoções.
en-mt: He expects higher production costs as suppliers try to keep up with demand, and fewer promotions.

sourceString: On Tuesday, ALDI announced that following the early release of stock, some stores can't run the Wednesday special.
targetString: Na terça-feira, a ALDI anunciou que, após a liberação antecipada do estoque, algumas lojas não poderão realizar a promoção de quarta-feira.
en-mt: On Tuesday, ALDI announced that following the early release of stock, some stores will not be able to carry out the Wednesday sale.

sourceString: In a News.com.au report, Dr Gary Mortimer, retail expert from Queensland University of Technology, said the stores fill the stock every night.
targetString: Em uma reportagem da News.com.au, o Dr. Gary Mortimer, especialista em varejo da Universidade de Tecnologia de Queensland, disse que as lojas repõem o estoque todas as noites.
en-mt: In a News.com.au report, Dr. Gary Mortimer, a retail expert at the Queensland University of Technology, said stores restock nightly.

sourceString: He remarked toilet paper is a bulky item, leading to low quantity of stocks in numbers, and, when sold out, leaves vast shelf spaces empty, hardening the feeling of a shortage.
targetString: Ele destacou que o papel higiênico é um item volumoso com números baixos em estoque em termos de quantidade, e que, quando esgotado, deixa muitos espaços vazios nas prateleiras, aumentando a sensação de escassez.
en-mt: He pointed out that toilet paper is a bulky item with low numbers in stock in terms of quantity, and that, when sold out, it leaves many empty spaces on the shelves, increasing the feeling of scarcity.

sourceString: Coles and Woolworths have a view [that] if there was plenty of stuff on the shelf, if product like toilet rolls and sanitiser could be [bought] and are there in quantities, you would probably minimise the panic said Russell Zimmerman per ABC News.
targetString: A Coles e a Woolworths têm a opinião [de] que se houvesse uma quantidade abundante nas prateleiras, se produtos como rolos de papel higiênico e antissépticos pudessem ser [comprados] e estivessem lá em quantidades, você provavelmente reduziria o pânico, disse Russel Zimmerman à ABC News.
en-mt: Coles and Woolworths are of the opinion [that] if you had a plentiful quantity on the shelves, if products like toilet rolls and antiseptics could be [purchased] and were there in quantities, you would probably reduce the panic, Russell Zimmerman told ABC News.

sourceString: Recycled toilet paper producer Who Gives a Crap said on last Wednesday they'd run out of stock.
targetString: O fabricante de papel higiênico reciclado Who Gives a Crap disse na última quarta-feira que eles ficariam sem estoque.
en-mt: Recycled toilet paper maker Who Gives a Crap said last Wednesday that they would run out of stock.

sourceString: Kimberly-Clark, which makes Kleenex Toilet Tissue, and Solaris Paper which makes Sorbent, emphasized they were working 24/7 to maintain the supply, according to the News.com.au report.
targetString: A Kimberly-Clark, que produz o papel higiênico Kleenex, e a Solaris Paper, que produz o Sorbent, enfatizaram que estavam trabalhando 24 horas por dia/7 dias por semana para manter o fornecimento, de acordo com reportagem da News.com.au.
en-mt: Kimberly-Clark, which makes Kleenex toilet paper, and Solaris Paper, which makes Sorbent, stressed they were working 24/7 to maintain supply, according to a News.com.au report. .

sourceString: Domain.com, a real estate site, reported some property sellers offering free toilet paper to the first bidder on auctions in Melbourne, when fewer auctions were held because of buyers having time off on the long weekend of Labour Day.
targetString: O site imobiliário domain.com informou que alguns vendedores de imóveis estavam oferecendo papel higiênico gratuito aos primeiros licitantes de leilões em Melbourne, quando menos leilões estavam sendo realizados com os compradores entrando de folga no fim de semana prolongado do Dia do Trabalho.
en-mt: Property website domain.com reported that some property sellers were offering free toilet paper to early bidders at auctions in Melbourne when fewer auctions were taking place with buyers going in over the Labor Day long weekend off.

sourceString: The Thursday edition of NT News, a daily printed in Darwin, included an eight-page insert meant to be cut up and used as toilet paper.
targetString: A edição de quinta-feira do NT News, um impresso diário de Darwin, incluiu um inserto de oito páginas com objetivo de ser recortado e utilizado como papel higiênico.
en-mt: The Thursday edition of NT News, Darwin's daily print, included an eight-page insert intended to be cut out and used as toilet paper.

sourceString: The stores were originally reluctant to impose restrictions, according to a report from ABC Australia on March 3 in which they said they had no plans to introduce restrictions on the purchases.
targetString: Inicialmente, as lojas estavam relutantes em impor restrições, de acordo com uma reportagem da ABC Australia em 3 de março na qual disseram que não tinham planos de implementar restrições sobre as compras.
en-mt: Initially, stores were reluctant to impose restrictions, according to an ABC Australia report on March 3 in which they said they had no plans to implement restrictions on purchases.

sourceString: Russell Zimmerman added that other products are also in high demand, including masks, sanitiser, dried goods, handwash and flour.
targetString: Russell Zimmerman acrescentou que outros produtos também estão com alta demanda, como máscaras, antissépticos, produtos secos, sabonetes para as mãos e farinha.
en-mt: Russell Zimmerman added that other products are also in high demand, such as masks, antiseptics, dry goods, hand soaps and flour.

sourceString: Similarly, outside of Australia, on Sunday evening online British supermarket Ocado was observed limiting purchases of Andres toilet paper to two 12-roll packs.
targetString: Assim como na Austrália, na noite de domingo, o supermercado on-line britânico Ocado limitou as compras do papel higiênico Andres para dois pacotes de 12 rolos.
en-mt: As in Australia, on Sunday night, British online supermarket Ocado limited purchases of Andres toilet paper to two packs of 12 rolls.

sourceString: World Health Organization declares COVID-19 pandemic
targetString: A Organização Mundial da Saúde declara pandemia da COVID-19
en-mt: The World Health Organization declares COVID-19 a pandemic

sourceString: On Wednesday, the World Health Organization (WHO) declared the ongoing outbreak of COVID-19 — the disease caused by coronavirus SARS-CoV-2 — to be a pandemic.
targetString: Na quarta-feira, a Organização Mundial da Saúde (OMS) declarou que o atual surto de COVID-19 — a doença causada pelo coronavírus SARS-CoV-2 — é uma pandemia.
en-mt: On Wednesday, the World Health Organization (WHO) declared the current outbreak of COVID-19 — the disease caused by the SARS-CoV-2 coronavirus — to be a pandemic.

sourceString: Although the word "pandemic" only refers to how widely a disease has spread, not how dangerous specific cases are, the WHO noted the need to drive governments to action:
targetString: Embora a palavra "pandemia" indique apenas o grau de disseminação de uma doença, não quão perigosos são os casos específicos, a OMS enfatizou a necessidade de impulsionar os governos a agirem:
en-mt: While the word "pandemic" only indicates how widespread a disease is, not how dangerous specific cases are, the WHO has emphasized the need to spur governments to act:

sourceString: All countries can still change the course of this pandemic.
targetString: Todos os países ainda podem mudar o curso dessa pandemia.
en-mt: All countries can still change the course of this pandemic.

sourceString: If countries detect, test, treat, isolate, trace and mobilize their people in the response, said Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus, the Director-General of the WHO.
targetString: Se os países forem capazes de detectar, testar, tratar, isolar, rastrear e mobilizar a população para uma resposta, afirmou Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus, diretor-geral da OMS.
en-mt: If countries are able to detect, test, treat, isolate, track and mobilize the population for a response, said Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus, director general of WHO.

sourceString: We are deeply concerned both by the alarming levels of spread and severity and by the alarming levels of inaction.
targetString: Estamos muito preocupados com os níveis alarmantes de disseminação e gravidade e pelos níveis alarmantes de falta de ação.
en-mt: We are very concerned about the alarming levels of spread and severity and the alarming levels of inaction.

sourceString: According to Dr. Tom Frieden, formerly the director of the United States' Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, the pandemic is "unprecedented."
targetString: De acordo com o Dr. Tom Frieden, ex-diretor dos Centros de Controle e Prevenção de Doenças dos Estados Unidos, é uma pandemia "sem precedentes".
en-mt: According with the doctor. Tom Frieden, former director of the United States Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, is an "unprecedented" pandemic.

sourceString: He said, in remarks published by CNN in February, "other than influenza, no other respiratory virus has been tracked from emergence to continuous global spread."
targetString: Em comentários publicados pela CNN em fevereiro, ele afirmou que "fora a influenza, nenhum outro vírus respiratório foi monitorado desde o surgimento até a disseminação global contínua".
en-mt: In comments published by CNN in February, he said that "aside from influenza, no other respiratory virus has been monitored from emergence to continued global spread."

sourceString: Ghebreyesus expressed a similar view, saying "we have never before seen a pandemic sparked by a coronavirus."
targetString: Ghebreyesus expressou uma posição similar, afirmando que "jamais tínhamos visto uma pandemia iniciada por um coronavírus".
en-mt: Ghebreyesus expressed a similar position, stating that "we have never seen a pandemic started by a coronavirus".

sourceString: He continued, "and we have never before seen a pandemic that can be controlled at the same time."
targetString: E continuou "e nunca vimos uma pandemia que pudesse ser controlada ao mesmo tempo".
en-mt: He continued "and we've never seen a pandemic that could be controlled at the same time".

sourceString: The new status as a pandemic follows the WHO's decision in January to declare the outbreak a public health emergency of international concern.
targetString: O novo status de pandemia segue a decisão de janeiro da OMS de declarar o surto uma emergência de saúde pública de preocupação internacional.
en-mt: The new pandemic status follows the WHO's January decision to declare the outbreak a public health emergency of international concern.

sourceString: The United States' National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Disease's director, Dr. Anthony Fauci, said of the outbreak, "bottom line, it's going to get worse."
targetString: O diretor do Instituto Nacional de Alergia e Doenças Infecciosas dos Estados Unidos, Dr. Anthony Fauci, afirmou que o surto, "em suma, vai piorar".
en-mt: The director of the US National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases, Dr. Anthony Fauci, stated that the outbreak, "in short, is going to get worse".

sourceString: As of Thursday, Associated Press reported there were at least 126,000 cases of COVID-19 worldwide, resulting in over 4,600 deaths.
targetString: Na quinta-feira, o Associated Press relatou que havia, no mínimo, 126.000 casos de COVID-19 no mundo todo, com mais de 4.600 mortes.
en-mt: As of Thursday, the Associated Press reported that there were at least 126,000 cases of COVID-19 worldwide, with more than 4,600 deaths.

sourceString: The 2019–20 coronavirus pandemic is an ongoing pandemic of coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19), caused by severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2).
targetString: A pandemia de 2019–20 do coronavírus é uma pandemia contínua de doença por coronavírus 2019 (COVID-19), causada pelo coronavírus da síndrome respiratória aguda grave 2 (SARS-CoV-2).
en-mt: The 2019–20 coronavirus pandemic is an ongoing pandemic of coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19), caused by severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2).

sourceString: The outbreak was identified in Wuhan, China, in December 2019, declared to be a Public Health Emergency of International Concern on 30 January 2020, and recognized as a pandemic on 11 March 2020.
targetString: O surto foi identificado em Wuhan, na China, em dezembro de 2019, foi declarado uma emergência internacional de saúde pública de preocupação internacional em 30 de janeiro de 2020 e reconhecido como pandemia em 11 de março de 2020.
en-mt: The outbreak was identified in Wuhan, China, in December 2019, was declared an international public health emergency of international concern on 30 January 2020, and recognized as a pandemic on 11 March 2020.

sourceString: As of 10 April 2020, approximately 1.61 million cases of COVID-19 have been reported in 210 countries and territories, resulting in approximately 97,000 deaths.
targetString: Até 10 de abril de 2020, aproximadamente 1,61 milhão de casos da COVID-19 tinham sido relatados em 210 países e territórios, com aproximadamente 97.000 mortes.
en-mt: As of April 10, 2020, approximately 1.61 million cases of COVID-19 have been reported in 210 countries and territories, with approximately 97,000 deaths.

sourceString: About 364,000 people have recovered.
targetString: Cerca de 364.000 pessoas se recuperaram.
en-mt: About 364,000 people have recovered.

sourceString: The case fatality rate has been estimated to be 4% in China, while globally ranging from 13.04% in Algeria to .08% in New Zealand.
targetString: Estima-se que a taxa de mortalidade seja de 4% na China, enquanto globalmente varie de 13,04% na Argélia a 0,08% na Nova Zelândia.
en-mt: The fatality rate is estimated to be 4% in China, while globally it ranges from 13.04% in Algeria to 0.08% in New Zealand.

sourceString: Common symptoms include fever, cough and shortness of breath.
targetString: Os sintomas comuns incluem febre, tosse e falta de ar.
en-mt: Common symptoms include fever, cough and shortness of breath.

sourceString: Complications may include pneumonia and acute respiratory distress syndrome.
targetString: As complicações podem incluir pneumonia e síndrome do desconforto respiratório agudo.
en-mt: Complications can include pneumonia and acute respiratory distress syndrome.

sourceString: The time from exposure to onset of symptoms is typically around five days, but may range from two to fourteen days.
targetString: O tempo desde a exposição até o início dos sintomas é de aproximadamente cinco dias, mas pode variar de dois a quatorze dias.
en-mt: The time from exposure to the onset of symptoms is approximately five days, but can range from two to fourteen days.

sourceString: There is no known vaccine or specific antiviral treatment.
targetString: Não existe vacina ou tratamento antiviral específico conhecidos.
en-mt: There is no known vaccine or specific antiviral treatment.

sourceString: Primary treatment is symptomatic and supportive therapy.Recommended preventive measures include hand washing, covering one's mouth when coughing, maintaining distance from other people, and monitoring and self-isolation for people who suspect they are infected.
targetString: O tratamento primário é a terapia sintomática e de suporte. As medidas de prevenção recomendadas incluem lavar as mãos, cobrir a boca ao tossir, manter distância das pessoas e o monitoramento e isolamento de pessoas com suspeita de infecção.
en-mt: The primary treatment is symptomatic and supportive therapy. Recommended prevention measures include hand washing, covering the mouth when coughing, keeping distance from people, and monitoring and isolating people with suspected infection.

sourceString: Authorities worldwide have responded by implementing travel restrictions, quarantines, curfews, workplace hazard controls, and facility closures.
targetString: As autoridades de todo o mundo responderam com a implementação de restrições de viagem, quarentenas, toques de recolher, controles de risco no local de trabalho e fechamento de estabelecimentos.
en-mt: Authorities around the world have responded by implementing travel restrictions, quarantines, curfews, workplace risk controls and closures.

sourceString: The pandemic has led to severe global socioeconomic disruption, the postponement or cancellation of sporting, religious, political and cultural events, and widespread shortages of supplies exacerbated by panic buying.
targetString: A pandemia provocou uma interrupção socioeconômica global severa, o adiamento ou cancelamento de eventos esportivos, religiosos, políticos e culturais e escassez generalizada de suprimentos exacerbada pelas compras desencadeadas pelo pânico.
en-mt: The pandemic has triggered severe global socio-economic disruption, the postponement or cancellation of sporting, religious, political and cultural events, and widespread supply shortages exacerbated by panic buying.

sourceString: Schools and universities have closed either on a nationwide or local basis in 193 countries, affecting approximately 99.4 percent  of the world's student population.
targetString: Escolas e universidades fecharam a nível nacional ou local em 193 países, afetando aproximadamente 99,4% da população estudantil no mundo.
en-mt: Schools and universities have closed nationally or locally in 193 countries, affecting approximately 99.4% of the world's student population.

sourceString: Misinformation about the virus has spread online, and there have been incidents of xenophobia and discrimination against Chinese people, other people of East and Southeast Asian descent and appearance, and others from areas with significant virus cases.
targetString: A desinformação sobre o vírus se disseminou on-line e aconteceram incidentes de xenofobia e discriminação contra pessoas chinesas, pessoas com descendência e aparência do leste e sudeste asiático e outras pessoas de áreas com casos significativos do vírus.
en-mt: Misinformation about the virus spread online, and there were incidents of xenophobia and discrimination against Chinese people, people of East and Southeast Asian descent and appearance, and others from areas with significant cases of the virus.

sourceString: Due to reduced travel and closures of heavy industry, there has been a decrease in air pollution and carbon emissions.
targetString: Devido à redução de viagens e aos fechamentos da indústria pesada, houve uma diminuição na poluição do ar e nas emissões de carbono.
en-mt: Due to reduced travel and heavy industry closures, there has been a decrease in air pollution and carbon emissions.

sourceString: Health authorities in Wuhan, China (the capital of Hubei province) reported a cluster of pneumonia cases of unknown cause on 31 December 2019, and an investigation was launched in early January 2020.
targetString: Autoridades sanitárias de Wuhan, na China (a capital da província de Hubei) relataram um grupo de casos de pneumonia por causa desconhecida em 31 de dezembro de 2019 e uma investigação foi iniciada no início de janeiro de 2020.
en-mt: Health authorities in Wuhan, China (the capital of Hubei province) reported a cluster of pneumonia cases of unknown cause on December 31, 2019, and an investigation was launched in early January 2020.

sourceString: The cases mostly had links to the Huanan Seafood Wholesale Market and so the virus is thought to have a zoonotic origin.
targetString: Em grande parte, os casos tinham ligação com o mercado atacadista de frutos do mar de Huanan e, portanto, acredita-se que o vírus tenha origem zoonótica.
en-mt: The cases were largely linked to the Huanan seafood wholesale market and therefore the virus is believed to have a zoonotic origin.

sourceString: The virus that caused the outbreak is known as SARS-CoV-2, a newly discovered virus closely related to bat coronaviruses, pangolin coronaviruses, and SARS-CoV.The earliest known person with symptoms was later discovered to have fallen ill on 1 December 2019, and that person did not have visible connections with the later wet market cluster.
targetString: O vírus causador do surto é conhecido como SARS-CoV-2, um vírus descoberto recentemente e que tem ligação próxima com os coronavírus do morcego, do pangolim e com o SARS-CoV. A primeira pessoa com sintomas de que se tem conhecimento adoeceu em 1.º de dezembro de 2019 e não apresentava conexões visíveis com o grupo posterior do mercado de frutos do mar.
en-mt: The virus causing the outbreak is known as SARS-CoV-2, a recently discovered virus that is closely linked to bat coronaviruses, pangolin coronaviruses and SARS-CoV. The first known person with symptoms became ill on December 1, 2019 and had no visible connections with the seafood market later group.

sourceString: Of the early cluster of cases reported in December 2019, two-thirds were found to have a link with the market.
targetString: Do grupo inicial de casos relatados em dezembro de 2019, descobriu-se que dois terços tinham ligação com o mercado.
en-mt: Of the initial group of cases reported in December 2019, two-thirds were found to be market-related.

sourceString: On 13 March 2020, an unverified report from the South China Morning Post suggested that a case traced back to 17 November 2019, in a 55-year-old from Hubei province, may have been the first.On 26 February 2020, the WHO reported that, as new cases reportedly declined in China but suddenly increased in Italy, Iran, and South Korea, the number of new cases outside China had exceeded the number of new cases within China for the first time.
targetString: Em 13 de março de 2020, um relatório não verificado do South China Morning Post sugeriu que um caso apontava para 17 de novembro de 2019, em um indivíduo de 55 anos da província de Hubei, que pode ter sido o primeiro. Em 26 de fevereiro de 2020, a OMS relatou que, como os novos casos declarados diminuíam na China, mas subitamente aumentavam na Itália, Irã e Coreia do Sul, o número de novos casos fora da China tinha ultrapassado o número de novos casos da China pela primeira vez.
en-mt: On March 13, 2020, an unverified report by the South China Morning Post suggested that a case pointed to November 17, 2019, in a 55-year-old individual from Hubei Province, which may have been the first. On February 26, 2020, the WHO reported that, as newly declared cases declined in China but suddenly increased in Italy, Iran and South Korea, the number of new cases outside China had surpassed the number of new cases in China. for the first time.

sourceString: There may be substantial underreporting of cases, particularly among those with milder symptoms.
targetString: Pode haver uma subnotificação significativa dos casos, principalmente entre as pessoas com sintomas mais leves.
en-mt: There may be significant underreporting of cases, particularly among people with milder symptoms.

sourceString: By 26 February, relatively few cases had been reported among youths, with those 19 and under making up 2.4% of cases worldwide.The United Kingdom's chief scientific adviser, Patrick Vallance, estimated that 60% of the British population would need to become infected before effective herd immunity could be achieved.
targetString: Até 26 de fevereiro, relativamente poucos casos tinham sido relatados entre jovens com 19 anos ou menos, contabilizando 2,4% dos casos no mundo todo. O principal consultor científico do Reino Unido, Patrick Vallance, estimou que 60% da população britânica precisaria ser infectada até que uma imunidade coletiva eficaz pudesse ser alcançada.
en-mt: As of 26 February, relatively few cases have been reported among youth aged 19 and under, accounting for 2.4% of cases worldwide. The UK's chief scientific adviser, Patrick Vallance, estimated that 60% of the British population would need to be infected before effective herd immunity could be achieved.

sourceString: Cases refers to the number of people who have been tested for COVID-19, and whose test has been confirmed positive according to official protocols.
targetString: Os casos se referem ao número de pessoas que foram testadas para COVID-19 e cujos testes foram confirmados positivos de acordo com os protocolos oficiais.
en-mt: Cases refer to the number of people who have been tested for COVID-19 and whose tests have been confirmed positive according to official protocols.

sourceString: As of 23 March, no country had tested more than 3% of its population, and many countries have had official policies not to test those with only mild symptoms, such as Italy, the Netherlands, Spain, and Switzerland.
targetString: Até 23 de março, nenhum país tinha testado mais de 3% de sua população e vários países adotavam políticas oficiais de não testar pessoas apenas com sintomas leves, como a Itália, a Holanda, a Espanha e a Suíça.
en-mt: As of March 23, no country had tested more than 3% of its population and several countries had official policies not to test people with only mild symptoms, such as Italy, the Netherlands, Spain and Switzerland.

sourceString: A study published on 16 March found that in China, up to 23 January, an estimated 86% of COVID-19 infections had not been detected, and that these undocumented infections were the infection source for 79% of documented cases.
targetString: Um estudo publicado em 16 de março descobriu que, na China, até 23 de janeiro, se estimava que 86% das infecções por COVID-19 não tinham sido detectadas e que essas infecções não documentadas foram a fonte de infecção de 79% dos casos documentados.
en-mt: A study published on March 16 found that in China, as of January 23, an estimated 86% of COVID-19 infections had gone undetected and that these undocumented infections were the source of infection for 79% of documented cases. .

sourceString: A statistical analysis published 30 March estimated that numbers of infections in Italy were considerably greater than the reported cases.
targetString: Uma análise estatística publicada em 30 de março estimou que o número de pessoas infectadas na Itália foi consideravelmente maior do que os casos relatados.
en-mt: A statistical analysis published on March 30 estimated that the number of people infected in Italy was considerably higher than reported cases.

sourceString: The initial estimates of the basic reproduction number (R0) for COVID-19 were 1.4 to 2.4.
targetString: As estimativas iniciais do número básico de reprodução (R0) para a COVID-19 foram 1,4 a 2,4.
en-mt: Initial estimates of the basic reproduction number (R0) for COVID-19 were 1.4 to 2.4.

sourceString: A study published by the US Center for Disease Control and Prevention has concluded that it may be 5.7.
targetString: Um estudo publicado pelo Centro de Controle e Prevenção de Doenças dos EUA concluiu que ele pode ser 5,7.
en-mt: A study published by the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention concluded that it may be 5.7.

sourceString: Most people with COVID-19 recover.
targetString: A maioria das pessoas com COVID-19 se recupera.
en-mt: Most people with COVID-19 recover.

sourceString: For those who do not, the time from development of symptoms to death has been between 6 and 41 days, with the most common being 14 days.
targetString: Para aqueles que não se recuperam, o tempo desde o aparecimento dos sintomas até o óbito tem sido entre 6 e 41 dias, sendo 14 dias o mais comum.
en-mt: For those who do not recover, the time from the onset of symptoms to death has been between 6 and 41 days, with 14 days being the most common.

sourceString: As of 10 April 2020, approximately 97,000 deaths had been attributed to COVID-19.
targetString: Até 10 de abril de 2020, aproximadamente 97.000 mortes foram atribuídas à COVID-19.
en-mt: As of April 10, 2020, approximately 97,000 deaths have been attributed to COVID-19.

sourceString: In China, as of 5 February about 80% of deaths were in those over 60, and 75% had pre-existing health conditions including cardiovascular diseases and diabetes.Official tallies of deaths from the COVID-19 pandemic generally refer to dead people who tested positive for COVID according to official protocols.
targetString: Na China, até 5 de fevereiro, aproximadamente 80% das mortes ocorreram em pessoas com mais de 60 anos e 75% apresentavam condições médicas preexistentes, inclusive doenças cardiovasculares e diabetes. A contagem oficial de mortes pela pandemia de COVID-19 normalmente se refere às pessoas que morreram e que tinham teste positivo para COVID, de acordo com os protocolos oficiais.
en-mt: In China, as of February 5, approximately 80% of deaths occurred in people over the age of 60, and 75% had pre-existing medical conditions, including cardiovascular disease and diabetes. Official COVID-19 pandemic death counts typically refer to people who have died and who have tested positive for COVID, in accordance with official protocols.

sourceString: The number of true fatalities from COVID-19 may be much higher, as it may not include people who die without testing - e.g. at home, in nursing homes, etc.
targetString: O número real de mortes pela COVID-19 pode ser muito maior, uma vez que pode não incluir pessoas que faleceram sem ter feito o teste, por exemplo, que faleceram em casa, em casas de repouso, etc.
en-mt: The actual number of deaths from COVID-19 could be much higher, as it may not include people who died without having been tested, for example, who died at home, in nursing homes, etc.

sourceString: Partial data from Italy found that the number of excess deaths during the pandemic exceeded the official COVID death tally by a factor of 4-5x.
targetString: Os dados parciais da Itália demonstraram que o número adicional de mortes durante a pandemia ultrapassou a contagem oficial de mortes por COVID por um fator de 4-5x.
en-mt: Partial data from Italy demonstrated that the additional number of deaths during the pandemic exceeded the official COVID death count by a factor of 4-5x.

sourceString: A spokeswoman for the U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) acknowledged "We know that [the stated death toll] is an underestimation", a statement corroborated by anecdotal reports of undercounting in the U.S. Such underestimation often occurs in pandemics, such as the 2009 H1N1 swine flu epidemic.The first confirmed death was in Wuhan on 9 January 2020.
targetString: Uma porta-voz dos centros de controle e prevenção de doenças (CDC) dos EUA reconheceu que "sabemos que [o número de mortos oficial] é subestimado", uma declaração corroborada por relatos episódicos de subnotificação nos EUA. Essa subestimação frequentemente ocorre em pandemias, como a epidemia de gripe suína H1N1 em 2009. A primeira morte confirmada ocorreu em Wuhan, em 9 de janeiro de 2020.
en-mt: A spokeswoman for the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) acknowledged that "we know that [the official death toll] is underestimated," a statement borne out by episodic reports of underreporting in the US. This underestimation often occurs in pandemics, such as the H1N1 swine flu epidemic in 2009. The first confirmed death occurred in Wuhan on January 9, 2020.

sourceString: The first death outside mainland China occurred on 1 February in the Philippines, and the first death outside Asia was in France on 14 February.
targetString: A primeira morte fora da China ocorreu em 1.º de fevereiro, nas Filipinas, e a primeira morte fora da Ásia ocorreu na França, em 14 de fevereiro.
en-mt: The first death outside China occurred on February 1 in the Philippines, and the first death outside Asia occurred in France on February 14.

sourceString: By 28 February, outside mainland China, more than a dozen deaths each were recorded in Iran, South Korea, and Italy.
targetString: Em 28 de fevereiro, fora da China, mais de uma dúzia de mortes já tinham sido registradas no Irã, Coreia do Sul e Itália.
en-mt: As of February 28, outside of China, more than a dozen deaths had already been reported in Iran, South Korea and Italy.

sourceString: By 13 March, more than forty countries and territories had reported deaths, on every continent except Antarctica.Several measures are commonly used to quantify mortality.
targetString: Em 13 de março, mais de quarenta países e territórios tinham relatado mortes, em todos os continentes, exceto na Antártida. Várias medidas são comumente usadas para quantificar a mortalidade.
en-mt: As of March 13, more than forty countries and territories had reported deaths, on all continents except Antarctica. Several measures are commonly used to quantify mortality.

sourceString: These numbers vary by region and over time, and are influenced by the volume of testing, healthcare system quality, treatment options, time since initial outbreak, and population characteristics such as age, sex, and overall health.The death-to-case ratio reflects the number of deaths divided by the number of diagnosed cases within a given time interval.
targetString: Esses números variam de acordo com a região e ao longo do tempo e são influenciados pelo volume de testes, qualidade do sistema de saúde, opções de tratamento, tempo desde o surto inicial e pelas características da população, como idade, sexo e saúde geral. O coeficiente de fatalidade representa o número de mortes dividido pelo número de casos diagnosticados em um determinado intervalo.
en-mt: These numbers vary by region and over time and are influenced by the volume of testing, quality of the health care system, treatment options, time since the initial outbreak, and population characteristics such as age, gender, and general health. The fatality coefficient represents the number of deaths divided by the number of cases diagnosed in a given interval.

sourceString: Based on Johns Hopkins University statistics, the global death-to-case ratio is 6.0% (97,039/1,617,204) as of 10 April 2020.
targetString: Com base nas estatísticas da Universidade Johns Hopkins, o coeficiente de fatalidade global é 6,0% (97.039/1.617.204) até 10 de abril de 2020.
en-mt: Based on Johns Hopkins University statistics, the global fatality rate is 6.0% (97,039/1,617,204) as of April 10, 2020.

sourceString: The number varies by region.
targetString: O número varia de acordo com a região.
en-mt: The number varies by region.

sourceString: In China, estimates for the death-to-case ratio decreased from 17.3% (for those with symptom onset 1–10 January 2020) to 0.7% (for those with symptom onset after 1 February 2020).Other measures include the case fatality rate (CFR), which reflects the percent of diagnosed people who die from a disease, and the infection fatality rate (IFR), which reflects the percent of infected (diagnosed and undiagnosed) who die from a disease.
targetString: Na China, as estimativas do coeficiente de fatalidade caíram de 17,3% (em pessoas com início dos sintomas entre 1–10 de janeiro de 2020) para 0,7% (para pessoas com início dos sintomas após 1.º de fevereiro de 2020). Outras medidas incluem a taxa de letalidade (CFR), que representa a porcentagem de pessoas diagnosticadas que morrem devido a uma doença, e a taxa de letalidade da infecção (IFR), que representa a porcentagem de infectados (diagnosticados e não diagnosticados) que morrem devido à doença.
en-mt: In China, fatality rate estimates have dropped from 17.3% (in people with symptom onset between January 1–10, 2020) to 0.7% (for people with symptom onset after February 1, 2020). 2020). Other measures include the case fatality rate (CFR), which represents the percentage of diagnosed people who die from a disease, and the infection case fatality rate (IFR), which represents the percentage of infected (diagnosed and undiagnosed) people who die due to illness.

sourceString: These statistics are not timebound and follow a specific population from infection through case resolution.
targetString: Essas estatísticas não são estáticas no tempo e seguem uma população específica da infecção por meio da resolução do caso.
en-mt: These statistics are not static over time and follow a specific population of infection through case resolution.

sourceString: A number of academics have attempted to calculate these numbers for specific populations.
targetString: Alguns acadêmicos tentaram calcular esses números para populações específicas.
en-mt: Some academics have tried to calculate these numbers for specific populations.

sourceString: The University of Oxford's Centre for Evidence-Based Medicine estimates that the infection fatality rate for the pandemic as a whole is between 0.1% and 0.39%.
targetString: O Centro de Medicina Baseada em Evidências da Universidade de Oxford estima que a taxa de letalidade da infecção para a pandemia, no geral, está entre 0,1% e 0,39%.
en-mt: The Center for Evidence-Based Medicine at the University of Oxford estimates that the infection fatality rate for the pandemic overall is between 0.1% and 0.39%.

sourceString: The upper estimate of this range is consistent with the results from the first random testing for COVID-19 in Germany, and a statistical study analysing the impact of testing on CFR estimates.
targetString: A estimativa superior desse intervalo é compatível com os resultados do primeiro teste aleatório para COVID-19 na Alemanha e com um estudo estatístico que analisou o impacto dos testes nas estimativas da CFR.
en-mt: The upper estimate of this range is consistent with the results of the first randomized test for COVID-19 in Germany and with a statistical study that analyzed the impact of testing on CFR estimates.

sourceString: The WHO asserts that the pandemic can be controlled.
targetString: A OMS afirma que a pandemia pode ser controlada.
en-mt: The WHO claims that the pandemic can be controlled.

sourceString: The peak and ultimate duration of the outbreak are uncertain and may differ by location.
targetString: O pico e a duração máxima do surto são incertos e podem mudar de acordo com o local.
en-mt: The peak and maximum duration of the outbreak is uncertain and may change by location.

sourceString: Maciej Boni of Penn State University stated, "Left unchecked, infectious outbreaks typically plateau and then start to decline when the disease runs out of available hosts.
targetString: Maciej Boni, da Universidade Estadual da Pensilvânia, declarou que, "sem o devido controle, epidemias infecciosas geralmente atingem seu auge e depois entram em declínio quando não há mais hospedeiros disponíveis para a doença.
en-mt: Maciej Boni of Pennsylvania State University stated that, "Without proper control, infectious epidemics often peak and then decline when no more hosts are available for the disease.

sourceString: But it's almost impossible to make any sensible projection right now about when that will be".
targetString: Mas é quase impossível fazer qualquer projeção adequada no momento sobre quando isso ocorrerá".
en-mt: But it's almost impossible to make any adequate projections at the moment as to when that will occur."

sourceString: The Chinese government's senior medical adviser Zhong Nanshan argued that "it could be over by June" if all countries can be mobilized to follow the WHO's advice on measures to stop the spread of the virus.
targetString: O conselheiro médico sênior do governo chinês, Zhong Nanshan, defendeu que "pode acabar até junho" se todos os países se mobilizarem para seguir as recomendações da OMS em relação às medidas para impedir a disseminação do vírus.
en-mt: The Chinese government's senior medical adviser, Zhong Nanshan, argued that "it could be over by June" if all countries mobilize to follow WHO recommendations regarding measures to prevent the spread of the virus.

sourceString: On 17 March, Adam Kucharski of the London School of Hygiene & Tropical Medicine stated that SARS-CoV-2 "is going to be circulating, potentially for a year or two".
targetString: Em 17 de março, Adam Kucharski, da Escola de Higiene e Medicina Tropical de Londres, declarou que o SARS-CoV-2 "provavelmente continuará em circulação por um ano ou dois".
en-mt: On March 17, Adam Kucharski of the London School of Hygiene and Tropical Medicine stated that SARS-CoV-2 "is likely to remain in circulation for a year or two".

sourceString: According to the Imperial College study led by Neil Ferguson, physical distancing and other measures will be required "until a vaccine becomes available (potentially 18 months or more)".
targetString: De acordo com o estudo do Imperial College, liderado por Neil Ferguson, o distanciamento físico e outras medidas serão necessárias "até que uma vacina esteja disponível (potencialmente em 18 meses ou mais)".
en-mt: According to the Imperial College study, led by Neil Ferguson, physical distancing and other measures will be necessary "until a vaccine is available (potentially in 18 months or longer)".

sourceString: William Schaffner of Vanderbilt University stated, "I think it's unlikely that this coronavirus—because it's so readily transmissible—will disappear completely" and it "might turn into a seasonal disease, making a comeback every year".
targetString: William Schaffner, da Universidade Vanderbilt declarou: "Acho improvável que esse coronavírus desaparecerá completamente, já que é altamente transmissível" e "que poderá se tornar uma doença sazonal, reaparecendo todos os anos".
en-mt: William Schaffner of Vanderbilt University stated, "I think it is unlikely that this coronavirus will completely disappear, as it is highly transmissible" and "that it could become a seasonal illness, reappearing every year."

sourceString: The virulence of the comeback would depend on herd immunity and the extent of mutation.
targetString: A virulência do reaparecimento dependerá da imunidade de grupo e da extensão da mutação.
en-mt: The virulence of the reappearance will depend on herd immunity and the extent of the mutation.

sourceString: Symptoms of COVID-19 can be relatively non-specific and infected people may be asymptomatic.
targetString: Os sintomas da COVID-19 podem ser relativamente inespecíficos e as pessoas infectadas podem ser assintomáticas.
en-mt: The symptoms of COVID-19 can be relatively non-specific and infected people can be asymptomatic.

sourceString: The two most common symptoms are fever (88%) and dry cough (68%).
targetString: Os dois sintomas mais comuns são febre (88%) e tosse seca (68%).
en-mt: The two most common symptoms are fever (88%) and dry cough (68%).

sourceString: Less common symptoms include fatigue, respiratory sputum production (phlegm), loss of the sense of smell, shortness of breath, muscle and joint pain, sore throat, headache, chills, vomiting, hemoptysis, diarrhea, or cyanosis.The WHO states that approximately one person in six becomes seriously ill and has difficulty breathing.
targetString: Os sintomas menos comuns incluem fadiga, produção de secreção respiratória (catarro), perda da sensação olfativa, falta de ar, dor muscular e articular, dor de garganta, dor de cabeça, calafrios, vômito, hemoptise, diarreia ou cianose. A OMS afirma que aproximadamente uma em cada seis pessoas fica gravemente doente e apresenta dificuldade para respirar.
en-mt: Less common symptoms include fatigue, production of respiratory secretions (phlegm), loss of sense of smell, shortness of breath, muscle and joint pain, sore throat, headache, chills, vomiting, hemoptysis, diarrhea, or cyanosis. The WHO states that approximately one in six people becomes seriously ill and has difficulty breathing.

sourceString: The U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) lists emergency symptoms as difficulty breathing, persistent chest pain or pressure, sudden confusion, difficulty waking, and bluish face or lips; immediate medical attention is advised if these symptoms are present.Further development of the disease can lead to severe pneumonia, acute respiratory distress syndrome, sepsis, septic shock and death.
targetString: Os Centros para Controle e Prevenção de Doenças (CDC) dos EUA lista que os sintomas de emergência são a dificuldade para respirar, dor ou pressão no peito persistentes, confusão súbita, dificuldade para caminhar e face ou lábios com coloração azul. É aconselhado procurar ajuda médica se esses sintomas estiverem presentes. A evolução da doença pode causar pneumonia grave, síndrome do desconforto respiratório agudo, sepse, choque séptico e óbito.
en-mt: The US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) lists emergency symptoms as difficulty breathing, persistent chest pain or pressure, sudden confusion, difficulty walking, and blue-tinged face or lips. It is advised to seek medical help if these symptoms are present. The evolution of the disease can cause severe pneumonia, acute respiratory distress syndrome, sepsis, septic shock and death.

sourceString: Some of those infected may be asymptomatic, with no clinical symptoms but with test results that confirm infection, so researchers have issued advice that those with close contact to confirmed infected people should be closely monitored and examined to rule out infection.
targetString: Algumas das pessoas infectadas podem ser assintomáticas, sem sintomas clínicos, mas com resultados dos testes que confirmam a infecção, portanto, os pesquisadores recomendam que aqueles que estiveram em contato próximo com uma pessoa com infecção confirmada sejam monitorados e examinados de perto para descartar a infecção.
en-mt: Some of those infected may be asymptomatic, with no clinical symptoms but test results that confirm the infection, so researchers recommend that those who have been in close contact with a person with confirmed infection be closely monitored and examined to rule out infection. .

sourceString: Chinese estimates of the asymptomatic ratio range from few to 44%.
targetString: As estimativas chinesas da razão de assintomáticos varia de alguns até 44%.
en-mt: Chinese estimates of the asymptomatic ratio range from a few to 44%.

sourceString: The usual incubation period (the time between infection and symptom onset) ranges from one to 14 days; it is most commonly five days.As an example of uncertainty, the estimate of the fraction of people with COVID-19 who lost their sense of smell was initially 30% and later fell to 15%.
targetString: O período usual de incubação (o tempo entre o início da infecção e dos sintomas) varia de um a 14 dias, mas normalmente é de cinco dias. Como um exemplo da incerteza, a estimativa da fração de pessoas com COVID-19 que perderam a sensação olfativa era inicialmente 30% e posteriormente caiu para 15%.
en-mt: The usual incubation period (the time between the onset of infection and symptoms) ranges from one to 14 days, but is typically five days. As an example of the uncertainty, the estimated fraction of people with COVID-19 who lost their olfactory sensation was initially 30% and subsequently dropped to 15%.

sourceString: Some details about how the disease is spread are still being determined.
targetString: Alguns detalhes sobre como a doença se dissemina ainda estão sendo determinados.
en-mt: Some details about how the disease spreads are still being determined.

sourceString: The disease is believed to be primarily spread during close contact and by small droplets produced during coughing, sneezing, or talking; with close contact being within 1 to 2 metres (3 to 6 feet).
targetString: Acredita-se que essa doença seja disseminada principalmente pelo contato próximo e por pequenas gotículas produzidas durante o ato de tossir, espirrar ou falar, sendo o contato próximo considerado de 1 a 2 metros (3 a 6 pés).
en-mt: This disease is believed to be spread primarily by close contact and small droplets produced during coughing, sneezing, or talking, with close contact considered to be 1 to 2 meters (3 to 6 feet).

sourceString: Studies have found that an uncovered coughing can lead to droplets travelling up to 4.5 metres (15 feet) to 8.2 metres (27 feet).
