targetString: Estudos descobriram que tossir sem cobrir a boca pode fazer com que as gotículas alcancem de 4,5 metros (15 pés) até 8,2 metros (27 pés).
en-mt: Studies have found that coughing without covering your mouth can cause droplets to reach from 4.5 meters (15 feet) to 8.2 meters (27 feet).

sourceString: Some have proposed that the virus may also be transmitted by small droplets that stay for more prolonged periods in the air, that may be generated during speech.Respiratory droplets may also be produced during breathing out, including when talking, though the virus is not generally airborne.
targetString: Algumas pessoas propuseram que o vírus pode também ser transmitido por gotículas que permanecem por períodos mais prolongados no ar, que podem ter sido geradas durante uma conversa. Gotículas de respiração também podem ser produzidas durante a expiração, incluindo ao falar, embora o vírus não esteja normalmente em suspensão.
en-mt: Some people have proposed that the virus can also be transmitted by droplets that remain for longer periods in the air, which may have been generated during a conversation. Breath droplets can also be produced during exhalation, including when speaking, although the virus is not normally in suspension.

sourceString: The droplets can land in the mouths or noses of people who are nearby or possibly be inhaled into the lungs.
targetString: As gotículas podem pousar nas bocas e narizes de pessoas próximas ou, possivelmente, serem inaladas pelos pulmões.
en-mt: Droplets can land on the mouths and noses of people nearby or possibly be inhaled into the lungs.

sourceString: Some medical procedures such as intubation and cardiopulmonary resuscitation (CPR) may cause respiratory secretions to be aerosolized and thus result in airborne spread.
targetString: Alguns procedimentos médicos, como a intubação e a reanimação cardiopulmonar (CPR) podem causar a nebulização de secreções respiratórias, resultando na propagação pelo ar.
en-mt: Some medical procedures, such as intubation and cardiopulmonary resuscitation (CPR), can cause respiratory secretions to mist, resulting in airborne spread.

sourceString: It may also spread when one touches a contaminated surface, including skin, and then touches their eyes, nose, or mouth.
targetString: A propagação também pode ocorrer quando alguém toca uma superfície contaminada, incluindo a pele, e depois toca nos próprios olhos, nariz ou boca.
en-mt: Spread can also occur when someone touches a contaminated surface, including the skin, and then touches their eyes, nose or mouth.

sourceString: While there are concerns it may spread by faeces, this risk is believed to be low.
targetString: Embora haja a preocupação de que possa se espalhar pelas fezes, acredita-se que o risco disso acontecer seja baixo.
en-mt: While there is concern that it could be spread through stool, the risk of this happening is thought to be low.

sourceString: The Government of China denied the possibility of faecal-oral transmission of SARS-CoV-2.The virus is most contagious during the first three days after onset of symptoms, although spread may be possible before symptoms appear and in later stages of the disease.
targetString: O governo da China negou a possibilidade de transmissão oro-fecal do SARS-CoV-2. O vírus é mais contagioso durante os três primeiros dias após o surgimento dos sintomas, embora a transmissão possa ser possível antes dos sintomas aparecerem e em estágios posteriores da doença.
en-mt: The government of China has denied the possibility of oro-fecal transmission of SARS-CoV-2. The virus is most contagious during the first three days after symptoms appear, although transmission may be possible before symptoms appear and in later stages of the illness.

sourceString: People have tested positive for the disease up to three days before onset of symptoms suggesting transmission is possible before developing significant symptoms.
targetString: Houve testes positivos para a doença até três dias antes do surgimento dos sintomas, o que sugere que a transmissão é possível antes mesmo do desenvolvimento de sintomas significativos.
en-mt: There have been positive tests for the disease up to three days before symptoms appear, which suggests that transmission is possible even before significant symptoms develop.

sourceString: Only few reports of laboratory-confirmed asymptomatic cases exist, but asymptomatic transmission has been identified by some countries during contact tracing investigations.
targetString: Existem apenas alguns relatos de casos assintomáticos confirmados por laboratório, mas a transmissão assintomática foi identificada em alguns países durante investigações de rastreamento de contatos.
en-mt: There are only a few reports of laboratory-confirmed asymptomatic cases, but asymptomatic transmission has been identified in some countries during contact tracing investigations.

sourceString: The European Centre for Disease Prevention and Control (ECDC) states that while it is not entirely clear how easily the disease spreads, one person generally infects two to three others.The virus survives for hours to days on surfaces.
targetString: O Centro Europeu de Prevenção e Controle de Doenças (ECDC) estabelece que, embora não esteja inteiramente clara a facilidade com que a doença se espalha, uma pessoa geralmente infecta de duas a três outras pessoas. O vírus sobrevive de horas a dias em superfícies.
en-mt: The European Center for Disease Prevention and Control (ECDC) states that, although it is not entirely clear how easily the disease spreads, one person usually infects two to three other people. The virus survives for hours to days on surfaces.

sourceString: Specifically, the virus was found to be detectable for up to three days on plastic (polypropylene) and 304 stainless steel, for one day on cardboard, and for up to four hours on copper.
targetString: Especificamente, descobriu-se que o vírus é detectável por até três dias em plástico (polipropileno) e aço inoxidável 304, por um dia em papelão e por até quatro horas em cobre.
en-mt: Specifically, the virus was found to be detectable for up to three days on plastic (polypropylene) and 304 stainless steel, for one day on cardboard, and for up to four hours on copper.

sourceString: This, however, varies based on the humidity and temperature.Pets and other animals have tested positive for COVID-19.
targetString: Isto, no entanto, varia de acordo com a umidade e temperatura. Animais de estimação e outros animais já testaram positivo para a COVID-19.
en-mt: This, however, varies according to humidity and temperature. Pets and other animals have already tested positive for COVID-19.

sourceString: There is no evidence animals can pass the virus on to humans, though British authorities advise washing one's hands after contact with animals, like after contact with other surfaces infected people could have touched.
targetString: Não existem evidências de que animais possam passar o vírus para humanos. Contudo, as autoridades britânicas aconselham a lavar as mãos após o contato com animais, assim como após o contato com superfícies que pessoas infectadas possam ter tocado.
en-mt: There is no evidence that animals can pass the virus to humans. However, British authorities advise washing hands after contact with animals, as well as after contact with surfaces that infected people may have touched.

sourceString: Severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2) is a novel virus, first isolated from three people with pneumonia connected to the cluster of acute respiratory illness cases in Wuhan.
targetString: O coronavírus 2 da síndrome respiratória aguda grave (SARS-CoV-2) é um vírus novo, isolado pela primeira vez a partir de três pessoas com pneumonia conectadas a um conjunto de casos de doença respiratória aguda em Wuhan.
en-mt: Severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2) is a novel virus, first isolated from three people with pneumonia linked to a cluster of acute respiratory illness cases in Wuhan.

sourceString: All features of the novel SARS-CoV-2 virus occur in related coronaviruses in nature.Outside the human body, the virus is killed by household soap, which dissolves its protective envelope.SARS-CoV-2 is closely related to the original SARS-CoV.
targetString: Todas as características do novo vírus SARS-CoV-2 se assemelham às de coronavírus relacionados em sua natureza. Fora do corpo humano, o vírus morre por sabão caseiro, que dissolve seu envelope protetor. O SARS-CoV-2 está intimamente associado ao SARS-CoV original.
en-mt: All features of the new SARS-CoV-2 virus resemble related coronaviruses in nature. Outside the human body, the virus dies from homemade soap, which dissolves its protective envelope. SARS-CoV-2 is closely associated with the original SARS-CoV.

sourceString: It is thought to have a zoonotic origin.
targetString: Acredita-se que tenha origem zoonótica.
en-mt: It is believed to have zoonotic origin.

sourceString: Genetic analysis has revealed that the coronavirus genetically clusters with the genus Betacoronavirus, in subgenus Sarbecovirus (lineage B) together with two bat-derived strains.
targetString: A análise genética revelou que o coronavírus está associado geneticamente ao gênero Betacoronavírus, subgênero Sarbecovírus (linhagem B). Duas cepas desta mesma linhagem são derivadas de morcegos.
en-mt: Genetic analysis revealed that the coronavirus is genetically associated with the genus Betacoronavirus, subgenus Sarbecovirus (B lineage). Two strains from this same lineage are derived from bats.

sourceString: It is 96% identical at the whole genome level to other bat coronavirus samples (BatCov RaTG13).
targetString: Ele tem 96% de semelhança, em todo o nível do genoma, a outras amostras de coronavírus vindas de morcegos (BatCoV RaTG13).
en-mt: It has 96% similarity, at the entire genome level, to other coronavirus samples from bats (BatCoV RaTG13).

sourceString: In February 2020, Chinese researchers found that there is only one amino acid difference in certain parts of the genome sequences between the viruses from pangolins and those from humans.
targetString: Em fevereiro de 2020, pesquisadores chineses descobriram que existe apenas um aminoácido de diferença em certas partes das sequências de genoma entre o vírus de pangolins e o dos humanos.
en-mt: In February 2020, Chinese researchers discovered that there is only one amino acid difference in certain parts of the genome sequences between the pangolin virus and that of humans.

sourceString: Whole-genome comparison to date has found at most 92% of genetic material shared between pangolin coronavirus and SARS-CoV-2, which is insufficient to prove pangolins to be the intermediate host.
targetString: A comparação de todo o genoma, até agora, encontrou, no máximo, 92% de compartilhamento de material genético entre o coronavírus do pangolim e o SARS-CoV-2, o que é insuficiente para provar que os pangolins sejam o hospedeiro intermediário.
en-mt: The whole-genome comparison has so far found at most 92% sharing of genetic material between the pangolin coronavirus and SARS-CoV-2, which is insufficient to prove that pangolins are the intermediate host.

sourceString: Infection by the virus can be provisionally diagnosed on the basis of symptoms, though confirmation is ultimately by reverse transcription polymerase chain reaction (rRT-PCR) of infected secretions or CT imaging.
targetString: A infecção pelo vírus pode ser provisoriamente diagnosticada com base nos sintomas. A confirmação definitiva, porém, é pela transcrição reversa seguida de reação em cadeia da polimerase (rRT-PCR) de secreções infectadas ou por tomografia computadorizada (TC).
en-mt: Virus infection can be tentatively diagnosed based on symptoms. Definitive confirmation, however, is by reverse transcription followed by polymerase chain reaction (rRT-PCR) of infected secretions or by computed tomography (CT).

sourceString: A study comparing PCR to CT in Wuhan has suggested that CT is significantly more sensitive than PCR, though less specific, with many of its imaging features overlapping with other pneumonias and disease processes.
targetString: Um estudo feito em Wuhan, comparando a rRT-PCR à TC sugeriu que a TC é significativamente mais sensível, embora seja menos específica, com muitas de suas características de imagem coincidindo com outras pneumonias e processos patológicos.
en-mt: A study done in Wuhan comparing rRT-PCR to CT suggested that CT is significantly more sensitive, although it is less specific, with many of its imaging features coinciding with other pneumonias and disease processes.

sourceString: As of March 2020, the American College of Radiology recommends that "CT should not be used to screen for or as a first-line test to diagnose COVID-19".
targetString: Desde março de 2020, o American College of Radiology recomenda que "a TC não seja usada para triagem ou como teste de linha de frente para o diagnóstico da COVID-19".
en-mt: As of March 2020, the American College of Radiology recommends that "CT not be used for screening or as a frontline test for the diagnosis of COVID-19".

sourceString: The WHO has published several RNA testing protocols for SARS-CoV-2, with the first issued on 17 January.
targetString: A OMS publicou diversos protocolos de testagem de RNA para o SARS-CoV-2, o primeiro deles tendo sido publicado em 17 de janeiro.
en-mt: WHO has published several RNA testing protocols for SARS-CoV-2, the first of which was published on January 17.

sourceString: The test uses real-time reverse transcription polymerase chain reaction (rRT-PCR).
targetString: O teste usa transcrição reversa seguida de reação e cadeia da polimerase (rRT-PCR) em tempo real.
en-mt: The test uses real-time reverse transcription followed by polymerase chain reaction (rRT-PCR).

sourceString: The test can be done on respiratory or blood samples.
targetString: O teste pode ser feito em amostras respiratórias ou sanguíneas.
en-mt: The test can be done on respiratory or blood samples.

sourceString: Results are generally available within a few hours to days.
targetString: Os resultados são normalmente disponibilizados de poucas horas a dias.
en-mt: Results are usually available within hours to days.

sourceString: Generally this test is carried out on a nasopharyngeal swab though a throat swab may also be used.A number of laboratories and companies are developing serological tests, which detect antibodies.
targetString: Geralmente, este teste é realizado em esfregaço nasofaríngeo, embora o esfregaço da garganta também seja usado. Diversos laboratórios e empresas estão desenvolvendo testes serológicos, capazes de detectar os anticorpos.
en-mt: This test is usually performed on a nasopharyngeal swab, although a throat swab is also used. Several laboratories and companies are developing serological tests capable of detecting the antibodies.

sourceString: As of 6 April 2020, none of these has been proved sufficiently accurate to be approved for widespread use.
targetString: Na data de 6 de abril de 2020, nenhum destes havia se mostrado suficientemente preciso para ser aprovado para uso generalizado.
en-mt: As of April 6, 2020, none of these have proven accurate enough to be approved for widespread use.

sourceString: In the US a serological test developed by Cellex has been approved for emergency use by certified laboratories only.
targetString: Um teste serológico desenvolvido pela Cellex, nos Estados Unidos. foi aprovado para ser usado em caráter emergencial apenas por laboratórios certificados.
en-mt: A serological test developed by Cellex in the United States. approved for emergency use by certified laboratories only.

sourceString: Characteristic imaging features on radiographs and computed tomography (CT) of people who are symptomatic include asymmetric peripheral ground glass opacities and absent pleural effusions.
targetString: As particularidades das imagens de radiografias e tomografia computadorizada (TC) de pessoas sintomáticas incluem opacidades em vidro fosco periféricas assimétricas e ausência de derrames pleurais.
en-mt: Features of radiographs and computed tomography (CT) images of symptomatic people include asymmetrical peripheral ground-glass opacities and absence of pleural effusions.

sourceString: The Italian Radiological Society is compiling an international online database of imaging findings for confirmed cases.
targetString: A Sociedade Radiológica Italiana está reunindo um banco de dados internacional on-line de resultados de imagem em casos confirmados.
en-mt: The Italian Radiological Society is putting together an international online database of imaging results in confirmed cases.

sourceString: Due to overlap with other infections such as adenovirus, imaging without confirmation by PCR is of limited specificity in identifying COVID-19.
targetString: Devido à sobreposição com outras infecções como aquela por adenovírus, imagens sem a confirmação por PCR são de especificidade limitada na identificação da COVID-19.
en-mt: Due to overlap with other infections such as adenovirus, imaging without PCR confirmation is of limited specificity in identifying COVID-19.

sourceString: A large study in China compared chest CT results to PCR and demonstrated that though imaging is less specific for the infection, it is faster and more sensitive, suggesting its consideration as a screening tool in epidemic areas.
targetString: Um grande estudo na China comparou os resultados de TC torácica aos da PCR e demonstrou que, embora a imagem seja menos específica para a infecção, é mais rápida e mais sensível, o que sugere sua consideração como ferramenta de investigação em áreas epidêmicas.
en-mt: A large study in China compared the results of chest CT and PCR and demonstrated that, although the image is less specific for infection, it is faster and more sensitive, suggesting its consideration as an investigation tool in epidemic areas.

sourceString: Artificial intelligence-based convolutional neural networks have been developed to detect imaging features of the virus with both radiographs and CT.
targetString: Redes neurais convolucionais baseadas em inteligência artificial têm sido desenvolvidas para a detecção de características de imagens do vírus com radiografias e com TC.
en-mt: Convolutional neural networks based on artificial intelligence have been developed for the detection of features of virus images with radiographs and with CT.

sourceString: Strategies for preventing transmission of the disease include maintaining overall good personal hygiene, washing hands, avoiding touching the eyes, nose, or mouth with unwashed hands, and coughing or sneezing into a tissue and putting the tissue directly into a waste container.
targetString: As estratégias para evitar a transmissão da doença incluem manter uma boa higiene pessoal em geral, lavar as mãos, evitar tocar nos olhos, no nariz ou na boca sem lavar as mãos, tossir ou espirrar em um lenço de papel e colocar este lenço diretamente em um contêiner de resíduos.
en-mt: Strategies to prevent disease transmission include maintaining good general personal hygiene, washing hands, avoiding touching eyes, nose, or mouth without washing hands, coughing or sneezing into a tissue, and placing the tissue directly on a waste container.

sourceString: Those who may already have the infection have been advised to wear a surgical mask in public.
targetString: Aconselha-se quem já foi infectado a usar uma máscara cirúrgica em público.
en-mt: Anyone who has already been infected is advised to wear a surgical mask in public.

sourceString: Physical distancing measures are also recommended to prevent transmission.Many governments have restricted or advised against all non-essential travel to and from countries and areas affected by the outbreak.
targetString: Medidas de distanciamento físico também são recomendadas para evitar a transmissão. Muitos governos têm restringido ou desaconselhado viagens não essenciais indo para ou vindo de países e áreas afetados pelo surto.
en-mt: Physical distancing measures are also recommended to prevent transmission. Many governments have restricted or advised against non-essential travel to or from countries and areas affected by the outbreak.

sourceString: However, the virus has reached the stage of community spread in large parts of the world.
targetString: O vírus, porém, atingiu o estágio de propagação comunitária em vastas regiões do mundo.
en-mt: The virus, however, has reached the stage of community spread in vast regions of the world.

sourceString: This means that the virus is spreading within communities, and some community members don't know where or how they were infected.Health care providers taking care of someone who may be infected are recommended to use standard precautions, contact precautions, and eye protection.Contact tracing is an important method for health authorities to determine the source of an infection and to prevent further transmission.
targetString: Isto significa que o vírus está se espalhando dentro de comunidades e que alguns membros da comunidade não sabem onde ou como foram infectados. Recomenda-se aos profissionais de saúde que cuidam de indivíduos que possam estar infectados a usar as precauções padrão, as precauções de contato e proteção ocular. O rastreamento de contatos é um método importante para que as autoridades de saúde determinem a fonte de uma infecção e para impedir a transmissão posterior.
en-mt: This means that the virus is spreading within communities and that some community members do not know where or how they got infected. Healthcare professionals caring for individuals who may be infected are advised to use standard precautions, contact precautions and eye protection. Contact tracing is an important method for health authorities to determine the source of an infection and to prevent further transmission.

sourceString: The use of location data from mobile phones by governments for this purpose has prompted privacy concerns, with Amnesty International and over 100 other organizations issuing a statement calling for limits on this kind of surveillance.
targetString: O uso pelos governos de dados de localização a partir de celulares para este propósito tem suscitado questões de privacidade, com a Anistia Internacional e mais de 100 outras organizações emitindo uma declaração pedindo limites a esse tipo de vigilância.
en-mt: Governments' use of location data from mobile phones for this purpose has raised privacy concerns, with Amnesty International and more than 100 other organizations issuing a statement calling for limits on this type of surveillance.

sourceString: Various mobile apps have been implemented or proposed for voluntary use, and as of April 7, 2020, over a dozen expert groups were working on privacy-friendly solutions, such as using Bluetooth to log a user's proximity to other cellphones.
targetString: Vários aplicativos para celulares têm sido implementados ou propostos para uso voluntário. Em 7 de abril de 2020, mais de uma dúzia de grupos de especialistas estão trabalhando em soluções amigáveis à privacidade, como usar o Bluetooth para registrar a proximidade de um usuário em relação a outros telefones celulares.
en-mt: Several mobile applications have been implemented or proposed for voluntary use. As of April 7, 2020, more than a dozen expert groups are working on privacy-friendly solutions, such as using Bluetooth to record a user's proximity to other cell phones.

sourceString: Users then receive a message if they've been in close contact with someone who has tested positive for COVID-19.Misconceptions are circulating about how to prevent infection; for example, rinsing the nose and gargling with mouthwash are not effective.
targetString: Os usuários recebem então uma mensagem se estiveram em contato próximo com alguém que testou positivo para a COVID-19. Alguns conceitos incorretos sobre como prevenir a infecção têm circulado, como, por exemplo, enxaguar o nariz e gargarejar com colutórios, o que já se provou ineficaz.
en-mt: Users then receive a message if they have been in close contact with someone who has tested positive for COVID-19. Some misconceptions about how to prevent infection have been circulating, such as rinsing the nose and gargling with mouthwashes, which have proven ineffective.

sourceString: There is no COVID-19 vaccine, though many organizations are working to develop one.
targetString: Não existe vacina contra a COVID-19. No entanto, diversas organizações estão trabalhando para o desenvolvimento de uma.
en-mt: There is no vaccine against COVID-19. However, several organizations are working towards developing one.

sourceString: Hand washing is recommended to prevent the spread of the disease.
targetString: Lavar as mãos é recomendado para evitar a propagação da doença.
en-mt: Hand washing is recommended to prevent the spread of the disease.

sourceString: The CDC recommends that people wash hands often with soap and water for at least twenty seconds, especially after going to the toilet or when hands are visibly dirty; before eating; and after blowing one's nose, coughing, or sneezing.
targetString: O CDC recomenda que as pessoas lavem as mãos com frequência com água e sabão por, pelo menos, vinte segundos, especialmente após usar o toalete ou quando as mãos estão visivelmente sujas. Também se deve lavar as mãos antes de comer e após assoar o nariz, tossir ou espirrar.
en-mt: The CDC recommends that people wash their hands frequently with soap and water for at least twenty seconds, especially after using the restroom or when hands are visibly dirty. You should also wash your hands before eating and after blowing your nose, coughing or sneezing.

sourceString: This is because outside the human body, the virus is killed by household soap, which bursts its protective bubble.
targetString: Isto é porque, fora do corpo humano, o vírus é morto por sabão caseiro, que rompe sua capa protetora.
en-mt: This is because, outside the human body, the virus is killed by homemade soap, which breaks through its protective layer.

sourceString: CDC further recommended using an alcohol-based hand sanitizer with at least 60% alcohol by volume when soap and water are not readily available.
targetString: O CDC recomenda ainda o uso de higienizador de mãos à base de álcool com volume mínimo de 60% de álcool, quando não houver sabão e água prontamente disponíveis.
en-mt: The CDC further recommends the use of alcohol-based hand sanitizer with a minimum volume of 60% alcohol when soap and water are not readily available.

sourceString: The WHO advises people to avoid touching the eyes, nose, or mouth with unwashed hands.
targetString: A OMS aconselha a evitar tocar os olhos, o nariz ou a boca sem lavar as mãos.
en-mt: The WHO advises to avoid touching your eyes, nose or mouth without washing your hands.

sourceString: Surfaces may be decontaminated with a number of solutions (within one minute of exposure to the disinfectant for a stainless steel surface), including 62–71% ethanol, 50–100% isopropanol, 0.1% sodium hypochlorite, 0.5% hydrogen peroxide, and 0.2–7.5% povidone-iodine.
targetString: As superfícies podem ser descontaminadas com diversas soluções (em até um minuto de exposição ao desinfetante para uma superfície de aço inoxidável), incluindo etanol a 62–71%, álcool isopropílico a 50–100%, hipoclorito de sódio a 0,1%, peróxido de hidrogênio a 0,5% e iodopovidona a 0,2–7,5%.
en-mt: Surfaces can be decontaminated with a variety of solutions (within one minute of exposure to the disinfectant for a stainless steel surface), including 62–71% ethanol, 50–100% isopropyl alcohol, 0.1% sodium hypochlorite, 0.5% hydrogen peroxide and 0.2–7.5% povidone iodine.

sourceString: Other solutions, such as benzalkonium chloride and chrohexidine gluconate, are less effective.
targetString: Outras soluções, como o cloreto de benzalcônio e o gluconato de clorexidina, são menos eficazes.
en-mt: Other solutions, such as benzalkonium chloride and chlorhexidine gluconate, are less effective.

sourceString: The CDC recommends that if a COVID case is suspected or confirmed at a facility such as an office or day care, all areas such as offices, bathrooms, common areas, shared electronic equipment like tablets, touch screens, keyboards, remote controls, and ATM machines used by the ill persons, should be disinfected.
targetString: O CDC recomenda que, em caso de suspeita ou confirmação COVID-19 em uma local, como um escritório ou uma creche, todas as áreas como escritórios, banheiros, áreas comuns, equipamentos eletrônicos compartilhados como tablets, touchscreens, teclados, controles remotos e caixas eletrônicos usados pelas pessoas doentes devem ser desinfetados.
en-mt: The CDC recommends that, in the event of suspected or confirmed COVID-19 in a location, such as an office or day care, all areas such as offices, restrooms, common areas, shared electronic equipment such as tablets, touchscreens, keyboards, remote controls, and cashiers Electronics used by sick people must be disinfected.

sourceString: Health organizations recommended that people cover their mouth and nose with a bent elbow or a tissue when coughing or sneezing, and disposing of any tissue immediately.
targetString: As organizações de saúde recomendam cobrir a boca e o nariz com o cotovelo dobrado ou com um lenço de papel ao tossir ou espirrar, além de descartar imediatamente qualquer lenço.
en-mt: Health organizations recommend covering your mouth and nose with a bent elbow or tissue when coughing or sneezing, and immediately disposing of any tissues.

sourceString: Surgical masks are recommended for those who may be infected, as wearing a mask can limit the volume and travel distance of expiratory droplets dispersed when talking, sneezing, and coughing.
targetString: Máscaras cirúrgicas são recomendadas para aqueles que possam estar infectados, já que usar uma máscara pode limitar o volume e distância de deslocamento de gotículas expiratórias ao falar, espirrar ou tossir.
en-mt: Surgical masks are recommended for those who may be infected, as wearing a mask can limit the volume and distance that expiratory droplets travel when talking, sneezing or coughing.

sourceString: The WHO has issued instructions on when and how to use masks.
targetString: A OMS publicou instruções sobre quando e como usar máscaras.
en-mt: WHO has published instructions on when and how to use masks.

sourceString: According to Stephen Griffin, a virologist at the University of Leeds, "Wearing a mask can reduce the propensity [of] people to touch their faces, which is a major source of infection without proper hand hygiene."Masks have also been recommended for use by those taking care of someone who may have the disease.
targetString: De acordo com Stephen Griffin, um virologista da Universidade de Leeds, "O uso de máscaras pode reduzir a propensão das pessoas em tocar seus rostos, o que é uma das maiores fontes de infecção sem a higiene adequada das mãos." Também tem sido recomendado o uso de máscaras por cuidadores de pessoas que possam ter a doença.
en-mt: According to Stephen Griffin, a virologist at the University of Leeds, "The use of masks can reduce people's propensity to touch their faces, which is one of the biggest sources of infection without proper hand hygiene." The use of masks by caregivers of people who may have the disease has also been recommended.

sourceString: The WHO has recommended the wearing of masks by healthy people only if they are at high risk, such as those who are caring for a person with COVID-19, although they also acknowledge that wearing masks may help people avoid touching their face.
targetString: A OMS recomendou o uso de máscaras por pessoas saudáveis apenas quando estão sob alto risco, como os cuidadores de pessoas com a COVID-19, embora também reconheçam que usar as máscaras pode ajudar pessoas a não tocar o próprio rosto.
en-mt: WHO has recommended the use of masks by healthy people only when they are at high risk, such as caregivers of people with COVID-19, although they also recognize that wearing masks can help people not to touch their own face.

sourceString: Several countries have started to encourage the use of face masks by members of the public.
targetString: Em vários países, o uso de máscaras para o rosto pelo público em geral tem começado a ser encorajado.
en-mt: In several countries, the use of face masks by the general public has begun to be encouraged.

sourceString: In the U.S., the CDC recommends wearing non-medical face mask made out of cloth.China has specifically recommended the use of disposable medical masks by healthy members of the public, particularly when coming into close contact (1 metre (3 ft) or less) with other people.
targetString: Nos EUA, o CDC recomenda a utilização de máscara não médica para o rosto feita de pano. A China recomendou especificamente o uso de máscaras médicas descartáveis por pessoas saudáveis em geral, especialmente ao entrar em contato próximo com outra pessoa (ficar 1 metro ou menos de distância).
en-mt: In the US, the CDC recommends using a non-medical cloth face mask. China has specifically recommended the use of disposable medical masks by generally healthy people, especially when coming into close contact with another person (staying 1 meter or less apart).

sourceString: Hong Kong recommends wearing a surgical mask when taking public transport or staying in crowded places.
targetString: Em Hong Kong, recomenda-se o uso de máscara cirúrgica ao usar o transporte público ou ao permanecer em lugares lotados.
en-mt: In Hong Kong, it is recommended to wear a surgical mask when using public transport or when staying in crowded places.

sourceString: Thailand's health officials are encouraging people to make cloth facemasks at home and wash them daily.
targetString: As autoridades sanitárias da Tailândia estão encorajando pessoas a fazer máscaras faciais de pano em casa e a lavá-las diariamente.
en-mt: Health authorities in Thailand are encouraging people to make cloth face masks at home and wash them daily.

sourceString: The Czech Republic and Slovakia banned going out in public without wearing a mask or covering one's nose and mouth.
targetString: Na República Tcheca e na Eslováquia, é proibido sair em público sem usar uma máscara ou cobrir o nariz e boca.
en-mt: In the Czech Republic and Slovakia, it is forbidden to go out in public without wearing a mask or covering your nose and mouth.

sourceString: On 16 March, Vietnam requested everyone to wear a face mask when going to public areas in order to protect themselves and others.
targetString: Em 16 de março, o Vietnã solicitou que todos usassem máscara facial ao sair em áreas públicas a fim de se protegerem e aos outros.
en-mt: On March 16, Vietnam requested that everyone wear a face mask when going out in public areas in order to protect themselves and others.

sourceString: The Austrian government mandated that everyone entering a grocery store must wear a face mask.
targetString: O governo da Áustria exigiu que todos que entrem em supermercados devem usar uma máscara para o rosto.
en-mt: Austria's government has required everyone who enters supermarkets to wear a face mask.

sourceString: Israel has asked all residents to wear face masks when in public.
targetString: Em Israel, foi solicitado a todos os residentes que usem máscaras para o rosto em público.
en-mt: In Israel, all residents have been asked to wear face masks in public.

sourceString: Taiwan, which has been producing ten million masks per day since mid-March, required passengers on trains and intercity buses to wear face masks on 1 April.
targetString: Taiwan, que tem produzido dez milhões de máscaras por dia desde a metade de março, exigiu que passageiros em trens e ônibus intermunicipais usassem máscaras para o rosto a partir de 1º de abril.
en-mt: Taiwan, which has been producing 10 million masks a day since mid-March, required passengers on intercity trains and buses to wear face masks starting April 1.

sourceString: Panama has made it obligatory to wear a face mask whenever going outside, while also recommending the manufacture of a homemade face mask for those who cannot purchase face masks.
targetString: No Panamá, é obrigatória a utilização de máscara para o rosto ao sair na rua. Ao mesmo tempo, recomendou-se a produção de máscaras em casa para aqueles que não puderem comprar.
en-mt: In Panama, it is mandatory to wear a face mask when going out on the street. At the same time, it was recommended to produce masks at home for those who cannot afford to buy them.

sourceString: Face masks have also been widely used in Japan, South Korea, Malaysia, and Singapore.
targetString: Máscaras para o rosto também têm sido amplamente usadas no Japão, Coreia do Sul, Malásia e Singapura.
en-mt: Face masks have also been widely used in Japan, South Korea, Malaysia and Singapore.

sourceString: Social distancing (also known as physical distancing) includes infection control actions intended to slow the spread of disease by minimizing close contact between individuals.
targetString: O distanciamento social (também conhecido como distanciamento físico) envolve ações de controle de infecção destinadas a desacelerar a transmissão da doença, através da redução do contato próximo entre indivíduos.
en-mt: Social distancing (also known as physical distancing) involves infection control actions designed to slow down disease transmission by reducing close contact between individuals.

sourceString: Methods include quarantines; travel restrictions; and the closing of schools, workplaces, stadiums, theatres, or shopping centres.
targetString: Os métodos incluem quarentenas, restrições de viagem e o fechamento de escolas, locais de trabalho, estádios, teatros ou shopping centers.
en-mt: Methods include quarantines, travel restrictions and the closure of schools, workplaces, stadiums, theaters or shopping malls.

sourceString: Individuals may apply social distancing methods by staying at home, limiting travel, avoiding crowded areas, using no-contact greetings, and physically distancing themselves from others.
targetString: Métodos de distanciamento social podem ser aplicados por todos ao ficarem em casa, limitarem suas viagens, evitarem áreas lotadas, usarem saudações sem contato e mantendo distância dos outros.
en-mt: Social distancing methods can be applied by everyone by staying at home, limiting your travel, avoiding crowded areas, using contactless greetings, and keeping your distance from others.

sourceString: Many governments are now mandating or recommending social distancing in regions affected by the outbreak.
targetString: No momento, muitos governos estão obrigando ou recomendando o distanciamento social em regiões afetadas pela epidemia.
en-mt: At the moment, many governments are enforcing or recommending social distancing in regions affected by the epidemic.

sourceString: The maximum gathering size recommended by US government bodies and health organizations was swiftly reduced from 250 people (if there was no known COVID-19 spread in a region) to 50 people, and later to 10 people.
targetString: O número máximo de pessoas reunidas recomendado pelos órgãos governamentais dos EUA e pelas organizações de saúde foi rapidamente reduzido de 250 pessoas (se não houver conhecimento de transmissão de COVID-19 em uma região) para 50 pessoas e posteriormente para 10 pessoas.
en-mt: The maximum number of people gathered recommended by US government agencies and health organizations was quickly reduced from 250 people (if there is no known transmission of COVID-19 in a region) to 50 people and later to 10 people.

sourceString: On 22 March 2020, Germany banned public gatherings of more than two people.Older adults and those with underlying medical conditions such as diabetes, heart disease, respiratory disease, hypertension, and compromised immune systems face increased risk of serious illness and complications and have been advised by the CDC to stay home as much as possible in areas of community outbreak.In late March 2020, the WHO and other health bodies began to replace the use of the term "social distancing" with "physical distancing", to clarify that the aim is to reduce physical contact while maintaining social connections, either virtually or at a distance.
targetString: Em 22 de março de 2020, a Alemanha proibiu reuniões públicas de mais de duas pessoas. Adultos mais velhos e aqueles com doenças subjacentes como diabetes, doença cardíaca, doença respiratória, hipertensão e sistemas imunológicos comprometidos enfrentam risco maior de enfermidades sérias e complicações, sendo aconselhados pelo CDC a ficar em casa o máximo possível em áreas de epidemia comunitária. Ao final de março de 2020, a OMS e outros órgãos de saúde começaram a substituir o uso do termo "distanciamento social" por "distanciamento físico", para esclarecer que o objetivo é reduzir o contato físico mantendo as conexões sociais, seja virtualmente ou à distância.
en-mt: On March 22, 2020, Germany banned public gatherings of more than two people. Older adults and those with underlying illnesses such as diabetes, heart disease, respiratory disease, hypertension, and compromised immune systems face increased risk of serious illness and complications, and are advised by the CDC to stay home as much as possible in areas of community outbreak. At the end of March 2020, WHO and other health bodies began to replace the use of the term "social distancing" with "physical distancing", to clarify that the goal is to reduce physical contact while maintaining social connections, whether online or online. distance.

sourceString: The use of the term "social distancing" had led to implications that people should engage in complete social isolation, rather than encouraging them to stay in contact with others through alternative means.Some authorities have issued sexual health guidelines for use during the pandemic.
targetString: O uso do termo "distanciamento social" levou a implicações de que era preciso o isolamento social por completo ao invés de encorajar o contato por outros meios alternativos. Algumas autoridades publicaram orientações de saúde sexual durante a pandemia.
en-mt: The use of the term "social distancing" led to the implication that complete social isolation was needed rather than encouraging contact through other alternative means. Some authorities have published sexual health guidelines during the pandemic.

sourceString: These include recommendations to only have sex with someone you live with, who does not have the virus or symptoms of the virus.
targetString: Estas recomendações incluem fazer sexo somente com alguém com quem você viva, que não tenha o vírus ou sintomas do vírus.
en-mt: These recommendations include having sex only with someone you live with who does not have the virus or symptoms of the virus.

sourceString: Self-isolation at home has been recommended for those diagnosed with COVID-19 and those who suspect they have been infected.
targetString: O autoisolamento em casa foi recomendado para os que foram diagnosticados com a COVID-19 e para os que suspeitarem que foram infectados.
en-mt: Self-isolation at home has been recommended for those who have been diagnosed with COVID-19 and those who suspect they have been infected.

sourceString: Health agencies have issued detailed instructions for proper self-isolation.Many governments have mandated or recommended self-quarantine for entire populations living in affected areas.
targetString: As agências de saúde emitiram instruções detalhadas para o autoisolamento adequado. Muitos governos exigiram ou recomendaram a autoquarentena para populações inteiras que vivem em áreas afetadas.
en-mt: Health agencies have issued detailed instructions for proper self-isolation. Many governments have required or recommended self-quarantine for entire populations living in affected areas.

sourceString: The strongest self-quarantine instructions have been issued to those in high risk groups.
targetString: As instruções mais incisivas de autoquarentena foram emitidas para aqueles que se encontram em grupos de alto risco.
en-mt: The strongest self-quarantine instructions have been issued for those in high-risk groups.

sourceString: Those who may have been exposed to someone with COVID-19 and those who have recently travelled to a country or region with widespread transmission have been advised to self-quarantine for 14 days from the time of last possible exposure.
targetString: Aconselhou-se aos indivíduos que podem ter sido expostos a outros com a COVID-19 e aos que tenham viajado recentemente para um país ou região com transmissão em ampla escala que façam 14 dias de autoquarentena desde o momento da última exposição possível.
en-mt: Individuals who may have been exposed to others with COVID-19 and those who have recently traveled to a country or region with widespread transmission are advised to self-quarantine for 14 days from the time of last possible exposure.

sourceString: Strategies in the control of an outbreak are containment or suppression, and mitigation.
targetString: As estratégias para o controle de um surto são a contenção ou supressão e a redução.
en-mt: Strategies for controlling an outbreak are containment or suppression and mitigation.

sourceString: Containment is undertaken in the early stages of the outbreak and aims to trace and isolate those infected as well as introduce other measures of infection control and vaccinations to stop the disease from spreading to the rest of the population.
targetString: A contenção é realizada nos estágios preliminares de um surto e visa rastrear e isolar os infectados, bem como apresentar outras medidas de controle da infecção e vacinas que impeçam a propagação da doença para o resto da população.
en-mt: Containment is carried out in the preliminary stages of an outbreak and aims to track and isolate those infected, as well as introduce other infection control measures and vaccines that prevent the spread of the disease to the rest of the population.

sourceString: When it is no longer possible to contain the spread of the disease, efforts then move to the mitigation stage: measures are taken to slow the spread and mitigate its effects on the healthcare system and society.
targetString: Quando conter a propagação da doença já não for mais possível, passa-se a realizar esforços no sentido da redução: as medidas tomadas, agora, servem para diminuir a velocidade da propagação e para reduzir seus efeitos adversos no sistema de saúde, assim como na população.
en-mt: When containing the spread of the disease is no longer possible, efforts are made to reduce it: the measures taken now serve to slow down the spread of the disease and to reduce its adverse effects on the health system, as well as on the population.

sourceString: A combination of both containment and mitigation measures may be undertaken at the same time.
targetString: Medidas de contenção e de mitigação podem ser tomadas ao mesmo tempo, em combinação.
en-mt: Containment and mitigation measures can be taken at the same time, in combination.

sourceString: Suppression requires more extreme measures so as to reverse the pandemic by reducing the basic reproduction number to less than 1.Part of managing an infectious disease outbreak is trying to decrease the epidemic peak, known as flattening the epidemic curve.
targetString: A supressão demanda medidas mais extremas no sentido de reverter a pandemia a uma taxa de reprodução básica inferior a 1. A gestão de um surto de doença infecciosa, em parte, tem a ver com tentar reduzir o pico da epidemia. A isso, chamamos de "achatamento da curva epidêmica".
en-mt: Suppression demands more extreme measures towards reversing the pandemic to a baseline reproduction rate of less than 1. Managing an infectious disease outbreak is, in part, about trying to reduce the peak of the epidemic. We call this "flattening the epidemic curve".

sourceString: This decreases the risk of health services being overwhelmed and provides more time for vaccines and treatments to be developed.
targetString: Assim, reduz-se o risco de sobrecarga dos serviços de saúde, dando mais tempo para que vacinas e tratamentos possam ser desenvolvidos.
en-mt: Thus, the risk of overloading health services is reduced, giving more time for vaccines and treatments to be developed.

sourceString: Non-pharmaceutical interventions that may manage the outbreak include personal preventive measures, such as hand hygiene, wearing face-masks, and self-quarantine; community measures aimed at physical distancing such as closing schools and cancelling mass gathering events; community engagement to encourage acceptance and participation in such interventions; as well as environmental measures such surface cleaning.More drastic actions aimed at containing the outbreak were taken in China once the severity of the outbreak became apparent, such as quarantining entire cities and imposing strict travel bans.
targetString: Intervenções que não sejam de cunho farmacêutico e que possam administrar o surto incluem medidas preventivas pessoais, como a higienização das mãos, o uso de máscaras para o rosto e a autoquarentena; medidas comunitárias que visam o distanciamento físico, como o fechamento de escolas e o cancelamento de eventos que levem a aglomerações; envolvimento comunitário, de modo a estimular a aceitação e a participação nessas intervenções; e medidas ambientais como a limpeza das superfícies de contato. Ações mais drásticas, no sentido de conter o surto, foram tomadas na China quando a gravidade do surto ficou clara. Cidades inteiras, por exemplo, ficaram em quarentena e proibições às viagens foram impostas.
en-mt: Non-pharmaceutical interventions that can manage the outbreak include personal preventive measures such as hand hygiene, use of face masks and self-quarantine; community measures aimed at physical distancing, such as closing schools and canceling events that lead to crowds; community involvement, in order to encourage acceptance and participation in these interventions; and environmental measures such as cleaning contact surfaces. More drastic action to contain the outbreak was taken in China when the severity of the outbreak became clear. Entire cities, for example, were quarantined and travel bans were imposed.

sourceString: Other countries also adopted a variety of measures aimed at limiting the spread of the virus.
targetString: Outros países tomaram medidas diversas para fazer com que a propagação do vírus fosse limitada.
en-mt: Other countries have taken different measures to limit the spread of the virus.

sourceString: South Korea introduced mass screening and localized quarantines, and issued alerts on the movements of infected individuals.
targetString: A Coreia do Sul, por exemplo, apresentou a triagem em massa e as quarentenas localizadas. Além disso, o governo emitiu alertas sobre a movimentação de pessoas infectadas.
en-mt: South Korea, for example, introduced mass screening and localized quarantines. In addition, the government has issued warnings about the movement of infected people.

sourceString: Singapore provided financial support for those infected who quarantined themselves and imposed large fines for those who failed to do so.
targetString: Em Singapura, os infectados receberam apoio financeiro quando realizavam a autoquarentena e, para aqueles não faziam isso, foram impostas multas severas.
en-mt: In Singapore, those infected received financial support when they self-quarantine, and for those who did not, severe fines were imposed.

sourceString: Taiwan increased face mask production and penalized hoarding of medical supplies.Simulations for Great Britain and the United States show that mitigation (slowing but not stopping epidemic spread) and suppression (reversing epidemic growth) have major challenges.
targetString: Em Taiwan, ocorreu o aumento da produção de máscaras para o rosto e aqueles que estocavam suprimentos médicos foram punidos. Simulações realizadas no Reino Unido e nos Estados Unidos mostram que a redução (a diminuição da velocidade de contágio, sem parar com a propagação da epidemia) e a supressão (ou seja, a reversão do crescimento da epidemia) apresentam grandes desafios.
en-mt: In Taiwan, there was a surge in the production of face masks and those who stocked up on medical supplies were punished. Simulations carried out in the United Kingdom and the United States show that mitigation (decreasing the speed of contagion without stopping the spread of the epidemic) and suppression (i.e. reversing the growth of the epidemic) present major challenges.

sourceString: Optimal mitigation policies might reduce peak healthcare demand by 2/3 and deaths by half, but still result in hundreds of thousands of deaths and health systems being overwhelmed.
targetString: Políticas ideais de redução podem diminuir o pico da demanda pelos serviços de saúde em 2/3 e os óbitos pela metade. Ainda assim, isso resultaria em centenas de milhares de óbitos, sobrecarregando, ao mesmo tempo, os sistemas de saúde.
en-mt: Ideal reduction policies can reduce peak demand for health services by 2/3 and deaths by half. Still, this would result in hundreds of thousands of deaths, at the same time overwhelming health systems.

sourceString: Suppression can be preferred but needs to be maintained for as long as the virus is circulating in the human population (or until a vaccine becomes available, if that comes first), as transmission otherwise quickly rebounds when measures are relaxed.
targetString: A supressão pode ser a melhor alternativa, mas precisa ser mantida enquanto houver a circulação do vírus pela população humana ou até haver a disponibilidade de uma vacina, caso isso ocorra antes. Do contrário, a transmissão volta a ocorrer tão logo ocorre o relaxamento das medidas.
en-mt: Suppression may be the best alternative, but it needs to be maintained as long as the virus circulates in the human population or until a vaccine becomes available, if that happens sooner. Otherwise, the transmission occurs again as soon as the measures are relaxed.

sourceString: Long-term intervention to suppress the pandemic causes social and economic costs.
targetString: Uma intervenção em longo prazo no sentido de suprimir a pandemia traz consigo custos sociais e econômicos.
en-mt: A long-term intervention to suppress the pandemic brings with it social and economic costs.

sourceString: There are no specific antiviral medications approved for COVID-19, but development efforts are underway, including testing of existing medications.
targetString: Não há medicamento antiviral aprovado que seja específico para a COVID-19. Existem, no entanto, esforços no sentido do desenvolvimento de medicamentos, que incluem o teste de medicamentos existentes.
en-mt: There is no approved antiviral drug that is specific for COVID-19. There are, however, efforts towards drug development, which include testing existing drugs.

sourceString: Taking over-the-counter cold medications, drinking fluids, and resting may help alleviate symptoms.
targetString: O uso de medicamentos para resfriado que não necessitam de prescrição médica, beber bastante líquido e descansar podem ajudar no alívio dos sintomas.
en-mt: Using over-the-counter cold medicines, drinking plenty of fluids, and resting can help relieve symptoms.

sourceString: Depending on the severity, oxygen therapy, intravenous fluids, and breathing support may be required.
targetString: Dependendo da gravidade do caso, pode ser necessário o uso de terapia com oxigênio, inserção intravenosa de líquidos ou auxílio respiratório.
en-mt: Depending on the severity of the case, the use of oxygen therapy, intravenous fluids, or breathing assistance may be necessary.

sourceString: The use of steroids may worsen outcomes.
targetString: O uso de esteroides pode piorar a condição.
en-mt: Steroid use can make the condition worse.

sourceString: Several compounds that were previously approved for treatment of other viral diseases are being investigated for use in treating COVID-19.
targetString: Diversos compostos anteriormente aprovados para tratar outras doenças virais estão sob investigação para serem usados no tratamento da COVID-19.
en-mt: Several compounds previously approved to treat other viral illnesses are under investigation for use in the treatment of COVID-19.

sourceString: The WHO also stated that some "traditional and home remedies" can provide relief of the symptoms caused by SARS-CoV-19.
targetString: A Organização Mundial da Saúde também declarou que alguns medicamentos "caseiros e tradicionais" podem aliviar os sintomas causados pelo vírus SARS-CoV-19.
en-mt: The World Health Organization has also stated that some "homemade and traditional" medicines can alleviate the symptoms caused by the SARS-CoV-19 virus.

sourceString: Increasing capacity and adapting healthcare for the needs of COVID-19 patients is described by the WHO as a fundamental outbreak response measure.
targetString: A OMS descreve o aumento da capacidade e a adaptação dos cuidados com a saúde às necessidades trazidas pela COVID-19 como medidas fundamentais de combate ao surto.
en-mt: WHO describes building capacity and adapting healthcare to the needs brought about by COVID-19 as key measures to combat the outbreak.

sourceString: The ECDC and the European regional office of the WHO have issued guidelines for hospitals and primary healthcare services for shifting of resources at multiple levels, including focusing laboratory services towards COVID-19 testing, cancelling elective procedures whenever possible, separating and isolating COVID-19 positive patients, and increasing intensive care capabilities by training personnel and increasing the number of available ventilators and beds.
targetString: O Centro Europeu de Prevenção e Controle de Doenças, ECDC, e o escritório da OMS na Europa emitiram orientações para hospitais e serviços primários de assistência à saúde para que desloquem, em vários níveis, seus recursos, incluindo a concentração dos serviços laboratoriais para a testagem da COVID-19, o cancelamento de procedimentos não obrigatórios e a separação e o isolamento de pacientes com teste positivo para a COVID-19, além do aumento das capacidades de cuidados intensivos por meio do treinamento de pessoal e do aumento no número de leitos e ventiladores disponíveis.
en-mt: The European Center for Disease Prevention and Control, ECDC, and the WHO office in Europe have issued guidance for hospitals and primary health care services to shift their resources at various levels, including focusing laboratory services towards testing. of COVID-19, the cancellation of non-mandatory procedures and the separation and isolation of patients who test positive for COVID-19, in addition to increasing critical care capacities through staff training and an increase in the number of beds and fans available.

sourceString: There are various theories about where the very first case (the so-called patient zero) may have originated.
targetString: São diversas as teorias sobre o surgimento do primeiro caso (o chamado paciente zero).
en-mt: There are several theories about the emergence of the first case (the so-called patient zero).

sourceString: The first known case of the novel coronavirus may trace back to 1 December 2019 in Wuhan, Hubei, China.
targetString: O primeiro caso conhecido no novo coronavírus data de 1º de dezembro de 2019, na cidade de Wuhan, na província de Hubei, na China.
en-mt: The first known case of the new coronavirus dates back to December 1, 2019, in the city of Wuhan, in the province of Hubei, China.

sourceString: Within a month, the number of coronavirus cases in Hubei gradually increased.
targetString: Em um mês, o número de casos de coronavírus na região aumentou gradualmente.
en-mt: Within a month, the number of coronavirus cases in the region has gradually increased.

sourceString: These were mostly linked to the Huanan Seafood Wholesale Market, which also sold live animals, and one theory is that the virus came from one of these kinds of animals; or, in other words, has a zoonotic origin.A pneumonia cluster of unknown cause was observed on 26 December and treated by the doctor Zhang Jixian in Hubei Provincial Hospital, who informed the Wuhan Jianghan CDC on 27 December.
targetString: Esses casos foram, em grande parte, vinculados ao mercado atacadista de frutos do mar de Huanan. O mercado também vendia animais vivos, o que levou a teoria de que o vírus viesse de um desses animais. Em outras palavras, acreditou-se que ele tivesse uma origem zoonótica. No dia 26 de dezembro, um grupo de pacientes foi observado e tratado pela doutora Zhang Jixian, no Hospital Provincial de Hubei. No dia seguinte, o médico informou o Centro de Prevenção e Controle de Doenças de Wuhan Jianghan.
en-mt: These cases were largely linked to the Huanan seafood wholesale market. The market also sold live animals, which led to the theory that the virus came from one of these animals. In other words, it was believed to have a zoonotic origin. On December 26, a group of patients were seen and treated by Dr. Zhang Jixian at Hubei Provincial Hospital. The next day, the doctor informed the Wuhan Jianghan Center for Disease Control and Prevention.

sourceString: On 30 December, a group of doctors at Wuhan Central Hospital alerted their colleagues of a "SARS-like coronavirus".
targetString: No dia 30 de dezembro, um grupo de médicos do Hospital Central de Wuhan alertou seus colegas sobre um "coronavírus do tipo SARS".
en-mt: On December 30, a group of doctors at the Wuhan Central Hospital warned their colleagues about a "SARS-like coronavirus".

sourceString: Eight of these doctors, including Li Wenliang, were admonished by the police for spreading false rumours, and another, Ai Fen, was reprimanded by her superiors for raising the alarm.
targetString: Oito desses médicos, incluindo Li Wenliang, foram repreendidos pela polícia por espalhar notícias falsas. Um outro médico, Ai Fen, foi repreendido por seus superiores por ter dado o alarme.
en-mt: Eight of those doctors, including Li Wenliang, were reprimanded by the police for spreading false news. Another doctor, Ai Fen, was scolded by his superiors for raising the alarm.

sourceString: The Wuhan Municipal Health Commission later released a public notice on 31 December and informed the WHO.
targetString: A Comissão Municipal de Saúde de Wuhan, no dia 31 de dezembro, fez um comunicado à população e informou a OMS.
en-mt: The Wuhan Municipal Health Commission, on December 31, issued a statement to the population and informed the WHO.

sourceString: Enough cases of unknown pneumonia had been reported to health authorities in Wuhan to trigger an investigation in early January.During the early stages of the outbreak, the number of cases doubled approximately every seven and a half days.
targetString: Casos de pneumonia de origem desconhecida suficientes já haviam sido relatados às autoridades de saúde de Wuhan para gerar uma investigação no início de janeiro. Durante os primeiros estágios do surto, o número de casos duplicava a cada sete dias e meio, aproximadamente.
en-mt: Enough cases of pneumonia of unknown origin had already been reported to Wuhan health authorities to prompt an investigation in early January. During the early stages of the outbreak, the number of cases doubled approximately every seven and a half days.

sourceString: In early and mid-January 2020, the virus spread to other Chinese provinces, helped by the Chinese New Year migration and Wuhan being a transport hub and major rail interchange.
targetString: No começo e no meio de janeiro de 2020, o vírus se espalhou por outras províncias da China, facilitado pela migração do ano novo chinês e pelo fato de Wuhan ser um centro de transportes, além de um ponto principal de conexão ferroviária.
en-mt: In early to mid-January 2020, the virus spread to other provinces in China, facilitated by the Chinese New Year migration and the fact that Wuhan is a transport hub as well as a major rail connection point.

sourceString: On 20 January, China reported nearly 140 new cases in one day, including two people in Beijing and one in Shenzhen.
targetString: No dia 20 de janeiro, a China relatava cerca de 140 novos casos em um dia, incluindo duas pessoas em Pequim e uma em Shenzen.
en-mt: On January 20, China was reporting around 140 new cases in one day, including two people in Beijing and one in Shenzhen.

sourceString: Later official data shows that 6,174 people had already developed symptoms by 20 January 2020.As of 26 March, the United States has overtaken China and Italy with the highest number of confirmed cases in the world.As of 9 April 2020, more than 1.61 million cases have been reported worldwide; more than 97,000 people have died and more than 364,000 have recovered.
targetString: Dados oficiais posteriores mostram que 6.174 pessoas já haviam desenvolvido os sintomas até 20 de janeiro de 2020. Em 26 de março, os Estados Unidos ultrapassaram a China e a Itália, com o maior número de casos confirmados no mundo. Em 9 de abril de 2020, mais de 1,61 milhão de casos foram relatados no mundo todo; mais de 97.000 pessoas morreram, e mais de 364.000 se recuperaram.
en-mt: Later official data show that 6,174 people had already developed the symptoms by January 20, 2020. On March 26, the United States overtook China and Italy with the highest number of confirmed cases in the world. As of April 9, 2020, over 1.61 million cases have been reported worldwide; over 97,000 people died, and over 364,000 have recovered.

sourceString: Around 200 countries and territories have had at least one case.
targetString: Aproximadamente 200 países e territórios já tiveram, ao menos, um caso.
en-mt: Approximately 200 countries and territories have had at least one case.

sourceString: Due to the pandemic in Europe, many countries in the Schengen Area have restricted free movement and set up border controls.
targetString: Em função da pandemia na Europa, muitos países que fazem parte do Tratado de Schengen restringiram a livre circulação e estabeleceram controles de fronteira.
en-mt: Due to the pandemic in Europe, many countries that are part of the Schengen Treaty have restricted free movement and established border controls.

sourceString: National reactions have included containment measures such as quarantines (known as stay-at-home orders, shelter-in-place orders, or lockdown) and curfews.As of 2 April, nearly 300 million people, or about 90% of the population, are under some form of lockdown in the United States, more than 50 million people are in lockdown in the Philippines, about 59 million people are in lockdown in South Africa, and 1.3 billion people are in lockdown in India.
targetString: As reações dos países incluíram medidas de contenção, como quarentenas (também conhecidas como ordens de confinamento domiciliar, ordens de contenção domiciliar ou lockdown) e toques de recolher. Em 2 de abril, cerca de 300 milhões de pessoas (quase 90% da população) se encontram confinadas de algum modo nos Estados Unidos, mais de 50 milhões de pessoas estão confinadas nas Filipinas, em torno de 59 milhões de pessoas estão confinadas na África do Sul e 1,3 bilhão de pessoas estão confinadas na Índia.
en-mt: Country reactions have included containment measures such as quarantines (also known as home confinement orders, home containment orders or lockdown) and curfews. As of April 2, nearly 300 million people (nearly 90% of the population) are confined in some way in the United States, over 50 million people are confined in the Philippines, around 59 million people are confined in Africa of the South and 1.3 billion people are confined to India.

sourceString: On 26 March, 1.7 billion people worldwide were under some form of lockdown, which increased to 2.6 billion people two days later—around a third of the world's population.
targetString: Em 26 de março, 1,7 bilhão de pessoas em todo o mundo já se encontravam sob alguma forma de lockdown, que aumentaram para 2,6 bilhões de pessoas dois dias depois, cerca de um terço da população mundial.
en-mt: On March 26, 1.7 billion people worldwide were already under some form of lockdown, which increased to 2.6 billion people two days later, about a third of the world's population.

sourceString: The first confirmed case of COVID-19 has been traced back to 1 December 2019 in Wuhan; one unconfirmed report suggests the earliest case was on 17 November.
targetString: O primeiro caso confirmado de COVID-19 foi registrado em Wuhan, em 1º de dezembro de 2019. Um relato não confirmado sugere um caso anterior, de 17 de novembro.
en-mt: The first confirmed case of COVID-19 was reported in Wuhan on 1 December 2019. An unconfirmed report suggests a previous case on 17 November.

sourceString: Doctor Zhang Jixian observed a cluster of pneumonia cases of unknown cause on 26 December, upon which her hospital informed Wuhan Jianghan CDC on 27 December.
targetString: A doutora Zhang Jixian observou um grupo de pacientes com pneumonia de causas desconhecidas no dia 26 de dezembro. Seu hospital informou o Centro de Prevenção e Controle de Doenças de Wuhan Jianghan em 27 de dezembro.
en-mt: Dr Zhang Jixian observed a group of patients with pneumonia of unknown causes on December 26th. His hospital informed the Wuhan Jianghan Center for Disease Control and Prevention on Dec.

sourceString: Initial genetic testing of patient samples on 27 December 2019 indicated the presence of a SARS-like coronavirus.
targetString: Testes genéticos iniciais, em 27 de dezembro de 2019, em amostras retiradas dos pacientes indicaram a presença de um coronavírus do tipo SARS.
en-mt: Initial genetic testing, on December 27, 2019, on samples taken from patients indicated the presence of a SARS-like coronavirus.

sourceString: A public notice was released by Wuhan Municipal Health Commission on 31 December.
targetString: Um comunicado à população foi emitido pela Comissão Municipal de Saúde de Wuhan em 31 de dezembro.
en-mt: A public notice was issued by the Wuhan Municipal Health Commission on December 31.

sourceString: The WHO was informed on the same day.
targetString: A OMS foi informada no mesmo dia.
en-mt: The WHO was informed on the same day.

sourceString: As these notifications occurred, doctors in Wuhan were warned by police for "spreading rumours" about the outbreak.
targetString: Quando ocorreram essas notificações, os médicos de Wuhan foram advertidos pela polícia por "espalhar rumores" sobre o surto.
en-mt: When these notifications occurred, doctors in Wuhan were admonished by police for "spreading rumours" about the outbreak.

sourceString: The Chinese National Health Commission initially claimed that there was no "clear evidence" of human-to-human transmission.
targetString: A Comissão Nacional de Saúde da China, inicialmente, alegou não haver uma "evidência clara" de transmissão entre seres humanos.
en-mt: China's National Health Commission initially claimed there was "clear evidence" of human-to-human transmission.

sourceString: In late January, the Chinese government launched a radical campaign later described by the Chinese Communist Party general secretary Xi Jinping as a "people's war" to contain the spread of the virus.
targetString: No fim de janeiro, o governo chinês lançou uma campanha radical, mais tarde descrita pelo secretário geral do Partido Comunista Chinês, Xi Jinping, como uma "guerra do povo", para conter a propagação do vírus.
en-mt: In late January, the Chinese government launched a radical campaign, later described by Chinese Communist Party general secretary Xi Jinping, as a "people's war" to contain the spread of the virus.

sourceString: In what has been described as "the largest quarantine in human history", a cordon sanitaire was announced on 23 January stopping travel in and out of Wuhan, which was extended to a total of 15 cities in Hubei, affecting a total of about 57 million people.
targetString: Naquilo que foi descrito como "a maior quarentena da história da humanidade", um cordão sanitário foi anunciado em 23 de janeiro para interromper viagens de ida ou de volta para Wuhan, que foi estendido por 15 cidades de Hubei, atingindo cerca de 57 milhões de pessoas no total.
en-mt: In what has been described as "the biggest quarantine in human history", a cordon sanitaire was announced on January 23 to stop travel to and from Wuhan, which has been extended across 15 cities in Hubei, reaching around 57 million people. people in total.

sourceString: Private vehicle use was banned in the city.
targetString: O uso de veículos privados foi proibido na cidade.
en-mt: The use of private vehicles was prohibited in the city.

sourceString: Chinese New Year (25 January) celebrations were cancelled in many places.
targetString: As comemorações do ano novo chinês, em 25 de janeiro, foram canceladas em diversas localidades.
en-mt: Chinese New Year celebrations on January 25 have been canceled in several locations.

sourceString: The authorities also announced the construction of a temporary hospital, Huoshenshan Hospital, which was completed in 10 days.
targetString: As autoridades também anunciaram a construção de um hospital temporário, o Hospital Huoshenshan, que foi concluído em 10 dias.
en-mt: The authorities also announced the construction of a temporary hospital, Huoshenshan Hospital, which was completed in 10 days.

sourceString: Another hospital was built afterwards, Leishenshan Hospital, to handle additional patients.
targetString: Um outro hospital, o Leishenshan, foi construído posteriormente para atender mais pacientes.
en-mt: Another hospital, Leishenshan, was built later to serve more patients.

sourceString: In addition to newly constructed hospitals, China also converted 14 other facilities in Wuhan, such as convention centers and stadiums, into temporary hospitals.On 26 January, the government instituted further measures to contain the COVID-19 outbreak, including issuing health declarations for travellers and extending the Spring Festival holiday.
targetString: Juntamente aos hospitais recém-construídos, a China converteu outros 14 estabelecimentos de Wuhan em hospitais temporários, como centros de convenções e estádios. Em 26 de janeiro, o governo lançou mais medidas para conter o surto de COVID-19, incluindo a emissão de declarações de saúde para viajantes e a ampliação do feriado do Festival da Primavera.
en-mt: Alongside the newly built hospitals, China has converted 14 other Wuhan facilities into temporary hospitals such as convention centers and stadiums. On January 26, the government launched further measures to contain the COVID-19 outbreak, including issuing health declarations to travelers and extending the Spring Festival holiday.

sourceString: Universities and schools around the country were also closed.
targetString: Universidades e escolas do país inteiro também foram fechadas.
en-mt: Universities and schools across the country were also closed.

sourceString: The regions of Hong Kong and Macau instituted several measures, particularly in regard to schools and universities.
targetString: As regiões de Hong Kong e de Macau tomaram diversas medidas, em especial, com relação às escolas e universidades.
en-mt: The Hong Kong and Macao regions have taken various measures, in particular with regard to schools and universities.

sourceString: Remote working measures were instituted in several Chinese regions.
targetString: Medidas para trabalho remoto foram tomadas em muitas regiões do país.
en-mt: Measures for remote work have been taken in many regions of the country.

sourceString: Travel restrictions were enacted in and outside of Hubei.
targetString: Restrições para viagens foram realizadas em Hubei e fora dela.
en-mt: Travel restrictions have been enforced in Hubei and beyond.

sourceString: Public transport was modified, and museums throughout China were temporarily closed.
targetString: O transporte público foi modificado, e museus em toda a China foram fechados temporariamente.
en-mt: Public transport was modified, and museums across China were temporarily closed.

sourceString: Control of public movement was applied in many cities, and it has been estimated that about 760 million people (more than half the population) faced some form of outdoor restriction.After the outbreak entered its global phase in March, Chinese authorities took strict measures to prevent the virus from "importing" from other countries.
targetString: O controle da movimentação do público foi aplicado em diversas cidades, e foi estimado que cerca de 760 milhões de pessoas (mais da metade da população) passaram por algum tipo de restrição de saídas. Após o surto entrar em sua fase global, em março, as autoridades chinesas tomaram medidas rígidas para evitar a "importação" do vírus de outros países.
en-mt: Public movement control was applied in several cities, and it was estimated that around 760 million people (more than half of the population) went through some type of exit restriction. After the outbreak entered its global phase in March, Chinese authorities took strict measures to prevent the "importation" of the virus from other countries.

sourceString: For example, Beijing has imposed a 14-day mandatory quarantine for all international travellers entering the city.On 23 March, mainland China only one case had transmitted domestically in the five days prior, in this instance via a traveller returning to Guangzhou from Istanbul.
targetString: Pequim, por exemplo, impôs uma quarentena obrigatória de 14 dias para todos os viajantes internacionais que chegassem à cidade. Em 23 de março, a China continental tinha apenas um caso de transmissão doméstica em cinco dias, nesse caso, por meio de um viajante que retornou a Guangzhou vindo de Istanbul.
en-mt: Beijing, for example, imposed a mandatory 14-day quarantine on all international travelers arriving in the city. As of March 23, mainland China had only one case of domestic transmission in five days, in this case via a traveler returning to Guangzhou from Istanbul.

sourceString: On 24 March 2020, Chinese Premier Li Keqiang reported that the spread of domestically transmitted cases has been basically blocked and the outbreak has been controlled in China.
targetString: Em 24 de março de 2020, o premiê chinês, Li Keqiang, relatou que a propagação dos casos de transmissão doméstica havia sido basicamente bloqueada e que o surto havia sido controlado na China.
en-mt: On March 24, 2020, Chinese Premier Li Keqiang reported that the spread of domestic transmission cases had been basically blocked and the outbreak had been brought under control in China.

sourceString: The same day travel restrictions were eased in Hubei, apart from Wuhan, two months after the lockdown was imposed.The Chinese Ministry of Foreign Affairs announced on 26 March 2020 that entry for visa or residence permit holders would be suspended from 28 March onwards, with no specific details on when this policy will end.
targetString: No mesmo dia, as restrições de viagens foram reduzidas em Hubei, exceto em Wuhan, dois meses após o lockdown ter sido imposto. O Ministro de Relações Exteriores da China anunciou, em 26 de março de 2020, que a entrada de indivíduos com visto ou permissão de residência seria suspensa a partir de 28 de março, sem detalhes específicos sobre quando essa política será encerrada.
