en-mt: On the same day, travel restrictions were eased in Hubei, except for Wuhan, two months after the lockdown was imposed. China's Ministry of Foreign Affairs announced on March 26, 2020 that the entry of individuals with a visa or residence permit would be suspended from March 28, with no specific details on when this policy will end.

sourceString: Those who wish to enter China will have to apply for visas in Chinese embassies or consulates.
targetString: Quem desejar entrar na China precisará fazer o pedido dos vistos em embaixadas ou consulados chineses.
en-mt: Anyone wishing to enter China will need to apply for visas at Chinese embassies or consulates.

sourceString: The Chinese government encouraged businesses and factories to re-open on 30 March, and provided monetary stimulus packages for firms.The State Council declared a day of mourning to begin with a national three-minute moment of silence on 10:00 4 April, coinciding with Qingming Festival, although the central government asked families to pay their respects online in observance of physical distancing as to avoid a renewed COVID-19 outbreak.
targetString: O governo chinês incentivou empresas e fábricas a reabrirem no dia 30 de março, dando pacotes de estímulos financeiros às empresas. O Conselho de Estado declarou um dia de luto, começando com um momento de três minutos de silêncio no país inteiro, no dia 4 de abril às 10 horas, coincidindo com o Festival Qingming. O governo central, contudo, pediu às famílias que prestassem suas homenagens on-line, observando o distanciamento físico para evitar um novo surto de COVID-19.
en-mt: The Chinese government has encouraged businesses and factories to reopen on March 30 by giving companies financial stimulus packages. The State Council declared a day of mourning, starting with a nationwide three-minute moment of silence, on April 4 at 10 am, coinciding with the Qingming Festival. The central government, however, asked families to pay their respects online, observing physical distancing to prevent a new outbreak of COVID-19.

sourceString: COVID-19 was confirmed to have spread to South Korea on 20 January 2020 from China.
targetString: Em 20 de janeiro de 2020, foi confirmada a propagação da COVID-19 da China para a Coreia do Sul.
en-mt: On January 20, 2020, the spread of COVID-19 from China to South Korea was confirmed.

sourceString: The nation's health agency reported a significant increase in confirmed cases on 20 February, largely attributed to a gathering in Daegu of a new religious movement known as the Shincheonji Church of Jesus.
targetString: A agência nacional de saúde do país informou um aumento significativo nos casos confirmados no dia 20 de fevereiro, em grande parte atribuído a um encontro em Daegu de um novo movimento religioso, conhecido como a Igreja de Jesus de Shincheonji.
en-mt: The country's national health agency reported a significant increase in confirmed cases on Feb. 20, largely attributed to a meeting in Daegu of a new religious movement known as the Shincheonji Church of Jesus.

sourceString: Shincheonji devotees visiting Daegu from Wuhan were suspected to be the origin of the outbreak.
targetString: Suspeita-se que os devotos de Shincheonji que visitaram Daegu vindos de Wuhan foram a origem do surto.
en-mt: It is suspected that Shincheonji devotees who visited Daegu from Wuhan were the source of the outbreak.

sourceString: As of 22 February, among 9,336 followers of the church, 1,261 or about 13% reported symptoms.South Korea declared the highest level of alert on 23 February 2020.
targetString: Em 22 de fevereiro, entre os 9.336 seguidores da igreja, 1.261, ou cerca de 13% deles, relataram ter sintomas. A Coreia do Sul declarou nível de alerta máximo no dia 23 de fevereiro de 2020.
en-mt: As of Feb. 22, among the church's 9,336 followers, 1,261, or about 13% of them, reported having symptoms. South Korea declared a high alert level on February 23, 2020.

sourceString: On 28 February, more than 2,000 confirmed cases were reported in Korea, rising to 3,150 on 29 February.
targetString: Em 28 de fevereiro, foram relatados mais de 2 mil casos confirmados, chegando a 3.150 em 29 de fevereiro.
en-mt: As of February 28, more than 2,000 confirmed cases have been reported, rising to 3,150 on February 29.

sourceString: All South Korean military bases were quarantined after tests confirmed that three soldiers were positive for the virus.
targetString: Todas as bases militares da Coreia do Sul foram colocadas em quarentena após testes confirmarem que três soldados eram positivos para o vírus.
en-mt: All military bases in South Korea have been quarantined after tests confirmed that three soldiers tested positive for the virus.

sourceString: Airline schedules were also affected and therefore they were changed.South Korea introduced what was considered the largest and best-organized programme in the world to screen the population for the virus, and isolate any infected people as well as tracing and quarantining those who contacted them.
targetString: O cronograma das linhas aéreas também foi afetado e modificado. A Coreia do Sul apresentou o que foi considerado o maior e mais bem organizado programa do mundo em termos de triagem da população para o vírus. O país também isolou as pessoas infectadas e rastreou e colocou em quarentena aqueles que entrarem em contato com eles.
en-mt: The schedule of airlines was also affected and modified. South Korea introduced what was considered the largest and best organized program in the world in terms of screening the population for the virus. The country also isolated infected people and tracked and quarantined those who came into contact with them.

sourceString: Screening methods included mandatory self-reporting of symptoms by new international arrivals through mobile application, drive-thru testing for the virus with the results available the next day, and increasing testing capability to allow up to 20,000 people to be tested every day.
targetString: Os métodos de triagem incluíram o relato individual obrigatório de sintomas para aqueles que chegavam de viagens internacionais por meio de um aplicativo móvel, teste do vírus por drive-thru, com resultados à disposição no dia seguinte, além do aumento na capacidade de testes, o que permitiu que até 20 mil pessoas por dia fossem testadas.
en-mt: Screening methods included mandatory individual reporting of symptoms for those arriving from international travel via a mobile app, drive-thru virus testing with results available the next day, and increased testing capacity, the that allowed up to 20,000 people a day to be tested.

sourceString: South Korea's programme is considered to be a success in controlling the outbreak despite not quarantining entire cities.The South Korean society was initially polarized on President Moon Jae-in's response to the crisis.
targetString: O programa da Coreia do Sul é considerado um sucesso no controle do surto, embora não tenha colocado cidades inteiras em quarentena. A sociedade sul-coreana estava dividida inicialmente quanto à resposta à crise dada pelo presidente Moon Jae-in.
en-mt: South Korea's program is considered a success in controlling the outbreak, although it has not quarantined entire cities. South Korean society was initially divided over President Moon Jae-in's response to the crisis.

sourceString: Many Koreans signed petitions either calling for the impeachment of Moon over what they claimed to be government mishandling of the outbreak, or praising his response.
targetString: Muitos coreanos assinaram petições solicitando o impeachment de Moon sob a alegação de má gestão governamental do surto, ou enaltecendo sua resposta.
en-mt: Many Koreans have signed petitions calling for Moon's impeachment alleging government mishandling of the outbreak, or praising his response.

sourceString: On 23 March, it was reported that South Korea had the lowest one-day case total in four weeks.
targetString: Em 23 de março, foi relatado que a Coreia do Sul teve o número total de casos mais baixo em quatro semanas.
en-mt: On March 23, it was reported that South Korea had the lowest total number of cases in four weeks.

sourceString: On 29 March it was reported that beginning 1 April all new overseas arrivals will be quarantined for two weeks.
targetString: Em 29 de março foi comunicado que a partir de 1 de abril todas as novas chegadas advindas do exterior deveriam entrar em quarentena por duas semanas.
en-mt: On 29 March it was communicated that from 1 April all new arrivals from abroad would have to quarantine for two weeks.

sourceString: Per media reports on 1 April, South Korea has received requests for virus testing assistance from 121 different countries.
targetString: Através de relatos da mídia em 1 de abril, a Coreia do Sul recebeu pedidos para ajuda com a testagem do vírus de 121 países diferentes.
en-mt: Through media reports on April 1, South Korea has received requests for help with testing for the virus from 121 different countries.

sourceString: Iran reported its first confirmed cases of SARS-CoV-2 infections on 19 February in Qom, where, according to the Ministry of Health and Medical Education, two people died later that day.
targetString: O Irã confirmou seus primeiros casos de infecção por SARS-CoV-2 em 19 de fevereiro em Qom, onde, de acordo com o Ministério da Saúde e Educação Médica, duas pessoas morreram naquele dia.
en-mt: Iran confirmed its first cases of SARS-CoV-2 infection on February 19 in Qom, where, according to the Ministry of Health and Medical Education, two people died that day.

sourceString: Early measures announced by the government included the cancellation of concerts and other cultural events, sporting events, and Friday prayers, and closures of universities, higher education institutions, and schools.
targetString: Medidas precoces anunciadas pelo governo incluíram o cancelamento de concertos e outros eventos culturais, eventos esportivos, e eventos religiosos às sextas-feiras, o fechamento de universidades, instituições de ensino superior, e escolas.
en-mt: Early measures announced by the government included canceling concerts and other cultural events, sporting events, and religious events on Fridays, closing universities, higher education institutions, and schools.

sourceString: Iran allocated five trillion rials to combat the virus.
targetString: O Irã dispôs de cinco trilhões de Riais para o combate ao vírus.
en-mt: Iran has five trillion Riyals available to fight the virus.

sourceString: President Hassan Rouhani said on 26 February 2020 that there were no plans to quarantine areas affected by the outbreak, and only individuals would be quarantined.
targetString: O Presidente Hassan Rouhani disse em 26 de fevereiro de 2020 que não tinha planos para as áreas em quarentena afetadas pelo surto, e apenas indivíduos seriam colocados em quarentena.
en-mt: President Hassan Rouhani said on 26 February 2020 that he had no plans for quarantined areas affected by the outbreak, and only individuals would be quarantined.

sourceString: Plans to limit travel between cities were announced in March, although heavy traffic between cities ahead of the Persian New Year Nowruz continued.
targetString: Planos para limitar viagens entre as cidades foram anunciados em março, embora um tráfico pesado entre as cidades antes do Ano Novo Persa Nowruz continuasse.
en-mt: Plans to limit travel between the cities were announced in March, although heavy traffic between the cities ahead of the Persian New Year Nowruz continued.

sourceString: Shia shrines in Qom remained open to pilgrims until 16 March 2020.Iran became a centre of the spread of the virus after China during February.
targetString: Santuários xiitas em Qom permaneceram abertos aos peregrinos até 16 de março de 2020. O Irã tornou-se o centro da propagação do vírus depois da China durante fevereiro.
en-mt: Shia shrines in Qom remained open to pilgrims until March 16, 2020. Iran became the center of the spread of the virus after China during February.

sourceString: Amidst claims of a cover-up of the extent of the outbreak in Iran, more than ten countries had traced their cases back to Iran by 28 February, indicating that the extent of the outbreak may be more severe than the 388 cases reported by the Iranian government by that date.
targetString: Em meio a alegações de encobrimento da extensão do surto no Irã, mais de dez países rastrearam seus casos relacionados ao Irã em 28 de fevereiro indicando que a extensão do surto poderia ser mais grave do que os 388 casos relatados pelo governo Iraniano até aquela data.
en-mt: Amidst allegations of cover-ups of the extent of the outbreak in Iran, more than ten countries have tracked their Iran-related cases on February 28, indicating that the extent of the outbreak could be more severe than the 388 cases reported by the Iranian government to that date.

sourceString: The Iranian Parliament was shut down, with 23 of its 290 members reported to have had tested positive for the virus on 3 March.
targetString: O Parlamento Iraniano foi fechado, com 23 de seus 290 membros com teste positivo para o vírus em 3 de março.
en-mt: The Iranian Parliament was closed, with 23 of its 290 members testing positive for the virus on March 3.

sourceString: On 12 March, the Human Rights Watch urged the Iranian prison authorities to unconditionally release the human rights defenders detained for peaceful dissent, and to also temporarily release all the eligible prisoners.
targetString: Em 12 de março, a Human Rights Watch solicitou veementemente às autoridades prisionais iranianas que libertassem de forma incondicional os defensores dos direitos humanos presos por dissidência pacífica, e também que libertassem temporariamente todos os prisioneiros elegíveis.
en-mt: On March 12, Human Rights Watch strongly called on Iranian prison authorities to unconditionally release human rights defenders imprisoned for peaceful dissent, and also to temporarily release all eligible prisoners.

sourceString: It stated that there is a greater risk of the virus to spread in closed institutions like detention centres, which also lack adequate medical care.
targetString: O órgão afirmou que existe um maior risco de propagação do vírus em instituições fechadas como centros de detenção, que também sofrem com a falta de cuidados médicos.
en-mt: The body said there is a greater risk of spreading the virus in closed institutions such as detention centers, which also suffer from a lack of medical care.

sourceString: On 15 March, the Iranian government reported 100 deaths in a single day, the most recorded in the country since the outbreak began.
targetString: Em 15 de março, o governo iraniano relatou 100 mortes em um único dia, o maior número desde o início do surto no país.
en-mt: On March 15, the Iranian government reported 100 deaths in a single day, the highest number since the country's outbreak began.

sourceString: At least 12 sitting or former Iranian politicians and government officials had died from the disease by 17 March.
targetString: Pelo menos 12 políticos em exercício ou aposentados e oficiais do governo morreram em decorrência da doença até 17 de março.
en-mt: At least 12 sitting or retired politicians and government officials have died from the disease as of March 17.

sourceString: By 23 March, Iran was experiencing 50 new cases every hour and one new death every ten minutes due to coronavirus.
targetString: Até 23 de março, o Irã teve 50 novos casos por hora e uma nova morte a cada dez minutos devido ao Coronavírus.
en-mt: Until March 23, Iran had 50 new cases per hour and a new death every ten minutes due to the Coronavirus.

sourceString: According to a WHO official, there may be five times more cases in Iran than what is being reported.
targetString: De acordo com um representante da OMS, devem existir cinco vezes mais casos no Irã do que está sendo comunicados.
en-mt: According to a WHO representative, there must be five times more cases in Iran than are being reported.

sourceString: It is also suggested that U.S. sanctions on Iran may be affecting the country's financial ability to respond to the viral outbreak.
targetString: Sugere-se que as sanções dos EUA impostas ao Irã podem estar afetando a capacidade financeira do país de responder à pandemia viral.
en-mt: It is suggested that the US sanctions imposed on Iran may be affecting the country's financial ability to respond to the viral pandemic.

sourceString: The UN High Commissioner for Human Rights has demanded economic sanctions to be eased for nations most affected by the pandemic, including Iran.
targetString: O Alto Comissário para os Direitos Humanos solicitou que as sanções econômicas sejam aliviadas para as nações mais afetadas pela pandemia, incluindo o Irã.
en-mt: The High Commissioner for Human Rights has requested that economic sanctions be eased for nations hardest hit by the pandemic, including Iran.

sourceString: The outbreak was confirmed to have spread to Italy on 31 January, when two Chinese tourists tested positive for SARS-CoV-2 in Rome.
targetString: O surto foi confirmado como tendo se propagado para a Itália em 31 de janeiro, quando dois turistas chineses testaram positivo para a SARS-CoV-2 em Roma.
en-mt: The outbreak was confirmed to have spread to Italy on January 31, when two Chinese tourists tested positive for SARS-CoV-2 in Rome.

sourceString: Cases began to rise sharply, which prompted the Italian government to suspend all flights to and from China and declare a state of emergency.
targetString: Os casos começaram a aumentar bruscamente, o que levou o governo italiano a suspender todos os voos para e da China e declarar estado de emergência.
en-mt: Cases began to rise sharply, prompting the Italian government to suspend all flights to and from China and declare a state of emergency.

sourceString: An unassociated cluster of COVID-19 cases was later detected, starting with 16 confirmed cases in Lombardy on 21 February.On 22 February, the Council of Ministers announced a new decree-law to contain the outbreak, including quarantining more than 50,000 people from 11 different municipalities in northern Italy.
targetString: Um grupo não associado aos casos de COVID-19 foi detectado posteriormente, iniciando com 16 casos confirmados na Lombardia em 21 de fevereiro. Em 22 de fevereiro, o Conselho de Ministros anunciou um decreto-lei para conter o surto, incluindo a quarentena de mais de 50.000 pessoas de 11 municípios diferentes no norte da Itália.
en-mt: A cluster not associated with COVID-19 cases was later detected, starting with 16 confirmed cases in Lombardy on 21 February. On February 22, the Council of Ministers announced a decree-law to contain the outbreak, including the quarantine of over 50,000 people from 11 different municipalities in northern Italy.

sourceString: Prime Minister Giuseppe Conte said, "In the outbreak areas, entry and exit will not be provided.
targetString: O Primeiro Ministro Giuseppe Conte disse, "Nas áreas de surto, estão proibidas as entradas e saídas de pessoas.
en-mt: Prime Minister Giuseppe Conte said, "In outbreak areas, people are prohibited from entering and leaving.

sourceString: Suspension of work activities and sports events has already been ordered in those areas."On 4 March, the Italian government ordered the full closure of all schools and universities nationwide as Italy reached 100 deaths.
targetString: A suspensão de atividades de trabalho e eventos esportivos já tinham sido determinadas nessas áreas. "Em 4 de março, o governo italiano solicitou o fechamento total de todas as escolas e universidades pelo país quando a Itália atingiu 100 mortes.
en-mt: The suspension of work activities and sporting events had already been determined in these areas. "On March 4, the Italian government requested a full closure of all schools and universities across the country as Italy reached 100 deaths.

sourceString: All major sporting events, including Serie A football matches, were to be held behind closed doors until April, but on 9 March, all sport was suspended completely for at least one month.
targetString: Todos os grandes eventos esportivos, incluindo as partidas de futebol da Série A, tiverem que ser realizados a portas fechadas até abril, mas em 9 de março, todos os eventos esportivos foram suspensos completamente por pelo menos um mês.
en-mt: All major sporting events, including Serie A football matches, had to be held behind closed doors until April, but on March 9, all sporting events were suspended completely for at least a month.

sourceString: On 11 March, Prime Minister Conte ordered stoppage of nearly all commercial activity except supermarkets and pharmacies.On 6 March, the Italian College of Anaesthesia, Analgesia, Resuscitation and Intensive Care (SIAARTI) published medical ethics recommendations regarding triage protocols that might be employed.
targetString: Em 11 de março, o Primeiro Ministro Conte, solicitou o fechamento de quase todas as atividades comerciais, exceto supermercados e farmácias. Em 6 de março, o Colégio Italiano de Anestesia, Analgesia, Ressuscitação e Cuidados Intensivos (SIAARTI) publicou recomendações de ética médica em relação aos protocolos de triagem que poderiam ser empregados.
en-mt: On March 11, Prime Minister Conte, requested the closure of almost all commercial activities, except supermarkets and pharmacies. On March 6, the Italian College of Anesthesia, Analgesia, Resuscitation and Intensive Care (SIAARTI) published medical ethics recommendations regarding the screening protocols that could be employed.

sourceString: On 19 March, Italy overtook China as the country with the most coronavirus-related deaths in the world after reporting 3,405 fatalities from the pandemic.
targetString: Em 19 de março, a Itália passou a China como o país com mais mortes relacionadas ao Coronavírus no mundo após relatar 3.405 óbitos relacionados à pandemia.
en-mt: On March 19, Italy passed China as the country with the most Coronavirus-related deaths in the world after reporting 3,405 deaths related to the pandemic.

sourceString: On 22 March, it was reported that Russia had sent nine military planes with medical equipment to Italy.
targetString: Em 22 de março, foi comunicado que a Rússia enviou nove aviões militares com suprimentos médicos para a Itália.
en-mt: On March 22, it was reported that Russia had sent nine military planes with medical supplies to Italy.

sourceString: As of 5 April, there were 128,948 confirmed cases, 15,887 deaths, and 21,815 recoveries in Italy, with the majority of those cases occurring in the Lombardy region.
targetString: A partir de 5 de abril, tinha 128.948 casos confirmados, 15.887 mortes e 21.815 recuperados na Itália, com a maioria destes casos ocorrendo na região da Lombardia.
en-mt: As of April 5, it had 128,948 confirmed cases, 15,887 deaths and 21,815 recovered in Italy, with most of these cases occurring in the Lombardy region.

sourceString: A CNN report indicated that the combination of Italy's large elderly population and inability to test all who have the virus to date may be contributing to the high fatality rate.
targetString: Um relatório da CNN indicou que a combinação de uma população idosa na Itália e a incapacidade de testar todos que tiveram o vírus até aquele momento pode ter contribuído para uma alta taxa de mortalidade.
en-mt: A CNN report indicated that the combination of an elderly population in Italy and the inability to test everyone who had the virus up to that point may have contributed to a high death rate.

sourceString: The United Kingdom's response to the virus first emerged as one of the most relaxed of the affected countries, and until 18 March 2020, the British government did not impose any form of social distancing or mass quarantine measures on its citizens.
targetString: A resposta do Reino Unido ao vírus surgiu primeiramente como uma das mais brandas dos países afetados, e até 18 de março de 2020, o governo britânico não tinha imposto qualquer forma de distanciamento social ou medidas de quarentena em massa aos seus cidadãos.
en-mt: The UK's response to the virus first emerged as one of the mildest of the affected countries, and as of March 18, 2020, the British government had not imposed any form of social distancing or mass quarantine measures on its citizens.

sourceString: As a result, the government received criticism for the perceived lack of pace and intensity in its response to concerns faced by the public.On 16 March, Prime Minister Boris Johnson made an announcement advising against all non-essential travel and social contact, suggesting people work from home where possible and avoid venues such as pubs, restaurants, and theatres.
targetString: Como consequência, o governo recebeu críticas pela reconhecida falta de diligência e intensidade de sua resposta aos problemas enfrentados pela população. Em 16 de março, o primeiro-ministro Boris Johnson fez um pronunciamento em que aconselhava o interrompimento de todas as viagens não essenciais e de contato social, sugerindo que as pessoas trabalhassem em casa o máximo possível e evitassem locais como bares, restaurantes e teatros.
en-mt: As a result, the government has been criticized for its perceived lack of diligence and intensity in its response to the problems faced by the population. On March 16, Prime Minister Boris Johnson issued a statement advising a halt to all non-essential travel and social contact, urging people to work from home as much as possible and avoid venues such as pubs, restaurants and theatres.

sourceString: On 20 March, the government announced that all leisure establishments such as pubs and gyms were to close as soon as possible, and promised to pay up to 80% of workers' wages to a limit of £2,500 per month to prevent unemployment in the crisis.On 23 March, the Prime Minister announced tougher social distancing measures, banning gatherings of more than two people and restricting travel and outdoor activity to that deemed strictly necessary.
targetString: Em 20 de março, o governo anunciou que todos os estabelecimentos de lazer, como pubs e academias deviam ser fechados o mais rápido possível, e se comprometeu a pagar 80% dos salários dos trabalhadores até um limite de 2.500 libras por mês para evitar o desemprego durante a crise. Em 23 de março, o Primeiro Ministro anunciou medidas de distanciamento social mais pesadas, impedindo aglomerações com mais de duas pessoas e restringindo viagens e atividades ao ar livre ao mínimo necessário.
en-mt: On March 20, the government announced that all leisure establishments such as pubs and gyms should be closed as soon as possible, and committed to paying 80% of workers' wages up to a limit of £2,500 a month to avoid unemployment. during the crisis. On March 23, the Prime Minister announced tougher social distancing measures, preventing gatherings of more than two people and restricting travel and outdoor activities to the bare minimum.

sourceString: Unlike previous measures, these restrictions were enforceable by police through the issuing of fines and the dispersal of gatherings.
targetString: Diferentes das medidas anteriores, estas restrições foram reforçadas pela polícia através da emissão de multas e dispersão de aglomerações.
en-mt: Unlike previous measures, these restrictions were enforced by the police by issuing fines and dispersing crowds.

sourceString: Most businesses were ordered to close, with exceptions for businesses deemed "essential", including supermarkets, pharmacies, banks, hardware shops, petrol stations, and garages.
targetString: A maioria dos negócios receberam ordens para fechar, com exceções para negócios considerados "essenciais", incluindo supermercados, farmácias, bancos, lojas de ferragens, postos de gasolina e oficina de automóveis.
en-mt: Most businesses were ordered to close, with exceptions for businesses deemed "essential" including supermarkets, pharmacies, banks, hardware stores, gas stations and auto repair shops.

sourceString: On 20 January, the first known case of COVID-19 was confirmed in the Pacific Northwest state of Washington in a man who had returned from Wuhan on 15 January.
targetString: Em 20 de janeiro, o primeiro caso conhecido de COVID-19 foi confirmado no estado Noroeste Pacífico de Washington em um homem que tinha retornado de Wuhan em 15 de janeiro.
en-mt: On 20 January, the first known case of COVID-19 was confirmed in the Pacific Northwest state of Washington in a man who had returned from Wuhan on 15 January.

sourceString: The White House Coronavirus Task Force was established on 29 January.
targetString: A Força-tarefa da Casa Branca ao Combate do Coronavírus foi implementada em 29 de janeiro.
en-mt: The White House Coronavirus Task Force was implemented on January 29.

sourceString: On 31 January, the Trump administration declared a public health emergency, and placed restrictions on entry for travellers from China.
targetString: Em 31 de janeiro, a administração de Trump declarou emergência pública de saúde, e determinou restrições para a entrada de viajantes vindos da China.
en-mt: On January 31, the Trump administration declared a public health emergency, and imposed restrictions on the entry of travelers from China.

sourceString: On 28 January 2020, the Center for Disease Control—the leading public health institute of the U.S. government—announced they had developed their own testing kit.
targetString: Em 28 de janeiro de 2020, o Centro para Controle de Doenças — o instituto líder de saúde pública do governo dos Estados Unidos — anunciou que eles tinham desenvolvido seu próprio kit de testagem.
en-mt: On January 28, 2020, the Centers for Disease Control — the US government's leading public health institute — announced that they had developed their own testing kit.

sourceString: Despite doing so, the United States had a slow start in testing, which obscured the true extent of the outbreak at the time.
targetString: Apesar de ter feito isso, os Estados Unidos tiveram um início lento para os testes, o que ocultou a verdadeira extensão do surto naquele momento.
en-mt: Despite having done so, the United States had a slow start to testing, which hid the true extent of the outbreak at that time.

sourceString: Testing was marred by defective test kits produced by the federal government in February, a lack of federal government approval for non-government test kits (by academia, companies and hospitals) until the end of February, and restrictive criteria for people to qualify for a test until early March (a doctor's order was required thereafter).
targetString: A testagem foi marcada por kits de testes com defeito produzidos pelo governo federal em fevereiro, uma falta de aprovação do governo federal para kits de teste que não eram do governo (de academias, empresas e hospitais) até o final de fevereiro, e critérios restritivos para as pessoas que seriam testadas até o início de março (um pedido médico foi necessário subsequentemente).
en-mt: Testing was marred by faulty test kits produced by the federal government in February, a lack of federal government approval for non-government test kits (from gyms, businesses and hospitals) by the end of February, and restrictive criteria for people who would be tested until early March (a doctor's order was subsequently required).

sourceString: By 27 February, The Washington Post reported fewer than 4,000 tests had been conducted in the United States.
targetString: Até 27 de fevereiro, o Washington Post relatou que menos de 4.000 testes tinham sido realizados nos Estados Unidos.
en-mt: As of Feb. 27, the Washington Post reported that fewer than 4,000 tests had been performed in the United States.

sourceString: By 13 March, The Atlantic reported that less than 14,000 tests had been conducted.
targetString: Até 13 de março, o The Atlantic relatou que menos de 14.000 testes tinham sido realizados.
en-mt: As of March 13, The Atlantic reported that less than 14,000 tests had been performed.

sourceString: On 22 March, the Associated Press reported: "Many people who have symptoms and a doctor's order have waited hours or days for a test."After the first death in the United States was reported in Washington state on 29 February, Governor Jay Inslee declared a state of emergency, an action that was soon followed by other states.
targetString: Em 22 de março, o Associated Press comunicou: "Muitas pessoas que têm os sintomas e tinham um pedido médico tiveram que esperar horas ou dias para fazer um teste." Depois que a primeira morte nos Estados Unidos foi relatada no estado de Washington em 29 de fevereiro, o Governador Jay Inslee declarou estado de emergência, uma ação que foi brevemente seguida por outros estados.
en-mt: On March 22, the Associated Press reported, "Many people who have symptoms and had a doctor's order have had to wait hours or days to get tested." After the first US death was reported in Washington state on February 29, Governor Jay Inslee declared a state of emergency, an action that was briefly followed by other states.

sourceString: Schools in the Seattle area cancelled classes on 3 March, and by mid-March, schools across the country were shutting down.On 6 March 2020, the United States was advised of projections for the impact of the new coronavirus on the country by a group of epidemiologists at Imperial College London.
targetString: As escolas na área de Seattle cancelaram as aulas em 3 de março, e na segunda quinzena de março, escolas pelo país estavam fechando. Em 6 de março de 2020, os Estados Unidos foram avisados sobre projeções para o impacto do novo coronavírus no país por um grupo de epidemiologistas do Imperial College de Londres.
en-mt: Schools in the Seattle area canceled classes on March 3, and by the second half of March, schools across the country were closing. On March 6, 2020, the United States was advised of projections for the impact of the new coronavirus on the country by a group of epidemiologists at Imperial College London.

sourceString: On the same day President Trump signed the Coronavirus Preparedness and Response Supplemental Appropriations Act, which provided $8.3 billion in emergency funding for federal agencies to respond to the outbreak.
targetString: No mesmo dia, o Presidente Trump assinou a Lei de Dotações Complementares de Preparação e Resposta ao Coronavírus, que dispôs 8,3 bilhões de dólares em fundo de emergência para agências federais como uma resposta ao surto.
en-mt: On the same day, President Trump signed the Coronavirus Preparedness and Response Supplementary Appropriations Act, which made $8.3 billion in emergency funding available to federal agencies in response to the outbreak.

sourceString: Corporations imposed employee travel restrictions, cancelled conferences, and encouraged employees to work from home.
targetString: As corporações impuseram restrições de viagem aos funcionários, cancelaram conferências, e encorajaram os funcionários a trabalhar em casa.
en-mt: Corporations have imposed travel restrictions on employees, canceled conferences, and encouraged employees to work from home.

sourceString: Sports events and seasons were cancelled.On 11 March, Trump announced travel restrictions for most of Europe, excluding the United Kingdom, for 30 days, effective 13 March.
targetString: Os eventos e temporadas esportivas foram cancelados. Em 11 de março, Trump anunciou restrições de viagem para a maioria da Europa, excluindo o Reino Unido, por 30 dias, em vigor a partir de 13 de março.
en-mt: Sports events and seasons have been cancelled. On March 11, Trump announced travel restrictions for most of Europe, excluding the United Kingdom, for 30 days, effective March 13.

sourceString: The following day, he expanded the restrictions to include the United Kingdom and Ireland.
targetString: No dia seguinte, ele ampliou as restrições de forma a incluir o Reino Unido e a Irlanda.
en-mt: The following day, he extended the restrictions to include the UK and Ireland.

sourceString: On 13 March, he declared a national emergency, which made federal funds available to respond to the crisis.
targetString: Em 13 de março, ele declarou emergência nacional, o que tornou os fundos federais disponíveis para responder a crise.
en-mt: On March 13, he declared a national emergency, which made federal funds available to respond to the crisis.

sourceString: Beginning on 15 March, many businesses closed or reduced hours throughout the U.S. to try to reduce the spread of the virus.
targetString: Começando em 15 de março, muitos negócios fecharam ou reduziram os horários por todo os Estados Unidos para tentar reduzir a propagação do vírus.
en-mt: Starting March 15, many businesses closed or reduced hours across the United States to try to slow the spread of the virus.

sourceString: By 17 March, the epidemic had been confirmed in all 50 states and in the District of Columbia.On 23 March, it was reported that New York City had 10,700 cases of the coronavirus, more than the total number of cases in South Korea.
targetString: Até 17 de março, a epidemia tinha sido confirmada em todos os 50 estados e no Distrito de Columbia. Em 23 de março, foi relatado que a cidade de Nova York tinha 10.700 casos de Coronavírus, mais do que o número total dos casos na Coreia do Sul.
en-mt: As of March 17, the epidemic had been confirmed in all 50 states and the District of Columbia. On March 23, New York City was reported to have 10,700 cases of the Coronavirus, more than the total number of cases in South Korea.

sourceString: On 25 March, the governor said that social distancing seemed to be working, as estimates of case doubling slowed from 2.0 days to 4.7 days.
targetString: Em 25 de março, o governador disse que o distanciamento social parecia estar funcionando, uma vez que as estimativas de duplicação de casos diminuíram de 2,0 dias para 4,7 dias.
en-mt: On March 25, the governor said social distancing appeared to be working as case doubling estimates decreased from 2.0 days to 4.7 days.

sourceString: As of 28 March, there were 32,308 confirmed cases in New York City, and 672 people had died from the virus.On 26 March, the United States was reported to have more confirmed coronavirus infection cases than any other country in the world, including China and Italy.As of 8 April, 400,335 cases have been confirmed in the United States, and 12,841 people have died.
targetString: A partir de 28 de março, foram confirmados 32.308 casos na cidade de Nova York, e 672 pessoas morreram em decorrência do vírus. Em 26 de março, os Estados Unidos relataram mais casos de infecção por Coronavírus do que em qualquer outro país no mundo, incluindo a China e a Itália. A partir de 8 de abril, 400.335 casos foram confirmados nos Estados Unidos, e 12.841 pessoas morreram.
en-mt: As of March 28, 32,308 cases have been confirmed in New York City, and 672 people have died from the virus. As of March 26, the United States has reported more cases of Coronavirus infection than any other country in the world, including China and Italy. As of April 8, 400,335 cases have been confirmed in the United States, and 12,841 people have died.

sourceString: Per media reports on 30 March, U.S. President Trump has decided to extend social distancing guidelines until 30 April.
targetString: Segundos relatórios da mídia, em 30 de março, o Presidente Trump dos Estados Unidos decidiu estender as diretrizes do distanciamento social até 30 de abril.
en-mt: According to media reports, on March 30, President Trump of the United States decided to extend the social distancing guidelines until April 30.

sourceString: On the same day, the USNS Comfort, a hospital ship with about 1000 beds, made anchor in New York.
targetString: No mesmo dia, o USNS Comfort, um navio-hospital com cerca de 1000 camas, ancorou em Nova York.
en-mt: On the same day, the USNS Comfort, a hospital ship with about 1000 beds, docked in New York.

sourceString: On 3 April, the U.S. had a record 884 deaths due to the coronavirus in a 24-hour period.
targetString: Em 3 de abril, os EUA tiveram um recorde de 884 mortes devido ao Coronavírus em um período de 24 horas.
en-mt: On April 3, the US had a record 884 deaths due to the Coronavirus in a 24-hour period.

sourceString: In the state of New York the cases have exceeded 100,000 people on 3 April.The White House has been criticized for downplaying the threat and controlling the messaging by directing health officials and scientists to coordinate public statements and publications related to the virus with the office of Vice-President Mike Pence.
targetString: No estado de Nova York, os casos superaram 100.000 pessoas em 3 de abril. A Casa Branca foi criticada por subestimar a ameaça e controlar o envio de mensagens ao instruir os oficiais da saúde e cientistas a coordenarem as publicações e declarações públicas relacionadas ao vírus ao escritório do Vice-Presidente Mike Pence.
en-mt: In New York state, cases surpassed 100,000 people on April 3. The White House has been criticized for downplaying the threat and controlling messaging by instructing health officials and scientists to coordinate publications and public statements related to the virus to the office of Vice President Mike Pence.

sourceString: Overall approval of Trump's management of the crisis has been polarized along partisan lines.
targetString: Uma aprovação geral da gestão da crise por Trump foi polarizada ao longo de linhas partidárias.
en-mt: A general approval of Trump's handling of the crisis was polarized along party lines.

sourceString: Some U.S. officials and commentators criticized the U.S. reliance on importation of critical materials, including essential medical supplies, from China.
targetString: Alguns oficiais e comentaristas dos Estados Unidos criticaram a confiança dos Estados Unidos na importação de materiais essenciais, incluindo suprimentos médicos essenciais, da China.
en-mt: Some US officials and commentators have criticized the US reliance on importing essential materials, including essential medical supplies, from China.

sourceString: An analysis of air travel patterns was used to map and predict patterns of spread and was published in The Journal of Travel Medicine in mid-January 2020.
targetString: Uma análise dos padrões de viagem aérea foi usada para mapear e prever padrões de propagação e foi publicada no The Journal of Travel Medicine em meados de janeiro de 2020.
en-mt: An analysis of air travel patterns was used to map and predict patterns of spread and was published in The Journal of Travel Medicine in mid-January 2020.

sourceString: Based on 2018 information from the International Air Transport Association, Bangkok, Hong Kong, Tokyo, and Taipei had the largest volume of travellers from Wuhan.
targetString: Com base nas informações de 2018 da Associação Internacional de Transporte Aéreo, Bangkok, Hong Kong, Tóquio e Taipei tiveram o maior volume de viajantes partindo de Wuhan.
en-mt: Based on 2018 information from the International Air Transport Association, Bangkok, Hong Kong, Tokyo and Taipei had the highest volume of travelers departing from Wuhan.

sourceString: Dubai, Sydney, and Melbourne were also reported as popular destinations for people travelling from Wuhan.
targetString: Dubai, Sydney e Melbourne também foram relatadas como destinos populares para as pessoas que viajaram partindo de Wuhan.
en-mt: Dubai, Sydney and Melbourne were also reported as popular destinations for people traveling from Wuhan.

sourceString: Bali was reported as least able among the 20 most popular destination cities in terms of preparedness, while cities in Australia were considered most able.Australia released its Emergency Response Plan for Novel Coronavirus (COVID-19) on 7 February.
targetString: Bali foi relatada como a menos capaz entre os 20 destinos mais populares em termos de preparação, enquanto cidades na Austrália foram consideradas as mais capazes. A Austrália autorizou seu Plano de Resposta à Emergências para o Novo Coronavírus (COVID-19) em 7 de fevereiro.
en-mt: Bali was reported as the least capable of the top 20 destinations in terms of preparedness, while cities in Australia were considered the most capable. Australia authorized its Novel Coronavirus (COVID-19) Emergency Response Plan on 7 February.

sourceString: It stated that much was yet to be discovered about COVID-19, and that Australia would emphasize border control and communication in its response to the pandemic.
targetString: Ela declarou que muito ainda estava para ser descoberto sobre a COVID-19, e que a Austrália enfatizaria o controle das fronteiras e comunicação em sua resposta à pandemia.
en-mt: She stated that much remained to be discovered about COVID-19, and that Australia would emphasize border control and communication in its response to the pandemic.

sourceString: On 21 March, a human biosecurity emergency was declared in Australia.
targetString: Em 21 de março, uma emergência de biossegurança humana foi declarada na Austrália.
en-mt: On March 21, a human biosecurity emergency was declared in Australia.

sourceString: Owing to the effective quarantine of public transport in Wuhan and Hubei, several countries have planned to evacuate their citizens and diplomatic staff from the area, primarily through chartered flights of the home nation, with Chinese authorities providing clearance.
targetString: Devido a quarentena eficaz do transporte público em Wuhan e Hubei, vários países planejaram retirar seus cidadãos e equipe diplomática da área, primeiramente através de voos fretados da nação de origem, com a liberação das autoridades Chinesas.
en-mt: Due to the effective quarantine of public transport in Wuhan and Hubei, several countries have planned to evacuate their citizens and diplomatic staff from the area, primarily via chartered flights from the home nation, with the clearance of Chinese authorities.

sourceString: Canada, the United States, Japan, India, Sri Lanka, Australia, France, Argentina, Germany, and Thailand were among the first to plan the evacuation of their citizens.
targetString: O Canadá, os Estados Unidos, o Japão, a Índia, o Sri Lanka, a Austrália, a França, a Argentina, a Alemanha e a Tailândia estão entre os primeiros a planejarem a retirada de seus cidadãos.
en-mt: Canada, the United States, Japan, India, Sri Lanka, Australia, France, Argentina, Germany and Thailand are among the first to plan to evacuate their citizens.

sourceString: Pakistan has said that it will not be evacuating any citizens from China.
targetString: O Paquistão disse que não retiraria qualquer cidadão vindo da China.
en-mt: Pakistan said it would not withdraw any nationals coming from China.

sourceString: On 7 February, Brazil evacuated 34 Brazilians or family members in addition to four Poles, a Chinese person, and an Indian citizen.
targetString: Em 7 de fevereiro, o Brasil retirou 34 brasileiros ou membros da família além de quatro poloneses, um chinês e um indiano.
en-mt: On February 7, Brazil withdrew 34 Brazilians or family members in addition to four Poles, one Chinese and one Indian.

sourceString: The citizens of Poland, China, and India deplaned in Poland, where the Brazilian plane made a stopover before following its route to Brazil.
targetString: Os cidadãos da Polônia, China e Índia desembarcaram na Polônia, onde o avião brasileiro fez uma parada antes de seguir sua rota para o Brasil.
en-mt: The citizens of Poland, China and India disembarked in Poland, where the Brazilian plane made a stop before continuing on its route to Brazil.

sourceString: Brazilian citizens who went to Wuhan were quarantined at a military base near Brasília.
targetString: Os cidadãos brasileiros que foram para Wuhan ficaram sob quarentena em uma base militar próxima a Brasília.
en-mt: Brazilian citizens who went to Wuhan were quarantined at a military base near Brasilia.

sourceString: On the same day, 215 Canadians (176 from the first plane, and 39 from a second plane chartered by the U.S. government) were evacuated from Wuhan to CFB Trenton to be quarantined for two weeks.
targetString: No mesmo dia, 215 canadenses (176 do primeiro avião, e 39 de um segundo avião fretado pelo governo americano) foram retirados de Wuhan e enviados para a Base das Forças Aéreas Trenton para ficarem sob quarentena por duas semanas.
en-mt: On the same day, 215 Canadians (176 from the first plane, and 39 from a second plane chartered by the US government) were evacuated from Wuhan and sent to Trenton Air Force Base to be quarantined for two weeks.

sourceString: On 11 February, another plane of 185 Canadians from Wuhan landed at CFB Trenton.
targetString: Em 11 de fevereiro, outro avião com 185 Canadenses de Wuhan aterrissou na Base das Forças Canadenses de Trenton.
en-mt: On February 11, another plane carrying 185 Canadians from Wuhan landed at Canadian Forces Base Trenton.

sourceString: Australian authorities evacuated 277 citizens on 3 and 4 February to the Christmas Island Detention Centre, which had been repurposed as a quarantine facility, where they remained for 14 days.
targetString: As autoridades Australianas levaram 277 cidadãos em 3 e 4 de fevereiro para o Centro de Detenção da Ilha Christmas, que depois foi reaproveitado como instalação de quarentena, onde eles permaneceram por 14 dias.
en-mt: Australian authorities took 277 citizens on February 3 and 4 to the Christmas Island Detention Center, which was later repurposed as a quarantine facility, where they were held for 14 days.

sourceString: A New Zealand evacuation flight arrived in Auckland on 5 February; its passengers (including some from Australia and the Pacific) were quarantined at a naval base in Whangaparoa, north of Auckland.
targetString: Um voo de retirada de cidadãos da Nova Zelândia aterrissou em Auckland em 5 de fevereiro; seus passageiros (incluindo alguns da Austrália e do Pacífico) ficaram em quarentena em uma base naval em Whangaparoa, norte de Auckland.
en-mt: An evacuation flight for New Zealand citizens landed in Auckland on 5 February; its passengers (including some from Australia and the Pacific) were quarantined at a naval base at Whangaparoa, north of Auckland.

sourceString: On 15 February, the United States announced that it would evacuate Americans aboard the cruise ship Diamond Princess.
targetString: Em 15 de fevereiro, os Estados Unidos anunciaram que eles retirariam os americanos do cruzeiro Diamond Princess.
en-mt: On February 15, the United States announced that they would withdraw Americans from the Diamond Princess cruise.

sourceString: On 21 February, a plane carrying 129 Canadian passengers who had been evacuated from Diamond Princess landed in Trenton, Ontario.
targetString: Em 21 de fevereiro, um avião com 129 passageiros Canadenses que tinham sido retirados do Diamond Princess, aterrissou em Trenton, Ontário.
en-mt: On February 21, a plane carrying 129 Canadian passengers who had been evacuated from the Diamond Princess, landed in Trenton, Ontario.

sourceString: In early March, the Indian government began evacuating its citizens from Iran.On 14 March a South African Airways aircraft chartered by the South African Government repatriated 112 South African citizens.
targetString: No início de março, o governo Indiano começou a retirar seus cidadãos do Irã. Em 14 de março uma aeronave da South African Airways fretada pelo Governo Sul-Africano repatriou 112 cidadãos Sul-africanos.
en-mt: In early March, the Indian government began withdrawing its citizens from Iran. On 14 March a South African Airways aircraft chartered by the South African Government repatriated 112 South African citizens.

sourceString: Medical screening was performed prior to departure, and four South Africans who were showing signs of coronavirus were left behind to mitigate risk.
targetString: Uma triagem médica foi realizada antes dos embarques, e quatro sul-africanos que demonstraram sinais de coronavírus foram deixados para trás para mitigar os riscos.
en-mt: A medical screening was carried out prior to departures, and four South Africans who showed signs of the coronavirus were left behind to mitigate the risks.

sourceString: Only South Africans who tested negative were repatriated.
targetString: Apenas os Sul-africanos que testaram negativo foram repatriados.
en-mt: Only South Africans who tested negative were repatriated.

sourceString: Test results cleared all the South Africans, including the flight crew, pilots, hotel staff, police and soldiers involved in the humanitarian mission who, as a precautionary measure, all remained under observation and in quarantine for a 14-day period at The Ranch Resort.
targetString: Os resultados dos testes liberaram todos os Sul-africanos, incluindo a tripulação de voo, pilotos, equipe do hotel, polícia e soldados envolvidos na missão humanitária que, como medida preventiva, permaneceram em observação e em quarentena por um período de 14 dias no Resort The Ranch.
en-mt: Test results cleared all South Africans including flight crew, pilots, hotel staff, police and soldiers involved in the humanitarian mission who, as a preventive measure, remained under observation and quarantine for a period of 14 days at the Resort The Ranch.

sourceString: On 20 March, the United States began to partially withdrawal its troops from Iraq due to the pandemic.
targetString: Em 20 de março, os Estados Unidos começaram a retirar parcialmente suas tropas do Iraque devido à pandemia.
en-mt: On March 20, the United States began to partially withdraw its troops from Iraq due to the pandemic.

sourceString: On 5 February, the Chinese foreign ministry stated that 21 countries (including Belarus, Pakistan, Trinidad and Tobago, Egypt, and Iran) had sent aid to China.
targetString: Em 5 de fevereiro, o Ministério das Relações Exteriores da China declarou que 21 países (incluindo Bielorússia, Paquistão, Trinidad e Tobago, Egito e Irã) enviaram auxílio para a China.
en-mt: On February 5, China's Ministry of Foreign Affairs declared that 21 countries (including Belarus, Pakistan, Trinidad and Tobago, Egypt and Iran) have sent aid to China.

sourceString: Some Chinese students at American universities joined together to help send aid to virus-stricken parts of China, with a joint group in the greater Chicago area reportedly managing to send 50,000 N95 masks to hospitals in the Hubei province on 30 January.The humanitarian aid organization Direct Relief, in coordination with FedEx, sent 200,000 face masks along with other personal protective equipment, including gloves and gowns, by emergency airlift to the Wuhan Union Hospital by 30 January.
targetString: Alguns estudantes Chineses em Universidades americanas se uniram para ajudar a enviar auxílio para as partes afetadas pelo vírus na China, com um grupo conjunto na área da Grande Chicago que supostamente conseguiu enviar 50 mil máscaras N95 aos hospitais na Província de Hubei em 30 de janeiro. A organização de ajuda humanitária Direct Relief, em coordenação com a FedEx, enviou 200 mil máscaras faciais junto com outros equipamentos de proteção pessoal, incluindo luvas e capote, através de transporte aéreo de emergência para o Wuhan Union Hospital em 30 de janeiro.
en-mt: Some Chinese students at American universities have banded together to help send aid to virus-affected parts of China, with a joint group in the Greater Chicago area reportedly managing to send 50,000 N95 masks to hospitals in Hubei Province on Jan. 30. Aid organization Direct Relief, in coordination with FedEx, sent 200,000 face masks along with other personal protective equipment, including gloves and an overcoat, via emergency airlift to Wuhan Union Hospital on January 30.

sourceString: On 5 February, Bill and Melinda Gates announced a $100 million donation to the WHO to fund vaccine research and treatment efforts along with protecting "at-risk populations in Africa and South Asia".
targetString: Em 5 de fevereiro, Bill e Melinda Gates anunciaram uma doação de 100 milhões de dólares para a OMS para financiar a pesquisa de vacinas e esforços de tratamento juntamente com a proteção da "população em risco na África e Sul da Ásia".
en-mt: On February 5, Bill and Melinda Gates announced a $100 million grant to the WHO to fund vaccine research and treatment efforts along with protecting "at-risk populations in Africa and South Asia."

sourceString: Interaksyon reported that the Chinese government donated 200,000 masks to the Philippines on 6 February, after Senator Richard Gordon shipped 3.16 million masks to Wuhan.
targetString: A Interaksyon relatou que o governo chinês doou 200 mil máscaras para as Filipinas em 6 de fevereiro, após o senador Richard Gordon ter despachado 3,16 milhões de máscaras para Wuhan.
en-mt: Interaksyon reported that the Chinese government donated 200,000 masks to the Philippines on February 6, after Senator Richard Gordon shipped 3.16 million masks to Wuhan.

sourceString: On 19 February, the Singapore Red Cross announced that it would send $2.26 million worth of aid to China.
targetString: Em 19 de fevereiro, a Cruz Vermelha de Singapura anunciou que enviaria 2,26 milhões de dólares em ajuda para a China.
en-mt: On February 19, the Singapore Red Cross announced that it would send $2.26 million in aid to China.

sourceString: Japan donated one million face masks to Wuhan, Turkey dispatched medical equipment, Russia sent more than 13 tonnes of medical supplies to Wuhan, Malaysia announced a donation of 18 million medical gloves to China, Germany delivered various medical supplies including 10,000 Hazmat suits, and the United States donated 17.8 tons of medical supplies to China and promised an additional $100 million in financial support to affected countries.After cases in China seemed to stabilize, the country has been sending aid to various nations hit by the pandemic.
targetString: O Japão doou um milhão de máscaras para Wuhan, a Turquia enviou equipamentos médicos, a Rússia enviou mais de 13 toneladas de suprimentos médicos para Wuhan, a Malásia anunciou uma doação de 18 milhões de luvas médicas para a China, a Alemanha entregou vários suprimentos médicos, incluindo 10 mil roupas de proteção, e os Estados Unidos doaram 17,8 toneladas de suprimentos médicos para a China e prometeu mais 100 milhões de dólares adicionais em auxílio financeiro para os países afetados. Após os casos na China terem estabilizado, o país continuou enviando auxílio para várias nações atingidas pela pandemia.
en-mt: Japan donated one million masks to Wuhan, Turkey sent medical equipment, Russia sent over 13 tons of medical supplies to Wuhan, Malaysia announced a donation of 18 million medical gloves to China, Germany delivered several medical supplies , including 10,000 protective suits, and the United States donated 17.8 tons of medical supplies to China and pledged an additional $100 million in financial assistance to affected countries. After cases in China stabilized, the country continued to send aid to various nations hit by the pandemic.

sourceString: In March, China, Cuba and Russia sent medical supplies and experts to help Italy deal with its coronavirus outbreak.
targetString: Em março, a China, Cuba e Rússia enviaram suprimentos médicos e especialistas para ajudar a Itália a administrar o surto de Coronavírus.
en-mt: In March, China, Cuba and Russia sent medical supplies and experts to help Italy manage the Coronavirus outbreak.

sourceString: Businessman Jack Ma sent 1.1 million testing kits, 6 million face masks, and 60,000 protective suits to Addis Ababa, Ethiopia for distribution by the African Union.
targetString: O empresário Jack Ma enviou 1,1 milhões de kits de testagem, 6 milhões de máscaras faciais e 60 mil roupas de proteção para Addis Abeba na Etiópia para a distribuição pela União Africana.
en-mt: Businessman Jack Ma sent 1.1 million test kits, 6 million face masks and 60,000 protective clothing to Addis Ababa, Ethiopia for distribution by the African Union.

sourceString: He later sent 5,000 testing kits, 100,000 face masks and 5 ventilators to Panama.
targetString: Posteriormente, ele enviou 5 mil kits de testagem, 100 mil máscaras faciais e 5 ventiladores para o Panamá.
en-mt: He subsequently shipped 5,000 testing kits, 100,000 face masks, and 5 ventilators to Panama.

sourceString: Ma also donated medical supplies to Canada.The Netherlands, Spain, Turkey, Georgia, and the Czech Republic expressed their concerns over Chinese-made masks and test kits.
targetString: Ma também doou suprimentos médicos para o Canadá. Os Países Baixos, Espanha, Turquia, Georgia e a República Tcheca expressaram preocupação sobre as máscaras e os kits de testagem fabricados na China.
en-mt: Ma has also donated medical supplies to Canada. The Netherlands, Spain, Turkey, Georgia and the Czech Republic have all expressed concern about masks and testing kits made in China.

sourceString: For instance, Spain withdrew 58,000 Chinese-made coronavirus testing kits with an accuracy rate of just 30%, meanwhile, the Netherlands recalled 600,000 Chinese face masks which were defective.
targetString: Por exemplo, a Espanha recolheu 58 mil kits de testagem de Coronavírus feitos pela China com uma taxa de precisão de apenas 30%, enquanto isso, os Países Baixos devolveram 600 mil máscaras faciais que estavam com defeito.
en-mt: For example, Spain recalled 58,000 Chinese-made Coronavirus testing kits with an accuracy rate of just 30%, meanwhile, the Netherlands returned 600,000 face masks that were defective.

sourceString: Belgium recalled 100,000 unusable masks, thought to be from China, but were in fact from Colombia.
targetString: A Bélgica recolheu 100 mil máscaras inutilizáveis, que supostamente eram da China, mas que na verdade eram da Colômbia.
en-mt: Belgium recalled 100,000 unusable masks, which were supposedly from China but were actually from Colombia.

sourceString: On the other hand, Chinese aid has been well-received in parts of Latin America and Africa.On 2 April, the World Bank launched emergency support operations for developing countries.
targetString: Por outro lado, a ajuda da China foi bem recebida em partes da América Latina e na África. Em 2 de abril, o Banco Mundial lançou operações de apoio emergencial para países em desenvolvimento.
en-mt: On the other hand, China's help has been well received in parts of Latin America and Africa. On April 2, the World Bank launched emergency support operations for developing countries.

sourceString: The WHO has commended the efforts of Chinese authorities in managing and containing the epidemic.
targetString: A OMS elogiou os esforços das autoridades chinesas para gerir e conter a epidemia.
en-mt: The WHO commended the Chinese authorities' efforts to manage and contain the epidemic.

sourceString: The WHO noted the contrast between the 2002–2004 SARS outbreak, where Chinese authorities were accused of secrecy that impeded prevention and containment efforts, and the current crisis where the central government "has provided regular updates to avoid panic ahead of Lunar New Year holidays".
targetString: A OMS observou o contraste entre o surto da SARS 2002-2004, onde as autoridades chinesas foram acusadas de omitir dados que dificultaram a prevenção e esforços de contenção, e a crise atual, onde o governo central "forneceu atualizações regulares para evitar o pânico próximo das festividades no ano novo lunar".
en-mt: The WHO noted the contrast between the 2002-2004 SARS outbreak, where Chinese authorities were accused of withholding data that hampered prevention and containment efforts, and the current crisis, where the central government "provided regular updates to avert the coming panic". of the Lunar New Year festivities".

sourceString: On 23 January, in reaction to the central authorities' decision to implement a transportation ban in Wuhan, WHO representative Gauden Galea remarked that while it was "certainly not a recommendation the WHO has made", it was also "a very important indication of the commitment to contain the epidemic in the place where it is most concentrated" and called it "unprecedented in public health history".On 30 January, following confirmation of human-to-human transmission outside China and the increase in the number of cases in other countries, the WHO declared the outbreak a Public Health Emergency of International Concern (PHEIC), the sixth PHEIC since the measure was first invoked during the 2009 swine flu pandemic.
targetString: Em 23 de janeiro, em reação à decisão das principais autoridades para implementar uma proibição dos transportes em Wuhan, o representante da OMS Gauden Galea observou que "aquela certamente não era uma recomendação da OMS" e também era "uma indicação muito importante do compromisso de conter a epidemia na área onde ela estava mais concentrada". Em 30 de janeiro, após a confirmação da transmissão entre humanos fora da China e o aumento no número de casos em outros países, a OMS declarou o surto como Emergência de Saúde Pública de Âmbito Internacional (PHEIC), o sexto PHEIC desde que a medida foi primeiramente invocada durante a pandemia de gripe suína de 2009.
en-mt: On January 23, in reaction to the decision by leading authorities to implement a transport ban in Wuhan, WHO representative Gauden Galea noted that "that was certainly not a WHO recommendation" and was also "a very important indication of the commitment to contain the epidemic in the area where it was most concentrated". On January 30, following confirmation of human-to-human transmission outside China and an increase in the number of cases in other countries, the WHO declared the outbreak a Public Health Emergency of International Concern (PHEIC), the sixth PHEIC since the measure was first invoked during the 2009 swine flu pandemic.

sourceString: WHO Director-General Tedros Adhanom said that the PHEIC was due to "the risk of global spread, especially to low- and middle-income countries without robust health systems.
targetString: O Diretor Geral da OMS, Tedros Adhanom disse que o PHEIC foi invocado devido ao "risco de disseminação global, especialmente em países de baixa e média renda sem sistemas de saúde robustos.
en-mt: WHO Director General Tedros Adhanom said the PHEIC was invoked because of the "risk of global spread, especially in low- and middle-income countries without robust health systems.

sourceString: In response to the implementations of travel restrictions, Tedros stated that "there is no reason for measures that unnecessarily interfere with international travel and trade" and that the "WHO doesn't recommend limiting trade and movement."
targetString: Em resposta à implementação de restrições de viagem, Tedros declarou que "não há razão para medidas que interfiram de forma desnecessária em viagens internacionais e comércio" e que a "OMS não recomenda limitar o comércio e deslocamentos."
en-mt: In response to the implementation of travel restrictions, Tedros stated that "there is no reason for measures that unnecessarily interfere with international travel and trade" and that "WHO does not recommend limiting trade and travel."

sourceString: On 5 February, the WHO appealed to the global community for a $675 million contribution to fund strategic preparedness in low-income countries, citing the urgency to support those countries which "do not have the systems in place to detect people who have contracted the virus, even if it were to emerge".
targetString: Em 5 de fevereiro, a OMS apelou à comunidade global por uma contribuição de 675 milhões de dólares para financiar uma preparação estratégica em países de baixa e média renda, citando a urgência em auxiliar estes países que "não possuem sistemas em vigor para detectar as pessoas que contraíram o vírus, e mesmo que ele surja".
en-mt: On February 5, WHO appealed to the global community for a contribution of US$675 million to fund strategic preparedness in low- and middle-income countries, citing the urgency of assisting these countries that "do not have systems in place to detect people who have contracted the virus, and even if it breaks out".

sourceString: Tedros further made statements declaring that "we are only as strong as our weakest link" and urged the international community to "invest today or pay more later".On 11 February, the WHO in a press conference established COVID-19 as the name of the disease.
targetString: Tedros fez posteriores declarações indicando que "somos tão fortes quanto nosso elo mais fraco" e solicitou à comunidade internacional "invistam agora ou terão que pagar mais tarde". Em 11 de fevereiro, a OMS em uma conferência de imprensa estabeleceu COVID-19 como o nome da doença.
en-mt: Tedros made further statements indicating that "we are only as strong as our weakest link" and urged the international community to "invest now or pay later". On February 11, the WHO at a press conference established COVID-19 as the name of the disease.

sourceString: On the same day, Tedros stated that UN Secretary-General António Guterres had agreed to provide the "power of the entire UN system in the response".
targetString: No mesmo dia, Tedros declarou que o secretário-geral das Nações Unidas, António Guterres havia concordado em fornecer o "poder de todo o sistema das Nações Unidas como resposta".
en-mt: On the same day, Tedros declared that the Secretary-General of the United Nations, António Guterres, had agreed to provide the "power of the entire United Nations system in response".

sourceString: A UN Crisis Management Team was activated as a result, allowing coordination of the entire United Nations response, which the WHO states will allow them to "focus on the health response while the other agencies can bring their expertise to bear on the wider social, economic and developmental implications of the outbreak".
targetString: A Equipe de Gestão de Crise das Nações Unidas foi ativada, como resultado, permitindo a coordenação de toda a resposta das Nações Unidas, o que a OMS declara que permitirá com que eles "se concentrem na resposta de saúde enquanto outras agências podem entrar com sua experiência no âmbito social, econômico e implicações para o desenvolvimento resultantes do surto".
en-mt: The United Nations Crisis Management Team was activated as a result, allowing coordination of the entire United Nations response, which the WHO states will allow them to "focus on the health response while other agencies can step in with their experience of the social, economic and development implications resulting from the outbreak".

sourceString: On 14 February, a WHO-led Joint Mission Team with China was activated to provide international and WHO experts on the ground in China to assist in the domestic management and evaluate "the severity and the transmissibility of the disease" by hosting workshops and meetings with key national-level institutions and to conduct field visits to assess the "impact of response activities at provincial and county levels, including urban and rural settings".On 25 February, the WHO declared that "the world should do more to prepare for a possible coronavirus pandemic," stating that while it was still too early to call it a pandemic, countries should nonetheless be "in a phase of preparedness".
targetString: Em 14 de fevereiro, uma Equipe de Missão Conjunta da OMS com a China foi habilitada para fornecer aos especialistas internacionais e da OMS em terra na China um auxílio na gestão doméstica e avaliar "a gravidade e transmissibilidade da doença" através de workshops e reuniões com as principais instituições de nível nacional e realizar visitas de campo para avaliar " o impacto das atividades de resposta nos níveis de província e municípios, incluindo panoramas urbanos e rurais". Em 25 de fevereiro, a OMS declarou que "o mundo deveria fazer mais para se preparar para uma possível pandemia de Coronavírus", declarando que, embora fosse muito cedo para declarar uma pandemia, os países deveriam mesmo assim, instaurar "uma fase de preparação".
en-mt: On 14 February, a WHO-China Joint Mission Team was empowered to provide WHO and international experts on the ground in China with assistance in domestic management and assess "disease severity and transmissibility" through workshops and meetings with key institutions at the national level and conduct field visits to assess "the impact of response activities at provincial and municipal levels, including urban and rural landscapes". On February 25, the WHO declared that "the world should do more to prepare for a possible Coronavirus pandemic", stating that, although it was too early to declare a pandemic, countries should nevertheless institute "a preparedness phase ".

sourceString: In response to a developing outbreak in Iran, the WHO sent a Joint Mission Team there to assess the situation.On 28 February, WHO officials said that the coronavirus threat assessment at the global level would be raised from "high" to "very high", its highest level of alert and risk assessment.
targetString: Em resposta a um surto em desenvolvimento no Irã, a OMS enviou uma Equipe de Missão Conjunta para avaliar a situação. Em 28 de fevereiro, os funcionários da OMS disseram que a avaliação da ameaça do Coronavírus em nível global seria elevada de "alta" para "muito alta", é o maior nível de alerta e de avaliação de risco.
en-mt: In response to a developing outbreak in Iran, WHO deployed a Joint Mission Team to assess the situation. On February 28, WHO officials said that the threat assessment of the Coronavirus at the global level would be raised from "high" to "very high", it is the highest level of alert and risk assessment.

sourceString: Mike Ryan, executive director of the WHO's health emergencies program, warned in a statement that "This is a reality check for every government on the planet: Wake up.
targetString: Mike Ryan, diretor executivo do programa de emergências de saúde, avisou em uma declaração que "Esta é uma declaração da realidade para cada governo no planeta: Acordem.
en-mt: Mike Ryan, Executive Director of the Health Emergencies Program, warned in a statement that "This is a statement of reality for every government on the planet: Wake up.

sourceString: This virus may be on its way and you need to be ready," urging that the right response measures could help the world avoid "the worst of it".
targetString: Este vírus pode estar a caminho e vocês precisam estar prontos", insistindo que as medidas de resposta corretas poderiam ajudar o mundo a evitar "o pior".
en-mt: This virus could be on its way and you need to be ready", insisting that the right response measures could help the world avoid "the worst".

sourceString: Ryan further stated that the current data did not warrant public health officials to declare a global pandemic, saying that such a declaration would mean "we're essentially accepting that every human on the planet will be exposed to that virus."
targetString: Ryan ainda declarou que os dados atuais não autorizavam os oficiais de saúde pública a declarar uma pandemia global, dizendo que tal declaração significaria que "estamos essencialmente aceitando que cada humano no planeta será exposto a este vírus."
en-mt: Ryan further stated that the current data did not authorize public health officials to declare a global pandemic, saying that such a declaration would mean that "we are essentially accepting that every human on the planet will be exposed to this virus."

sourceString: On 11 March, the WHO declared the coronavirus outbreak a pandemic.
targetString: Em 11 de março, a OMS declarou o surto de Coronavírus uma pandemia.
en-mt: On March 11, the WHO declared the Coronavirus outbreak a pandemic.

sourceString: The Director-General said that the WHO was "deeply concerned both by the alarming levels of spread and severity, and by the alarming levels of inaction".The WHO has faced significant criticism for what is seen as inadequate handling of the pandemic, including the late declaration of a public health emergency and the classification of the virus as a pandemic.
targetString: O Diretor Geral disse que a OMS estava "profundamente preocupada com os níveis alarmantes de disseminação e gravidade, e pelos níveis alarmantes de inação". A OMS enfrentou muitas críticas pelo que foi visto como uma gestão inadequada da pandemia, incluindo a declaração tardia de uma emergência de saúde pública e a classificação do vírus como uma pandemia.
en-mt: The Director-General said WHO was "deeply concerned by the alarming levels of spread and severity, and by the alarming levels of inaction". The WHO faced a lot of criticism for what was seen as inadequate management of the pandemic, including late declaration of a public health emergency and classification of the virus as a pandemic.

sourceString: The backlash included a petition for the WHO Director-General Tedros Adhanom to tender his resignation, signed by 733,000 people as of 6 April.
targetString: A reação incluiu uma petição ao Diretor Geral da OMS, Tedros Adhanom para apresentar sua demissão, assinada por 733 mil pessoas em 6 de abril.
en-mt: The backlash included a petition to WHO Director General Tedros Adhanom to tender his resignation, signed by 733,000 people on 6 April.

sourceString: On 26 March 2020, dozens of UN human rights experts emphasized respecting the rights of every individual during the COVID-19 pandemic.
targetString: Em 26 de março de 2020, dezenas de especialistas dos direitos humanos das Nações Unidas enfatizaram o respeito aos direitos de cada indivíduo durante a pandemia da COVID-19.
en-mt: On March 26, 2020, dozens of United Nations human rights experts stressed respecting the rights of every individual during the COVID-19 pandemic.

sourceString: The expert group stated that everyone is entitled to life-saving interventions and the government holds this responsibility.
targetString: O grupo de especialistas declarou que todos têm o direito a intervenções para salvar a vida e que o governo é o responsável.
en-mt: The expert group declared that everyone has the right to life-saving interventions and that the government is responsible.

sourceString: The group stressed that the lack of resources or health insurance should never serve as a justification for discrimination against a specific group.
targetString: O grupo enfatizou que a falta de recursos ou plano de saúde jamais deveria servir como uma justificativa para discriminação contra um grupo específico.
en-mt: The group emphasized that a lack of resources or health care should never serve as a justification for discrimination against a specific group.

sourceString: The experts underscored that every individual has the right to health, including people with disabilities, belonging to minority groups, older people, internally displaced people, the homeless, those living in extremely poor conditions, people in detention, as well as refugees and other unspecified groups in need of government support.
targetString: Os especialistas destacaram que cada indivíduo tem o direito a saúde, incluindo pessoas com deficiência, minorias, idosos, pessoas com problemas mentais, desabrigados, os que vivem em condições de extrema pobreza, pessoas presas, bem como os refugiados e outros grupos não especificados que precisam de ajuda do governo.
en-mt: Experts highlighted that every individual has the right to health, including people with disabilities, minorities, the elderly, people with mental health problems, the homeless, those living in extreme poverty, people in prison, as well as refugees and other unspecified groups who need government assistance.
