en-mt: The test has been approved by the Food and Drug Administration under an emergency use authorization. Commercial labs began testing in early March 2020.

sourceString: As of 5 March 2020 LabCorp announced nationwide availability of COVID-19 testing based on RT-PCR.
targetString: A partir de 5 de março de 2020, o LabCorp anunciou a disponibilidade nacional do teste para o COVID-19 baseado em RT-PCR.
en-mt: Effective March 5, 2020, LabCorp announced the nationwide availability of the RT-PCR based COVID-19 test.

sourceString: Quest Diagnostics similarly made nationwide COVID-19 testing available as of 9 March 2020.
targetString: A Quest Diagnostics igualmente tornou os testes para COVID-19 nacionalmente disponíveis a partir de 9 de março de 2020.
en-mt: Quest Diagnostics also made testing for COVID-19 nationally available effective March 9, 2020.

sourceString: No quantity limitations were announced; specimen collection and processing must be performed according to CDC requirements.
targetString: Nenhuma restrição de quantidade foi anunciada; a coleta e o processamento das amostras devem ser realizados de acordo com os requisitos do CDC.
en-mt: No quantity restrictions were announced; Sample collection and processing must be performed in accordance with CDC requirements.

sourceString: In Russia, the COVID-19 test was developed and produced by the State Research Center of Virology and Biotechnology VECTOR.
targetString: Na Rússia, o teste para COVID-19 foi desenvolvido e produzido pelo Centro de Pesquisa do Estado em Virologia e Biotecnologia, VECTOR.
en-mt: In Russia, the test for COVID-19 was developed and produced by the State Research Center for Virology and Biotechnology, VECTOR.

sourceString: On 11 February 2020 the test was registered by the Federal Service for Surveillance in Healthcare.On 12 March 2020, Mayo Clinic was reported to have developed a test to detect COVID-19 infection.On 13 March 2020, Roche Diagnostics received FDA approval for a test which could be performed within 3.5 hours in high volume, thus allowing one machine to do approximately 4,128 tests in a 24-hour period.
targetString: Em 11 de fevereiro de 2020, o teste foi registrado pelo Serviço Federal de Vigilância Sanitária. Em 12 de março de 2020, a Mayo Clinic afirmou ter desenvolvido um teste para detectar a infecção por COVID-19. Em 13 de março de 2020, a Roche Diagnostics recebeu uma aprovação da FDA para um teste que poderia ser realizado no prazo de 3,5 horas em ampla escala, permitindo, assim, a uma máquina processar aproximadamente 4.128 testes em um período de 24 horas.
en-mt: On February 11, 2020, the test was registered by the Federal Health Surveillance Service. On March 12, 2020, the Mayo Clinic claimed to have developed a test to detect COVID-19 infection. On March 13, 2020, Roche Diagnostics received FDA approval for a test that could be performed within 3.5 hours on a large scale, thus allowing one machine to process approximately 4,128 tests in a 24-hour period. .

sourceString: On 19 March 2020, the FDA issued emergency use authorization (EUA) to Abbott Laboratories for a test on Abbott's m2000 system; the FDA had previously issued similar authorization to Hologic, LabCorp, and Thermo Fisher Scientific.
targetString: Em 19 de março de 2020, a FDA emitiu uma Autorização para Uso Emergencial (EUA) para os laboratórios Abbott para um teste no sistema m2000 da Abbott; a FDA emitiu previamente uma autorização para a Hologic, a LabCorp, e a Thermo Fisher Scientific.
en-mt: On March 19, 2020, the FDA issued an Emergency Use Authorization (EUA) to Abbott Laboratories for a test on the Abbott m2000 system; the FDA previously issued an authorization to Hologic, LabCorp, and Thermo Fisher Scientific.

sourceString: On 21 March 2020, Cepheid similarly received EUA from the FDA for a test that takes about 45 minutes.
targetString: Em 21 de março de 2020, a Cepheid recebeu igualmente uma EUA da FDA para um teste que leva cerca de 45 minutos.
en-mt: On March 21, 2020, Cepheid also received an EUA from the FDA for a test that takes about 45 minutes.

sourceString: The FDA has approved a test that uses isothermal nucleic acid amplification technology instead of PCR.
targetString: A FDA aprovou um teste que utiliza a tecnologia de amplificação de ácido nucleico isotérmico, em vez de PCR.
en-mt: The FDA has approved a test that uses isothermal nucleic acid amplification technology instead of PCR.

sourceString: Since this does not require a series of alternating temperature cycles this method can deliver positive results in as little as five minutes and negative results in 13 minutes.
targetString: Como não exige uma série de ciclos alternados de temperatura, esse método pode gerar resultados positivos em apenas cinco minutos e resultados negativos em 13 minutos.
en-mt: As it does not require a series of alternating temperature cycles, this method can generate positive results in as little as five minutes and negative results in 13 minutes.

sourceString: There are currently about 18,000 of these machines in the U.S. and Abbott expects to ramp up manufacturing to deliver 50,000 tests per day.A test which uses a monoclonal antibody which specifically binds to the nucleocapsid protein (N protein) of the novel coronavirus is being developed in Taiwan, with the hope that it can provide results in 15 to 20 minutes just like a rapid influenza test.
targetString: Existem atualmente cerca de 18.000 dessas máquinas nos EUA e a Abbott espera aumentar a produção para fornecer 50.000 testes por dia. Um teste que utiliza um anticorpo monoclonal e o vincula de forma particular à proteína do nucleocapsídeo (proteína N) do novo coronavírus está sendo desenvolvido em Taiwan, com a expectativa de fornecer resultados em 15 a 20 minutos tal como um teste rápido de gripe.
en-mt: There are currently about 18,000 of these machines in the US and Abbott hopes to increase production to provide 50,000 tests a day. A test that uses a monoclonal antibody and binds it particularly to the nucleocapsid protein (N protein) of the new coronavirus is being developed in Taiwan, with the expectation of providing results in 15 to 20 minutes like a rapid flu test.

sourceString: A March 2020 literature review concluded that "chest radiographs are of little diagnostic value in early stages, whereas CT [computed tomography] findings may be present even before symptom onset."
targetString: Uma revisão de literatura em março de 2020 concluiu que "as radiografias de tórax possuem um valor de diagnóstico menor nos estágios iniciais, enquanto os achados de TC, tomografia computadorizada, podem estar presentes mesmo antes do surgimento dos sintomas".
en-mt: A literature review in March 2020 concluded that "chest X-rays have a lower diagnostic value in the early stages, whereas CT findings, CT scans, may be present even before the onset of symptoms".

sourceString: Typical features on CT include bilateral multilobar ground-glass opacificities with a peripheral, asymmetric and posterior distribution.
targetString: As características típicas em TC incluem opacidades multilobares bilaterais em vidro fosco com uma distribuição posterior, periférica e assimétrica.
en-mt: Typical CT features include bilateral multilobar ground-glass opacities with a posterior, peripheral, and asymmetrical distribution.

sourceString: Subpleural dominance, crazy paving and consolidation develop as the disease evolves.
targetString: A dominância subpleural, a pavimentação em mosaico e a consolidação evoluem conforme a doença progride.
en-mt: Subpleural dominance, mosaic paving, and consolidation evolve as the disease progresses.

sourceString: A study comparing PCR to CT in Wuhan at the point of origin of the current pandemic has suggested that CT is significantly more sensitive than PCR, though less specific, with many of its imaging features overlapping with other pneumonias and disease processes.
targetString: Um estudo comparando PCR a TC em Wuhan no ponto de origem da pandemia atual sugeriu que a TC é significativamente mais sensível que o PCR, embora menos específica, com muitos de seus aspectos de imagem coincidindo com outras pneumonias e processos patológicos.
en-mt: A study comparing PCR to CT in Wuhan at the point of origin of the current pandemic suggested that CT is significantly more sensitive than PCR, although less specific, with many of its imaging features coinciding with other pneumonias and disease processes.

sourceString: As of March 2020, the American College of Radiology recommends that "CT should not be used to screen for or as a first-line test to diagnose COVID-19".As of March 2020, the CDC recommends PCR for initial screening.
targetString: A partir de março de 2020, o American College of Radiology recomenda que a "TC não deve ser utilizada para triagem ou como um teste de primeira linha para diagnosticar a COVID-19". Desde março de 2020, o CDC recomenda o PCR para uma checagem inicial.
en-mt: As of March 2020, the American College of Radiology recommends that "CT should not be used for screening or as a first-line test to diagnose COVID-19". As of March 2020, the CDC recommends PCR for an initial check.

sourceString: Part of the immune response to infection is the production of antibodies including IgM and IgG.
targetString: Parte da resposta imune à infecção é a produção de anticorpos incluindo IgM e IgG.
en-mt: Part of the immune response to infection is the production of antibodies including IgM and IgG.

sourceString: These can be used to detect infection in individuals starting 7 days or so after the onset of symptoms, to determine immunity, and in population surveillance.Assays can be performed in central laboratories (CLT) or by point-of-care testing (PoCT).
targetString: Esses podem ser utilizados para detectar a infecção em indivíduos iniciada há 7 dias ou logo após o surgimento dos sintomas, para determinar a imunidade, e no monitoramento da população. Os ensaios podem ser realizados em laboratórios centrais (CLT) ou por meio de testes laboratoriais remotos (PoCT).
en-mt: These can be used to detect infection in individuals that started 7 days ago or shortly after the onset of symptoms, to determine immunity, and in monitoring the population. Assays can be performed in central laboratories (CLT) or through remote laboratory tests (PoCT).

sourceString: The high-throughput automated systems in many clinical laboratories will be able to perform these assays but their availability will depend on the rate of production for each system.
targetString: Os sistemas automatizados de alta produtividade em muitos laboratórios clínicos serão capazes de realizar esses testes, mas sua disponibilidade dependerá da taxa de produção de cada sistema.
en-mt: High throughput automated systems in many clinical laboratories will be capable of performing these tests, but their availability will depend on the production rate of each system.

sourceString: For CLT a single specimen of peripheral blood is commonly used, although serial specimens can be used to follow the immune response.
targetString: Para CLT, uma única amostra de sangue periférico é comumente utilizada, embora inúmeras amostras possam ser utilizadas para acompanhar a resposta imune.
en-mt: For CLT, a single peripheral blood sample is commonly used, although multiple samples can be used to follow the immune response.

sourceString: For PoCT a single specimen of blood is usually obtained by skin puncture.
targetString: Para PoCT, uma única amostra de sangue é geralmente obtida por punção cutânea.
en-mt: For PoCT, a single blood sample is usually obtained by skin prick.

sourceString: Unlike PCR methods an extraction step is not needed before assay.On March 26, 2020, the FDA named 29 entities that provided notification to the agency as required and are now therefore able to distribute their antibody tests.
targetString: Ao contrário dos métodos de PCR, a etapa de coleta não é necessária antes do teste. Em 26 de março de 2020, a FDA indicou 29 entidades que notificaram à agência, conforme requerido, e a partir de agora estão aptas a distribuir seus testes de anticorpos.
en-mt: Unlike PCR methods, the collection step is not required prior to testing. As of March 26, 2020, the FDA has named 29 entities that have notified the agency, as required, and are now able to distribute their antibody tests.

sourceString: As of April 7, 2020, only a single test has been approved by the FDA under an emergency use authorization.In late March 2020, Euroimmun Medical Laboratory Diagnostics and Epitope Diagnostics received European approvals for their test kits, which can detect IgG and IgA antibodies against the virus in blood samples.
targetString: A partir de 7 de abril de 2020, somente um teste foi aprovado pela FDA com uma autorização para uso emergencial. No final de março de 2020, a Euroimmun Medical Laboratory Diagnostics e a Epitope Diagnostics receberam aprovações europeias para seus kits de testes, que podem detectar anticorpos IgG e IgA para o vírus em amostras de sangue.
en-mt: As of April 7, 2020, only one test has been approved by the FDA with an authorization for emergency use. In late March 2020, Euroimmun Medical Laboratory Diagnostics and Epitope Diagnostics received European approvals for their test kits, which can detect IgG and IgA antibodies to the virus in blood samples.

sourceString: The testing capacity is several hundred samples within hours and therefore much faster than the conventional PCR assay of viral RNA.
targetString: A capacidade de testagem é de várias centenas de amostras em questão de horas e, portanto, muito mais rápido do que os testes PCR convencionais de RNA viral.
en-mt: Testing capacity is several hundred samples in a matter of hours and therefore much faster than conventional viral RNA PCR tests.

sourceString: The antibodies are usually detectable 14 days after the onset of the infection.In early April, the UK found none of the antibody test kits it purchased were sufficiently good to use.
targetString: Os anticorpos são normalmente detectados 14 dias após o início da infecção. No início de abril, o Reino Unido considerou que nenhum dos kits de testes de anticorpos adquiridos eram adequados o bastante para serem utilizados.
en-mt: Antibodies are usually detected 14 days after the onset of infection. In early April, the UK considered that none of the purchased antibody test kits were suitable enough to use.

sourceString: Hong Kong has set up a scheme where suspected patients can stay home, "emergency department will give a specimen tube to the patient", they spit into it, send it back and get a test result a while after.The British NHS has announced that it is piloting a scheme to test suspected cases at home, which removes the risk of a patient infecting others if they come to a hospital or having to disinfect an ambulance if one is used.In drive-through testing for COVID-19 for suspected cases, a healthcare professional takes sample using appropriate precautions.
targetString: Hong Kong organizou um sistema no qual os pacientes suspeitos podem ficam em casa, "o departamento de emergência dará um tubo de amostragem para o paciente", eles devem expelir saliva no tubo, mandá-lo de volta e obter um resultado pouco tempo depois. O NHS britânico anunciou que está coordenando um sistema para testar os casos suspeitos em casa, o que elimina o risco de um paciente infectar outros se eles forem ao hospital ou a necessidade de desinfectar uma ambulância se alguma for utilizada. Nos testes de drive-thru para a COVID-19 em casos suspeitos, um profissional de saúde coleta amostras tomando as precauções apropriadas.
en-mt: Hong Kong has set up a system where suspected patients can stay at home, "the emergency department will give the patient a sampling tube", they must expel saliva into the tube, send it back and get a result shortly afterwards. The British NHS has announced that it is co-ordinating a system to test suspected cases at home, which eliminates the risk of a patient infecting others if they go to hospital or the need to disinfect an ambulance if one is used. In drive-thru testing for COVID-19 in suspected cases, a healthcare professional collects samples taking appropriate precautions.

sourceString: Drive-through centers have helped South Korea do some of the fastest, most-extensive testing of any country.In Germany, the National Association of Statutory Health Insurance Physicians said on 2 March, that it had a capacity for about 12,000 tests per day in the ambulatory setting and 10.700 had been tested in the prior week.
targetString: Centros de drive-thru têm ajudado a Coreia do Sul a realizar alguns dos testes mais rápidos e abrangentes de um país. Na Alemanha, a Associação Nacional de Médicos Estatutários de Seguro de Saúde afirmou em 2 de março que tinha capacidade para cerca de 12.000 testes por dia em atendimento ambulatorial, sendo que 10.700 tinham sido testados na semana anterior.
en-mt: Drive-thru centers have helped South Korea conduct some of the fastest and most comprehensive testing in a country. In Germany, the National Association of Statutory Health Insurance Physicians said on March 2 that it had capacity for around 12,000 tests a day in outpatient care, with 10,700 tested in the previous week.

sourceString: Costs are borne by the health insurance when the test is ordered by a physician.
targetString: Os custos ficam a cargo do seguro de saúde quando o teste é solicitado por um médico.
en-mt: The costs are covered by the health insurance when the test is requested by a doctor.

sourceString: According to the president of the Robert Koch Institute, Germany has an overall capacity for 160,000 tests per week.
targetString: Segundo o presidente do Instituto Robert Koch, a Alemanha tem uma capacidade total para 160 mil testes por semana.
en-mt: According to the president of the Robert Koch Institute, Germany has a total capacity for 160,000 tests per week.

sourceString: As of 19 March drive in tests were offered in several large cities.
targetString: Desde 19 de março, testes em drive-in foram oferecidos em várias cidades grandes.
en-mt: As of March 19, drive-in trials have been offered in several major cities.

sourceString: As of 26 March 2020 the total number of tests performed in Germany was unknown, because only positive results are reported.
targetString: Desde 26 de março de 2020, o número total de testes realizado na Alemanha permanece desconhecido, já que apenas os testes positivos são registrados.
en-mt: As of March 26, 2020, the total number of tests carried out in Germany remains unknown, as only positive tests are recorded.

sourceString: A first lab survey revealed that as of calendar week 12/2020 a total of at least 483,295 samples were tested up to and including week 12/2020 and 33,491 samples (6.9%) tested positive for SARS-CoV-2.In Israel, researchers at Technion and Rambam Hospital developed and tested a method for testing samples from 64 patients simultaneously, by pooling the samples and only testing further if the combined sample is found to be positive.In Wuhan a makeshift 2000-sq-meter emergency detection laboratory named "Huo-Yan" (Chinese: 火眼, or "Fire Eye" in English) was opened on 5 February 2020 by BGI, which can process over 10,000 samples a day.
targetString: O primeiro laboratório de pesquisa revelou que desde a 12º semana de 2020 um total de, no mínimo, 483.295 amostras foram testadas até a 12° semana de 2020 e 33.491 amostras (6,9%) testaram positivo para o SARS-CoV-2. Em Israel, pesquisadores dos hospitais Technion e Rambam desenvolveram e testaram um método para testar amostras de 64 pacientes simultaneamente, reunindo as amostras e realizando testes adicionais apenas se a amostra combinada fosse considerada como positiva. Em Wuhan, um laboratório improvisado de 2000 m² para detecção de emergência chamado "Huo-Yan" (chinês: 火眼, ou "Fire Eye" em inglês) foi aberto em 5 de fevereiro de 2020 pela BGI, o qual pode processar mais de 10 mil amostras por dia.
en-mt: The first research lab revealed that as of Week 12 2020 a total of at least 483,295 samples were tested through Week 12 2020 and 33,491 samples (6.9%) tested positive for SARS-CoV-2. In Israel, researchers at Technion and Rambam hospitals developed and tested a method to test samples from 64 patients simultaneously, pooling the samples and performing additional tests only if the combined sample was found to be positive. In Wuhan, a 2000 m² makeshift laboratory for emergency detection called "Huo-Yan" (Chinese: 火眼, or "Fire Eye" in English) was opened on February 5, 2020 by BGI, which can process more than 10 thousand samples per day.

sourceString: With the construction overseen by BGI-founder Wang Jian and taking 5-days, modelling has show cases in Hubei would have been 47% higher and the corresponding cost of the tackling the quarantine would have doubled if this testing capacity hadn't come on line.
targetString: Com a construção supervisionada pelo fundador da BGI, Wang Jian, e levando 5 dias, a modelagem revelou que os casos em Hubei teriam sido 47% maiores e o custo correspondente para lidar com a quarentena teria dobrado se essa capacidade de testagem não tivesse um acesso on-line.
en-mt: With construction overseen by BGI founder Wang Jian and taking 5 days, modeling revealed that cases in Hubei would have been 47% higher and the corresponding cost of dealing with quarantine would have doubled if this testing capacity did not have access. online.

sourceString: The Wuhan Laboratory has been promptly followed by Huo-Yan labs in Shenzhen, Tianjin, Beijing, and Shanghai, in a total of 12 cities across China.
targetString: O laboratório Wuhan foi prontamente seguido pelos laboratórios Huo-Yan em in Shenzhen, Tianjin, Pequim, e Xangai, em um total de 12 cidades em toda China.
en-mt: The Wuhan lab was promptly followed by the Huo-Yan labs in Shenzhen, Tianjin, Beijing, and Shanghai, in a total of 12 cities across China.

sourceString: By 4 March 2020 the daily throughput totals were 50,000 tests per day.Open source, multiplexed designs released by Origami Assays have been released that can test as many as 1122 patient samples for COVID19 using only 93 assays .  These balanced designs can be run in small laboratories without the need for robotic liquid handlers.
targetString: Em 4 de março de 2020, o total do rendimento diário era de 50 mil testes por dia. Modelos multiplexados de código aberto divulgados pela Origami Assays foram lançados como capazes de testar até 1.122 amostras de pacientes para COVID-19, utilizando apenas 93 ensaios. Esses modelos balanceados podem ser executados em pequenos laboratórios sem a necessidade de manipuladores robóticos para os líquidos.
en-mt: As of March 4, 2020, the total daily throughput is 50,000 tests per day. Open source multiplexed models released by Origami Assays were released as capable of testing up to 1,122 patient samples for COVID-19, utilizing just 93 assays. These balanced models can be run in small labs without the need for robotic liquid handlers.

sourceString: By March, shortages and insufficient amounts of reagent has become a bottleneck for mass testing in the EU and UK and the US.
targetString: Em março, a escassez ou quantidades insuficientes de reagente tornou-se um entrave para a testagem em massa na União Europeia, no Reino Unido e nos EUA.
en-mt: In March, shortages or insufficient quantities of the reagent became an impediment to mass testing in the European Union, the United Kingdom and the United States.

sourceString: This has led some authors to explore sample preparation protocols that involve heating samples at 98 °C (208 °F) for 5 minutes to release RNA genomes for further testing.On 31 March it was announced United Arab Emirates was now testing more of its population for Coronavirus per head than any other country, and was on track to scale up the level of testing to reach the bulk of the population.
targetString: Isso levou alguns autores a estudar os protocolos de preparação das amostras que envolvem o aquecimento das amostras a 98 °C (208 °F) por 5 minutos para liberar os genomas do RNA para testes adicionais. Em 31 de março, foi divulgado que os Emirados Árabes Unidos agora estão fazendo mais testes por habitante em sua população para o Coronavírus do que outros países, e estariam a caminho de aumentar o nível de testagem e atingir a maior parte da população.
en-mt: This has led some authors to study sample preparation protocols that involve heating samples to 98 °C (208 °F) for 5 minutes to release the RNA genomes for further testing. On March 31, it was reported that the UAE is now doing more testing per inhabitant of its population for the Coronavirus than other countries, and would be on track to increase the level of testing and reach the majority of the population.

sourceString: This was through a combination of drive-through capability, and purchasing a population-scale mass-throughput laboratory from Group 42 and BGI (based on their "Huo-Yan" emergency detection laboratories in China).
targetString: Isso se deu por uma combinação da capacidade drive-thru, e aquisição de um laboratório para processamento em massa de escala populacional do Grupo 42 e da BGI (inspirado por seus laboratórios de detecção emergencial "Huo-Yan" na China).
en-mt: This came about through a combination of drive-thru capability, and acquisition of a population-scale mass processing lab from Group 42 and BGI (inspired by their "Huo-Yan" emergency detection labs in China).

sourceString: Constructed in 14 days, the lab is capable of conducting tens of thousands RT-PCR tests per day and is the first in the world of this scale to be operational outside of China.
targetString: Construído em 14 dias, o laboratório é capaz de conduzir dezenas de milhares de testes RT-PCR por dia e é o primeiro do mundo dessa escala a funcionar fora da China.
en-mt: Built in 14 days, the lab is capable of conducting tens of thousands of RT-PCR tests a day and is the first in the world of this scale to operate outside of China.

sourceString: Different testing recipes targeting different parts of the coronavirus genetic profile were developed in China, France, Germany, Hong Kong, Japan, and the United States.
targetString: Diferentes métodos de testes voltados para diferentes componentes do perfil genético do coronavírus foram desenvolvidos na China, na França, na Alemanha, em Hong Kong, no Japão e nos Estados Unidos.
en-mt: Different testing methods targeting different components of the genetic profile of the coronavirus have been developed in China, France, Germany, Hong Kong, Japan and the United States.

sourceString: The World Health Organization adopted the German recipe for manufacturing kits sent to low-income countries without the resources to develop their own.
targetString: A Organização Mundial de Saúde adotou o método da Alemanha para a fabricação de kits enviados para os países de baixo rendimento que não possuem recurso para desenvolver os seus próprios.
en-mt: The World Health Organization has adopted Germany's method for making kits sent to low-income countries that lack the resources to develop their own.

sourceString: The German recipe was published on 17 January 2020; the protocol developed by the United States Centers for Disease Control was not available until 28 January, delaying available tests in the U.S.China and the United States had problems with the reliability of test kits early in the outbreak, and these countries and Australia were unable to supply enough kits to satisfy demand and recommendations for testing by health experts.
targetString: O método alemão foi divulgado em 17 de janeiro de 2020; o protocolo desenvolvido pelo Centro de Controle de Doenças dos Estados Unidos não estava disponível até 28 de janeiro, houve atraso nos testes disponibilizados para os EUA e para a China e os Estados Unidos enfrentaram problemas com a confiabilidade dos kits de testes bem no início do surto, além disso, esses países junto da Austrália não conseguiram fornecer kits suficientes para satisfazer a demanda e as recomendações para testagem feitas por profissionais da saúde.
en-mt: The German method was released on January 17, 2020; the protocol developed by the US Centers for Disease Control was not available until January 28, there was a delay in tests being made available to the US and China, and the US faced problems with the reliability of test kits very early in the outbreak , in addition, these countries together with Australia have not been able to supply enough kits to satisfy the demand and recommendations for testing made by health professionals.

sourceString: In contrast, experts say South Korea's broad availability of testing helped reduce the spread of the novel coronavirus.
targetString: Em contrapartida, os especialistas afirmam que a ampla disponibilidade da Coreia do Sul para a testagem ajudou a reduzir a propagação do novo coronavírus.
en-mt: On the other hand, experts say that South Korea's wide availability for testing has helped to reduce the spread of the new coronavirus.

sourceString: Testing capacity, largely in private sector labs, was built up over several years by the South Korean government.
targetString: A capacidade de teste, em grande parte nos laboratórios do setor privado, foi consolidada ao longo de muitos anos pelo governo da Coreia do Sul.
en-mt: Testing capacity, largely in private sector labs, has been built up over many years by the government of South Korea.

sourceString: On 16 March, the World Health Organization called for ramping up the testing programmes as the best way to slow the advance of COVID-19 pandemic.High demand for testing due to wide spread of the virus caused backlogs of hundreds of thousands of tests at private U.S. labs, and supplies of swabs and chemical reagents became strained.
targetString: Em 16 de março, a Organização Mundial de Saúde indicou o reforço dos programas de testes como a melhor forma de retardar o avanço da pandemia da COVID-19. A elevada demanda por testes devido à ampla disseminação do vírus provocou o atraso de centenas de milhares de testes em laboratórios privados dos EUA, e o fornecimento de cotonetes e reagentes químicos foi afetado.
en-mt: On March 16, the World Health Organization named strengthening testing programs as the best way to slow the spread of the COVID-19 pandemic. High demand for testing due to the widespread spread of the virus has delayed hundreds of thousands of tests at private US labs, and the supply of swabs and chemical reagents has been affected.

sourceString: In March 2020 China reported problems with accuracy in their test kits.
targetString: Em março de 2020, a China relatou problemas com precisão em seus kits de testes.
en-mt: In March 2020, China reported problems with accuracy in its test kits.

sourceString: In the United States, the test kits developed by the CDC had "flaws;" the government then removed the bureaucratic barriers that had prevented private testing.Spain purchased test kits from Chinese firm  Shenzhen Bioeasy Biotechnology Co Ltd, but found that results were inaccurate.
targetString: Nos Estados Unidos, os kits de testes desenvolvidos pelo CDC apresentaram "falhas"; o governo, então, retirou as barreiras burocráticas que impediam os testes particulares. A Espanha adquiriu kits de testes da empresa chinesa Shenzhen Bioeasy Biotechnology Co Ltd, mas considerou os resultados imprecisos.
en-mt: In the United States, test kits developed by the CDC were "flawed"; the government then removed the bureaucratic barriers that prevented private testing. Spain purchased test kits from Chinese company Shenzhen Bioeasy Biotechnology Co Ltd, but found the results to be inaccurate.

sourceString: The firm explained that the incorrect results may be a result of a failure to collect samples or use the kits correctly.
targetString: A empresa explicou que os resultados incorretos poderiam ser consequência de uma falha na coleta de amostras ou do uso incorreto dos kits.
en-mt: The company explained that the incorrect results could be the result of a failure to collect samples or incorrect use of the kits.

sourceString: The Spanish ministry said it will withdraw the kits that returned incorrect results, and would replace them with a different testing kit provided by Shenzhen Bioeasy.80% of test kits the Czech Republic purchased from China gave wrong results.Slovakia purchased 1.2 million test kits from China which were found to be inaccurate.
targetString: O ministro da Espanha afirmou que cancelaria os kits que geraram resultados incorretos e os substituiria por um kit diferente de testagem fornecido pela Shenzhen Bioeasy. 80% dos kits de testes que a República Tcheca comprou da China geraram resultados errados. A Eslováquia adquiriu 1,2 milhões de kits de testes da China considerados imprecisos.
en-mt: Spain's minister said he would cancel the kits that generated incorrect results and replace them with a different testing kit provided by Shenzhen Bioeasy. 80% of the test kits that the Czech Republic bought from China gave wrong results. Slovakia purchased 1.2 million test kits from China that were found to be inaccurate.

sourceString: Prime Minister Matovič suggested these be dumped into the Danube.Ateş Kara of the Turkish Health Ministry said the test kits Turkey purchased from China had a "high error rate" and did not "put them into use."The UK purchased 3.5 million test kits from China but in early April 2020 announced these were not usable.
targetString: O primeiro-ministro Matovic sugeriu que eles seriam descartados no Danúbio. Ates Kara do Ministério de Saúde da Turquia disse que os kits de testes da Turquia comprados da China tinham uma "taxa de erro elevada" e que não "os utilizaria". O Reino Unido adquiriu 3,5 milhões de kits de testes da China, mas no início de abril de 2020 anunciou que eles não eram úteis.
en-mt: Prime Minister Matovic suggested they would be dropped into the Danube. Ates Kara of Turkey's Ministry of Health said that Turkey's test kits purchased from China had a "high error rate" and that he would not "use them". The UK purchased 3.5 million testing kits from China, but in early April 2020 announced that they were not usable.

sourceString: Testing, followed with quarantine of those who tested positive and tracing of those with whom the SARS-CoV-2 positive people had had contact, resulted in positive outcomes.
targetString: A testagem, seguida da quarentena daqueles que testaram positivo e do monitoramento daqueles com os quais as pessoas positivas para o SARS-CoV-2 tiveram contato, tiveram resultados positivos.
en-mt: Testing, followed by quarantining those who tested positive and monitoring those with whom SARS-CoV-2 positive people came into contact, yielded positive results.

sourceString: Researchers working in the Italian town of Vò, the site of the first COVID-19 death in Italy, conducted two rounds of testing on the entire population of about 3,400 people, about ten days apart.
targetString: Os pesquisadores que atuam na cidade italiana de Vò, o local da primeira morte por COVID-19 na Itália, realizaram duas etapas de testagem de toda a população de aproximadamente 3.400 pessoas, com um intervalo de cerca de dez dias.
en-mt: The researchers working in the Italian town of Vò, the site of the first COVID-19 death in Italy, carried out two stages of testing the entire population of approximately 3,400 people, with an interval of about ten days.

sourceString: About half the people testing positive had no symptoms, and all discovered cases were quarantined.
targetString: Cerca de metade das pessoas que testaram positivo não tinham nenhum sintoma, e todos os casos descobertos foram colocados em quarentena.
en-mt: About half of those who tested positive had no symptoms, and all discovered cases were quarantined.

sourceString: With travel to the commune restricted, this eliminated new infections completely.
targetString: Com o deslocamento para a comuna restringido, isso eliminou novas infecções completamente.
en-mt: With travel to the commune restricted, this eliminated new infections completely.

sourceString: With aggressive contact tracing, inbound travel restrictions, testing, and quarantining, the 2020 coronavirus pandemic in Singapore has proceeded much more slowly than in other developed countries, but without extreme restrictions like forced closure of restaurants and retail establishments.
targetString: Com o monitoramento agressivo do contato, restrições de viagem para o país, testagem e quarentena, a pandemia do coronavírus em 2020 em Singapura tem avançado de forma bem mais lenta do que em outros países desenvolvidos, e sem restrições radicais como o fechamento obrigatório de restaurantes e estabelecimentos de vendas.
en-mt: With aggressive contact monitoring, travel restrictions to the country, testing and quarantine, the 2020 coronavirus pandemic in Singapore has been progressing much slower than in other developed countries, and without radical restrictions such as mandatory restaurant closures. and sales outlets.

sourceString: Many events have been cancelled, and Singapore did start advising residents to stay at home on 28 March, but schools reopened on time after holiday break on 23 March.
targetString: Muitos eventos foram cancelados, e Singapura começou a aconselhar seriamente os habitantes a ficarem em casa em 28 de março, mas as escolas reabriram dentro do previsto após as férias em 23 de março.
en-mt: Many events were cancelled, and Singapore began to seriously advise residents to stay at home on March 28, but schools reopened on schedule after the holidays on March 23.

sourceString: Several other countries have also managed the pandemic with aggressive contact tracing, inbound travel restrictions, testing, and quarantining, but with less aggressive lock-downs, such as Iceland and South Korea.
targetString: Muitos outros países também têm administrado a pandemia com monitoramento agressivo de contato, restrições de viagem para o país, testagem e quarentena, mas com lockdowns menos agressivos, como a Islândia e a Coreia do Sul.
en-mt: Many other countries have also been managing the pandemic with aggressive contact monitoring, in-country travel restrictions, testing and quarantine, but with less aggressive lockdowns, such as Iceland and South Korea.

sourceString: A statistical study has found that countries that have tested more, relative to the number of deaths, have much lower case fatality rates, probably because these countries are better able to detect those with only mild or no symptoms.
targetString: Um estudo estatístico identificou que os países que realizaram mais testes, em relação ao número de mortes, tiveram mais taxas de mortalidade inferiores, provavelmente porque esses países são mais capazes de detectar aqueles com nenhum ou pouco sintoma.
en-mt: A statistical study identified that countries that performed more tests, relative to the number of deaths, had lower mortality rates, probably because these countries are better able to detect those with no or few symptoms.

sourceString: WHO recommends that countries that do not have testing capacity and national laboratories with limited experience on COVID-19 send their first five positives and the first ten negative COVID-19 samples to one of the 16 WHO reference laboratories for confirmatory testing.
targetString: A OMS recomenda que os países que não possuem capacidade de testagem e tenham laboratórios nacionais com experiência limitada em COVID-19 enviem suas cinco primeiras amostras positivas e as dez primeiras amostras negativas para um dos 16 laboratórios de referência da OMS para testes confirmatórios.
en-mt: WHO recommends that countries that lack testing capacity and have national laboratories with limited experience in COVID-19 send their first five positive samples and first ten negative samples to one of the 16 WHO reference laboratories for confirmatory testing.

sourceString: Out of the 16 reference laboratories, 7 are in Asia, 5 in Europe, 2 in Africa, 1 in North America and 1 in Australia.
targetString: Dos 16 laboratórios de referência, 7 estão na Ásia, 5 na Europa, 2 na África, 1 na América do Norte e 1 na Austrália.
en-mt: Of the 16 reference laboratories, 7 are in Asia, 5 in Europe, 2 in Africa, 1 in North America and 1 in Australia.

sourceString: In the following chart, the column “Positive as % of tests” is influenced by the country's testing policy.
targetString: Na tabela seguinte, a coluna "Positivo em % de testes" é influenciada pela política de testagem dos países.
en-mt: In the following table, the column "Positive in % of tests" is influenced by the countries' testing policy.

sourceString: A country that only tests people admitted to hospitals will have a higher positive as % of tests than a country that tests all citizens, whether or not they are showing symptoms, other things being equal.
targetString: Um país que testa apenas pessoas internadas em hospitais terá uma maior % de testes positivos do que um país que tenha testado todos os cidadãos, quer eles apresentem ou não sintomas, as demais características são equivalentes.
en-mt: A country that tests only people admitted to hospitals will have a higher % of positive tests than a country that has tested all citizens, whether or not they have symptoms, other characteristics are equivalent.

sourceString: Hand washing (or handwashing), also known as hand hygiene, is the act of cleaning one's hands for the purpose of removing soil, grease, microorganisms, or other unwanted substances.
targetString: A lavagem das mãos (ou limpeza das mãos), também conhecida como higienização das mãos, é o ato de lavar as mãos com a finalidade de remover sujeira, gordura, microrganismos, ou outras substâncias indesejadas.
en-mt: Handwashing (or hand cleaning), also known as hand hygiene, is the act of washing hands for the purpose of removing dirt, grease, microorganisms, or other unwanted substances.

sourceString: Hand washing with soap consistently at certain "critical moments" during the day prevents the spread of many diseases, for example diarrhoea and cholera, which are transmitted through fecal–oral route.
targetString: A lavagem das mãos com sabão constantemente em determinados "momentos críticos" durante o dia previne a disseminação de muitas doenças, como, por exemplo, diarreia e cólera, que são transmitidas por rota oro-fecal.
en-mt: Washing hands with soap constantly at certain "critical moments" during the day prevents the spread of many diseases, such as diarrhea and cholera, which are transmitted via the oro-fecal route.

sourceString: People can also become infected with respiratory diseases such as influenza or the common cold, for example, if they do not wash their hands before touching their eyes, nose, or mouth (i.e., mucous membranes).
targetString: As pessoas também podem ser infectadas com doenças respiratórias como a gripe ou um resfriado comum, por exemplo, caso elas não lavem suas mãos antes de tocar os olhos, o nariz ou a boca (ou seja, as mucosas).
en-mt: People can also become infected with respiratory illnesses like the flu or a common cold, for example, if they don't wash their hands before touching their eyes, nose or mouth (ie mucous membranes).

sourceString: The five critical moments during the day where washing hands with soap is important include: before and after defecation, after cleaning a child's bottom or changing nappies, before feeding a child, before eating and before and after preparing food or handling raw meat, fish, or poultry.
targetString: Os cinco momentos cruciais durante o dia quando lavar as mãos com sabão é importante incluem: antes e após a defecação, após limpar o bumbum da criança ou trocar fraldas, antes de alimentar uma criança, antes das refeições e antes e depois de preparar o alimento ou manusear carne, franco ou peixe crus.
en-mt: The five crucial times during the day when handwashing with soap is important include: before and after defecation, after wiping a child's bottom or changing diapers, before feeding a child, before meals, and before and after preparing food. or handling raw meat, franks or fish.

sourceString: If water and soap are not available, hands can be cleaned with ash.The World Health Organization recommends washing hands:
targetString: Se água e sabão não estiverem disponíveis, as mãos podem ser higienizadas com cinzas. A Organização Mundial de Saúde recomenda a higienização das mãos:
en-mt: If soap and water are not available, hands can be washed with ash. The World Health Organization recommends hand hygiene:

sourceString: Before, during, and after preparing food.
targetString: Antes, durante e depois de preparar o alimento.
en-mt: Before, during and after preparing food.

sourceString: Before and after caring for a sick person.
targetString: Antes e depois de cuidar de uma pessoa doente.
en-mt: Before and after caring for a sick person.

sourceString: After changing the diapers or cleaning up a child who has used the toilet.
targetString: Depois de trocar fraldas ou limpar uma criança que tenha usado o banheiro.
en-mt: After changing diapers or cleaning up a child who has used the bathroom.

sourceString: After blowing your nose, coughing or sneezing.
targetString: Depois de assoar o nariz, tossir ou espirrar.
en-mt: After blowing your nose, coughing or sneezing.

sourceString: After touching animal, animal feed, or animal waste.
targetString: Depois de tocar animal, ração ou dejetos de animais.
en-mt: After touching animal, feed or animal waste.

sourceString: Medical hand hygiene refers to hygiene practices related to medical procedures.
targetString: A higienização clínica das mãos refere-se às práticas de higiene relacionadas aos procedimentos médicos.
en-mt: Clinical hand hygiene refers to hygiene practices related to medical procedures.

sourceString: Hand washing before administering medicine or medical care can prevent or minimize the spread of disease.
targetString: A lavagem das mãos antes de administrar remédios ou de cuidados médicos pode prevenir ou minimizar a propagação de doenças.
en-mt: Hand washing before administering medicine or medical care can prevent or minimize the spread of disease.

sourceString: The main medical purpose of washing hands is to cleanse the hands of pathogens (bacteria, viruses, or other microorganisms that can cause disease) and chemicals which can cause harm or diseases.
targetString: O principal objetivo de lavar as mãos é limpar as mãos de patógenos (bactérias, vírus, ou outros microrganismos que possam causar doenças) e substâncias químicas que podem provocar danos ou doenças.
en-mt: The main purpose of hand washing is to clean the hands of pathogens (bacteria, viruses, or other microorganisms that can cause illness) and chemicals that can cause harm or illness.

sourceString: This is especially important for people who handle food or work in the medical field, but also an important practice for the general public.
targetString: Isso é particularmente importante para pessoas que manuseiam alimentos ou trabalham na área médica, mas também é uma prática importante para o público em geral.
en-mt: This is particularly important for people who handle food or work in the medical field, but it is also an important practice for the general public.

sourceString: Hand washing has many health benefits, including minimizing the spread of influenza, coronavirus, and other infectious diseases; preventing infectious causes of diarrhea; decreasing respiratory infections;
targetString: A lavagem das mãos tem muitos benefícios para a saúde, incluindo a redução da propagação da gripe, do coronavírus e de outras doenças infecciosas; prevenindo as causas infecciosas de diarreia; reduzindo as infecções respiratórias;
en-mt: Handwashing has many health benefits, including reducing the spread of the flu, coronavirus and other infectious diseases; preventing the infectious causes of diarrhea; reducing respiratory infections;

sourceString: and reducing infant mortality rate at home birth deliveries.
targetString: e diminuindo a taxa de mortalidade infantil em partos feitos em casa.
en-mt: and lowering the infant mortality rate in home births.

sourceString: A 2013 study showed that improved hand washing practices may lead to small improvements in the length growth in children under five years of age.
targetString: Um estudo de 2013 revelou que melhores práticas para a lavagem das mãos podem provocar pequenas melhorias no crescimento de crianças com menos de cinco anos de idade.
en-mt: A 2013 study found that better handwashing practices can lead to small growth improvements in children under five years of age.

sourceString: In developing countries, childhood mortality rates related to respiratory and diarrheal diseases can be reduced by introducing simple behavioral changes, such as hand washing with soap.
targetString: Em países desenvolvidos, as taxas de mortalidade infantil relacionadas a doenças de diarreia e respiratórias podem ser reduzidas pela simples introdução de mudanças comportamentais, como lavar as mãos com sabão.
en-mt: In developed countries, infant mortality rates related to diarrhea and respiratory illnesses can be reduced simply by introducing behavioral changes, such as washing hands with soap.

sourceString: This simple action can reduce the rate of mortality from these diseases by almost 50%.
targetString: Essa simples atitude pode reduzir a taxa de mortalidade dessas doenças em quase 50%.
en-mt: This simple attitude can reduce the mortality rate of these diseases by almost 50%.

sourceString: Interventions that promote hand washing can reduce diarrhoea episodes by about a third, and this is comparable to providing clean water in low income areas.
targetString: Intervenções que promovem a lavagem das mãos podem reduzir episódios de diarreia em cerca de um terço, o que é comparável a fornecer água limpa para áreas carentes.
en-mt: Interventions that promote handwashing can reduce episodes of diarrhea by about a third, which is comparable to providing clean water to underserved areas.

sourceString: 48% of reductions in diarrhoea episodes can be associated with hand washing with soap.Hand washing with soap is the single most effective and inexpensive way to prevent diarrhea and acute respiratory infections (ARI), as automatic behavior performed in homes, schools, and communities worldwide.
targetString: 48% das reduções em episódios de diarreia podem estar associadas à lavagem das mãos com sabão. A lavagem das mãos com sabão é a forma mais efetiva e econômica de prevenir diarreia e infecções respiratórias agudas (IRA), como comportamento automático realizada em casas, escolas, e comunidades em todo o mundo.
en-mt: 48% of reductions in diarrheal episodes can be associated with hand washing with soap. Handwashing with soap is the most effective and cost-effective way to prevent diarrhea and acute respiratory infections (ARI), as an automatic behavior performed in homes, schools, and communities around the world.

sourceString: Pneumonia, a major ARI, is the number one cause of mortality among children under five years old, taking the lives of an estimated 1.8 million children per year.
targetString: A pneumonia, principal IRA, é a primeira causa de mortalidade entre crianças menores de cinco anos, tirando a vida de estimadas 1,8 milhões de crianças por ano.
en-mt: Pneumonia, the main ARI, is the leading cause of mortality among children under five years of age, claiming the lives of an estimated 1.8 million children per year.

sourceString: Diarrhea and pneumonia together account for almost 3.5 million child deaths annually.
targetString: A diarreia e a pneumonia juntas são responsáveis por quase 3,5 milhões de mortes de crianças anualmente.
en-mt: Diarrhea and pneumonia together are responsible for nearly 3.5 million child deaths annually.

sourceString: According to UNICEF, turning hand washing with soap before eating and after using the toilet into an ingrained habit can save more lives than any single vaccine or medical intervention, cutting deaths from diarrhea by almost half and deaths from acute respiratory infections by one-quarter.
targetString: De acordo com a UNICEF, transformar a lavagem das mãos com sabão antes de comer e depois de usar o banheiro em um hábito arraigado pode salvar mais vidas do que qualquer vacina ou intervenção médica, reduzindo as mortes por diarreia quase pela metade e as mortes de infecções respiratórias agudas em um quarto.
en-mt: According to UNICEF, making handwashing with soap before eating and after using the toilet an ingrained habit could save more lives than any vaccine or medical intervention, cutting deaths from diarrhea by nearly half and deaths from acute respiratory infections in one room.

sourceString: Hand washing is usually integrated together with other sanitation interventions as part of water, sanitation and hygiene (WASH) programmes.
targetString: A lavagem das mãos é geralmente associada a outras intervenções sanitárias como parte dos programas de água, saneamento e instalações de higiene (WASH).
en-mt: Handwashing is usually associated with other health interventions as part of water, sanitation and hygiene facilities (WASH) programmes.

sourceString: Hand washing also protects against impetigo which is transmitted through direct physical contact.
targetString: A lavagem das mãos também protege contra o impetigo que é transmitido por contato físico direto.
en-mt: Hand washing also protects against impetigo which is transmitted by direct physical contact.

sourceString: A small detrimental effect of hand washing is that frequent hand washing can lead to skin damage due to drying of the skin.
targetString: Um efeito negativo menos significante da lavagem das mãos é que a lavagem frequente das mãos pode provocar lesões na pele em função do ressecamento da pele.
en-mt: A less significant negative effect of hand washing is that frequent hand washing can cause skin damage due to dry skin.

sourceString: A 2012 Danish study found that excessive hand washing can lead to an itchy, flaky skin condition known as hand eczema or hand dermatitis, which is especially common among health-care workers.
targetString: Um estudo dinamarquês de 2012 descobriu que a lavagem excessiva das mãos pode provocar uma condição de descamação e irritação na pele conhecida como eczema ou dermatite de mão, que é particularmente comum entre trabalhadores do sistema de saúde.
en-mt: A 2012 Danish study found that excessive hand washing can lead to a scaly, irritating skin condition known as eczema or hand dermatitis, which is particularly common among healthcare workers.

sourceString: Too frequent hand washing is also seen as one of the symptoms of obsessive-compulsive disorder (OCD).
targetString: A lavagem frequente das mãos também é percebida como um dos sintomas de transtorno obsessivo compulsivo (TOC).
en-mt: Frequent hand washing is also perceived as one of the symptoms of obsessive compulsive disorder (OCD).

sourceString: There are five critical times during the day where washing hands with soap is important to reduce fecal-oral transmission of disease: after using the bathroom (urination, defecation), after cleaning a child's bottom (changing nappies), before feeding a child, before eating and before/after preparing food or handling raw meat, fish, or poultry.
targetString: Há cinco momentos cruciais durante o dia quando lavar as mãos com sabão é importante para reduzir a transmissão fecal-oral de doenças: após usar o banheiro (micção, defecação), após limpar o bumbum de uma criança (trocar fraldas), antes de alimentar uma criança, antes de comer e antes/depois de preparar um alimento ou manusear carne, peixe ou frango crus.
en-mt: There are five crucial times during the day when handwashing with soap is important to reduce faecal-oral disease transmission: after using the toilet (urination, defecation), after wiping a child's bottom (changing diapers), before feeding a child, before eating and before/after preparing food or handling raw meat, fish or poultry.

sourceString: Other occasions when correct handwashing technique should be practiced in order to prevent the transmission of disease include before and after treating a cut or wound; after sneezing, coughing, or blowing your nose; after touching animal waste or handling animals; and after touching garbage.
targetString: Outras situações quando a técnica correta para a lavagem de mãos deve ser praticada a fim de prevenir a transmissão de doenças incluem o antes e depois de tratar um corte ou ferimento; depois de espirrar, tossir ou assoar o nariz; depois de tocar dejetos de animais ou lidar com animais; e depois de tocar em lixo.
en-mt: Other situations when proper handwashing technique must be practiced in order to prevent the transmission of disease include before and after treating a cut or wound; after sneezing, coughing or blowing your nose; after touching animal droppings or handling animals; and after touching garbage.

sourceString: In many countries, there is a low rate of hand washing with soap.
targetString: Em muitos países, existe uma taxa reduzida de lavagem das mãos com sabão.
en-mt: In many countries, there is a reduced rate of handwashing with soap.

sourceString: A study of hand washing in 54 countries in 2015 found that on average, 38.7% of households practiced hand washing with soap.A 2014 study showed that Saudi Arabia had the highest rate of 97 percent; the United States near the middle with 77 percent; and China with the lowest rate of 23 percent.Several behaviour change methodologies now exist to increase uptake of the behaviour of hand washing with soap at the critical times.Group hand washing for school children at set times of the day is one option in developing countries to engrain hand washing in children's behaviors.
targetString: Um estudo sobre a lavagem das mãos em 54 países em 2015 constatou que, em média, 38,7% das famílias tinham o hábito de lavar as mãos com sabão. Um estudo de 2014 revelou que a Arábia Saudita tinha o maior índice com 97 porcento; os Estados Unidos próximo da média com 77 porcento; e a China com o menor índice com 23 porcento. Diversos métodos para mudanças de comportamento existem atualmente para aumentar a aceitação sobre o hábito de lavar as mãos com sabão em períodos críticos. A lavagem coletiva das mãos para as crianças nas escolas em determinados períodos do dia é uma alternativa nos países em desenvolvimento para incutir a lavagem das mãos nos hábitos das crianças.
en-mt: A study of handwashing in 54 countries in 2015 found that, on average, 38.7% of households were in the habit of washing their hands with soap. A 2014 study revealed that Saudi Arabia had the highest rate at 97 percent; the United States near the average at 77 percent; and China with the lowest rate at 23 percent. Several methods for behavior change currently exist to increase acceptance of handwashing with soap at critical times. Collective hand washing for children in schools at certain times of the day is an alternative in developing countries to instill hand washing in children's habits.

sourceString: The "Essential Health Care Program" implemented by the Department of Education in the Philippines is an example of at scale action to promote children's health and education.
targetString: O "Programa de Serviços de Saúde Essenciais" implementado pelo Departamento de Educação nas Filipinas é um exemplo de uma ação em larga escala para promover a saúde e a educação das crianças.
en-mt: The "Essential Health Services Program" implemented by the Department of Education in the Philippines is an example of large-scale action to promote children's health and education.

sourceString: Deworming twice a year, supplemented with washing hands daily with soap, brushing teeth daily with fluoride, is at the core of this national program.
targetString: A desparasitação duas vezes ao ano, complementadas com a lavagem das mãos diariamente com sabão, a escovação dos dentes diariamente com flúor, estão no centro desse programa nacional.
en-mt: Deworming twice a year, complemented by daily hand washing with soap and daily toothbrushing with fluoride, are at the heart of this national program.

sourceString: It has also been successfully implemented in Indonesia.
targetString: Ele também foi implementado com sucesso na Indonésia.
en-mt: It has also been successfully implemented in Indonesia.

sourceString: Removal of microorganisms from skin is enhanced by the addition of soaps or detergents to water.
targetString: A remoção de microrganismos da pele é reforçada ao agregar sabões e detergentes à água.
en-mt: The removal of microorganisms from the skin is enhanced by adding soaps and detergents to the water.

sourceString: The main action of soaps and detergents is to reduce barriers to solution, and increase solubility.
targetString: A principal ação de sabões e detergentes é reduzir as barreiras para a solução, e aumentar a solubilidade.
en-mt: The main action of soaps and detergents is to reduce barriers to solution and increase solubility.

sourceString: Water alone is an inefficient skin cleanser because fats and proteins, which are components of organic soil, are not readily dissolved in water.
targetString: A água sozinha é um agente de limpeza ineficaz para a pele, porque gorduras e proteínas, componentes de sujeira orgânica, não são facilmente dissolvidas em água.
en-mt: Water alone is an ineffective cleansing agent for the skin because fats and proteins, components of organic dirt, are not easily dissolved in water.

sourceString: Cleansing is, however, aided by a reasonable flow of water..
targetString: A limpeza é, contudo, facilitada por um fluxo razoável de água...
en-mt: Cleaning is, however, facilitated by a reasonable flow of water...

sourceString: Solid soap, because of its reusable nature, may hold bacteria acquired from previous uses.
targetString: O sabão em barra, em função de sua natureza reutilizável, pode reter as bactérias acumuladas de usos anteriores.
en-mt: Bar soap, due to its reusable nature, can retain accumulated bacteria from previous uses.

sourceString: A small number of studies which have looked at the bacterial transfer from contaminated solid soap have concluded transfer is unlikely as the bacteria are rinsed off with the foam.
targetString: Um número reduzido de estudos que analisaram a transmissão bacteriana de um sabão em barra contaminado concluiu que a transmissão é improvável já que as bactérias são enxaguadas com a espuma.
en-mt: A small number of studies that have looked at bacterial transmission from contaminated bar soap have concluded that transmission is unlikely as the bacteria are rinsed with the suds.

sourceString: The CDC still states "liquid soap with hands-free controls for dispensing is preferable".
targetString: O CDC reitera "sabonete líquido com comandos automáticos para dosagem é preferível".
en-mt: The CDC reiterates "liquid soap with automatic dosing controls is preferable."

sourceString: Antibacterial soaps have been heavily promoted to a health-conscious public.
targetString: Os sabonetes antibacterianos foram amplamente divulgados para o público consciente em termos de saúde.
en-mt: Antibacterial soaps have been widely marketed to the health conscious public.

sourceString: To date, there is no evidence that using recommended antiseptics or disinfectants selects for antibiotic-resistant organisms in nature.
targetString: Até o momento, não existem indícios de que utilizar antissépticos ou desinfetantes recomendados pode levar à seleção de organismos resistentes a antibióticos na natureza.
en-mt: To date, there is no evidence that using recommended antiseptics or disinfectants can lead to the selection of antibiotic-resistant organisms in nature.

sourceString: However, antibacterial soaps contain common antibacterial agents such as triclosan, which has an extensive list of resistant strains of organisms.
targetString: No entanto, sabonetes antibacterianos contêm agentes antibacterianos comuns, como, por exemplo, o triclosan, que possui uma lista extensa de cepas resistentes de organismos.
en-mt: However, antibacterial soaps contain common antibacterial agents such as triclosan, which has an extensive list of resistant strains of organisms.

sourceString: So, even if antibiotic resistant strains aren't selected for by antibacterial soaps, they might not be as effective as they are marketed to be.
targetString: Assim, ainda que cepas resistentes a antibióticos não sejam selecionadas por sabonetes antibacterianos, talvez eles não sejam tão eficazes como são divulgados.
en-mt: So, while antibiotic-resistant strains are not selected for by antibacterial soaps, they may not be as effective as advertised.

sourceString: Besides the surfactant and skin-protecting agent, the sophisticated formulations may contain acids (acetic acid, ascorbic acid, lactic acid) as pH regulator, antimicrobially active benzoic acid and further skin conditioners (aloe vera, vitamins, menthol, plant extracts).A comprehensive analysis from the University of Oregon School of Public Health indicated that plain soaps are as effective as consumer-grade anti-bacterial soaps containing triclosan in preventing illness and removing bacteria from the hands.
targetString: Além dos surfactantes e dos agentes de proteção da pele, as fórmulas complexas podem conter ácidos (ácido acético, ácido ascórbico, ácido lático) como regulador de pH, ácido benzoico ativo antimicrobiano e outros hidratantes para a pele (aloe vera, vitaminas, mentol, extratos vegetais). Uma análise abrangente da University of Oregon School of Public Health indicou que sabonetes comuns são tão eficazes em prevenir doenças e remover bactérias das mãos quanto sabonetes antibacterianos voltados para o consumidor final contendo triclosan.
en-mt: In addition to surfactants and skin protection agents, complex formulas may contain acids (acetic acid, ascorbic acid, lactic acid) as a pH regulator, antimicrobial active benzoic acid and other skin moisturizers (aloe vera, vitamins, menthol, plant extracts). A comprehensive analysis by the University of Oregon School of Public Health indicated that regular soaps are just as effective at preventing illness and removing bacteria from hands as consumer-grade antibacterial soaps containing triclosan.

sourceString: Hot water that is comfortable for washing hands is not hot enough to kill bacteria.
targetString: Água quente que seja confortável para a lavagem das mãos não é quente o bastante para matar as bactérias.
en-mt: Hot water that is comfortable for hand washing is not hot enough to kill bacteria.

sourceString: Bacteria grow much faster at body temperature (37 °C).
targetString: As bactérias crescem mais rápido em temperatura corporal (37 ºC).
en-mt: Bacteria grow faster at body temperature (37°C).

sourceString: However, warm, soapy water is more effective than cold, soapy water at removing natural oils which hold soils and bacteria.
targetString: Entretanto, água quente com sabão é mais eficaz do que água fria com sabão para remover a oleosidade natural que retém sujeiras e bactérias.
en-mt: However, hot soapy water is more effective than cold soapy water at removing the natural oils that trap dirt and bacteria.

sourceString: Contrary to popular belief however, scientific studies have shown that using warm water has no effect on reducing the microbial load on hands.
targetString: Ao contrário da crença popular, porém, estudos científicos revelaram que utilizar água quente não é eficaz para reduzir a carga microbiana nas mãos.
en-mt: Contrary to popular belief, however, scientific studies have shown that using hot water is not effective in reducing the microbial load on hands.

sourceString: A hand sanitizer or hand antiseptic is a non-water-based hand hygiene agent.
targetString: Um higienizador ou antisséptico de mãos é um agente de higienização das mãos de base não aquosa.
en-mt: A hand sanitizer or antiseptic is a non-aqueous based hand sanitizing agent.

sourceString: In the late 1990s and early part of the 21st century, alcohol rub non-water-based hand hygiene agents (also known as alcohol-based hand rubs, antiseptic hand rubs, or hand sanitizers) began to gain popularity.
targetString: No final da década de 1990 e no início do século XXI, agentes de higienização das mãos de base não aquosa à base de álcool (também conhecidos como produto para higienização das mãos à base de álcool, produto para higienização das mãos antisséptico, ou higienizador das mãos) começam a ganhar popularidade.
en-mt: In the late 1990s and early 21st century, non-aqueous alcohol-based hand sanitizing agents (also known as an alcohol-based hand sanitizing product, antiseptic hand sanitizing product, or hand sanitizer) hands) begin to gain popularity.

sourceString: Most are based on isopropyl alcohol or ethanol formulated together with a thickening agent such as Carbomer (polymer of acrylic acid) into a gel, or a humectant such as glycerin into a liquid, or foam for ease of use and to decrease the drying effect of the alcohol.
targetString: A maioria é feita à base de álcool isopropil ou etanol formulado com um agente espessante, como o carbômero (polímero ou ácido acrílico), em gel, ou um umectante, como a glicerina, em líquido, ou em espuma para facilitar o uso e reduzir o efeito de ressecamento do álcool.
en-mt: Most are made from isopropyl alcohol or ethanol formulated with a thickening agent, such as carbomer (polymer or acrylic acid), in gel, or a humectant, such as glycerin, in liquid or foam to facilitate use and reduce the drying effect of alcohol.

sourceString: Adding diluted hydrogen-peroxide increases further  the antimicrobial activity.Hand sanitizers containing a minimum of 60 to 95% alcohol are efficient germ killers.
targetString: A adição de peróxido de hidrogênio aumenta a atividade antimicrobiana. Higienizadores das mãos que contêm um mínimo de 60 a 95% de álcool matam germes com eficiência.
en-mt: The addition of hydrogen peroxide increases antimicrobial activity. Hand sanitizers that contain a minimum of 60 to 95% alcohol effectively kill germs.

sourceString: Alcohol rub sanitizers kill bacteria, multi-drug resistant bacteria (MRSA and VRE), tuberculosis, and some viruses (including HIV, herpes, RSV, rhinovirus, vaccinia, influenza, and hepatitis) and fungi.
targetString: Higienizadores à base de álcool matam bactérias, bactérias multirresistentes (MRSA e VRE), tuberculose, e alguns vírus (incluindo HIV, herpes, RSV, rinovírus, vaccinia, influenza e hepatite) e fungos.
en-mt: Alcohol-based sanitizers kill bacteria, multidrug-resistant bacteria (MRSA and VRE), tuberculosis, and some viruses (including HIV, herpes, RSV, rhinovirus, vaccinia, influenza, and hepatitis) and fungi.

sourceString: Alcohol rub sanitizers containing 70% alcohol kill 99.97% (3.5 log reduction, similar to 35 decibel reduction) of the bacteria on hands 30 seconds after application and 99.99% to 99.999% (4 to 5 log reduction) of the bacteria on hands 1 minute after application.Hand sanitizers are most effective against bacteria and less effective against some viruses.
targetString: Higienizadores à base de álcool que contêm 70% de álcool matam 99,97% (redução de 3,5 logaritmos, similar a redução de 35 decibéis) das bactérias nas mãos, 30 segundos após sua aplicação e 99,99% a 99,999% (redução de 4 a 5 logaritmos) das bactérias nas mãos 1 minuto após sua aplicação. Os higienizadores das mãos são mais eficazes contra bactérias e menos eficazes contra alguns vírus.
en-mt: Alcohol-based sanitizers containing 70% alcohol kill 99.97% (3.5 log reduction, similar to 35 decibel reduction) of bacteria on hands 30 seconds after application and 99.99% to 99.999% ( reduction of 4 to 5 logarithms) of bacteria on the hands 1 minute after its application. Hand sanitizers are more effective against bacteria and less effective against some viruses.

sourceString: Alcohol-based hand sanitizers are almost entirely ineffective against norovirus (or Norwalk) type viruses, the most common cause of contagious gastroenteritis.Enough hand antiseptic or alcohol rub must be used to thoroughly wet or cover both hands.
targetString: Os higienizadores das mãos à base de álcool são quase totalmente ineficazes contra o vírus do tipo norovírus (ou Norwalk), a causa mais comum de gastroenterite contagiosa. Antissépticos para as mãos ou higienizadores à base de álcool podem ser utilizados para umedecer ou cobrir bem as duas mãos.
en-mt: Alcohol-based hand sanitizers are almost entirely ineffective against the norovirus (or Norwalk) virus, the most common cause of contagious gastroenteritis. Hand sanitizers or alcohol-based sanitizers can be used to moisten or coat both hands well.

sourceString: The front and back of both hands and between and the ends of all fingers are rubbed for approximately 30 seconds until the liquid, foam or gel is dry.
targetString: As costas e palmas das mãos, entre os dedos e suas extremidades são esfregadas por aproximadamente 30 segundos até que o líquido, espuma ou gel esteja seco.
en-mt: The back and palms of the hands, between the fingers and their ends are rubbed for approximately 30 seconds until the liquid, foam or gel is dry.

sourceString: Finger tips must be washed well too, rubbing them in both palms.The US Center for Disease Control and Prevention recommends hand washing over hand sanitizer rubs, particularly when hands are visibly dirty.
targetString: As pontas dos dedos também devem ser bem lavadas, sendo esfregadas com as duas palmas. O Centro de Controle e Prevenção de Doenças recomenda a lavagem das mãos com higienizadores de mãos, principalmente quando as mãos estiverem visualmente sujas.
en-mt: The tips of the fingers should also be thoroughly washed, being rubbed with both palms. The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention recommends hand washing with hand sanitizers, particularly when hands are visually dirty.

sourceString: The increasing use of these agents is based on their ease of use and rapid killing activity against micro-organisms; however, they should not serve as a replacement for proper hand washing unless soap and water are unavailable.
targetString: O uso crescente desses agentes baseia-se na sua facilidade de uso e rápida ação exterminadora contra microrganismos; contudo, eles não devem substituir a lavagem adequada das mãos, a menos que sabão e água não estejam disponíveis.
en-mt: The growing use of these agents is based on their ease of use and rapid killing action against microorganisms; however, they should not replace proper hand washing unless soap and water are unavailable.

sourceString: Frequent use of alcohol-based hand sanitizers can cause dry skin unless emollients and/or skin moisturizers are added to the formula.
targetString: O uso frequente de higienizadores das mãos à base de álcool pode provocar o ressecamento da pele, a não ser que emolientes e/ou hidratantes de pele sejam adicionados à fórmula.
en-mt: Frequent use of alcohol-based hand sanitizers can cause skin dryness unless emollients and/or skin moisturizers are added to the formula.

sourceString: The drying effect of alcohol can be reduced or eliminated by adding glycerin and/or other emollients to the formula.
targetString: O efeito de ressecamento do álcool pode ser reduzido ou eliminado pela adição de glicerina e/ou outros emolientes à fórmula.
en-mt: The drying effect of alcohol can be reduced or eliminated by adding glycerin and/or other emollients to the formula.

sourceString: In clinical trials, alcohol-based hand sanitizers containing emollients caused substantially less skin irritation and dryness than soaps or antimicrobial detergents.
targetString: Em ensaios clínicos, os higienizadores das mãos à base de álcool contendo emolientes causaram substancialmente menos irritação e ressecamento na pele do que sabonetes ou detergentes antimicrobianos.
en-mt: In clinical trials, alcohol-based hand sanitizers containing emollients caused substantially less skin irritation and dryness than antimicrobial soaps or detergents.

sourceString: Allergic contact dermatitis, contact urticaria syndrome or hypersensitivity to alcohol or additives present in alcohol hand rubs rarely occur.
targetString: Dermatite alérgica de contato, síndrome de urticária de contato ou hipersensibilidade ao álcool ou a aditivos presentes nos higienizadores das mãos à base de álcool raramente ocorrem.
en-mt: Allergic contact dermatitis, contact urticaria syndrome, or hypersensitivity to alcohol or additives in alcohol-based hand sanitizers rarely occur.

sourceString: The lower tendency to induce irritant contact dermatitis became an attraction as compared to soap and water hand washing.
targetString: A tendência menor de provocar dermatite de contato irritativa tornou-se um atrativo se comparado a lavagem das mãos com água e sabonete.
en-mt: The lower tendency to cause irritant contact dermatitis has become an attraction compared to washing hands with soap and water.

sourceString: Despite their effectiveness, non-water agents do not cleanse the hands of organic material, but simply disinfect them.
targetString: Apesar de sua eficácia, agentes de base não aquosa não limpam as mãos de matéria orgânica, apenas as desinfetam.
en-mt: Despite their effectiveness, non-aqueous based agents do not clean the hands of organic matter, they only disinfect them.

sourceString: It is for this reason that hand sanitizers are not as effective as soap and water at preventing the spread of many pathogens, since the pathogens still remain on the hands.
targetString: É por essa razão que os higienizadores das mãos não são tão eficazes quanto água e sabão para a prevenção da propagação de muitos patógenos, uma vez que os patógenos ainda permanecem nas mãos.
en-mt: It is for this reason that hand sanitizers are not as effective as soap and water in preventing the spread of many pathogens, as the pathogens still remain on the hands.

sourceString: Alcohol-free hand sanitizer efficacy is heavily dependent on the ingredients and formulation, and historically has significantly under-performed alcohol and alcohol rubs.
targetString: A eficácia de higienizadores das mãos sem álcool é extremamente dependente de substâncias e da formulação, e historicamente tem ficado muito aquém do álcool e de higienizadores à base de álcool.
en-mt: The effectiveness of non-alcoholic hand sanitizers is extremely substance and formulation dependent, and historically has lagged far behind alcohol and alcohol-based hand sanitizers.

sourceString: More recently, formulations that use benzalkonium chloride have been shown to have persistent and cumulative antimicrobial activity after application, unlike alcohol, which has been shown to decrease in efficacy after repeated use, probably due to progressive adverse skin reactions.
targetString: Mais recentemente, formulações que utilizam cloreto de benzalcônio revelaram ter ação antimicrobiana contínua e cumulativa após aplicação, diferente do álcool, que revelou ter sua eficácia reduzida após uso recorrente, provavelmente devido às crescentes reações adversas na pele.
en-mt: More recently, formulations using benzalkonium chloride have been shown to have continuous and cumulative antimicrobial action after application, unlike alcohol, which has shown to have reduced effectiveness after recurrent use, probably due to increasing adverse skin reactions.

sourceString: Many people in low-income communities cannot afford soap and use ash or soil instead.
