en-mt: The Privacy Group at the MIT Media Lab has been developing Safe Paths, a platform for using privacy-preserving techniques when collecting and using location or path crossing data to track the spread of COVID-19.

sourceString: It is based on research from the whitepaper "Apps Gone Rogue: Maintaining Personal Privacy in an Epidemic" released in March 2020.Another similar effort is the SafeTrace platform by Enigma MPC, a company developing privacy technologies that was also originally founded at the MIT Media Lab.
targetString: Ele é baseado na pesquisa a partir da publicação técnica "Aplicativos jogam sujo: mantendo a privacidade pessoal em uma epidemia" divulgada em março de 2020. Outro esforço semelhante é a plataforma SafeTrace da Enigma MPC, uma empesa que desenvolve tecnologias de privacidade e originalmente fundada no MIT Media Lab.
en-mt: It is based on research from the white paper "Apps Play Dirty: Maintaining Personal Privacy in an Epidemic" released in March 2020. Another similar effort is the SafeTrace platform from Enigma MPC, a company that develops privacy technologies and originally founded at the MIT Media Lab.

sourceString: SafeTrace utilizes secure hardware technologies to allow users to share sensitive location and health data with other users and officials, without compromising the privacy of that data.
targetString: A SafeTrace utiliza tecnologias de hardware seguras para permitir aos usuários compartilharem dados sensíveis de localização e saúde com outros usuários e responsáveis, sem comprometer a privacidade desses dados.
en-mt: SafeTrace uses secure hardware technologies to allow users to share sensitive location and health data with other users and guardians without compromising the privacy of that data.

sourceString: On 5 April 2020, the global TCN Coalition was founded by groups that had coalesced around what was essentially the same approach and largely overlapping protocols, with the goal to reduce fragmentation, and enable global interoperability of tracing and alerting apps, a key aspect of achieving widespread adoption.
targetString: Em 5 de abril de 2020, a TCN Coalition global foi fundada por grupos que se uniram em torno do que era essencialmente a mesma abordagem e em grande parte com sobreposição de protocolos, com o objetivo de reduzir a fragmentação, e permitir a interoperabilidade global de aplicativos de alerta e rastreamento, um aspecto-chave da conquista da adoção generalizada.
en-mt: On April 5, 2020, the global TCN Coalition was founded by groups that coalesced around what was essentially the same approach and largely overlapping protocols, with the goal of reducing fragmentation, and enabling global interoperability of alerting and tracking applications, a key aspect of achieving widespread adoption.

sourceString: On 9 April 2020, the Singaporean government announced that it had open-sourced the BlueTrace protocol used by its official government app.
targetString: Em 9 de abril de 2020, o governo de Singapura anunciou que o protocolo BlueTrace, utilizado pelo aplicativo oficial do governo, passou a ser de código aberto.
en-mt: On April 9, 2020, the Government of Singapore announced that the BlueTrace protocol, used by the official government application, became open source.

sourceString: On 10 April 2020, Google and Apple, the companies that control the Android and iOS mobile platforms, announced an initiative for contact tracing, which they claimed would preserve privacy, based on a combination of Bluetooth Low Energy technology and privacy-preserving cryptography.
targetString: Em 10 de abril de 2020, a Google e a Apple, empresas que controlam as plataformas móveis Android e iOS, anunciaram uma iniciativa para o rastreamento de contato, em que alegaram que preservariam a privacidade, baseado em uma combinação de tecnologia Bluetooth Low Energy e criptografia para preservação de privacidade.
en-mt: On April 10, 2020, Google and Apple, the companies that control the Android and iOS mobile platforms, announced a contact tracing initiative, which they claimed would preserve privacy, based on a combination of Bluetooth Low Energy technology and privacy-preserving encryption.

sourceString: They also published specifications of the core technologies used in the system.
targetString: Elas publicaram ainda especificações das tecnologias principais usadas no sistema.
en-mt: They also published specifications of the main technologies used in the system.

sourceString: According to Apple and Google, the system is intended to be rolled out in three stages:
targetString: Segundo a Apple e a Google, o sistema prevê a implementação em três estágios:
en-mt: According to Apple and Google, the system foresees the implementation in three stages:

sourceString: rollout of tools to enable governments to create official privacy-preserving coronavirus tracing apps
targetString: desenvolvimento de ferramentas para permitir ao governo criar aplicativos oficiais de rastreamento de coronavírus preservando a privacidade
en-mt: development of tools to allow the government to create official privacy-preserving coronavirus tracking apps

sourceString: integration of this functionality directly into iOS and AndroidGoogle and Apple plan to address the take-up and persistent surveillance problems by first distributing the system through operating system updates, and later removing it in the same way once the threat has passed.
targetString: integração dessa funcionalidade diretamente em iOS e Android; a Google e a Apple planejam enfrentar os problemas de vigilância persistentes e assumidos distribuindo primeiro o sistema por atualizações de sistemas em funcionamento, e mais tarde removendo-o da mesma forma assim que a ameaça acabar.
en-mt: integration of this functionality directly into iOS and Android; Google and Apple plan to address the persistent and assumed surveillance issues by first distributing the system via updates to working systems, and later similarly removing it once the threat is gone.

sourceString: b'Drug repositioning (also known as drug repurposing, re-profiling, re-tasking or therapeutic switching) is the repurposing of an approved drug for the treatment of a different disease or medical condition than that for which it was originally developed.
targetString: Reposicionamento de fármaco (também conhecido como reproposta de fármaco, reperfilação, reatribuição ou substituição terapêutica) é a reproposta de um fármaco aprovado para o tratamento de uma condição médica ou doença diferente daquela para a qual ele foi desenvolvido originalmente.
en-mt: Drug repositioning (also known as drug repurposing, reprofiling, reassignment, or therapeutic substitution) is the repurposing of an approved drug for the treatment of a medical condition or disease other than that for which it was originally developed.

sourceString: This is one line of scientific research which is currently being pursued to develop safe and effective COVID-19 treatments.
targetString: Essa é uma das linhas de pesquisa científica que estão sendo adotadas atualmente para desenvolver tratamentos seguros e eficazes para COVID-19.
en-mt: This is one of the lines of scientific research currently being pursued to develop safe and effective treatments for COVID-19.

sourceString: Other research directions include the development of a COVID-19 vaccine and convalescent plasma transfusion.SARS-CoV-2 has about 66 druggable proteins, each of which has multiple ligand binding sites.
targetString: Outros direcionamentos de pesquisa incluem o desenvolvimento de uma transfusão de plasma convalescente e vacina para COVID-19. O SARS-CoV-2 tem cerca de 66 proteínas drogáveis, cada uma com múltiplos pontos de ligação.
en-mt: Other research directions include the development of a convalescent plasma transfusion and vaccine for COVID-19. SARS-CoV-2 has about 66 druggable proteins, each with multiple attachment points.

sourceString: Analyzing those binding sites provide the reasonable project of developing effective antiviral drug against COVID-19 proteins.
targetString: Analisar esses pontos de ligação fornece o projeto razoável de desenvolvimento de fármaco antiviral eficaz contra proteínas da COVID-19.
en-mt: Analyzing these binding points provides the reasonable blueprint for developing an antiviral drug effective against COVID-19 proteins.

sourceString: Of the most important SARS-CoV-2 target proteins are papain-like protease, RNA dependent RNA polymerase, helicase, S protein, and ADP ribophosphatase.
targetString: Entre as proteínas-alvos mais importantes do SARS-CoV-2 estão a protease similar à papaína, a RNA polimerase dependente de RNA, a helicase, a proteína S e a ADP ribofosfatase.
en-mt: Among the most important target proteins of SARS-CoV-2 are papain-like protease, RNA-dependent RNA polymerase, helicase, protein S, and ADP ribophosphatase.

sourceString: Hussein A A, et al studied several candidate compounds which then optimized and analyzed for their skeleton similarity with the highest similar approved drugs in order to accelerate a potent anti-SARS-CoV-2 drug development in his preclinical study to be recommended in a clinical study design.
targetString: Hussein A. A., et al., estudou vários compostos candidatos que depois aperfeiçoou e analisou por suas similaridades estruturais com os fármacos aprovados mais similares a fim de acelerar o desenvolvimento de um fármaco potente contra o SARS-CoV-2 em seu estudo pré-clínico a ser recomendado para uma concepção de estudo clínico.
en-mt: Hussein AA, et al., studied several candidate compounds which they then refined and analyzed for their structural similarities with the most similar approved drugs in order to accelerate the development of a potent drug against SARS-CoV-2 in their preclinical study at be recommended for a clinical trial design.

sourceString: Chloroquine is an anti-malarial medication that is also used against some auto-immune diseases.
targetString: A cloroquina é um fármaco contra a malária que também é usado contra algumas doenças autoimunes.
en-mt: Chloroquine is a malaria drug that is also used against some autoimmune diseases.

sourceString: On 18 March, the WHO announced that chloroquine and the related hydroxychloroquine would be among the four drugs studied as part of the Solidarity clinical trial.
targetString: Em 18 de março, a OMS anunciou que a cloroquina e a hidroxicloroquina relacionada estariam entre os quatro fármacos estudados como parte do ensaio clínico Solidarity.
en-mt: On March 18, the WHO announced that chloroquine and the related hydroxychloroquine would be among the four drugs studied as part of the Solidarity clinical trial.

sourceString: New York governor Andrew Cuomo announced that New York State trials of chloroquine and hydroxychloroquine would begin on 24 March.On 28 March, the FDA authorized the use of hydroxychloroquine sulfate and chloroquine phosphate under an Emergency Use Authorization (EUA).
targetString: O governador de Nova Iorque Andrew Cuomo anunciou que os ensaios com cloroquina e hidroxicloroquina do estado de Nova Iorque começariam em 24 de março. Em 28 de março, a FDA autorizou o uso de sulfato de hidroxicloroquina e fosfato de cloroquina por meio de uma Autorização de Uso Emergencial (AUE).
en-mt: New York Governor Andrew Cuomo announced that New York State trials of chloroquine and hydroxychloroquine would begin on March 24. On March 28, the FDA authorized the use of hydroxychloroquine sulfate and chloroquine phosphate through an Emergency Use Authorization (AUE).

sourceString: The treatment has not been approved by the FDA's clinical trials process and is authorized under the EUA only as an experimental treatment for emergency use in patients who are hospitalized but are not able to receive treatment in a clinical trial.
targetString: O tratamento não foi aprovado pelo processo de ensaios clínicos da FDA e está autorizado por meio da AUE somente como tratamento experimental para uso emergencial em pacientes hospitalizados que não possam receber o tratamento em um ensaio clínico.
en-mt: The treatment has not been approved through the FDA clinical trials process and is authorized through the AUE only as an investigational treatment for emergency use in hospitalized patients who cannot receive the treatment in a clinical trial.

sourceString: The CDC has said that "the use, dosing, or duration of hydroxychloroquine for prophylaxis or treatment of SARS-CoV-2 infection" are not yet established.
targetString: O CDC disse que "o uso, a dosagem ou a duração de hidroxicloroquina para profilaxia ou tratamento de infecção por SARS-CoV-2" ainda não estão estabelecidos.
en-mt: The CDC said "the use, dosage, or duration of hydroxychloroquine for the prophylaxis or treatment of SARS-CoV-2 infection" is not yet established.

sourceString: Doctors have said they are using the drug when "there's no other option".
targetString: Médicos disseram que estão usando o fármaco quando "não há outra opção".
en-mt: Doctors said they are using the drug when "there is no other option".

sourceString: A Turkish research team in Istanbul is conducting a small study on the use of chloroquine in combination with zinc, vitamin A, vitamin C and vitamin D.
targetString: Em Istambul, uma equipe de pesquisa turca está conduzindo um estudo pequeno sobre o uso de cloroquina em combinação com zinco, vitamina A, vitamina C e vitamina D.
en-mt: In Istanbul, a Turkish research team is conducting a small study on the use of chloroquine in combination with zinc, vitamin A, vitamin C and vitamin D.

sourceString: Large studies are underway at Duke University and the University of Oxford.
targetString: Estudos grandes estão em curso na Universidade Duke e na Universidade de Oxford.
en-mt: Large studies are underway at Duke University and the University of Oxford.

sourceString: NYU Langone Medical School is conducting a trial on the safety and efficacy of preventative use of hydroxychloroquine.
targetString: A Escola de Medicina Langone da NYU está conduzindo um ensaio sobre a segurança e eficácia do uso preventivo da hidroxicloroquina.
en-mt: NYU's Langone School of Medicine is conducting a trial on the safety and efficacy of preventive use of hydroxychloroquine.

sourceString: Chinese clinical trials in Wuhan and Shenzhen claimed to show favipiravir was "clearly effective".
targetString: Ensaios clínicos chineses em Wuhan e Shenzhen afirmaram demonstrar que o favipiravir foi "claramente eficaz".
en-mt: Chinese clinical trials in Wuhan and Shenzhen claimed to show that favipiravir was "clearly effective".

sourceString: 35 patients in Shenzhen tested negative in a median of 4 days, while the length of illness was 11 days in the 45 patients who did not receive it.
targetString: Em Shenzhen, 35 pacientes testavam negativo dentro de 4 dias em média, enquanto a duração da doença nos 45 pacientes que não o recebiam era de 11 dias.
en-mt: In Shenzhen, 35 patients tested negative within 4 days on average, while the duration of illness in the 45 patients who did not receive it was 11 days.

sourceString: In a study conducted in Wuhan on 240 patients with pneumonia, half were given favipiravir and half received umifenovir.
targetString: Em um estudo conduzido em Wuhan com 240 pacientes com pneumonia, metade foi tratada com favipiravir, e metade recebeu umifenovir.
en-mt: In a study conducted in Wuhan with 240 patients with pneumonia, half were treated with favipiravir, and half were given umifenovir.

sourceString: The Italian Pharmaceutical Agency reminded the public that the existing evidence in support of the drug is scant and preliminary.
targetString: A Agência Farmacêutica Italiana lembrou a população de que as evidências existentes para embasar o medicamento são escassas e preliminares.
en-mt: The Italian Pharmaceutical Agency reminded the population that the existing evidence to support the drug is scarce and preliminary.

sourceString: On 2 April, Germany announced that it would purchase the drug from Japan for its stockpile, and use the military to deliver the drug to university hospitals, where the drug will be used to treat COVID-19 patients.
targetString: Em 2 de abril, a Alemanha anunciou que compraria o medicamento do Japão para estocá-lo e usaria o exército para entregá-lo a hospitais universitários, onde ele seria usado para tratar pacientes com COVID-19.
en-mt: On April 2, Germany announced that it would buy the drug from Japan to stock it and use the military to deliver it to university hospitals, where it would be used to treat COVID-19 patients.

sourceString: According to the South China Morning Post, Shinzo Abe has made overtures to the Trump administration about purchasing the drug.The drug may be less effective in severe cases of illness where the virus has already multiplied.
targetString: De acordo com o South China Morning Post, Shinzo Abe tem criado aberturas para a administração Trump sobre a compra do medicamento. O medicamento pode ser menos eficaz em casos graves da doença, quando o vírus já se multiplicou.
en-mt: According to the South China Morning Post, Shinzo Abe has been creating openings for the Trump administration over the purchase of the drug. The medicine may be less effective in severe cases of the disease, when the virus has already multiplied.

sourceString: It may not be safe for use by pregnant women or those trying to conceive.
targetString: Seu uso pode não ser seguro para gestantes ou mulheres tentando engravidar.
en-mt: Its use may not be safe for pregnant women or women trying to conceive.

sourceString: One study of lopinavir/ritonavir (Kaletra), a combination of the antivirals lopinavir and ritonavir, concluded that "no benefit was observed".
targetString: Um estudo de lopinavir/ritonavir (Kaletra), uma combinação dos antivirais lopinavir e ritonavir, concluiu que "nenhum benefício foi observado".
en-mt: A study of lopinavir/ritonavir (Kaletra), a combination of the antivirals lopinavir and ritonavir, concluded that "no benefit was seen."

sourceString: The drugs were designed to inhibit HIV from replicating by binding to the protease.
targetString: Os fármacos foram desenvolvidos para inibir a replicação do HIV por meio de ligação com a protease.
en-mt: Drugs have been developed to inhibit HIV replication through protease binding.

sourceString: A team of researchers at the University of Colorado are trying to modify the drugs to find a compound that will bind with the protease of SARS-CoV-2.There are criticisms within the scientific community about directing resources to repurposing drugs specifically developed for HIV/AIDS.
targetString: Uma equipe de pesquisadores na Universidade do Colorado está tentando modificar os fármacos para encontrar um composto que se ligue à protease do SARS-CoV-2. Existem críticas na comunidade científica sobre direcionar recursos para repropor fármacos desenvolvidos especificamente para HIV/AIDS.
en-mt: A team of researchers at the University of Colorado is trying to modify drugs to find a compound that binds to the SARS-CoV-2 protease. There are criticisms in the scientific community about directing resources to re-propose drugs developed specifically for HIV/AIDS.

sourceString: The WHO included lopinavir/ritonavir in the international Solidarity trial.
targetString: A OMS incluiu lopinavir/ritonavir no ensaio internacional Solidarity.
en-mt: WHO has included lopinavir/ritonavir in the international Solidarity trial.

sourceString: Remdesivir was created and developed by Gilead Sciences as a treatment for Ebola virus disease and Marburg virus infections . Gilead Sciences subsequently discovered that Remdesivir had antiviral activity in vitro against multiple filo-, pneumo-, paramyxo-, and corona- viruses .
targetString: O remdesivir foi criado e desenvolvido pela Gilead Sciences como um tratamento para a doença do vírus ebola e infecções pelo vírus de Marburg. A Gilead Sciences descobriu depois que o remdesivir apresentava atividade antiviral in vitro contra filo, pneumo, paramixo e coronavírus.
en-mt: Remdesivir was created and developed by Gilead Sciences as a treatment for Ebola virus disease and Marburg virus infections. Gilead Sciences later found that remdesivir exhibited in vitro antiviral activity against phyla, pneumo, paramyxos, and coronavirus.

sourceString: One issue with antiviral treatment is the development of resistance through mutations that can lead to more severe disease and transmission.
targetString: Um dos problemas com tratamento antiviral é a resistência desenvolvida por mutações, que podem provocar transmissões ou doenças mais graves.
en-mt: One of the problems with antiviral treatment is resistance developed by mutations, which can lead to transmission or more serious disease.

sourceString: Some early pretrial studies suggest remdesivir may have a high genetic barrier to resistance.There are several clinical trials underway, including two conducted by Cleveland University Hospitals; one for people with moderate illness and another for those with more severe illness.
targetString: Alguns estudos pré-ensaios iniciais sugerem que o remdesivir pode ter uma barreira genética alta à resistência. Há vários ensaios clínicos em curso, incluindo dois conduzidos por Hospitais Universitários de Cleveland, um para pessoas com doença moderada e outro para aquelas com doença mais grave.
en-mt: Some early pre-trial studies suggest that remdesivir may have a high genetic barrier to resistance. There are several ongoing clinical trials, including two conducted by University Hospitals of Cleveland, one for people with moderate disease and one for those with more severe disease.

sourceString: There are three ongoing clinical trials of intravenous vitamin C for people who are hospitalized and severely ill with COVID-19; two placebo controlled (China, Canada) and one with no control (Italy).
targetString: Há três ensaios clínicos com vitamina C intravenosa ocorrendo para pessoas hospitalizadas e gravemente enfermas com COVID-19: dois deles são controlados por placebo (na China e no Canadá), enquanto o outro não apresenta grupo de controle (Itália).
en-mt: There are three clinical trials of intravenous vitamin C taking place for people who are hospitalized and critically ill with COVID-19: two of them are placebo-controlled (in China and Canada), while the other has no control group (Italy).

sourceString: New York State began trials for the antibiotic azithromycin on 24 March 2020.
targetString: O estado de Nova York começou a realizar testes com a azitromicina, um antibiótico, em 24 de março de 2020.
en-mt: New York State began testing azithromycin, an antibiotic, on March 24, 2020.

sourceString: Japan's National Center for Global Health and Medicine (NCGM) is planning a clinical trial for Teijin's Alvesco (ciclesonide), an inhaled corticosteroid for asthma, for the treatment of pre-symptomatic patients infected with the novel coronavirus.
targetString: O Centro Nacional de Saúde e Medicina Global (NCGM) do Japão planeja um teste clínico do Alvesco (ciclesonida), da empresa Teijin, que é um corticosteroide inalável para asma. O objetivo é o tratamento de pacientes pré-sintomáticos infectados com o novo coronavírus.
en-mt: Japan's National Center for Global Health and Medicine (NCGM) plans a clinical trial of Teijin's Alvesco (ciclesonide), which is an inhaled corticosteroid for asthma. The objective is the treatment of pre-symptomatic patients infected with the new coronavirus.

sourceString: A form of angiotensin-converting enzyme 2, a Phase II trial is underway with 200 patients to be recruited from severe, hospitalized cases in Denmark, Germany, and Austria to determine the effectiveness of the treatment.
targetString: A fase II de um estudo com um tipo de enzima conversora de angiotensina 2 está em andamento com 200 pacientes, a serem recrutados entre os casos graves hospitalizados na Dinamarca, na Alemanha e na Áustria, para determinar a eficácia do tratamento.
en-mt: A phase II study with a type 2 angiotensin-converting enzyme is underway with 200 patients, to be recruited among severe cases hospitalized in Denmark, Germany and Austria, to determine the effectiveness of the treatment.

sourceString: Researchers from the Montreal Heart Institute in Canada are currently studying the role of colchicine in reducing inflammation and pulmonary complications in patients suffering from mild symptoms of COVID-19.
targetString: No momento, pesquisadores do Instituto do Coração, no Canadá, estão pesquisando a função da colchicina na redução de complicações pulmonares e de inflamações em pacientes com sintomas leves da COVID-19.
en-mt: Researchers at the Heart Institute in Canada are currently investigating the role of colchicine in reducing lung complications and inflammation in patients with mild COVID-19 symptoms.

sourceString: The study, named COLCORONA, is recruiting 6000 adults aged 40 and over who were diagnosed with COVID-19 and experience mild symptoms not requiring hospitalization.
targetString: O estudo, chamado de COLCORONA, está recrutando 6 mil adultos com idade acima dos 40 anos, diagnosticados com a COVID-19 e com sintomas leves, que não precisaram ser hospitalizados.
en-mt: The study, called COLCORONA, is recruiting 6,000 adults over the age of 40, diagnosed with COVID-19 and with mild symptoms, who did not need to be hospitalized.

sourceString: Women who are pregnant or breastfeeding or who do not have an effective contraceptive method are not eligible.
targetString: Não foram incluídas nos testes mulheres grávidas, que estão amamentando ou que não usem métodos anticoncepcionais eficazes.
en-mt: Women who are pregnant, breastfeeding or not using effective contraception were not included in the tests.

sourceString: Several anticoagulants are being tested in Italy.
targetString: Diversos anticoagulantes encontram-se em teste na Itália.
en-mt: Several anticoagulants are being tested in Italy.

sourceString: Low-molecular-weight heparin is being widely used to treat patients, prompting the Italian Medicines Agency to publish guidelines on its use.
targetString: A heparina, de baixo peso molecular, está sendo amplamente utilizada no tratamento de pacientes, o que levou a Agência Italiana de Medicamentos a publicar orientações sobre o uso.
en-mt: Low molecular weight heparin is being widely used in the treatment of patients, which has led the Italian Medicines Agency to publish guidelines on its use.

sourceString: A multicenter study on 300 patients researching the use of enoxaparin sodium at prophylaxis and therapeutic dosages was announced in Italy on April 14.
targetString: Um estudo multicêntrico, com 300 pacientes, está analisando o uso da enoxaparina sódica na profilaxia e em dosagens terapêuticas. O estudo foi anunciado no dia 14 de abril, na Itália.
en-mt: A multicenter study with 300 patients is analyzing the use of enoxaparin sodium in prophylaxis and therapeutic dosages. The study was announced on April 14 in Italy.

sourceString: Since SARS-CoV-2 is a virus, considerable scientific attention has been focused on repurposing approved anti-viral drugs that were developed for prior outbreaks such as MERS, SARS, and West Nile virus.
targetString: Pelo fato de o SARS-CoV-2 ser um vírus, a atenção da comunidade científica tem sido considerável no sentido de dar novo propósito a medicamentos antivirais aprovados e desenvolvidos para o tratamento de surtos anteriores, como os de MERS, SARS e do vírus do Nilo Ocidental.
en-mt: Because SARS-CoV-2 is a virus, there has been considerable attention in the scientific community towards repurposing antiviral drugs approved and developed to treat previous outbreaks such as MERS, SARS, and the SARS virus. West Nile.

sourceString: Ribavirin: ribavirin was recommended for COVID-19 treatment according to Chinese 7th edition guidelines
targetString: Ribavirina: a ribavirina foi recomendada para o tratamento da COVID-19, de acordo com a 7ª edição das orientações chinesas
en-mt: Ribavirin: Ribavirin has been recommended for the treatment of COVID-19 according to the 7th edition of the Chinese guidelines

sourceString: Umifenovir: umifenovir was recommended for COVID-19 treatment according to Chinese 7th edition guidelines
targetString: Umifenovir: o umifenovir foi recomendado para o tratamento da COVID-19, de acordo com a 7ª edição das orientações chinesas
en-mt: Umifenovir: Umifenovir has been recommended for the treatment of COVID-19 according to the 7th edition of the Chinese guidelines

sourceString: Some antibiotics that have been identified as potentially repurposable as COVID-19 treatments:
targetString: Alguns antibióticos foram identificados como capazes de receber um novo propósito para o tratamento de pacientes com a COVID-19:
en-mt: Some antibiotics have been identified as being able to be given a new purpose for treating patients with COVID-19:

sourceString: Tocilizumab (Anti-IL-6 receptor): Approved by China.
targetString: Tocilizumab (receptor anti-IL-6): aprovado na China.
en-mt: Tocilizumab (anti-IL-6 receptor): approved in China.

sourceString: Also trials in Italy and China. and see Tocilizumab#COVID-19.
targetString: Também há testes na Itália e na China. Consulte Tocilizumab#COVID-19.
en-mt: There are also tests in Italy and China. See Tocilizumab#COVID-19.

sourceString: b'A COVID-19 vaccine is a hypothetical vaccine against coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19).
targetString: A vacina para a COVID-19 é uma vacina hipotética contra a doença do coronavírus de 2019 (COVID-19).
en-mt: The vaccine for COVID-19 is a hypothetical vaccine against coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19).

sourceString: Although no vaccine has completed clinical trials, there are multiple attempts in progress to develop such a vaccine.
targetString: Embora não haja uma vacina com os testes clínicos concluídos, há várias tentativas em andamento para desenvolvê-la.
en-mt: While there is no vaccine that has completed clinical trials, there are several ongoing attempts to develop one.

sourceString: In late February 2020, the World Health Organization (WHO) said it did not expect a vaccine against SARS-CoV-2, the causative virus, to become available in less than 18 months.
targetString: No final de fevereiro de 2020, a Organização Mundial da Saúde (OMS) afirmou não esperar uma vacina contra o SARS-CoV-2, vírus causador da doença, à disposição em menos de 18 meses.
en-mt: At the end of February 2020, the World Health Organization (WHO) said it did not expect a vaccine against SARS-CoV-2, the virus that causes the disease, to be available in less than 18 months.

sourceString: Five vaccine candidates were in Phase I safety studies in April.
targetString: Cinco candidatas à vacina estavam na fase I dos estudos de segurança em abril.
en-mt: Five vaccine candidates were in phase I safety studies in April.

sourceString: COVID-19 was identified in December 2019.
targetString: A COVID-19 foi identificada em dezembro de 2019.
en-mt: COVID-19 was identified in December 2019.

sourceString: A major outbreak spread around the world in 2020, leading to considerable investment and research activity to develop a vaccine.
targetString: Ocorreu uma grande propagação do surto em 2020, o que levou a investimentos e atividades de pesquisa consideráveis para o desenvolvimento de uma vacina.
en-mt: There was a large spread of the outbreak in 2020, which led to considerable investment and research activities for the development of a vaccine.

sourceString: Many organizations are using published genomes to develop possible vaccines against SARS-CoV-2.
targetString: Várias organizações estão utilizando genomas publicados para o desenvolvimento de vacinas possíveis contra o SARS-CoV-2.
en-mt: Several organizations are using published genomes to develop possible vaccines against SARS-CoV-2.

sourceString: Stated in April, imperatives of the CEPI initiative for vaccine development are speed, manufacturing capacity, deployment at scale, and global access.
targetString: A iniciativa da Coalizão de Inovações em Preparação Epidêmica, CEPI, declarou em abril que as necessidades para o desenvolvimento da vacina são a velocidade, a capacidade de fabricação, o desenvolvimento em grande escala e o acesso global.
en-mt: The Coalition for Epidemic Preparedness Innovations, CEPI, initiative stated in April that the needs for vaccine development are speed, manufacturability, large-scale development and global access.

sourceString: In April, CEPI scientists reported that 10 different technology platforms were under research and development during early 2020 to create an effective vaccine against COVID-19.
targetString: Em abril, os cientistas da CEPI relataram 10 plataformas de tecnologias diversas sendo pesquisadas e em desenvolvimento durante o início de 2020 para criar uma vacina eficaz contra a COVID-19.
en-mt: In April, CEPI scientists reported 10 diverse technology platforms being researched and under development during the early 2020s to create an effective vaccine against COVID-19.

sourceString: Major platform targets advanced into Phase I safety studies include:
targetString: As metas das maiores plataformas que avançaram para os estudos de segurança de fase I incluem:
en-mt: Goals for major platforms that have advanced to Phase I security studies include:

sourceString: nucleic acid (DNA and RNA) (Phase I developer and vaccine candidate: Moderna, mRNA-1273)
targetString: ácido nucleico (DNA ou RNA) (desenvolvedor em fase I e candidato a vacina: Moderna, mRNA-1273)
en-mt: nucleic acid (DNA or RNA) (phase I developer and vaccine candidate: Moderna, mRNA-1273)

sourceString: viral vector (Phase I developer and vaccine candidate: CanSino Biologics, adenovirus type 5 vector)
targetString: vetor viral (desenvolvedor da fase I e candidato a vacina: CanSino Biologics, vetor de tipo 5 de adenovírus)
en-mt: viral vector (phase I developer and vaccine candidate: CanSino Biologics, adenovirus type 5 vector)

sourceString: As reported by CEPI scientists in April, 115 total vaccine candidates are in early stages of development, with 78 confirmed as active projects (79, according to the Milken Institute), and 37 others announced, but with little public information available (presumed to be in planning or being designed).
targetString: Conforme relatado pelos cientistas da CEPI em abril, um total de 115 candidatos a vacina estão nos estágios iniciais de desenvolvimento, com 78 deles confirmados como projetos ativos (79, de acordo com o Instituto Milken). Outros 37 foram anunciados, mas com poucas informações disponíveis para o público (consideradas em planejamento ou sendo projetadas).
en-mt: As reported by CEPI scientists in April, a total of 115 vaccine candidates are in the early stages of development, with 78 of them confirmed as active projects (79, according to the Milken Institute). Another 37 were announced, but with little information available to the public (considered in planning or being projected).

sourceString: A Phase I-II trial conducts preliminary safety and immunogenicity testing, is typically randomized, placebo-controlled, and at multiple sites, while determining more precise, effective doses.
targetString: Um teste de fase I-II realiza a testagem de segurança e imunogenicidade preliminar. Ele é tipicamente aleatorizado, controlado por placebo e multicêntrico, ao mesmo tempo em que determina doses mais precisas e eficazes.
en-mt: A phase I-II trial performs preliminary safety and immunogenicity testing. It is typically randomized, placebo-controlled, and multicenter, while determining more accurate and effective doses.

sourceString: Phase III trials typically involve more participants, including a control group, and test effectiveness of the vaccine to prevent the disease, while monitoring for adverse effects at the optimal dose.
targetString: Testes de fase III tipicamente envolvem mais participantes em um grupo controle. Eles testam a eficácia da vacina em evitar a doença, ao mesmo tempo em que monitoram efeitos adversos na dose ideal.
en-mt: Phase III trials typically involve more participants in a control group. They test the vaccine's effectiveness in preventing the disease, while monitoring adverse effects at the optimal dose.

sourceString: Of 79 vaccine candidates in active development (confirmed as of early April 2020), 74 were not yet in human evaluation (still in "preclinical" research).
targetString: Dos 79 candidatos a vacina em desenvolvimento ativo (confirmados no início de abril de 2020), 74 ainda não tiveram avaliação em seres humanos (seguem em pesquisa pré-clínica).
en-mt: Of the 79 vaccine candidates in active development (confirmed in early April 2020), 74 have not yet been evaluated in humans (they are still in pre-clinical research).

sourceString: Around 24 January 2020 in Australia, the University of Queensland announced that it is investigating the potential of a molecular clamp vaccine that would genetically modify viral proteins in order to stimulate an immune reaction.
targetString: Em 24 de janeiro de 2020, na Austrália, a Universidade de Queensland anunciou que está investigando o potencial de uma vacina com um grampo molecular, o qual modificaria geneticamente as proteínas virais para estimular uma reação imune.
en-mt: On January 24, 2020, in Australia, the University of Queensland announced that it is investigating the potential of a vaccine with a molecular clamp, which would genetically modify viral proteins to stimulate an immune reaction.

sourceString: Around 24 January 2020 in Canada, the International Vaccine Centre (VIDO-InterVac) at the University of Saskatchewan announced the commencement of work on a vaccine, aiming to start human testing in 2021.
targetString: Em 24 de janeiro de 2020, no Canadá, o Centro de Vacinas Internacional (VIDO-InterVac) na Universidade de Saskatchewan, anúncio o começo dos trabalhos em uma vacina, com o objetivo de testagem em seres humanos em 2021.
en-mt: On January 24, 2020, in Canada, the International Vaccine Center (VIDO-InterVac) at the University of Saskatchewan announced the start of work on a vaccine, with the aim of testing it in humans in 2021.

sourceString: Vaccine development projects were announced at the Chinese Center for Disease Control and Prevention on 26 January 2020, and the University of Hong Kong on 28 January.
targetString: Foram anunciados projetos de desenvolvimento de vacinas no Centro de Prevenção e Controle de Doenças da China, em 26 de janeiro de 2020, e na Universidade de Hong Kong, em 28 de janeiro.
en-mt: Vaccine development projects were announced at the China Center for Disease Control and Prevention on January 26, 2020 and at the University of Hong Kong on January 28.

sourceString: Around 29 January 2020, Janssen Pharmaceutical Companies, led by Hanneke Schuitemaker, announced that it had begun work on developing a vaccine.
targetString: Em 29 de janeiro de 2020, as Empresas Farmacêuticas Janssen, lideradas por Hanneke Schuitemaker, anunciaram o início de seus trabalhos para o desenvolvimento de uma vacina.
en-mt: On January 29, 2020, Janssen Pharmaceutical Companies, led by Hanneke Schuitemaker, announced the start of work on the development of a vaccine.

sourceString: Janssen is co-developing an oral vaccine with its biotechnology partner, Vaxart.
targetString: A Janssen está codesenvolvendo uma vacina oral com sua parceira de biotecnologia a Vaxart.
en-mt: Janssen is co-developing an oral vaccine with its biotech partner Vaxart.

sourceString: On 18 March 2020, Emergent BioSolutions announced a manufacturing partnership with Vaxart to develop the vaccine.
targetString: Em 18 de março de 2020, a Emergent BioSolutions anunciou uma parceria de fabricação com a Vaxart para desenvolver a vacina.
en-mt: On March 18, 2020, Emergent BioSolutions announced a manufacturing partnership with Vaxart to develop the vaccine.

sourceString: On 8 February 2020, the laboratory OncoGen in Romania published a paper on the design of a vaccine with similar technology to the one used for cancer neoantigen vaccination therapy.
targetString: Em 8 de fevereiro de 2020, o laboratório OncoGen na Romênia publicou um documento sobre a elaboração de uma vacina com tecnologia semelhante a usada para a terapia de vacinação contra neoantígenos.
en-mt: On February 8, 2020, the OncoGen laboratory in Romania published a document on the development of a vaccine with technology similar to that used for vaccination therapy against neoantigens.

sourceString: On 25 March the head of the research institute announced that they had finalized the synthesis of the vaccine and were beginning the tests.
targetString: Em 25 de março o chefe do instituto de pesquisa anunciou que eles tinham finalizado a síntese da vacina e estavam iniciando os testes.
en-mt: On March 25th the head of the research institute announced that they had finished synthesizing the vaccine and were starting testing.

sourceString: On 27 February 2020, a Generex subsidiary company, NuGenerex Immuno-Oncology, announced they were beginning a vaccine project to create an Ii-Key peptide vaccine against COVID-19.
targetString: Em 27 de fevereiro de 2020, uma empresa subsidiária da Generex, a NuGenerex Immnuno-Oncology, anunciou que eles estavam iniciando um projeto de vacina para criar uma vacina de peptídeo li-Key contra a COVID-19.
en-mt: On February 27, 2020, a subsidiary company of Generex, NuGenerex Immnuno-Oncology, announced that they were starting a vaccine project to create a li-Key peptide vaccine against COVID-19.

sourceString: They wanted to produce a vaccine candidate that could be tested in humans "within 90 days."
targetString: Eles queriam produzir uma candidata à vacina que poderia ser testada em humanos "nos próximos 90 dias".
en-mt: They wanted to produce a vaccine candidate that could be tested in humans "within the next 90 days".

sourceString: On 5 March 2020, Washington University in St. Louis announced its projects to develop a vaccine.
targetString: Em 5 de março de 2020, a Universidade de Washington em St. Louis anunciou seus projetos para desenvolver uma vacina.
en-mt: On March 5, 2020, Washington University in St. Louis announced his plans to develop a vaccine.

sourceString: On 5 March 2020, the United States Army Medical Research and Materiel Command at Fort Detrick and the Walter Reed Army Institute of Research in Silver Spring, both in western Maryland, announced they were working on a vaccine.
targetString: Em 5 de março de 2020, o Comando de Pesquisa e Desenvolvimento Médico do Exército dos Estados Unidos em Fort Detrick e o Instituto de Pesquisa do Exército Walter Reed em Silver Spring, ambos na região ocidental de Maryland, anunciaram que estavam trabalhando em uma vacina.
en-mt: On March 5, 2020, the United States Army Medical Research and Development Command at Fort Detrick and the Walter Reed Army Research Institute in Silver Spring, both in western Maryland, announced that they were working on a vaccine.

sourceString: Around 10 March 2020, Emergent Biosolutions announced that it had teamed with Novavax Inc.
targetString: Por volta de 10 de março de 2020, a Emergent Biosolutions anunciou que se uniu a Novavax Inc.
en-mt: On or about March 10, 2020, Emergent Biosolutions announced that it had merged with Novavax Inc.

sourceString: in the development and manufacture of a vaccine.
targetString: no desenvolvimento e fabricação de uma vacina.
en-mt: in the development and manufacture of a vaccine.

sourceString: The partners further announced plans for preclinical testing and a Phase I clinical trial by July 2020.
targetString: As parceiras posteriormente anunciaram planos para o teste pré-clínico e a Fase I de estudos clínicos em julho de 2020.
en-mt: The partners later announced plans for pre-clinical testing and Phase I clinical trials in July 2020.

sourceString: On 12 March 2020, India's Health Ministry announced they are working with 11 isolates, and that even on a fast track it would take at least around one-and-a-half to two years to develop a vaccine.
targetString: Em 12 de março de 2020, o Ministério da Saúde da Índia anunciou que estão trabalhando com 11 isolados e, mesmo a um passo acelerado, levaria pelo menos entre um ano e meio e dois anos para desenvolverem uma vacina.
en-mt: On March 12, 2020, the Indian Ministry of Health announced that they are working with 11 isolates and, even at an accelerated pace, it would take at least between a year and a half and two years to develop a vaccine.

sourceString: On 12 March 2020, Medicago, a biotechnology company in Quebec City, Quebec, reported development of a coronavirus-like particle under partial funding from the Canadian Institutes for Health Research.
targetString: Em 12 de março de 2020, a Medicago, uma empresa de biotecnologia na cidade de Quebec, relatou o desenvolvimento de uma partícula semelhante ao Coronavírus sob financiamento parcial dos Institutos Canadenses para Pesquisa de Saúde.
en-mt: On March 12, 2020, Medicago, a biotechnology company in Quebec City, reported the development of a Coronavirus-like particle under partial funding from the Canadian Institutes for Health Research.

sourceString: The vaccine candidate is in laboratory research, with human testing planned for July or August 2020.
targetString: A candidata à vacina está em pesquisa no laboratório, com os testes humanos planejados para julho ou agosto de 2020.
en-mt: The vaccine candidate is under research in the laboratory, with human trials planned for July or August 2020.

sourceString: Earlier that week, The Guardian reported that the US President Donald Trump had offered CureVac "'large sums of money' for exclusive access to a Covid-19 vaccine", against which the German government protested.
targetString: No início daquela semana, o The Guardian declarou que o Presidente dos Estados Unidos, Donald Trump ofereceu a CureVac "grandes somas de dinheiro para acesso exclusivo à vacina da Covid-19" sob protesto do governo alemão.
en-mt: Earlier that week, The Guardian stated that US President Donald Trump had offered CureVac "large sums of money for exclusive access to the Covid-19 vaccine" over protest from the German government.

sourceString: On 17 March 2020, American pharmaceutical company Pfizer announced a partnership with German company BioNTech to jointly develop a mRNA-based vaccine.
targetString: Em 17 de março de 2020, a empresa farmacêutica Pfizer anunciou uma parceria com a empresa alemã BioNTech para desenvolver em conjunto uma vacina baseada em mRNA.
en-mt: On March 17, 2020, pharmaceutical company Pfizer announced a partnership with German company BioNTech to jointly develop an mRNA-based vaccine.

sourceString: mRNA-based vaccine candidate BNT162, currently in pre-clinical testing with clinical trials expected to begin in April 2020.
targetString: BNT162, uma vacina candidata baseada em mRNA, atualmente em teste pré-clínico, com testes clínicos esperados para começarem em abril de 2020.
en-mt: BNT162, an mRNA-based vaccine candidate, currently in preclinical testing, with clinical trials expected to begin in April 2020.

sourceString: In Italy on 17 March 2020, Takis Biotech, an Italian biotech company announced they will have pre-clinical testing results in April 2020 and their final vaccine candidate could begin human testing by fall.
targetString: Na Itália em 17 de março de 2020, a Takis Biotech, uma empresa de biotecnologia italiana anunciou que ela teria resultados de testes pré-clínicos em abril de 2020 e sua candidata à vacina final poderia partir para testes humanos no outono.
en-mt: In Italy on March 17, 2020, Takis Biotech, an Italian biotechnology company announced that it would have pre-clinical test results in April 2020 and its final vaccine candidate could start human trials in the autumn.

sourceString: In France on 19 March 2020, the Coalition for Epidemic Preparedness Innovations (CEPI) announced a US$4.9 million investment in a COVID-19 vaccine research consortium involving the Institut Pasteur, Themis Bioscience (Vienna, Austria), and the University of Pittsburgh, bringing CEPI's total investment in COVID-19 vaccine development to US$29 million.
targetString: Na França, em 19 de março de 2020, a Coalizão de Inovações em Preparação para Epidemia (CEPI) anunciou um investimento de 4,9 milhões de dólares em um consórcio de pesquisa para a vacina para a COVID-19 envolvendo o Institut Pasteur, Themis Bioscience (Viena, Áustria), e a Universidade de Pittsburgh, levando o investimento total da CEPI no desenvolvimento da vacina para a COVID-19 para 29 milhões de dólares.
en-mt: In France, on March 19, 2020, the Coalition for Epidemic Preparedness Innovations (CEPI) announced a USD 4.9 million investment in a COVID-19 vaccine research consortium involving Institut Pasteur, Themis Bioscience (Vienna, Austria), and the University of Pittsburgh, bringing CEPI's total investment in COVID-19 vaccine development to $29 million.

sourceString: CEPI's other investment partners for COVID-19 vaccine development are Moderna, Curevac, Inovio, Novavax, the University of Hong Kong, the University of Oxford, and the University of Queensland.
targetString: As outras parceiras de investimento da CEPI para o desenvolvimento da vacina para a COVID-19 são Moderna, Curevac, Inovio, Novavax, a Universidade de Hong Kong, a Universidade de Oxford, e a Universidade de Queensland.
en-mt: CEPI's other investment partners for COVID-19 vaccine development are Moderna, Curevac, Inovio, Novavax, the University of Hong Kong, the University of Oxford, and the University of Queensland.

sourceString: On 20 March 2020, Russian health officials announced that scientists have begun animal testing of six different vaccine candidates.
targetString: Em 20 de março de 2020, autoridades de saúde da Rússia anunciaram que cientistas começaram o teste em animais de seis candidatas diferentes à vacina.
en-mt: On March 20, 2020, Russian health officials announced that scientists had begun animal testing of six different vaccine candidates.

sourceString: Imperial College London researchers announced on 20 March 2020 that they are developing a self-amplifying RNA vaccine for COVID-19.
targetString: Os pesquisadores do Imperial College em Londres anunciaram em 20 de março de 2020 que eles estão desenvolvendo uma vacina autoamplificadora de RNA para a COVID-19.
en-mt: Researchers at Imperial College London announced on March 20, 2020 that they are developing an auto-amplifying RNA vaccine for COVID-19.

sourceString: The vaccine candidate was developed within 14 days of receiving the sequence from China.
targetString: A candidata à vacina foi desenvolvida no prazo de 14 dias do recebimento do sequenciamento da China.
en-mt: The vaccine candidate was developed within 14 days of receiving sequencing from China.

sourceString: In late March, the Canadian government announced C$275 million in funding for 96 research projects on medical countermeasures against COVID-19, including numerous vaccine candidates at Canadian companies and universities, such as the Medicago and University of Saskatchewan initiatives.
targetString: No fim de março, o governo canadense anunciou C$ 275 milhões em financiamento para 96 projetos de pesquisa sobre contramedidas médicas contra a COVID-19, incluindo várias candidatas à vacina em empresas e universidades Canadenses, como a Medicago e as iniciativas da Universidade de Saskatchewan.
en-mt: In late March, the Canadian government announced C$275 million in funding for 96 research projects on medical countermeasures against COVID-19, including several vaccine candidates at Canadian companies and universities, such as Medicago and the University of Saskatchewan initiatives. .

sourceString: Around the same time, the Canadian government announced C$192 million specifically for developing a COVID-19 vaccine, with plans to establish a national "vaccine bank" of several new vaccines that could be used if another coronavirus outbreak occurs.
targetString: Quase no mesmo período, o governo Canadense anunciou C$ 192 milhões especificamente para desenvolver a vacina para a COVID-19, com planos de estabelecer um "banco de vacina" nacional de várias novas vacinas que poderiam ser usadas se outros surtos do Coronavírus ocorrerem.
en-mt: In about the same period, the Canadian government announced C$192 million specifically to develop a vaccine for COVID-19, with plans to establish a national "vaccine bank" of several new vaccines that could be used if further outbreaks of the Coronavirus occur.

sourceString: On 2 April 2020, researchers at the University of Pittsburgh School of Medicine reported on testing of PittCoVacc, a possible COVID-19 vaccine in mice, stating that "MNA delivered SARS-CoV-2 S1 subunit vaccines elicited potent antigen-specific antibody responses [in the mice] that were evident beginning 2 weeks after immunization."
targetString: Em 2 de abril de 2020, os pesquisadores na Universidade da Escola de Medicina de Pittsburgh relataram o teste do PittCoVacc, uma possível vacina contra COVID-19 em ratos, declarando que "A MNA entregou vacinas da subunidade S1 de SARS-CoV-2 que suscitaram respostas potentes de anticorpos específicos para antígenos [no rato] que eram evidentes que se iniciaram 2 semanas após a imunização."
en-mt: On April 2, 2020, researchers at the University of Pittsburgh School of Medicine reported testing PittCoVacc, a potential COVID-19 vaccine in mice, stating that "MNA has delivered SARS-CoV-2 S1 subunit vaccines that elicited potent antigen-specific antibody responses [in the mouse] that were evident to begin 2 weeks after immunization."

sourceString: In Canada on 16 April 2020, the University of Waterloo School of Pharmacy announced design of a DNA-based vaccine candidate as a possible nasal spray.
targetString: No Canadá em 16 de abril de 2020, a Universidade da Escola de Farmácia de Waterloo anunciou a elaboração de uma candidata à vacina baseada em DNA como possivelmente um spray nasal.
en-mt: In Canada on April 16, 2020, the University of Waterloo School of Pharmacy announced the development of a DNA-based vaccine candidate as possibly a nasal spray.

sourceString: Using bacteriophages, the DNA will be designed to replicate inside human bacteria to produce harmless virus-like particles, which may stimulate the immune system to produce antibodies against the SARS-CoV-2 virus.
targetString: Usando bacteriófagos, o DNA será planejado para se replicar dentro de uma bactéria humana para produzir partículas inofensivas semelhantes ao vírus, que podem estimular o sistema imunológico a produzir anticorpos contra o vírus da SARS-CoV-2.
en-mt: Using bacteriophages, DNA will be engineered to replicate within a human bacterium to produce harmless virus-like particles that can stimulate the immune system to produce antibodies against the SARS-CoV-2 virus.

sourceString: In March 2020, the US government, industry, and three universities pooled resources to access supercomputers from IBM, combined with cloud computing resources from Hewlett Packard Enterprise, Amazon, Microsoft, and Google.
targetString: Em março de 2020, o governo, a indústria e três universidades dos EUA juntaram recursos para acessar supercomputadores da IBM, em combinação com a computação na nuvem da Hewlett Packard Enterprise, da Amazon, da Microsoft e da Google.
en-mt: In March 2020, government, industry and three US universities pooled resources to access supercomputers from IBM, in combination with cloud computing from Hewlett Packard Enterprise, Amazon, Microsoft and Google.

sourceString: Some vaccines have heterologous effects, also called non-specific effects.
targetString: Algumas vacinas têm efeitos heterólogos, também chamados de efeitos não específicos.
en-mt: Some vaccines have heterologous effects, also called non-specific effects.

sourceString: That means they can have benefits beyond the disease they prevent.
targetString: Isso significa que elas podem ter benefícios além da doença que ela previne.
en-mt: This means they can have benefits beyond the disease they prevent.

sourceString: A further randomized trial in Australia is seeking to enrol 4,170 healthcare workers.
targetString: Um teste posterior randomizado na Austrália está buscando inscrever 4.170 trabalhadores da área da saúde.
en-mt: A further randomized trial in Australia is seeking to enroll 4,170 healthcare workers.

sourceString: It is possible vaccines in development will not be safe or effective.
targetString: É possível que as vacinas em desenvolvimento não sejam seguras ou eficazes.
en-mt: It is possible that vaccines under development are not safe or effective.

sourceString: Early research to assess vaccine efficacy using COVID-19-specific animal models, such as ACE2-transgenic mice, other laboratory animals, and non-human primates, indicate a need for biosafety-level 3 containment measures for handling live viruses, and international coordination to ensure standardized safety procedures.
targetString: Pesquisas iniciais para avaliar a eficácia da vacina usando exemplares de animais específicos para a COVID-19, tais como o rato ACE2-transgênico, outros animais de laboratório e primatas não humanos, indicam uma necessidade de medidas de contenção para biossegurança de nível 3 para manipular vírus vivo, e uma coordenação internacional para garantir procedimentos de segurança padronizados.
en-mt: Initial research to assess vaccine efficacy using specific animal specimens for COVID-19, such as the ACE2-transgenic mouse, other laboratory animals, and non-human primates, indicates a need for biosafety level 3 containment measures to handle live virus, and international coordination to ensure standardized safety procedures.

sourceString: Vaccines against SARS and MERS have been tested in non-human animal models.
targetString: Vacinas contra a SARS e MERS já foram testadas em exemplares de animais não humanos.
en-mt: Vaccines against SARS and MERS have already been tested in non-human animals.

sourceString: As of 2020, there is no cure or protective vaccine for SARS that has been shown to be both safe and effective in humans.
targetString: Em 2020, não existe uma cura ou vacina que proteja contra a SARS que tenha se mostrado segura e eficaz em humanos.
en-mt: As of 2020, there is no cure or vaccine that protects against SARS that has been shown to be safe and effective in humans.

sourceString: According to research papers published in 2005 and 2006, the identification and development of novel vaccines and medicines to treat SARS was a priority for governments and public health agencies around the world.There is also no proven vaccine against MERS.
targetString: De acordo com documentos de pesquisa publicados em 2005 e 2006, a identificação e desenvolvimento de novas vacinas e medicações para tratar a SARS era uma prioridade para governos e agências de saúde pública pelo mundo. Também não existe uma vacina comprovada contra a MERS.
en-mt: According to research papers published in 2005 and 2006, identifying and developing new vaccines and medications to treat SARS was a priority for governments and public health agencies around the world. There is also no proven vaccine against MERS.

sourceString: When MERS became prevalent, it was believed that existing SARS research may provide a useful template for developing vaccines and therapeutics against a MERS-CoV infection.
targetString: Quando a MERS se tornou predominante, acreditava-se que a pesquisa existente da SARS pudesse fornecer um modelo útil para o desenvolvimento de vacinas e tratamento terapêutico contra a infecção da MERS-CoV.
en-mt: When MERS became prevalent, it was believed that existing SARS research could provide a useful model for developing vaccines and therapeutic treatment against MERS-CoV infection.

sourceString: As of March 2020, there was one (DNA based) MERS vaccine which completed phase I clinical trials in humans, and three others in progress, all of which are viral-vectored vaccines, two adenoviral-vectored (ChAdOx1-MERS,  BVRS-GamVac), and one MVA-vectored (MVA-MERS-S).
targetString: A partir de março de 2020, houve uma vacina contra a MERS (baseadas em DNA) que concluiu a fase I de estudos clínicos em humanos, e três outras em progresso, todas as quais são vacinas vetorizadas por vírus, duas com vetor adenoviral (ChAdOx1-MERS, BVRS-GamVac), e uma vetorizada por MVA (MVA-MERS-S).
en-mt: As of March 2020, there is one MERS (DNA-based) vaccine that has completed phase I human clinical trials, and three others in progress, all of which are virus-vectored vaccines, two with adenoviral vector (ChAdOx1 -MERS, BVRS-GamVac), and one vectorized by MVA (MVA-MERS-S).

sourceString: Social media posts have promoted a conspiracy theory claiming the virus behind COVID-19 was known and that a vaccine was already available.
targetString: Publicações da mídia social promoveram uma teoria da conspiração alegando que o vírus por trás da COVID-19 era conhecido e que uma vacina já estava disponível.
en-mt: Social media posts promoted a conspiracy theory claiming that the virus behind COVID-19 was known and a vaccine was already available.

sourceString: The patents cited by various social media posts reference existing patents for genetic sequences and vaccines for other strains of coronavirus such as the SARS coronavirus.
targetString: As patentes citadas por várias publicações em mídia social indicam patentes existentes para sequências genéticas e vacinas para outras cepas de Coronavírus como o Coronavírus SARS.
en-mt: Patents cited by various social media posts indicate existing patents for genetic sequences and vaccines for other strains of Coronavirus such as the SARS Coronavirus.

sourceString: b'Coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) is an infectious disease caused by severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2).
targetString: A doença por Betacoronavírus 2019 (COVID-19) é uma doença infecciosa causada por uma síndrome respiratória aguda grave do Coronavírus 2 (SARS-CoV-2).
en-mt: Betacoronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) is an infectious disease caused by severe acute respiratory syndrome Coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2).

sourceString: Common symptoms include fever, cough, and shortness of breath.
targetString: Os sintomas comuns incluem febre, tosse, e dificuldade para respirar.
en-mt: Common symptoms include fever, cough, and difficulty breathing.

sourceString: Other symptoms may include fatigue, muscle pain, diarrhea, sore throat, loss of smell, and abdominal pain.
targetString: Outros sintomas podem incluir fadiga, dor muscular, diarreia, dor de garganta, perda de olfato e dor abdominal.
en-mt: Other symptoms may include fatigue, muscle pain, diarrhea, sore throat, loss of smell and abdominal pain.

sourceString: The time from exposure to onset of symptoms is typically around five days but may range from two to fourteen days.
targetString: O tempo da exposição até o início dos sintomas é de cerca de 5 dias, mas pode variar de dois a quatorze dias.
en-mt: The time from exposure to the onset of symptoms is about 5 days, but it can vary from two to fourteen days.

sourceString: While the majority of cases result in mild symptoms, some progress to viral pneumonia and multi-organ failure.
targetString: Embora a maioria dos casos resultem em sintomas leves, alguns evoluem para uma pneumonia viral e falha múltipla dos órgãos.
en-mt: While most cases result in mild symptoms, some progress to viral pneumonia and multiple organ failure.

sourceString: As of 17 April 2020, more than 2.24 million cases have been reported across 210 countries and territories, resulting in more than 153,000 deaths.
targetString: A partir de 17 de abril de 2020, mais de 2,24 milhões de casos tinham sido relatados em 210 países e territórios, resultando em mais de 153 mil mortes.
en-mt: As of April 17, 2020, more than 2.24 million cases had been reported in 210 countries and territories, resulting in more than 153,000 deaths.

sourceString: More than 568,000 people have recovered.The virus is primarily spread between people during close contact, often via small droplets produced by coughing, sneezing, or talking.
targetString: Mais de 568 mil pessoas já se curaram. O vírus é disseminado entre as pessoas principalmente durante o contato direto, geralmente por meio de gotículas produzidas pela tosse, espirro ou pela fala.
en-mt: More than 568,000 people have already recovered. The virus is spread between people mainly during direct contact, usually through droplets produced by coughing, sneezing or talking.

sourceString: While these droplets are produced when breathing out, they usually fall to the ground or onto surfaces rather than being infectious over long distances.
targetString: Embora essas gotículas sejam produzidas ao expirar, elas normalmente caem no chão ou ficam em superfícies em vez de permanecerem infecciosas em longas distâncias.
en-mt: Although these droplets are produced when exhaling, they typically fall to the ground or remain on surfaces rather than remaining infectious over long distances.

sourceString: People may also become infected by touching a contaminated surface and then touching their eyes, nose, or mouth.
targetString: As pessoas podem se infectar também tocando superfícies contaminadas e depois tocar os olhos, nariz ou boca.
en-mt: People can also become infected by touching contaminated surfaces and then touching their eyes, nose or mouth.

sourceString: The virus can survive on surfaces up to 72 hours.
targetString: O vírus pode sobreviver em superfícies por até 72 horas.
en-mt: The virus can survive on surfaces for up to 72 hours.

sourceString: It is most contagious during the first three days after the onset of symptoms, although spread may be possible before symptoms appear and in later stages of the disease.The standard method of diagnosis is by real-time reverse transcription polymerase chain reaction (rRT-PCR) from a nasopharyngeal swab.
targetString: É mais contagioso durantes os primeiros 3 dias após o início dos sintomas, embora a disseminação possa ser possível antes dos sintomas aparecerem e em estágios posteriores da doença. O método padrão de diagnose é por reação em cadeia da polimerase da transcrição reversa em tempo real (rRT-PCR) de um swab nasofaríngeo.
en-mt: It is most contagious during the first 3 days after the onset of symptoms, although spread may be possible before symptoms appear and in later stages of the illness. The standard method of diagnosis is by real-time reverse transcription polymerase chain reaction (rRT-PCR) of a nasopharyngeal swab.

sourceString: The use of masks is recommended for those who suspect they have the virus and their caregivers.
targetString: O uso de máscaras é recomendado para as pessoas com suspeita do vírus e para as pessoas responsáveis pelo seu cuidado.
en-mt: The use of masks is recommended for people suspected of having the virus and for those responsible for their care.

sourceString: Recommendations for mask use by the general public vary, with some authorities recommending against their use, some recommending their use, and others requiring their use.
targetString: Recomendações para o uso de máscara pela população em geral variam, onde algumas autoridades recomendam o não uso, algumas recomendam o uso e outras obrigam o uso.
en-mt: Recommendations for mask use by the general population vary, with some authorities recommending non-use, some recommending use, and others requiring use.

sourceString: Currently, there is no vaccine or specific antiviral treatment for COVID-19.
targetString: Atualmente, não existe uma vacina ou tratamento antiviral específico para a COVID-19.
en-mt: Currently, there is no vaccine or specific antiviral treatment for COVID-19.

sourceString: Local transmission of the disease has been recorded in most countries across all six WHO regions.
targetString: A transmissão local da doença foi registrada na maioria dos países por todas as seis regiões da OMS.
en-mt: Local transmission of the disease has been reported in most countries across all six WHO regions.

sourceString: Those infected with the virus may be asymptomatic or develop flu-like symptoms such as fever, cough, fatigue, and shortness of breath.
targetString: Os infectados pelo vírus podem estar assintomáticos ou desenvolver sintomas parecidos com a gripe, tosse, fadiga e dificuldade para respirar.
en-mt: Those infected with the virus may be asymptomatic or develop flu-like symptoms of coughing, fatigue and difficulty breathing.

sourceString: Emergency symptoms include difficulty breathing, persistent chest pain or pressure, confusion, difficulty waking, and bluish face or lips; immediate medical attention is advised if these symptoms are present.
targetString: Os sintomas de emergência incluem dificuldade para respirar, dor ou pressão persistente no peito, confusão, dificuldade em manter-se desperto, rosto ou lábios azulados.
en-mt: Emergency symptoms include difficulty breathing, persistent chest pain or pressure, confusion, difficulty staying awake, a bluish face or lips.

sourceString: Less commonly, upper respiratory symptoms such as sneezing, runny nose or sore throat may be seen.
targetString: Menos comuns, sintomas do trato respiratório superior como espirros, nariz escorrendo ou dor de garganta podem ser vistos.
en-mt: Less common, upper respiratory tract symptoms like sneezing, runny nose or sore throat can be seen.

sourceString: Gastrointestinal symptoms such as nausea, vomiting and diarrhoea have been observed in varying percentages.
targetString: Sintomas gastrointestinais como náusea, vômito e diarreia foram observados em diferentes percentagens.
en-mt: Gastrointestinal symptoms such as nausea, vomiting and diarrhea were observed in different percentages.

sourceString: Some cases in China initially presented only with chest tightness and palpitations.
targetString: Alguns casos na China apresentaram inicialmente apenas aperto no peito e palpitações.
en-mt: Some cases in China initially showed only chest tightness and palpitations.

sourceString: In some, the disease may progress to pneumonia, multi-organ failure, and death.
targetString: Em alguns, a doença pode evoluir para pneumonia, falha múltipla dos órgãos, e morte.
en-mt: In some, the disease can progress to pneumonia, multiple organ failure, and death.

sourceString: This is called the incubation period.
targetString: Este é o chamado período de incubação.
en-mt: This is called the incubation period.

sourceString: The incubation period for COVID-19 is typically five to six days but may range from two to 14 days.
targetString: O período de incubação para a COVID-19 é de normalmente seis dias, mas pode variar de dois a 14 dias.
en-mt: The incubation period for COVID-19 is typically six days, but can range from two to 14 days.

sourceString: 97.5% of people who develop symptoms will do so within 11.5 days of infection.Reports indicate that not all who are infected develop symptoms.
targetString: 97,5% das pessoas que desenvolvem os sintomas, os desenvolverão no prazo de 11,5 dias da infecção. Relatórios indicam que nem todos os infectados desenvolverão sintomas.
en-mt: 97.5% of people who develop symptoms will develop them within 11.5 days of infection. Reports indicate that not all those infected will develop symptoms.

sourceString: The role of these asymptomatic carriers in transmission is not yet fully known; however, preliminary evidence suggests that they may contribute to the spread of the disease.
targetString: A função que estes assintomáticos desempenham na transmissão ainda não é totalmente conhecida; entretanto, uma evidência preliminar sugere que eles possam contribuir para a disseminação da doença.
en-mt: The role played by these asymptomatic individuals in transmission is still not fully known; however, preliminary evidence suggests that they may contribute to the spread of the disease.

sourceString: The proportion of infected people who do not display symptoms is currently unknown and being studied, with the Korea Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (KCDC) reporting that 20% of all confirmed cases remained asymptomatic during their hospital stay.
targetString: A proporção de pessoas infectadas que não apresentam sintomas é atualmente desconhecida e está sendo estudada, e os Centros Coreanos para Controle e Prevenção de Doenças (KCDC) relataram que 20% de todos os casos confirmados permaneceram assintomáticos durante sua estadia no hospital.
en-mt: The proportion of infected people who do not show symptoms is currently unknown and is being studied, and the Korean Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (KCDC) reported that 20% of all confirmed cases remained asymptomatic during their hospital stay.

sourceString: China's National Health Commission began including asymptomatic cases in its daily cases on 1 April; of the 166 infections on that day, 130 (78%) were asymptomatic at the time of testing.
targetString: A Comissão de Saúde Nacional da China começou a incluir casos assintomáticos em seus casos diários em 1 de abril; das 166 infecções naquele dia, 130 (78%) eram assintomáticas no momento da testagem.
en-mt: China's National Health Commission began including asymptomatic cases in its daily cases on April 1; of the 166 infections that day, 130 (78%) were asymptomatic at the time of testing.

sourceString: Both sputum and saliva can carry large viral loads.
targetString: O escarro e a saliva podem carregar grandes cargas virais.
en-mt: Sputum and saliva can carry large viral loads.

sourceString: Loud talking releases more droplets than normal talking.
targetString: Falar alto libera mais gotículas do que falar de forma normal.
en-mt: Speaking loudly releases more droplets than normal speaking.

sourceString: A study in Singapore found that an uncovered cough can lead to droplets travelling up to 4.5 meters (15 feet).
targetString: Um estudo na Singapura descobriu que tossir sem cobrir a boca pode fazer com que as gotículas atinjam 4,5 metros (15 pés).
en-mt: A study in Singapore found that coughing without covering your mouth can cause droplets to reach 4.5 meters (15 feet).

sourceString: Though the virus is not generally airborne, the National Academy of Science has suggested that bioaerosol transmission may be possible and air collectors positioned in the hallway outside of people's rooms yielded samples positive for viral RNA.
targetString: Embora o vírus não seja geralmente transportado pelo ar, a Academia Nacional de Ciência sugeriu que a transmissão por bioaerossol pode ser possível e coletores de ar posicionados em corredores fora dos quartos das pessoas continham amostras positivas para um RNA viral.
en-mt: Although the virus is not generally airborne, the National Academy of Science has suggested that bioaerosol transmission may be possible, and air traps positioned in hallways outside people's bedrooms have contained positive samples for a viral RNA.

sourceString: Some medical procedures such as intubation and cardiopulmonary resuscitation (CPR) may cause respiratory secretions to be aerosolised and thus result in airborne spread.
targetString: Alguns procedimentos médicos, como intubação e reanimação cardiopulmonar (RCP), podem gerar secreções respiratórias que serão aerossolizadas e, portanto, transmitidas pelo ar.
en-mt: Some medical procedures, such as intubation and cardiopulmonary resuscitation (CPR), can generate respiratory secretions that will be aerosolized and therefore airborne.

sourceString: While there are concerns it may spread via feces, this risk is believed to be low.The virus is most contagious when people are symptomatic; while spread may be possible before symptoms emerge, the risk is low.
targetString: Embora exista a preocupação de que ele possa ser transmitido por meio das fezes, se acredita que o risco seja baixo. O vírus é mais contagioso quando as pessoas são sintomáticas. Embora seja possível haver transmissão antes dos sintomas aparecerem, o risco é baixo.
en-mt: Although there is concern that it can be transmitted via faeces, the risk is thought to be low. The virus is most contagious when people are symptomatic. While it is possible for transmission to occur before symptoms appear, the risk is low.

sourceString: The European Centre for Disease Prevention and Control (ECDC) says while it is not entirely clear how easily the disease spreads, one person generally infects two to three others.The virus survives for hours to days on surfaces.
targetString: O Centro Europeu de Prevenção e Controle de Doenças (ECDC) afirma que, embora não esteja totalmente claro a facilidade com que a doença é disseminada, normalmente uma pessoa infecta uma ou duas. O vírus sobrevive por horas ou dias nas superfícies.
en-mt: The European Center for Disease Prevention and Control (ECDC) says that while it's not entirely clear how easily the disease is spread, typically one person infects one or two. The virus survives for hours or days on surfaces.

sourceString: Specifically, the virus was found to be detectable for one day on cardboard, for up to three days on plastic (polypropylene) and stainless steel (AISI 304), and for up to four hours on 99% copper.
targetString: Especificamente, descobriu-se que o vírus era detectável por um dia em papelão, até três dias em plástico (polipropileno) e aço inoxidável (AISI 304) e até quatro horas em cobre 99%.
en-mt: Specifically, the virus was found to be detectable for one day on cardboard, up to three days on plastic (polypropylene) and stainless steel (AISI 304), and up to four hours on 99% copper.

sourceString: This, however, varies depending on the humidity and temperature.
targetString: Isso, porém, depende da umidade e da temperatura.
en-mt: This, however, depends on humidity and temperature.

sourceString: Soap and detergent are also effective if correctly used; soap products degrade the virus' fatty protective layer, deactivating it, as well as freeing them from skin and other surfaces.
targetString: Sabão e detergente também são efetivos se forem usados corretamente. Produtos com sabão degradam o envelope lipídico protetor do vírus, desativando-o, além de eliminá-lo da pele e de outras superfícies.
en-mt: Soap and detergent are also effective if used correctly. Soap products degrade the virus's protective lipid envelope, deactivating it, in addition to eliminating it from the skin and other surfaces.

sourceString: Other solutions, such as benzalkonium chloride and chlorhexidine gluconate (a surgical disinfectant), are less effective.In a Hong Kong study, saliva samples were taken a median of two days after the start of hospitalization.
targetString: Outras soluções, como o cloreto de benzalcônio e o gliconato de clorexidina (um desinfetante cirúrgico), são menos efetivas. Em um estudo realizado em Hong Kong, amostras de saliva foram coletadas em média dois dias após o início da hospitalização.
en-mt: Other solutions, such as benzalkonium chloride and chlorhexidine gluconate (a surgical disinfectant), are less effective. In a study conducted in Hong Kong, saliva samples were collected on average two days after the start of hospitalization.

sourceString: In five of six patients, the first sample showed the highest viral load, and the sixth patient showed the highest viral load on the second day tested.
targetString: Em cinco dos seis pacientes, a primeira amostra apresentou a carga viral mais alta, enquanto o sexto paciente apresentou a carga viral mais alta no segundo dia testado.
