en-mt: In five of the six patients, the first sample had the highest viral load, while the sixth patient had the highest viral load on the second tested day.

sourceString: Severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2) is a novel severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus, first isolated from three people with pneumonia connected to the cluster of acute respiratory illness cases in Wuhan.
targetString: O coronavírus da síndrome respiratória aguda grave 2 (SARS-CoV-2) é um novo coronavírus da síndrome respiratória aguda que foi primeiramente isolado em três pessoas com pneumonia que tinham relação com um grupo de casos de doenças respiratórias agudas em Wuhan.
en-mt: Severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2) is a new acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus that was first isolated in three people with pneumonia that were related to a cluster of acute respiratory disease cases in Wuhan.

sourceString: All features of the novel SARS-CoV-2 virus occur in related coronaviruses in nature.
targetString: Todas as características do novo vírus SARS-CoV-2 ocorrem na natureza, em coronavírus relacionados.
en-mt: All features of the novel SARS-CoV-2 virus occur in nature in related coronaviruses.

sourceString: Outside the human body, the virus is killed by household soap, which bursts its protective bubble.SARS-CoV-2 is closely related to the original SARS-CoV.
targetString: Fora do corpo humano, o vírus morre em contato com sabão doméstico, que rompe sua camada de proteção. O SARS-CoV-2 está intimamente ligado ao SARS-CoV original.
en-mt: Outside the human body, the virus dies in contact with household soap, which breaks its protective layer. SARS-CoV-2 is closely linked to the original SARS-CoV.

sourceString: The lungs are the organs most affected by COVID-19 because the virus accesses host cells via the enzyme angiotensin-converting enzyme 2 (ACE2), which is most abundant in the type II alveolar cells of the lungs.
targetString: Os pulmões são os órgãos mais afetados pela COVID-19 porque o vírus acessa as células hospedeiras por meio da enzima conversora da angiotensina 2 (ACE2), que é mais abundante nas células alveolares tipo II dos pulmões.
en-mt: The lungs are the organs most affected by COVID-19 because the virus accesses host cells through angiotensin-converting enzyme 2 (ACE2), which is most abundant in type II alveolar cells of the lungs.

sourceString: The virus uses a special surface glycoprotein called a "spike" (peplomer) to connect to ACE2 and enter the host cell.
targetString: O vírus usa uma glicoproteína de superfície especial chamada "espícula" (peplômero) para se conectar à ACE2 e entrar na célula hospedeira.
en-mt: The virus uses a special surface glycoprotein called a "spike" (peplomere) to attach to ACE2 and enter the host cell.

sourceString: Acute cardiac injury was found in 12% of infected people admitted in hospital in Wuhan, China, and is more frequent in severe disease.
targetString: Lesão cardíaca aguda foi observada em 12% das pessoas infectadas que foram internadas no hospital em Wuhan, na China, e é mais frequente na doença grave.
en-mt: Acute cardiac injury was seen in 12% of infected people who were admitted to hospital in Wuhan, China, and is more frequent in severe illness.

sourceString: Rates of cardiovascular symptoms is high, owing to the systemic inflammatory response and immune system disorders during disease progression, but acute myocardial injury may also be related to ACE2 receptors in the heart.
targetString: A taxa de sintomas cardiovasculares é alta graças à resposta inflamatória sistêmica e a distúrbios do sistema imune durante a evolução da doença, mas lesão aguda do miocárdio também pode estar relacionada aos receptores da ACE2 no coração.
en-mt: The rate of cardiovascular symptoms is high due to the systemic inflammatory response and disturbances of the immune system during the course of the disease, but acute myocardial injury may also be related to ACE2 receptors in the heart.

sourceString: ACE2 receptors are highly expressed in the heart and are involved in heart function.
targetString: Os receptores da ACE2 são altamente expressos no coração e estão envolvidos na função cardíaca.
en-mt: ACE2 receptors are highly expressed in the heart and are involved in cardiac function.

sourceString: A high incidence of thrombosis (31%) and venous thromboembolism (25%) have been found in ICU patients with COVID-19 infections and may be related to poor prognosis.Autopsies of people who died of COVID-19 have found diffuse alveolar damage (DAD), and lymphocyte-containing inflammatory infiltrates within the lung.
targetString: Uma alta incidência de trombose (31%) e tromboembolia venosa (25%) foi encontrada em pacientes na UTI com infecções pela COVID-19 e pode estar relacionada ao prognóstico ruim. Necropsias de pessoas que morreram devido à COVID-19 mostraram dano alveolar difuso (DAD) e infiltrados inflamatórios contendo linfócitos no pulmão.
en-mt: A high incidence of thrombosis (31%) and venous thromboembolism (25%) was found in ICU patients with COVID-19 infections and may be related to poor prognosis. Necropsies of people who died from COVID-19 showed diffuse alveolar damage (DAD) and inflammatory infiltrates containing lymphocytes in the lung.

sourceString: Although SARS-COV-2 has a tropism for ACE2-expressing epithelial cells of the respiratory tract, patients with severe COVID-19 have symptoms of systemic hyperinflammation.
targetString: Embora o SARS-CoV-2 tenha tropismo para células epiteliais do trato respiratório que expressam a ACE2, pacientes com COVID-19 grave apresentam sintomas de hiperinflamação sistêmica.
en-mt: Although SARS-CoV-2 has tropism for respiratory tract epithelial cells that express ACE2, patients with severe COVID-19 show symptoms of systemic hyperinflammation.

sourceString: In particular, pathogenic GM-CSF-secreting T-cells were shown to correlate with the recruitment of inflammatory IL-6-secreting monocytes and severe lung pathology in COVID-19 patients.
targetString: Em particular, foi demonstrado que as células T patogênicas que secretam GM-CSF têm correlação com o recrutamento de monócitos inflamatórios secretores de IL-6 e patologia grave do pulmão em pacientes com COVID-19.
en-mt: In particular, pathogenic T cells secreting GM-CSF have been shown to correlate with recruitment of IL-6-secreting inflammatory monocytes and severe lung pathology in patients with COVID-19.

sourceString: Lymphocytic infiltrates have also been reported at autopsy.
targetString: Infiltrados linfocíticos também foram relatados na necropsia.
en-mt: Lymphocytic infiltrates were also reported at necropsy.

sourceString: The WHO has published several testing protocols for the disease.
targetString: A OMS publicou diversos protocolos de teste para a doença.
en-mt: The WHO has published several testing protocols for the disease.

sourceString: The standard method of testing is real-time reverse transcription polymerase chain reaction (rRT-PCR).
targetString: O método padrão de testagem é a reação em cadeia da polimerase via transcrição reversa em tempo real (rRT-PCR).
en-mt: The standard method of testing is real-time reverse transcription polymerase chain reaction (rRT-PCR).

sourceString: The test is typically done on respiratory samples obtained by a nasopharyngeal swab; however, a nasal swab or sputum sample may also be used.
targetString: O teste geralmente é feito em amostras respiratórias obtidas por meio de um swab nasofaríngeo, no entanto, podem ser usados um swab nasal ou amostra de catarro.
en-mt: Testing is usually done on respiratory specimens obtained using a nasopharyngeal swab, however, a nasal swab or sputum specimen may be used.

sourceString: Results are generally available within a few hours to two days.
targetString: Os resultados normalmente ficam disponíveis em algumas horas até dois dias.
en-mt: Results are typically available within a few hours to two days.

sourceString: Blood tests can be used, but these require two blood samples taken two weeks apart and the results have little immediate value.
targetString: Exames de sangue podem ser usados, mas para isso é necessário coletar duas amostras de sangue com duas semanas de diferença e os resultados possuem pouco valor imediato.
en-mt: Blood tests can be used, but this requires taking two blood samples two weeks apart and the results have little immediate value.

sourceString: Chinese scientists were able to isolate a strain of the coronavirus and publish the genetic sequence so laboratories across the world could independently develop polymerase chain reaction (PCR) tests to detect infection by the virus.
targetString: Os cientistas chineses foram capazes de isolar uma cepa de coronavírus e publicar sua sequência genética para que laboratórios em todo o mundo pudessem desenvolver, de forma independente, testes de reação em cadeia da polimerase (PCR) para detectar a infecção pelo vírus.
en-mt: Chinese scientists were able to isolate a strain of coronavirus and publish its genetic sequence so that laboratories around the world could independently develop polymerase chain reaction (PCR) tests to detect infection with the virus.

sourceString: As of 4 April 2020, antibody tests (which may detect active infections and whether a person had been infected in the past) were in development, but not yet widely used.
targetString: A partir de 4 de abril de 2020, testes por meio de anticorpos (que podem detectar infecções ativas e se uma pessoa foi infectada no passado) estavam em desenvolvimento, mas ainda não foram amplamente usados.
en-mt: As of April 4, 2020, antibody tests (which can detect active infections and whether a person has been infected in the past) are in development but have not yet been widely used.

sourceString: The Chinese experience with testing has shown the accuracy is only 60 to 70%.
targetString: A experiência dos chineses com a testagem mostrou que sua precisão é de 60 a 70%.
en-mt: The experience of the Chinese with testing has shown that its accuracy is 60-70%.

sourceString: The FDA in the United States approved the first point-of-care test on 21 March 2020 for use at the end of that month.Diagnostic guidelines released by Zhongnan Hospital of Wuhan University suggested methods for detecting infections based upon clinical features and epidemiological risk.
targetString: A FDA dos Estados Unidos aprovou o primeiro teste laboratorial remoto em 21 de março de 2020, para uso no fim daquele mês. As diretrizes de diagnóstico liberadas pelo Hospital Zhongnan da Universidade de Wuhan sugerem métodos para detectar infecções com base nos recursos clínicos e risco epidemiológico.
en-mt: The US FDA approved the first remote laboratory test on March 21, 2020, for use later that month. Diagnostic guidelines released by the Zhongnan Hospital of Wuhan University suggest methods to detect infections based on clinical features and epidemiological risk.

sourceString: Bilateral multilobar ground-glass opacities with a peripheral, asymmetric and posterior distribution are common in early infection.
targetString: Opacidades em vidro fosco multilobar bilateral com distribuição periférica, assimétrica e posterior são comuns no começo da infecção.
en-mt: Bilateral multilobar ground-glass opacities with peripheral, asymmetric, and posterior distribution are common early in the infection.

sourceString: Subpleural dominance, crazy paving (lobular septal thickening with variable alveolar filling), and consolidation may appear as the disease progresses.
targetString: Dominância subpleural, pavimentação em mosaico (septos lobulares espessados com enchimento alveolar variável) e consolidação podem aparecer à medida que a doença progride.
en-mt: Subpleural dominance, mosaic paving (thickened lobular septa with variable alveolar filling), and consolidation may appear as the disease progresses.

sourceString: Few data are available about microscopic lesions and the pathophysiology of COVID-19.
targetString: Há poucos dados disponíveis a respeito das lesões microscópicas e da fisiopatologia da COVID-19.
en-mt: Little data is available regarding the microscopic lesions and pathophysiology of COVID-19.

sourceString: The main pathological findings at autopsy are:
targetString: Os principais achados patológicos durante as autópsias são:
en-mt: The main pathological findings during autopsies are:

sourceString: Macroscopy: pleurisy, pericarditis, lung consolidation and pulmonary oedema
targetString: Macroscopia: pleurisia, pericardite, consolidação pulmonar e edema pulmonar
en-mt: Macroscopy: pleurisy, pericarditis, pulmonary consolidation and pulmonary edema

sourceString: Four types of severity of viral pneumonia can be observed:
targetString: Quatro tipos de gravidade da pneumonia viral podem ser observados:
en-mt: Four types of severity of viral pneumonia can be observed:

sourceString: mild pneumonia: pulmonary oedema, pneumocyte hyperplasia, large atypical pneumocytes, interstitial inflammation with lymphocytic infiltration and multinucleated giant cell formation
targetString: pneumonia leve: edema pulmonar, hiperplasia dos pneumócitos, pneumócitos grandes atípicos, inflamação intersticial com infiltração linfocítica e formação de células gigantes multinucleadas
en-mt: mild pneumonia: pulmonary edema, pneumocytic hyperplasia, atypical large pneumocytes, interstitial inflammation with lymphocytic infiltration, and multinucleated giant cell formation

sourceString: severe pneumonia: diffuse alveolar damage (DAD) with diffuse alveolar exudates.
targetString: pneumonia grave: dano alveolar difuso (DAD) com exsudatos alveolares difusos.
en-mt: severe pneumonia: diffuse alveolar damage (DAD) with diffuse alveolar exudates.

sourceString: DAD is the cause of acute respiratory distress syndrome (ARDS) and severe hypoxemia.
targetString: DAD é a causa da síndrome do desconforto respiratório agudo (SDRA) e hipóxia grave.
en-mt: DAD is the cause of acute respiratory distress syndrome (ARDS) and severe hypoxia.

sourceString: healing pneumonia: organisation of exudates in alveolar cavities and pulmonary interstitial fibrosis
targetString: pneumonia tratada: organização de exsudatos em cavidades alveolares e fibrose intersticial pulmonar
en-mt: treated pneumonia: organization of exudates in alveolar cavities and interstitial lung fibrosis

sourceString: Blood: disseminated intravascular coagulation (DIC); leukoerythroblastic reaction
targetString: Sangue: coagulação intravascular disseminada (CID); reação leucoeritroblástica
en-mt: Blood: disseminated intravascular coagulation (DIC); leukoerythroblastic reaction

sourceString: Preventive measures to reduce the chances of infection include staying at home, avoiding crowded places, washing hands with soap and water often and for at least 20 seconds, practising good respiratory hygiene and avoiding touching the eyes, nose or mouth with unwashed hands.
targetString: As medidas preventivas para redução das chances de infecção incluem ficar em casa, evitar lugares com muitas pessoas, lavar frequentemente as mãos com sabão e água por, pelo menos, 20 segundos, praticar uma boa higiene respiratória e evitar tocar os olhos, nariz e boca com as mãos sem lavar.
en-mt: Preventive measures to reduce the chances of infection include staying at home, avoiding crowded places, frequently washing your hands with soap and water for at least 20 seconds, practicing good respiratory hygiene, and avoiding touching your eyes, nose, and mouth. with unwashed hands.

sourceString: The CDC recommends covering the mouth and nose with a tissue when coughing or sneezing and recommends using the inside of the elbow if no tissue is available.
targetString: O CDC recomenda que se cubra a boca e o nariz com um lenço ao tossir ou espirrar, bem como tapar a boca com o lado interno do cotovelo caso o lenço não esteja disponível.
en-mt: The CDC recommends covering your mouth and nose with a tissue when coughing or sneezing, as well as covering your mouth with the inside of your elbow if a tissue is not available.

sourceString: Proper hand hygiene after any cough or sneeze is encouraged.
targetString: A higiene adequada da mão após se tossir ou espirrar é encorajada.
en-mt: Proper hand hygiene after coughing or sneezing is encouraged.

sourceString: The CDC has recommended the use of cloth face coverings in public settings, in part to limit transmission by asymptomatic individuals.Social distancing strategies aim to reduce contact of infected persons with large groups by closing schools and workplaces, restricting travel and cancelling large public gatherings.
targetString: O CDC recomendou o uso de máscaras de pano em locais públicos, em parte para limitar a transmissão por indivíduos assintomáticos. Estratégias de distanciamento social visam reduzir o contato de pessoas infectadas com grandes grupos ao se fechar as escolas e locais de trabalho, restringir viagens e cancelar grandes reuniões públicas.
en-mt: The CDC has recommended the use of cloth masks in public places, in part to limit transmission by asymptomatic individuals. Social distancing strategies aim to reduce contact of infected people with large groups by closing schools and workplaces, restricting travel and canceling large public gatherings.

sourceString: Distancing guidelines also include that people stay at least 6 feet (1.8 m) apart.
targetString: As diretrizes do distanciamento também incluem que as pessoas fiquem a pelo menos 1,8 metros (6 pés) de distância umas das outras.
en-mt: Distancing guidelines also include that people stay at least 1.8 meters (6 feet) apart from each other.

sourceString: There is no medication known to be effective at preventing COVID-19.As a vaccine is not expected until 2021 at the earliest, a key part of managing COVID-19 is trying to decrease the epidemic peak, known as "flattening the curve".
targetString: Não se conhece um medicamento efetivo para a prevenção da COVID-19. Uma vez que a vacina não deve ser lançada antes de 2021, um ponto chave para o controle da COVID-19 é tentar diminuir o pico da epidemia, também conhecido como "achatamento da curva".
en-mt: There is no known effective medicine for the prevention of COVID-19. Since the vaccine is not expected to be launched before 2021, a key point for COVID-19 control is to try to reduce the peak of the epidemic, also known as "flattening the curve".

sourceString: The CDC also recommends that individuals wash hands often with soap and water for at least 20 seconds, especially after going to the toilet or when hands are visibly dirty, before eating and after blowing one's nose, coughing or sneezing.
targetString: O CDC também recomenda que os indivíduos lavem suas mãos com frequência usando sabão e água por pelo menos 20 segundos, especialmente depois de ir ao banheiro ou quando as mãos estão visivelmente sujas, antes de comer e depois de assoar o nariz, tossir ou espirrar.
en-mt: The CDC also recommends that individuals wash their hands frequently using soap and water for at least 20 seconds, especially after going to the bathroom or when hands are visibly dirty, before eating, and after blowing their nose, coughing, or sneezing.

sourceString: It further recommends using an alcohol-based hand sanitiser with at least 60% alcohol, but only when soap and water are not readily available.For areas where commercial hand sanitisers are not readily available, the WHO provides two formulations for local production.
targetString: Ele também recomenda usar antisséptico para mãos a base de álcool com pelo menos 60% de álcool, mas apenas quando o sabão e água não estiverem prontamente disponíveis. Para locais onde os antissépticos para mão comerciais não estejam prontamente disponíveis, a OMS fornece duas formulações para a produção local.
en-mt: He also recommends using an alcohol-based hand sanitizer with at least 60% alcohol, but only when soap and water are not readily available. For locations where commercial hand sanitizers are not readily available, WHO provides two formulations for local production.

sourceString: In these formulations, the antimicrobial activity arises from ethanol or isopropanol.
targetString: Nessas formulações, a atividade antimicrobiana se dá por meio do etanol ou do isopropanol.
en-mt: In these formulations, the antimicrobial activity occurs through ethanol or isopropanol.

sourceString: Hydrogen peroxide is used to help eliminate bacterial spores in the alcohol; it is "not an active substance for hand antisepsis".
targetString: O peróxido de hidrogênio é usado para ajudar a eliminar esporos bacterianos no álcool; não é "uma substância ativa para a assepsia das mãos".
en-mt: Hydrogen peroxide is used to help eliminate bacterial spores in alcohol; it is not "an active substance for hand asepsis".

sourceString: Glycerol is added as a humectant.
targetString: O glicerol é adicionado como umidificante.
en-mt: Glycerol is added as a humectant.

sourceString: People are managed with supportive care, which may include fluid therapy, oxygen support, and supporting other affected vital organs.
targetString: As pessoas são tratadas por meio de cuidados paliativos, que podem incluir terapia com fluídos, suporte de oxigênio e suporte para outros órgãos vitais afetados.
en-mt: People are treated through palliative care, which may include fluid therapy, oxygen support, and support for other affected vital organs.

sourceString: The CDC recommends that those who suspect they carry the virus wear a simple face mask.
targetString: O CDC recomenda que as pessoas que suspeitarem de que estão com o vírus usem uma máscara facial simples.
en-mt: The CDC recommends that people who suspect they have the virus wear a simple face mask.

sourceString: Extracorporeal membrane oxygenation (ECMO) has been used to address the issue of respiratory failure, but its benefits are still under consideration.
targetString: A oxigenação da membrana extracorpórea (ECMO) foi usada para tratar o problema da insuficiência respiratória, mas seus benefícios ainda estão em análise.
en-mt: Extracorporeal membrane oxygenation (ECMO) has been used to treat the problem of respiratory failure, but its benefits are still under review.

sourceString: Personal hygiene and a healthy lifestyle and diet have been recommended to improve immunity.
targetString: A higiene pessoal e o estilo de vida e dieta saudáveis estão sendo recomendados para melhorar a imunidade.
en-mt: Personal hygiene and healthy lifestyle and diet are being recommended to improve immunity.

sourceString: Supportive treatments may be useful in those with mild symptoms at the early stage of infection.The WHO and Chinese National Health Commission have published recommendations for taking care of people who are hospitalised with COVID-19.
targetString: Tratamentos de apoio podem ser úteis para aquelas pessoas com sintomas leves e nos estágios iniciais da infecção. A OMS e a Comissão Nacional de Saúde da China publicaram recomendações para o cuidado das pessoas hospitalizadas com a COVID-19.
en-mt: Supportive treatments can be helpful for those people with mild symptoms and in the early stages of the infection. WHO and China's National Health Commission have published recommendations for the care of people hospitalized with COVID-19.

sourceString: Intensivists and pulmonologists in the U.S. have compiled treatment recommendations from various agencies into a free resource, the IBCC.
targetString: Médicos intensivistas e pneumologistas dos E.U.A reuniram recomendações de tratamento de várias agências em um recurso gratuito, o IBCC.
en-mt: Critical care physicians and pulmonologists across the US have compiled treatment recommendations from multiple agencies into a free resource, the IBCC.

sourceString: As of April 2020, there is no specific treatment for COVID-19.
targetString: Até abril de 2020, não há tratamento específico para a COVID-19.
en-mt: As of April 2020, there is no specific treatment for COVID-19.

sourceString: For symptoms, some medical professionals recommend paracetamol (acetaminophen) over ibuprofen for first-line use.
targetString: Para os sintomas, alguns profissionais de saúde recomendam o paracetamol (acetaminofeno) em vez do ibuprofeno para uso em primeira linha.
en-mt: For symptoms, some healthcare professionals recommend acetaminophen (acetaminophen) over ibuprofen for first-line use.

sourceString: Precautions must be taken to minimise the risk of virus transmission, especially in healthcare settings when performing procedures that can generate aerosols, such as intubation or hand ventilation.
targetString: É preciso tomar precauções para minimizar os riscos de transmissão do vírus, especialmente no ambiente da saúde, quando se está realizando procedimentos que podem gerar aerossóis, como intubação e ventilação manual.
en-mt: Precautions must be taken to minimize the risk of transmission of the virus, especially in the healthcare environment when performing procedures that may generate aerosols, such as intubation and manual ventilation.

sourceString: For healthcare professionals caring for people with COVID-19, the CDC recommends placing the person in an Airborne Infection Isolation Room (AIIR) in addition to using standard precautions, contact precautions and airborne precautions.The CDC outlines the guidelines for the use of personal protective equipment (PPE) during the pandemic.
targetString: Para os profissionais da saúde cuidando de pessoas com COVID-19, o CDC recomenda colocar a pessoa em salas com isolamento de infecções transmitidas pelo ar (SIIA) além de se tomar as precauções padrão, precauções de contato e precauções aéreas. O CDC resume as diretrizes para o uso de equipamento de proteção pessoal (EPI) durante a pandemia.
en-mt: For healthcare professionals caring for people with COVID-19, the CDC recommends placing the person in airborne infection isolation (IAIS) rooms in addition to taking standard precautions, contact precautions, and airborne precautions. The CDC summarizes guidelines for using personal protective equipment (PPE) during the pandemic.

sourceString: The recommended gear is: PPE gown, respirator or facemask, eye protection, and medical gloves.When available, respirators (instead of facemasks) are preferred.
targetString: O equipamento recomendado é: manta de EPI, respirador ou máscara facial, proteção visual e luvas médicas. Quando estiver disponível, é preferível usar respiradores em vez de máscaras faciais.
en-mt: Recommended equipment is: PPE blanket, respirator or face mask, eye protection and medical gloves. Where available, respirators are preferred over face masks.

sourceString: N95 respirators are approved for industrial settings but the FDA has authorised the masks for use under an Emergency Use Authorisation (EUA).
targetString: Respiradores N95 estão aprovados para ambientes industriais, mas a FDA autorizou as máscaras para uso sob Autorização de uso de emergência (EUA).
en-mt: N95 respirators are approved for industrial environments, but the FDA has authorized the masks for use under an Emergency Use Authorization (USA).

sourceString: They are designed to protect from airborne particles like dust but effectiveness against a specific biological agent is not guaranteed for off-label uses.
targetString: Elas foram projetadas para proteger contra partículas aéreas como poeira, mas sua eficácia contra um agente biológico específico não é garantida para usos não descritos.
en-mt: They are designed to protect against airborne particles such as dust, but their effectiveness against a specific biological agent is not guaranteed for uses not described.

sourceString: When masks are not available, the CDC recommends using face shields or, as a last resort, homemade masks.
targetString: Quando as máscaras não estiverem disponíveis, o CDC recomenda o uso de escudos faciais ou, como último recurso, máscaras caseiras.
en-mt: When masks are not available, the CDC recommends using face shields or, as a last resort, homemade masks.

sourceString: Most cases of COVID-19 are not severe enough to require mechanical ventilation or alternatives, but a percentage of cases are.
targetString: A maior parte dos casos de COVID-19 não são graves o bastante para exigir ventilação mecânica ou alternativas, mas uma porcentagem de casos são.
en-mt: Most cases of COVID-19 are not severe enough to require mechanical ventilation or alternatives, but a percentage of cases are.

sourceString: The type of respiratory support for individuals with COVID-19 related respiratory failure is being actively studied for people in hospital, with some evidence that intubation can be avoided with a high flow nasal cannula or bi-level positive airway pressure.
targetString: O tipo de suporte respiratório para indivíduos com insuficiência respiratória relacionada à COVID-19 está sendo estudado para as pessoas nos hospitais, com algumas evidências de que a intubação pode ser evitada com uma cânula nasal de alto fluxo ou pressão positiva nas vias aéreas em dois níveis.
en-mt: The type of respiratory support for individuals with COVID-19-related respiratory failure is being studied for people in hospitals, with some evidence that intubation can be avoided with a high-flow nasal cannula or bilevel positive airway pressure .

sourceString: Whether either of these two leads to the same benefit for people who are critically ill is not known.
targetString: Se algum desses dois leva aos mesmos benefícios para as pessoas que estão gravemente doentes não se sabe.
en-mt: Whether either of these two leads to the same benefits for people who are seriously ill is not known.

sourceString: Some doctors prefer staying with invasive mechanical ventilation when available because this technique limits the spread of aerosol particles compared to a high flow nasal cannula.Severe cases are most common in older adults (those older than 60 years, and especially those older than 80 years).
targetString: Alguns médicos preferem ficar com a ventilação mecânica invasiva quando ela está disponível porque esta técnica limita que as partículas aerossóis se espalhem, se comparadas com a cânula nasal de alto fluxo. Casos graves são mais comuns em idosos (aqueles acima de 60 anos e, especialmente, acima de 80 anos).
en-mt: Some clinicians prefer to stick with invasive mechanical ventilation when it is available because this technique limits the spread of aerosol particles compared to a high-flow nasal cannula. Severe cases are more common in the elderly (those over 60 and especially over 80).

sourceString: Many developed countries do not have enough hospital beds per capita, which limits a health system's capacity to handle a sudden spike in the number of COVID-19 cases severe enough to require hospitalisation.
targetString: Muitos países em desenvolvimento não possuem leitos hospitalares per capita em quantidade suficiente, o que limita a capacidade do sistema de saúde para lidar com a escalada repentina no número de casos de COVID-19 graves o bastante para exigirem hospitalização.
en-mt: Many developing countries do not have enough hospital beds per capita, which limits the health system's ability to deal with the sudden escalation in the number of COVID-19 cases severe enough to require hospitalization.

sourceString: One study in China found 5% were admitted to intensive care units, 2.3% needed mechanical support of ventilation, and 1.4% died.
targetString: Um estudo na China observou que 5% foram admitidos em unidades de terapia intensiva, 2,3% precisaram do suporte mecânico de ventilação e 1,4% morreram.
en-mt: A study in China noted that 5% were admitted to intensive care units, 2.3% required mechanical ventilation support, and 1.4% died.

sourceString: In China, approximately 30% of people in hospital with COVID-19 are eventually admitted to ICU.
targetString: Na China, cerca de 30% das pessoas no hospital com COVID-19 foram, eventualmente, levadas para a UTI.
en-mt: In China, around 30% of people in the hospital with COVID-19 were eventually taken to the ICU.

sourceString: Mechanical ventilation becomes more complex as acute respiratory distress syndrome (ARDS) develops in COVID-19 and oxygenation becomes increasingly difficult.
targetString: A ventilação mecânica se torna mais complexa à medida que a síndrome do desconforto respiratório agudo (SDRA) se desenvolve na COVID-19 e a oxigenação fica cada vez mais difícil.
en-mt: Mechanical ventilation becomes more complex as acute respiratory distress syndrome (ARDS) develops in COVID-19 and oxygenation becomes increasingly difficult.

sourceString: Ventilators capable of pressure control modes and high PEEP are needed to maximise oxygen delivery while minimising the risk of ventilator-associated lung injury and pneumothorax.
targetString: Ventiladores que possuem modo de controle de pressão e nível alto de PEEP são necessários para aumentar a entrega de oxigênio enquanto se minimiza o risco de lesões pulmonares e no pneumotórax associadas com a ventilação.
en-mt: Ventilators that have a pressure control mode and a high PEEP level are needed to increase oxygen delivery while minimizing the risk of lung injury and pneumothorax associated with ventilation.

sourceString: High PEEP may not be available on older ventilators.
targetString: Alto nível de PEEP pode não estar disponíveis em ventiladores mais antigos.
en-mt: High PEEP level may not be available on older ventilators.

sourceString: Research into potential treatments started in January 2020, and several antiviral drugs are in clinical trials.
targetString: A pesquisa por tratamentos potenciais começou em janeiro de 2020 e estão sendo feitos testes clínicos com diversos medicamentos antivirais.
en-mt: Searching for potential treatments began in January 2020, and clinical trials are underway with several antiviral drugs.

sourceString: Remdesivir appears to be the most promising.
targetString: O Remdesivir parece ser o mais promissor.
en-mt: Remdesivir appears to be the most promising.

sourceString: Although new medications may take until 2021 to develop, several of the medications being tested are already approved for other uses or are already in advanced testing.
targetString: Embora novos medicamentos possam demorar até 2021 para serem desenvolvidos, diversos dos medicamentos testados já foram aprovados para outros usos ou estão em fase avançada de teste.
en-mt: Although new drugs may take until 2021 to be developed, several of the drugs tested have already been approved for other uses or are in advanced stages of testing.

sourceString: Antiviral medication may be tried in people with severe disease.
targetString: Medicamento antiviral pode ser testado em pessoas com diversas doenças.
en-mt: Antiviral medication can be tested on people with a variety of illnesses.

sourceString: The WHO recommended volunteers take part in trials of the effectiveness and safety of potential treatments.The FDA has granted temporary authorisation to convalescent plasma as an experimental treatment in cases where the person's life is seriously or immediately threatened.
targetString: A OMS recomendou que voluntários participem dos testes de efetividade e segurança dos tratamentos potenciais. A FDA deu autorização temporária para uso de plasma de pessoas convalescentes como tratamento nos casos em que a vida da pessoa está séria e imediatamente ameaçada.
en-mt: WHO has recommended that volunteers participate in testing the effectiveness and safety of potential treatments. The FDA has given temporary authorization for the use of plasma from convalescents as a treatment in cases where the person's life is seriously and immediately threatened.

sourceString: It has not undergone the clinical studies needed to show it is safe and effective for the disease.
targetString: Ainda não foram realizados os estudos clínicos necessários para mostrar sua segurança e efetividade contra a doença.
en-mt: The necessary clinical studies to show its safety and effectiveness against the disease have not yet been carried out.

sourceString: In February 2020, China launched a mobile app to deal with the disease outbreak.
targetString: Em fevereiro de 2020, a China lançou um aplicativo móvel para lidar com o surto da doença.
en-mt: In February 2020, China launched a mobile app to deal with the disease outbreak.

sourceString: Users are asked to enter their name and ID number.
targetString: É solicitado que os usuários informem seu nome e número de ID.
en-mt: Users are asked to provide their name and ID number.

sourceString: The app is able to detect 'close contact' using surveillance data and therefore a potential risk of infection.
targetString: O aplicativo consegue detectar o "contato próximo" usando dados de monitoramento e, assim, o risco potencial de infecção.
en-mt: The app is able to detect "close contact" using monitoring data and thus the potential risk of infection.

sourceString: Every user can also check the status of three other users.
targetString: Cada usuário também pode verificar o status de três outros usuários.
en-mt: Each user can also check the status of three other users.

sourceString: If a potential risk is detected, the app not only recommends self-quarantine, it also alerts local health officials.Big data analytics on cellphone data, facial recognition technology, mobile phone tracking and artificial intelligence are used to track infected people and people whom they contacted in South Korea, Taiwan and Singapore.
targetString: Se for detectado um risco potencial, o aplicativo não apenas recomenda a quarentena como também alerta as autoridades sanitárias locais. Análises de big data de dados de celulares, tecnologia de reconhecimento facial, rastreamento de telefonia móvel e inteligência artificial estão sendo usados para rastrear pessoas infectadas e as pessoas com as quais elas tiveram contato na Coreia do Sul, Taiwan e Singapura.
en-mt: If a potential risk is detected, the app not only recommends quarantine but also alerts local health authorities. Big data analysis of cell phone data, facial recognition technology, mobile phone tracking and artificial intelligence are being used to track infected people and the people they came into contact with in South Korea, Taiwan and Singapore.

sourceString: In March 2020, the Israeli government enabled security agencies to track mobile phone data of people supposed to have coronavirus.
targetString: Em março de 2020, o governo de Israel autorizou que as agências de segurança rastreiem dados de telefonia móvel de pessoas que supostamente estão com coronavírus.
en-mt: In March 2020, the government of Israel authorized security agencies to track mobile phone data of people who allegedly have the coronavirus.

sourceString: The measure was taken to enforce quarantine and protect those who may come into contact with infected citizens.
targetString: A medida foi tomada para reforçar a quarentena e proteger as pessoas que podem entrar em contato com cidadãos infectados.
en-mt: The measure was taken to reinforce the quarantine and protect people who may come into contact with infected citizens.

sourceString: Also in March 2020, Deutsche Telekom shared aggregated phone location data with the German federal government agency, Robert Koch Institute, in order to research and prevent the spread of the virus.
targetString: Ainda em março de 2020, a Deutsche Telekom compartilhou dados agregados de localização de telefone com a agência do governo federal alemão, o Robert Koch Institute, para se pesquisar e prevenir a transmissão do vírus.
en-mt: Also in March 2020, Deutsche Telekom shared aggregated phone location data with the German federal government agency, the Robert Koch Institute, to research and prevent transmission of the virus.

sourceString: Russia deployed facial recognition technology to detect quarantine breakers.
targetString: A Rússia implementou a tecnologia de reconhecimento facial para detectar quem descumpre a quarentena.
en-mt: Russia has implemented facial recognition technology to detect quarantine violators.

sourceString: Italian regional health commissioner Giulio Gallera said he has been informed by mobile phone operators that "40% of people are continuing to move around anyway".
targetString: O comissário regional de saúde italiano, Giulio Gallera, disse ter sido informado por operadoras de celular que "40% das pessoas continuam circulando mesmo assim".
en-mt: Italy's regional health commissioner, Giulio Gallera, said he had been told by mobile operators that "40% of people are still moving around".

sourceString: German government conducted a 48 hours weekend hackathon with more than 42.000 participants.
targetString: O governo alemão conduziu um hackaton de 48 horas no fim de semana com mais de 42 mil participantes.
en-mt: The German government conducted a 48-hour hackathon over the weekend with over 42,000 participants.

sourceString: Also the president of Estonia, Kersti Kaljulaid, made a global call for creative solutions against the spread of coronavirus.
targetString: Além disso, o presidente da Estônia, Kersti Kaljulaid, fez um apelo global por soluções criativas contra a disseminação do coronavírus.
en-mt: Furthermore, Estonian President Kersti Kaljulaid made a global call for creative solutions against the spread of the coronavirus.

sourceString: Individuals may experience distress from quarantine, travel restrictions, side effects of treatment or fear of the infection itself.
targetString: Os indivíduos podem passar por dificuldades na quarentena, restrições de viagem, efeitos colaterais de tratamento ou medo da infecção em si.
en-mt: Individuals may experience difficulties with quarantine, travel restrictions, treatment side effects, or fear of the infection itself.

sourceString: BBC quoted Rory O'Connor in saying, "Increased social isolation, loneliness, health anxiety, stress and an economic downturn are a perfect storm to harm people's mental health and wellbeing."
targetString: A BBC citou Rory O'Connor, que disse: "O aumento do isolamento social, da solidão, da ansiedade médica, do estresse e uma crise econômica são uma tempestade perfeita para prejudicar a saúde mental e o bem-estar das pessoas."
en-mt: The BBC quoted Rory O'Connor who said: "Increasing social isolation, loneliness, medical anxiety, stress and an economic downturn are a perfect storm to damage people's mental health and well-being."

sourceString: The disease may take a mild course with few or no symptoms, resembling other common upper respiratory diseases such as the common cold.
targetString: A doença pode ter uma evolução leve, com poucos ou nenhum sintoma, parecendo outras doenças comuns do trato respiratório superior, como o resfriado.
en-mt: The disease can have a mild course, with few or no symptoms, resembling other common illnesses of the upper respiratory tract, such as the common cold.

sourceString: Mild cases typically recover within two weeks, while those with severe or critical diseases may take three to six weeks to recover.
targetString: Casos leves normalmente se recuperam dentro de duas semanas, ao passo que aqueles com doença grave ou crítica podem levar de três a seis semanas para se recuperar.
en-mt: Mild cases typically recover within two weeks, whereas those with severe or critical illness may take three to six weeks to recover.

sourceString: Pregnant women may be at higher risk for severe infection with COVID-19 based on data from other similar viruses, like SARS and MERS, but data for COVID-19 is lacking.In some people, COVID-19 may affect the lungs causing pneumonia.
targetString: Mulheres grávidas podem ter um maior risco de infecção grave da COVID-19, conforme dados de outros vírus parecidos, como SARS e MERS, mas faltam dados da COVID-19. Em algumas pessoas, a COVID-19 pode afetar os pulmões, causando pneumonia.
en-mt: Pregnant women may be at increased risk of severe COVID-19 infection, as data from other similar viruses such as SARS and MERS have shown, but data from COVID-19 is lacking. In some people, COVID-19 can affect the lungs, causing pneumonia.

sourceString: In those most severely affected, COVID-19 may rapidly progress to acute respiratory distress syndrome (ARDS) causing respiratory failure, septic shock or multi-organ failure.
targetString: Naqueles mais gravemente afetados, a COVID-19 pode progredir rapidamente para síndrome de angústia respiratória do adulto (ARDS), causando insuficiência respiratória, choque séptico ou falência múltipla de órgãos.
en-mt: In those most severely affected, COVID-19 can rapidly progress to adult respiratory distress syndrome (ARDS), causing respiratory failure, septic shock, or multiple organ failure.

sourceString: Complications associated with COVID-19 include sepsis, abnormal clotting and damage to the heart, kidneys and liver.
targetString: Complicações associadas à COVID-19 incluem sepse, distúrbios de coagulação e danos no coração, nos rins e no fígado.
en-mt: Complications associated with COVID-19 include sepsis, clotting disorders, and heart, kidney, and liver damage.

sourceString: Clotting abnormalities, specifically an increase in prothrombin time, have been described in 6% of those admitted to hospital with COVID-19, while abnormal kidney function is seen in 4% of this group.
targetString: Os distúrbios de coagulação, especificamente o aumento no tempo de protrombina, foram descritos em 6% dos internados em hospitais com COVID-19, ao passo que a insuficiência renal foi vista em 4% desse grupo.
en-mt: Coagulation disorders, specifically increased prothrombin time, were described in 6% of those admitted to hospitals with COVID-19, whereas renal failure was seen in 4% of that group.

sourceString: Approximately 20-30% of people who present with COVID-19 demonstrate elevated liver enzymes (transaminases).
targetString: Aproximadamente 20-30% das pessoas que têm a COVID-19 apresentam elevadas enzimas hepáticas (transaminases).
en-mt: Approximately 20-30% of people who have COVID-19 have elevated liver enzymes (transaminases).

sourceString: According to the same report, the median time between onset of symptoms and death was ten days, with five being spent hospitalised.
targetString: De acordo com o mesmo relatório, a mediana entre o surgimento dos sintomas e a morte foi de dez dias, com cinco de hospitalização.
en-mt: According to the same report, the median time between the onset of symptoms and death was ten days, with five days of hospitalization.

sourceString: However, patients transferred to an ICU had a median time of seven days between hospitalisation and death.
targetString: No entanto, pacientes transferidos para uma UTI tiveram uma mediana de sete dias entre a hospitalização e a morte.
en-mt: However, patients transferred to an ICU had a median of seven days between hospitalization and death.

sourceString: In a study of early cases, the median time from exhibiting initial symptoms to death was 14 days, with a full range of six to 41 days.
targetString: Em um estudo com casos precoces, a mediana da manifestação dos sintomas iniciais até a morte foi de 14 dias, com um intervalo total de seis a 41 dias.
en-mt: In a study of early cases, the median from onset of initial symptoms to death was 14 days, with a total range of six to 41 days.

sourceString: In a study by the National Health Commission (NHC) of China, men had a death rate of 2.8% while women had a death rate of 1.7%.
targetString: Em um estudo da Comissão Nacional de Saúde (NHC) da China, homens tiveram uma taxa de mortalidade de 2,8%, ao passo que as mulheres tiveram uma taxa de mortalidade de 1,7%.
en-mt: In a study by the National Health Commission (NHC) of China, men had a mortality rate of 2.8%, while women had a mortality rate of 1.7%.

sourceString: Histopathological examinations of post-mortem lung samples show diffuse alveolar damage with cellular fibromyxoid exudates in both lungs.
targetString: Exames histopatológicos de amostras post mortem de pulmão mostram danos alveolares difusos com exsudatos fibromixoides celulares nos dois pulmões.
en-mt: Histopathological examinations of post mortem lung specimens show diffuse alveolar damage with fibromyxoid cellular exudates in both lungs.

sourceString: Viral cytopathic changes were observed in the pneumocytes.
targetString: Alterações citopáticas virais foram observadas nos pneumócitos.
en-mt: Viral cytopathic changes were observed in pneumocytes.

sourceString: The lung picture resembled acute respiratory distress syndrome (ARDS).
targetString: O exame de imagem do pulmão parecia síndrome do desconforto respiratório agudo (ARDS).
en-mt: Lung imaging looked like acute respiratory distress syndrome (ARDS).

sourceString: In 11.8% of the deaths reported by the National Health Commission of China, heart damage was noted by elevated levels of troponin or cardiac arrest.
targetString: Em 11,8% das mortes relatadas pela Comissão Nacional de Saúde da China, foram detectados danos no coração em razão dos níveis elevados de troponina ou parada cardíaca.
en-mt: In 11.8% of deaths reported by China's National Health Commission, heart damage was detected due to elevated troponin levels or cardiac arrest.

sourceString: According to March data from the United States, 89% of those hospitalised had preexisting conditions.Availability of medical resources and the socioeconomics of a region may also affect mortality.
targetString: De acordo com dados de março dos Estados Unidos, 89% dos hospitalizados tinham comorbidades preexistentes. A disponibilidade de recursos médicos e fatores socioeconômicos de uma região também podem afetar a mortalidade.
en-mt: According to March data from the United States, 89% of those hospitalized had preexisting comorbidities. The availability of medical resources and socioeconomic factors in a region can also affect mortality.

sourceString: Estimates of the mortality from the condition vary because of those regional differences, but also because of methodological difficulties.
targetString: As estimativas de mortalidade por comorbidade variam devido a essas diferenças regionais, mas também devido a dificuldades metodológicas.
en-mt: Estimates of comorbid mortality vary due to these regional differences, but also due to methodological difficulties.

sourceString: The under-counting of mild cases can cause the mortality rate to be overestimated.
targetString: A subnotificação de casos leves pode fazer com que a taxa de mortalidade seja superestimada.
en-mt: Underreporting of mild cases can cause the mortality rate to be overestimated.

sourceString: However, the fact that deaths are the result of cases contracted in the past can mean the current mortality rate is underestimated.
targetString: No entanto, o fato de as mortes serem o resultado de casos contraídos no passado pode significar que a taxa de mortalidade atual seja subestimada.
en-mt: However, the fact that the deaths are the result of cases contracted in the past may mean that the current death rate is underestimated.

sourceString: Smokers were 1.4 times more likely to have severe symptoms of COVID-19 and approximately 2.4 times more likely to require intensive care or die compared to non-smokers.Concerns have been raised about long-term sequelae of the disease.
targetString: Fumantes eram 1,4 vez mais propensos a ter sintomas graves da COVID-19 e aproximadamente 2,4 vezes mais propensos a precisar de tratamento intensivo ou morrer, em comparação com não fumantes. Preocupações foram suscitadas a respeito de sequelas da doença em longo prazo.
en-mt: Smokers were 1.4 times more likely to have severe COVID-19 symptoms and approximately 2.4 times more likely to need intensive care or die, compared to non-smokers. Concerns have been raised regarding long-term sequelae of the disease.

sourceString: The Hong Kong Hospital Authority found a drop of 20% to 30% in lung capacity in some people who recovered from the disease, and lung scans suggested organ damage.
targetString: A autoridade hospitalar de Hong Kong verificou uma queda de 20% a 30% na capacidade pulmonar em algumas pessoas que se recuperaram da doença, e exames de pulmão indicaram danos no órgão.
en-mt: Hong Kong's hospital authority has seen a 20% to 30% drop in lung capacity in some people who have recovered from the disease, and lung scans have indicated lung damage.

sourceString: This may also lead to post-intensive care syndrome following recovery.
targetString: Isso também pode levar à síndrome pós-cuidados intensivos depois da recuperação.
en-mt: This can also lead to Post Intensive Care Syndrome after recovery.

sourceString: As of March 2020, it was unknown if past infection provides effective and long-term immunity in people who recover from the disease.
targetString: Até março de 2020, não se sabia se infecções passadas dariam imunidade efetiva e duradoura para pessoas que se recuperaram da doença.
en-mt: Until March 2020, it was not known whether past infections would provide effective and lasting immunity for people who have recovered from the disease.

sourceString: Immunity is seen as likely, based on the behaviour of other coronaviruses, but cases in which recovery from COVID-19 have been followed by positive tests for coronavirus at a later date have been reported.
targetString: A imunidade é vista como provável, com base no comportamento de outros coronavírus, mas foram relatados casos em que a recuperação da COVID-19 foi seguida por testes positivos para coronavírus em uma data posterior.
en-mt: Immunity is seen as likely based on the behavior of other coronaviruses, but cases have been reported where recovery from COVID-19 was followed by testing positive for coronavirus at a later date.

sourceString: These cases are believed to be worsening of a lingering infection rather than re-infection.
targetString: Acredita-se que esses casos sejam a piora de uma infecção prolongada em vez de uma reinfecção.
en-mt: These cases are believed to be the worsening of a prolonged infection rather than a reinfection.

sourceString: The virus is thought to be natural and have an animal origin, through spillover infection.
targetString: Acredita-se que o vírus seja natural e tenha origem animal, por meio de infecção por transbordamento.
en-mt: The virus is believed to be natural and of animal origin, via spillover infection.

sourceString: The actual origin is unknown, but by December 2019 the spread of infection was almost entirely driven by human-to-human transmission.
targetString: A origem real é desconhecida, mas, a partir de dezembro de 2019, a propagação da infecção tornou-se quase inteiramente impulsionada pela transmissão de humano para humano.
en-mt: The actual origin is unknown, but as of December 2019, the spread of the infection has become almost entirely driven by human-to-human transmission.

sourceString: A study of the first 41 cases of confirmed COVID-19, published in January 2020 in The Lancet, revealed the earliest date of onset of symptoms as 1 December 2019.
targetString: Um estudo com os 41 primeiros casos confirmados de COVID-19, publicado em janeiro de 2020 na The Lancet, revelou que a data mais antiga do surgimento dos sintomas foi 1º de dezembro de 2019.
en-mt: A study of the first 41 confirmed cases of COVID-19, published in January 2020 in The Lancet, revealed that the earliest date of onset of symptoms was December 1, 2019.

sourceString: Official publications from the WHO reported the earliest onset of symptoms as 8 December 2019.
targetString: Publicações oficiais da OMS relatavam a data mais antiga do surgimento de sintomas como 8 de dezembro de 2019.
en-mt: Official WHO publications reported the earliest date of onset of symptoms as December 8, 2019.

sourceString: Several measures are commonly used to quantify mortality.
targetString: Várias medidas são comumente usadas para quantificar a mortalidade.
en-mt: Several measures are commonly used to quantify mortality.

sourceString: These numbers vary by region and over time and are influenced by the volume of testing, healthcare system quality, treatment options, time since initial outbreak and population characteristics such as age, sex and overall health.
targetString: Esses números variam por região e com o tempo e são influenciados pelo volume de testes, qualidade do sistema de saúde, opções de tratamento, tempo decorrido desde o surto inicial e características populacionais como idade, sexo e saúde em geral.
en-mt: These numbers vary by region and over time and are influenced by the volume of testing, quality of the health care system, treatment options, time elapsed since the initial outbreak, and population characteristics such as age, gender, and general health.

sourceString: In late 2019, WHO assigned the emergency ICD-10 disease codes U07.1 for deaths from lab-confirmed SARS-CoV-2 infection and U07.2 for deaths from clinically or epidemiologically diagnosed COVID-19 without lab-confirmed SARS-CoV-2 infection.The death-to-case ratio reflects the number of deaths divided by the number of diagnosed cases within a given time interval.
targetString: No final de 2019, a OMS atribuiu os códigos de doença CID-10 de emergência U07.1 para mortes decorrentes de infecção por SARS-CoV-2 confirmadas em laboratório e U07.2 para mortes por COVID-19 com diagnóstico clínico ou epidemiológico, sem infecção por SARS-CoV-2 confirmada em laboratório. A taxa de mortalidade reflete o número de mortes dividido pelo número de casos diagnosticados dentro de um determinado intervalo de tempo.
en-mt: In late 2019, WHO assigned emergency ICD-10 disease codes U07.1 for deaths due to laboratory-confirmed SARS-CoV-2 infection and U07.2 for COVID-19 deaths with clinical or epidemiological diagnosis, no laboratory-confirmed SARS-CoV-2 infection. The mortality rate reflects the number of deaths divided by the number of cases diagnosed within a given time interval.

sourceString: Based on Johns Hopkins University statistics, the global death-to-case ratio is 6.9% (153,822/2,240,191) as of 17 April 2020.
targetString: Com base nas estatísticas da Universidade Johns Hopkins, a taxa de letalidade global era de 6,9% (153.822/2.240.191) em 17 de abril de 2020.
en-mt: Based on Johns Hopkins University statistics, the global case fatality rate was 6.9% (153,822/2,240,191) as of April 17, 2020.

sourceString: The number varies by region.Other measures include the case fatality rate (CFR), which reflects the percent of diagnosed individuals who die from a disease, and the infection fatality rate (IFR), which reflects the percent of infected individuals (diagnosed and undiagnosed) who die from a disease.
targetString: O número varia por região. Outras medidas incluem a taxa de letalidade por casos (CFR), que reflete a porcentagem de indivíduos diagnosticados que morrem de uma doença, e a taxa de letalidade por infeção (IFR), que reflete a porcentagem de indivíduos infectados (diagnosticados e não diagnosticados) que morrem de uma doença.
en-mt: The number varies by region. Other measures include the case fatality rate (CFR), which reflects the percentage of diagnosed individuals who die from a disease, and the infection fatality rate (IFR), which reflects the percentage of infected individuals (diagnosed and undiagnosed). who die from an illness.

sourceString: These statistics are not time bound and follow a specific population from infection through case resolution.
targetString: Essas estatísticas não estão restritas ao tempo e acompanham uma população específica desde a infecção até a resolução do caso.
en-mt: These statistics are not time-bound and follow a specific population from infection to case resolution.

sourceString: While not all infected people develop antibodies, the presence of antibodies may provide information about how many people have been infected.
targetString: Embora nem todas as pessoas infectadas desenvolvam anticorpos, a presença de anticorpos pode dar informações sobre quantas pessoas tenham sido infectadas.
en-mt: Although not all infected people develop antibodies, the presence of antibodies can give information about how many people have been infected.

sourceString: In the epicentre of the outbreak in Italy, Castiglione d'Adda, a small village of 4600, 80 (1.7%) are already dead.
targetString: No epicentro do surto na Itália, Castiglione d'Adda, um pequeno povoado de 4.600, 80 (1,7%) já morreram.
en-mt: In the epicenter of the outbreak in Italy, Castiglione d'Adda, a small town of 4,600, 80 (1.7%) have already died.

sourceString: In Gangelt, the disease was spread by Carnival festivals, and spread to younger people, causing a relatively lower mortality, and not all COVID-19 deaths may have been formally classified as such.
targetString: Em Gangelt, a doença foi propagada por festivais de Carnaval e se espalhou entre pessoas mais jovens, causando uma mortalidade relativamente mais baixa, e nem todas as mortes por COVID-19 devem ter sido formalmente registradas como tais.
en-mt: In Gangelt, the disease was spread by Carnival festivals and spread among younger people, causing relatively lower mortality, and not all COVID-19 deaths must have been formally registered as such.

sourceString: Furthermore, the German health system has not been overwhelmed.
targetString: Além disso, o sistema de saúde alemão não foi sobrecarregado.
en-mt: Furthermore, the German healthcare system was not overburdened.

sourceString: In the Netherlands, about 3% may have antibodies, as assessed from blood donors.
targetString: Nos Países Baixos, cerca de 3% podem ter anticorpos, conforme verificado em doadores de sangue.
en-mt: In the Netherlands, about 3% may have antibodies, as seen in blood donors.

sourceString: 69 (0.004% of the population) have been confirmed to have died from COVID-19.
targetString: 69 (0,004% da população) tiveram a morte por COVID-19 confirmada.
en-mt: 69 (0.004% of the population) had confirmed deaths from COVID-19.

sourceString: The impact of the pandemic and its mortality rate are different for men and women.
targetString: O impacto da pandemia e sua taxa de mortalidade são diferentes para homens e mulheres.
en-mt: The impact of the pandemic and its death rate are different for men and women.

sourceString: Mortality is higher in men in studies conducted in China and Italy.
targetString: A mortalidade é maior em homens em estudos realizados na China e na Itália.
en-mt: Mortality is higher in men in studies conducted in China and Italy.

sourceString: The highest risk for men is in their 50s, with the gap between men and women closing only at 90.
targetString: O maior risco para os homens é na faixa dos 50 anos, com a diferença entre homens e mulheres se aproximando apenas aos 90.
en-mt: The greatest risk for men is in their 50s, with the difference between men and women approaching only at 90.

sourceString: In China, the death rate was 2.8 percent for men and 1.7 percent for women.
targetString: Na China, a taxa de mortalidade foi de 2,8 por cento para homens e 1,7 por cento para mulheres.
en-mt: In China, the death rate was 2.8 percent for men and 1.7 percent for women.

sourceString: The exact reasons for this sex-difference is not known, but genetic and behavioural factors could be a reason.
targetString: As razões exatas para a diferença entre os sexos não são conhecidas, mas fatores genéticos e comportamentais podem ser o motivo.
en-mt: The exact reasons for the difference between the sexes are not known, but genetic and behavioral factors may be the reason.

sourceString: Sex-based immunological differences, lesser prevalence of smoking in women and men developing co-morbid conditions such as hypertension at a younger age than women could have contributed to the higher mortality in men.
targetString: Diferenças imunológicas em razão do sexo, menor prevalência de mulheres fumantes e o desenvolvimento por homens de comorbidades como hipertensão em uma idade menor do que as mulheres podem ter contribuído para a maior mortalidade entre os homens.
en-mt: Immunological differences by sex, lower prevalence of female smokers, and the development by men of comorbidities such as hypertension at a younger age than females may have contributed to the higher mortality among males.

sourceString: In Europe, 57% of the infected individuals were men and 72% of those died with COVID-19 were men.
targetString: Na Europa, 57% dos indivíduos infectados eram homens, e 72% dos mortos por COVID-19 eram homens.
en-mt: In Europe, 57% of infected individuals were men, and 72% of those killed by COVID-19 were men.

sourceString: As of April 2020, the US government is not tracking sex-related data of COVID-19 infections.
targetString: Até abril de 2020, o governo dos EUA não estava rastreando dados de infecções por COVID-19 relacionados ao sexo.
en-mt: As of April 2020, the US government was not tracking sex-related COVID-19 infection data.

sourceString: Research has shown that viral illnesses like Ebola, HIV, influenza and SARS affect men and women differently.
targetString: Pesquisas mostraram que doenças virais como Ebola, HIV, gripe e SARS afetam homens e mulheres de jeitos diferentes.
en-mt: Research has shown that viral illnesses such as Ebola, HIV, influenza and SARS affect men and women differently.

sourceString: A higher percentage of health workers, particularly nurses, are women, and they have a higher chance of being exposed to the virus.
targetString: Uma maior porcentagem de trabalhadores da saúde, principalmente enfermeiros, são mulheres, e elas têm mais chances de ser expostas ao vírus.
en-mt: A higher percentage of healthcare workers, particularly nurses, are women, and they are more likely to be exposed to the virus.

sourceString: The World Health Organization announced on 11 February 2020 that the official name of the disease would be "COVID-19".
targetString: A Organização Mundial da Saúde anunciou, em 11 de fevereiro de 2020, que o nome oficial da doença era "COVID-19".
en-mt: The World Health Organization announced, on February 11, 2020, that the official name of the disease was "COVID-19".

sourceString: WHO chief Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus explained that CO stands for corona, VI for virus, D for disease, and 19 for when the outbreak was first identified: 31 December 2019.
targetString: O chefe da OMS, Tedros Adhanon Ghebreyesus, explicou que "CO" é de "corona", "VI", de "vírus", "D", de doença e "19" é de quando o surto foi identificado: 31 de dezembro de 2019.
en-mt: WHO chief Tedros Adhanon Ghebreyesus explained that "CO" stands for "corona", "VI" for "virus", "D" for disease and "19" is for when the outbreak was identified: December 31 of 2019.

sourceString: The name had been chosen to avoid references to a specific geographical location (e.g. China), animal species or group of people, in line with international recommendations for naming aimed at preventing stigmatisation.The virus that causes COVID-19 is named severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2).
targetString: O nome foi escolhido para evitar referências a um local geográfico específico (ex.: China), espécie animal ou grupo de pessoas, em conformidade com as recomendações internacionais de nomenclatura para prevenir estigmatizações. O vírus que causa a COVID-19 foi chamado de coronavírus da síndrome respiratória aguda grave 2 (SARS-CoV-2).
en-mt: The name was chosen to avoid references to a specific geographic location (eg China), animal species or group of people, in line with international naming recommendations to prevent stigmatization. The virus that causes COVID-19 has been called severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2).

sourceString: The WHO additionally uses "the COVID-19 virus" and "the virus responsible for COVID-19" in public communications.
targetString: A OMS também usa "o vírus COVID-19" e "o vírus responsável pela COVID-19" em comunicações ao público.
en-mt: WHO also uses "the COVID-19 virus" and "the virus responsible for COVID-19" in communications to the public.

sourceString: Both the disease and virus are commonly referred to as "coronavirus".
targetString: Tanto a doença quanto o vírus são comumente chamados de "coronavírus".
en-mt: Both the disease and the virus are commonly referred to as the "coronavirus".

sourceString: During the initial outbreak in Wuhan, China, the virus and disease were commonly referred to as "coronavirus" and "Wuhan coronavirus".
targetString: Durante o surto inicial em Wuhan, China, o vírus e a doença eram comumente chamados de "coronavírus" e "coronavírus de Wuhan".
en-mt: During the initial outbreak in Wuhan, China, the virus and disease were commonly referred to as "coronavirus" and "Wuhan coronavirus".

sourceString: In January 2020, WHO recommended 2019-nCov and 2019-nCoV acute respiratory disease as interim names for the virus and disease in accordance with 2015 guidance against using locations in disease and virus names.
targetString: Em janeiro de 2020, a OMS recomendou "2019-nCov" e "doença respiratória aguda por 2019-nCoV" como nomes interinos para o vírus e a doença, de acordo com a orientação de 2015 contra o uso de locais em nomes de doenças e vírus.
en-mt: In January 2020, WHO recommended "2019-nCov" and "2019-nCoV acute respiratory illness" as interim names for the virus and disease, in line with 2015 guidance against using locales in disease names and virus.

sourceString: The official names COVID-19 and SARS-CoV-2 were issued on 11 February 2020.
targetString: Os nomes oficiais COVID-19 e SARS-CoV-2 foram publicados em 11 de fevereiro de 2020.
en-mt: The official names COVID-19 and SARS-CoV-2 were published on February 11, 2020.

sourceString: Due to capacity limitations in the standard supply chains, some digital manufacturers are printing healthcare material such as nasal swabs and ventilator parts.
targetString: Devido a limitações de capacidade nas cadeias de suprimento padrão, alguns fabricantes digitais estão imprimindo material de saúde, como zaragotas nasofaríngeas e peças de respiradores.
en-mt: Due to capacity limitations in standard supply chains, some digital manufacturers are printing healthcare supplies such as nasopharyngeal swabs and ventilator parts.

sourceString: In one example, when an Italian hospital urgently required a ventilator valve, and the supplier was unable to deliver in the timescale required, a local startup reverse-engineered and printed the required 100 valves overnight.
targetString: Em um exemplo, quando um hospital italiano precisava urgentemente de uma válvula de respirador, e o fornecedor era incapaz de entregar no cronograma necessário, uma startup local fez engenharia reversa e imprimiu as 100 válvulas necessárias de um dia para o outro.
en-mt: In one example, when an Italian hospital urgently needed a ventilator valve, and the supplier was unable to deliver on the required schedule, a local startup reverse-engineered and printed the required 100 valves overnight.

sourceString: After the initial outbreak of COVID-19, conspiracy theories, misinformation and disinformation emerged regarding the origin, scale, prevention, treatment and other aspects of the disease and rapidly spread online.
targetString: Após o surto inicial da COVID-19, surgiram teorias da conspiração, informações erradas e desinformação a respeito da origem, dimensão, prevenção, tratamento e outros aspectos da doença, que rapidamente se espalharam pela Internet.
en-mt: After the initial outbreak of COVID-19, conspiracy theories, misinformation and misinformation regarding the origin, extent, prevention, treatment and other aspects of the disease emerged, which quickly spread across the internet.

sourceString: Humans appear to be capable of spreading the virus to some other animals.
targetString: Aparentemente, humanos são capazes de transmitir o vírus para alguns outros animais.
en-mt: Apparently, humans are capable of transmitting the virus to some other animals.

sourceString: The study failed to find evidence of viral replication in pigs, ducks, and chickens.
targetString: O estudo não conseguiu encontrar evidências de replicação viral em porcos, patos e galinhas.
en-mt: The study failed to find evidence of viral replication in pigs, ducks and chickens.

sourceString: No medications or vaccine is approved to treat the disease.
targetString: Nenhum medicamento ou vacina foi aprovado para o tratamento da doença.
en-mt: No drug or vaccine has been approved to treat the disease.

sourceString: International research on vaccines and medicines in COVID-19 are underway by government organisations, academic groups and industry researchers.
targetString: Pesquisas internacionais sobre vacinas e medicamentos para COVID-19 estão em andamento em organizações governamentais, grupos acadêmicos e pesquisadores da indústria.
en-mt: International research on vaccines and drugs for COVID-19 is ongoing from government organizations, academic groups, and industry researchers.

sourceString: In March, the World Health Organization initiated the "SOLIDARITY Trial" to assess treatment effects of four existing antiviral compounds with the most promise of efficacy.
targetString: Em março, a Organização Mundial da Saúde deu início ao "SOLIDARITY Trial" para avaliar os efeitos do tratamento com quatro componentes antivirais existentes com eficácia mais provável.
en-mt: In March, the World Health Organization initiated the "SOLIDARITY Trial" to assess the effects of treatment with four existing antiviral components most likely to be effective.

sourceString: There is no available vaccine, but various agencies are actively developing vaccine candidates.
targetString: Não há vacina disponível, mas várias agências estão desenvolvendo ativamente candidatas a vacina.
en-mt: There is no vaccine available, but several agencies are actively developing vaccine candidates.

sourceString: Previous work on SARS-CoV is being utilised because SARS-CoV and SARS-CoV-2 both use the ACE2 receptor to enter human cells.
targetString: Trabalhos anteriores sobre SARS-CoV estão sendo utilizados porque tanto o SARS-CoV quanto o SARS-CoV-2 usam o receptor ACE2 para entrar nas células humanas.
en-mt: Previous work on SARS-CoV is being utilized because both SARS-CoV and SARS-CoV-2 use the ACE2 receptor to enter human cells.

sourceString: There are three vaccination strategies being investigated.
targetString: Há três estratégias de vacinação sendo investigadas.
en-mt: There are three vaccination strategies being investigated.

sourceString: First, researchers aim to build a whole virus vaccine.
targetString: Primeiro, os pesquisadores visam a elaborar uma vacina com o vírus integral.
en-mt: First, the researchers aim to develop a vaccine with the whole virus.

sourceString: The use of such a virus, be it inactive or dead, aims to elicit a prompt immune response of the human body to a new infection with COVID-19.
targetString: O uso desse vírus, esteja ele inativo ou morto, visa a provocar uma resposta imunológica rápida do corpo humano a uma nova infecção de COVID-19.
en-mt: The use of this virus, whether inactive or dead, is aimed at eliciting a rapid immune response from the human body to a new COVID-19 infection.

sourceString: A second strategy, subunit vaccines, aims to create a vaccine that sensitises the immune system to certain subunits of the virus.
targetString: Uma segunda estratégia, vacinas de subunidade, visa a criar uma vacina que sensibilize o sistema imunológico a certas subunidades do vírus.
en-mt: A second strategy, subunit vaccines, aims to create a vaccine that sensitizes the immune system to certain subunits of the virus.

sourceString: In the case of SARS-CoV-2, such research focuses on the S-spike protein that helps the virus intrude the ACE2 enzyme receptor.
targetString: No caso do SARS-CoV-2, essa pesquisa se concentra na proteína da espícula que ajuda o vírus a entrar no receptor da enzima ACE2.
en-mt: In the case of SARS-CoV-2, this research focuses on the spike protein that helps the virus enter the ACE2 enzyme receptor.

sourceString: A third strategy is that of the nucleic acid vaccines (DNA or RNA vaccines, a novel technique for creating a vaccination).
targetString: Uma terceira estratégia é a das vacinas de ácido nucleico (vacinas de DNA ou RNA, uma nova técnica para criar vacinas).
en-mt: A third strategy is that of nucleic acid vaccines (DNA or RNA vaccines, a new technique for creating vaccines).

sourceString: Experimental vaccines from any of these strategies would have to be tested for safety and efficacy.On 16 March 2020, the first clinical trial of a vaccine started with four volunteers in Seattle.
targetString: Vacinas experimentais de qualquer uma dessas estratégias deveriam ter a segurança e a eficácia testadas. Em 16 de março de 2020, o primeiro teste clínico de uma vacina começou com quatro voluntários em Seattle.
en-mt: Experimental vaccines from any of these strategies should be tested for safety and efficacy. On March 16, 2020, the first clinical trial of a vaccine began with four volunteers in Seattle.

sourceString: The vaccine contains a harmless genetic code copied from the virus that causes the disease.Antibody dependent enhancement has been suggested as a potential challenge for vaccine development for SARS-COV-2, but this is controversial.
targetString: A vacina contém um código genético inofensivo copiado do vírus que causa a doença. O aprimoramento dependente de anticorpos foi apontado como um possível desafio para o desenvolvimento de uma vacina para o SARS-CoV-2, mas isso é controverso.
en-mt: The vaccine contains a harmless genetic code copied from the virus that causes the disease. Antibody-dependent enhancement has been touted as a potential challenge for developing a vaccine for SARS-CoV-2, but this is controversial.

sourceString: There are more than 300 active clinical trials underway as of April 2020.
targetString: Há mais de 300 testes clínicos em andamento desde abril de 2020.
en-mt: There are over 300 ongoing clinical trials as of April 2020.

sourceString: Seven trials were evaluating already approved treatments for malaria, including four studies on hydroxychloroquine or chloroquine.
targetString: Sete testes avaliaram tratamentos já aprovados para a malária, inclusive quatro estudos sobre a hidroxicloroquina ou cloroquina.
en-mt: Seven trials looked at approved treatments for malaria, including four trials of hydroxychloroquine or chloroquine.

sourceString: Repurposed antiviral drugs make up most of the Chinese research, with nine phase III trials on remdesivir across several countries due to report by the end of April.
targetString: O redirecionamento de drogas antivirais compõe a maior parte das pesquisas chinesas, com nove testes clínicos na fase III do remdesivir em diversos países devido a um relatório do fim de abril.
en-mt: Antiviral drug repurposing makes up the bulk of Chinese research, with nine phase III clinical trials of remdesivir across countries due to a late-April report.

sourceString: A dynamic review of clinical development for COVID-19 vaccine and drug candidates was in place, as of April 2020.Several existing antiviral medications are being evaluated for treatment of COVID-19, including remdesivir, chloroquine and hydroxychloroquine, lopinavir/ritonavir and lopinavir/ritonavir combined with interferon beta.
targetString: Uma análise dinâmica do desenvolvimento clínico de candidatos a remédio e vacina para a COVID-19 estava em curso em abril de 2020.
